49     namespace {
50         // local struct used in setVarId
51         // in order to store information about the scope
52         struct VarIdScopeInfo {
53             VarIdScopeInfo()
54                 :isExecutable(false), isStructInit(false), isEnum(false), startVarid(0) {
55             }
56             VarIdScopeInfo(bool isExecutable, bool isStructInit, bool isEnum, nonneg int startVarid)
57                 :isExecutable(isExecutable), isStructInit(isStructInit), isEnum(isEnum), startVarid(startVarid) {
58             }
59     
60             const bool isExecutable;
61             const bool isStructInit;
62             const bool isEnum;
63             const nonneg int startVarid;
64         };
65     }
66     
67     /** Return whether tok is the "{" that starts an enumerator list */
68     static bool isEnumStart(const Token* tok)
69     {
70         if (!tok || tok->str() != "{")
71             return false;
72         return (tok->strAt(-1) == "enum") || (tok->strAt(-2) == "enum");
73     }
74     
75     template<typename T>
76     static void skipEnumBody(T **tok)
77     {
78         T *defStart = *tok;
79         while (Token::Match(defStart, "%name%|::|:"))
80             defStart = defStart->next();
81         if (defStart && defStart->str() == "{")
82             *tok = defStart->link()->next();
83     }
84     
85     const Token * Tokenizer::isFunctionHead(const Token *tok, const std::string &endsWith) const
86     {
87         return Tokenizer::isFunctionHead(tok, endsWith, isCPP());
88     }
89     
90     const Token * Tokenizer::isFunctionHead(const Token *tok, const std::string &endsWith, bool cpp)
91     {
92         if (!tok)
93             return nullptr;
94         if (tok->str() == "(")
95             tok = tok->link();
96         if (Token::Match(tok, ") ;|{|[")) {
97             tok = tok->next();
98             while (tok && tok->str() == "[" && tok->link())
99                 tok = tok->link()->next();
100             return (tok && endsWith.find(tok->str()) != std::string::npos) ? tok : nullptr;
101         }
102         if (cpp && tok->str() == ")") {
103             tok = tok->next();
104             while (Token::Match(tok, "const|noexcept|override|final|volatile|&|&& !!(") ||
105                    (Token::Match(tok, "%name% !!(") && tok->isUpperCaseName()))
106                 tok = tok->next();
107             if (tok && tok->str() == ")")
108                 tok = tok->next();
109             while (tok && tok->str() == "[")
110                 tok = tok->link()->next();
111             if (Token::Match(tok, "throw|noexcept ("))
112                 tok = tok->linkAt(1)->next();
113             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% (") && tok->isUpperCaseName())
114                 tok = tok->linkAt(1)->next();
115             if (tok && tok->originalName() == "->") { // trailing return type
116                 for (tok = tok->next(); tok && !Token::Match(tok, ";|{|override|final"); tok = tok->next())
117                     if (tok->link() && Token::Match(tok, "<|[|("))
118                         tok = tok->link();
119             }
120             while (Token::Match(tok, "override|final !!(") ||
121                    (Token::Match(tok, "%name% !!(") && tok->isUpperCaseName()))
122                 tok = tok->next();
123             if (Token::Match(tok, "= 0|default|delete ;"))
124                 tok = tok->tokAt(2);
125     
126             return (tok && endsWith.find(tok->str()) != std::string::npos) ? tok : nullptr;
127         }
128         return nullptr;
129     }
130     
131     /**
132      * is tok the start brace { of a class, struct, union, or enum
133      */
134     static bool isClassStructUnionEnumStart(const Token * tok)
135     {
136         if (!Token::Match(tok->previous(), "class|struct|union|enum|%name%|>|>> {"))
137             return false;
138         const Token * tok2 = tok->previous();
139         while (tok2 && !Token::Match(tok2, "class|struct|union|enum|{|}|;"))
140             tok2 = tok2->previous();
141         return Token::Match(tok2, "class|struct|union|enum");
142     }
143     
144     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
145     
146     Tokenizer::Tokenizer() :
147         list(nullptr),
148         mSettings(nullptr),
149         mErrorLogger(nullptr),
150         mSymbolDatabase(nullptr),
151         mTemplateSimplifier(nullptr),
152         mVarId(0),
153         mUnnamedCount(0),
154         mCodeWithTemplates(false), //is there any templates?
155         mTimerResults(nullptr)
156     #ifdef MAXTIME
157         ,mMaxTime(std::time(0) + MAXTIME)
158     #endif
159     {
160     }
161     
162     Tokenizer::Tokenizer(const Settings *settings, ErrorLogger *errorLogger) :
163         list(settings),
164         mSettings(settings),
165         mErrorLogger(errorLogger),
166         mSymbolDatabase(nullptr),
167         mTemplateSimplifier(nullptr),
168         mVarId(0),
169         mUnnamedCount(0),
170         mCodeWithTemplates(false), //is there any templates?
171         mTimerResults(nullptr)
172     #ifdef MAXTIME
173         ,mMaxTime(std::time(0) + MAXTIME)
174     #endif
175     {
176         // make sure settings are specified
177         assert(mSettings);
178     
179         mTemplateSimplifier = new TemplateSimplifier(this);
180     }
181     
182     Tokenizer::~Tokenizer()
183     {
184         delete mSymbolDatabase;
185         delete mTemplateSimplifier;
186     }
187     
188     
189     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
190     // SizeOfType - gives the size of a type
191     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
192     
193     nonneg int Tokenizer::sizeOfType(const Token *type) const
194     {
195         if (!type || type->str().empty())
196             return 0;
197     
198         if (type->tokType() == Token::eString)
199             return Token::getStrLength(type) + 1U;
200     
201         const std::map<std::string, int>::const_iterator it = mTypeSize.find(type->str());
202         if (it == mTypeSize.end()) {
203             const Library::PodType* podtype = mSettings->library.podtype(type->str());
204             if (!podtype)
205                 return 0;
206     
207             return podtype->size;
208         } else if (type->isLong()) {
209             if (type->str() == "double")
210                 return mSettings->sizeof_long_double;
211             else if (type->str() == "long")
212                 return mSettings->sizeof_long_long;
213         }
214     
215         return it->second;
216     }
217     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
218     
219     // check if this statement is a duplicate definition
220     bool Tokenizer::duplicateTypedef(Token **tokPtr, const Token *name, const Token *typeDef) const
221     {
222         // check for an end of definition
223         const Token * tok = *tokPtr;
224         if (tok && Token::Match(tok->next(), ";|,|[|=|)|>|(|{")) {
225             const Token * end = tok->next();
226     
227             if (end->str() == "[") {
228                 if (!end->link())
229                     syntaxError(end); // invalid code
230                 end = end->link()->next();
231             } else if (end->str() == ",") {
232                 // check for derived class
233                 if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "public|private|protected"))
234                     return false;
235     
236                 // find end of definition
237                 while (end && end->next() && !Token::Match(end->next(), ";|)|>")) {
238                     if (end->next()->str() == "(")
239                         end = end->linkAt(1);
240     
241                     end = (end)?end->next():nullptr;
242                 }
243                 if (end)
244                     end = end->next();
245             } else if (end->str() == "(") {
246                 if (tok->previous()->str().compare(0, 8, "operator")  == 0) {
247                     // conversion operator
248                     return false;
249                 } else if (tok->previous()->str() == "typedef") {
250                     // typedef of function returning this type
251                     return false;
252                 } else if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "public:|private:|protected:")) {
253                     return false;
254                 } else if (tok->previous()->str() == ">") {
255                     if (!Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "%type%"))
256                         return false;
257     
258                     if (!Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-3), ",|<"))
259                         return false;
260     
261                     *tokPtr = end->link();
262                     return true;
263                 }
264             }
265     
266             if (end) {
267                 if (Token::simpleMatch(end, ") {")) { // function parameter ?
268                     // look backwards
269                     if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type%") &&
270                         !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "return|new|const|struct")) {
271                         // duplicate definition so skip entire function
272                         *tokPtr = end->next()->link();
273                         return true;
274                     }
275                 } else if (end->str() == ">") { // template parameter ?
276                     // look backwards
277                     if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type%") &&
278                         !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "return|new|const|volatile")) {
279                         // duplicate definition so skip entire template
280                         while (end && end->str() != "{")
281                             end = end->next();
282                         if (end) {
283                             *tokPtr = end->link();
284                             return true;
285                         }
286                     }
287                 } else {
288                     // look backwards
289                     if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "typedef|}|>") ||
290                         (end->str() == ";" && tok->previous()->str() == ",") ||
291                         (tok->previous()->str() == "*" && tok->next()->str() != "(") ||
292                         (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type%") &&
293                          (!Token::Match(tok->previous(), "return|new|const|friend|public|private|protected|throw|extern") &&
294                           !Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-2), "friend class")))) {
295                         // scan backwards for the end of the previous statement
296                         while (tok && tok->previous() && !Token::Match(tok->previous(), ";|{")) {
297                             if (tok->previous()->str() == "}") {
298                                 tok = tok->previous()->link();
299                             } else if (tok->previous()->str() == "typedef") {
300                                 return true;
301                             } else if (tok->previous()->str() == "enum") {
302                                 return true;
303                             } else if (tok->previous()->str() == "struct") {
304                                 if (tok->strAt(-2) == "typedef" &&
305                                     tok->next()->str() == "{" &&
306                                     typeDef->strAt(3) != "{") {
307                                     // declaration after forward declaration
308                                     return true;
309                                 } else if (tok->next()->str() == "{") {
310                                     return true;
311                                 } else if (Token::Match(tok->next(), ")|*")) {
312                                     return true;
313                                 } else if (tok->next()->str() == name->str()) {
314                                     return true;
315                                 } else if (tok->next()->str() != ";") {
316                                     return true;
317                                 } else {
318                                     return false;
319                                 }
320                             } else if (tok->previous()->str() == "union") {
321                                 if (tok->next()->str() != ";") {
322                                     return true;
323                                 } else {
324                                     return false;
325                                 }
326                             } else if (isCPP() && tok->previous()->str() == "class") {
327                                 if (tok->next()->str() != ";") {
328                                     return true;
329                                 } else {
330                                     return false;
331                                 }
332                             }
333                             if (tok)
334                                 tok = tok->previous();
335                         }
336     
337                         if ((*tokPtr)->strAt(1) != "(" || !Token::Match((*tokPtr)->linkAt(1), ") .|(|["))
338                             return true;
339                     }
340                 }
341             }
342         }
343     
344         return false;
345     }
346     
347     void Tokenizer::unsupportedTypedef(const Token *tok) const
348     {
349         if (!mSettings->debugwarnings)
350             return;
351     
352         std::ostringstream str;
353         const Token *tok1 = tok;
354         int level = 0;
355         while (tok) {
356             if (level == 0 && tok->str() == ";")
357                 break;
358             else if (tok->str() == "{")
359                 ++level;
360             else if (tok->str() == "}") {
361                 if (level == 0)
362                     break;
363                 --level;
364             }
365     
366             if (tok != tok1)
367                 str << " ";
368             str << tok->str();
369             tok = tok->next();
370         }
371         if (tok)
372             str << " ;";
373     
374         reportError(tok1, Severity::debug, "debug",
375                     "Failed to parse \'" + str.str() + "\'. The checking continues anyway.");
376     }
377     
378     Token * Tokenizer::deleteInvalidTypedef(Token *typeDef)
379     {
380         Token *tok = nullptr;
381     
382         // remove typedef but leave ;
383         while (typeDef->next()) {
384             if (typeDef->next()->str() == ";") {
385                 typeDef->deleteNext();
386                 break;
387             } else if (typeDef->next()->str() == "{")
388                 Token::eraseTokens(typeDef, typeDef->linkAt(1));
389             else if (typeDef->next()->str() == "}")
390                 break;
391             typeDef->deleteNext();
392         }
393     
394         if (typeDef != list.front()) {
395             tok = typeDef->previous();
396             tok->deleteNext();
397         } else {
398             list.front()->deleteThis();
399             tok = list.front();
400         }
401     
402         return tok;
403     }
404     
405     namespace {
406         struct Space {
407             Space() : bodyEnd(nullptr), isNamespace(false) { }
408             std::string className;
409             const Token * bodyEnd;
410             bool isNamespace;
411         };
412     }
413     
414     static Token *splitDefinitionFromTypedef(Token *tok, nonneg int *unnamedCount)
415     {
416         Token *tok1;
417         std::string name;
418         bool isConst = false;
419     
420         if (tok->next()->str() == "const") {
421             tok->deleteNext();
422             isConst = true;
423         }
424     
425         if (tok->strAt(2) == "{") { // unnamed
426             tok1 = tok->linkAt(2);
427     
428             if (tok1 && tok1->next()) {
429                 // use typedef name if available
430                 if (Token::Match(tok1->next(), "%type%"))
431                     name = tok1->next()->str();
432                 else // create a unique name
433                     name = "Unnamed" + MathLib::toString((*unnamedCount)++);
434                 tok->next()->insertToken(name);
435             } else
436                 return nullptr;
437         } else if (tok->strAt(3) == ":") {
438             tok1 = tok->tokAt(4);
439             while (tok1 && tok1->str() != "{")
440                 tok1 = tok1->next();
441             if (!tok1)
442                 return nullptr;
443     
444             tok1 = tok1->link();
445     
446             name = tok->strAt(2);
447         } else { // has a name
448             tok1 = tok->linkAt(3);
449     
450             if (!tok1)
451                 return nullptr;
452     
453             name = tok->strAt(2);
454         }
455     
456         tok1->insertToken(";");
457         tok1 = tok1->next();
458     
459         if (tok1->next() && tok1->next()->str() == ";" && tok1->previous()->str() == "}") {
460             tok->deleteThis();
461             tok1->deleteThis();
462             return nullptr;
463         } else {
464             tok1->insertToken("typedef");
465             tok1 = tok1->next();
466             Token * tok3 = tok1;
467             if (isConst) {
468                 tok1->insertToken("const");
469                 tok1 = tok1->next();
470             }
471             tok1->insertToken(tok->next()->str()); // struct, union or enum
472             tok1 = tok1->next();
473             tok1->insertToken(name);
474             tok->deleteThis();
475             tok = tok3;
476         }
477     
478         return tok;
479     }
480     
481     /* This function is called when processing function related typedefs.
482      * If simplifyTypedef generates an "Internal Error" message and the
483      * code that generated it deals in some way with functions, then this
484      * function will probably need to be extended to handle a new function
485      * related pattern */
486     Token *Tokenizer::processFunc(Token *tok2, bool inOperator) const
487     {
488         if (tok2->next() && tok2->next()->str() != ")" &&
489             tok2->next()->str() != ",") {
490             // skip over tokens for some types of canonicalization
491             if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "( * %type% ) ("))
492                 tok2 = tok2->linkAt(5);
493             else if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "* ( * %type% ) ("))
494                 tok2 = tok2->linkAt(6);
495             else if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "* ( * %type% ) ;"))
496                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(5);
497             else if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "* ( %type% [") &&
498                      Token::Match(tok2->linkAt(4), "] ) ;|="))
499                 tok2 = tok2->linkAt(4)->next();
500             else if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "* ( * %type% ("))
501                 tok2 = tok2->linkAt(5)->next();
502             else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2->next(), "* [") &&
503                      Token::simpleMatch(tok2->linkAt(2), "] ;"))
504                 tok2 = tok2->next();
505             else {
506                 if (tok2->next()->str() == "(")
507                     tok2 = tok2->next()->link();
508                 else if (!inOperator && !Token::Match(tok2->next(), "[|>|;")) {
509                     tok2 = tok2->next();
510     
511                     while (Token::Match(tok2, "*|&") &&
512                            !Token::Match(tok2->next(), ")|>"))
513                         tok2 = tok2->next();
514     
515                     // skip over namespace
516                     while (Token::Match(tok2, "%name% ::"))
517                         tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
518     
519                     if (!tok2)
520                         return nullptr;
521     
522                     if (tok2->str() == "(" &&
523                         tok2->link()->next() &&
524                         tok2->link()->next()->str() == "(") {
525                         tok2 = tok2->link();
526     
527                         if (tok2->next()->str() == "(")
528                             tok2 = tok2->next()->link();
529                     }
530     
531                     // skip over typedef parameter
532                     if (tok2->next() && tok2->next()->str() == "(") {
533                         tok2 = tok2->next()->link();
534                         if (!tok2->next())
535                             syntaxError(tok2);
536     
537                         if (tok2->next()->str() == "(")
538                             tok2 = tok2->next()->link();
539                     }
540                 }
541             }
542         }
543         return tok2;
544     }
545     
546     void Tokenizer::simplifyTypedef()
547     {
548         std::vector<Space> spaceInfo;
549         bool isNamespace = false;
550         std::string className;
551         bool hasClass = false;
552         bool goback = false;
553         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
554             if (mErrorLogger && !list.getFiles().empty())
555                 mErrorLogger->reportProgress(list.getFiles()[0], "Tokenize (typedef)", tok->progressValue());
556     
557             if (Settings::terminated())
558                 return;
559     
560             if (isMaxTime())
561                 return;
562     
563             if (goback) {
564                 //jump back once, see the comment at the end of the function
565                 goback = false;
566                 tok = tok->previous();
567             }
568     
569             if (tok->str() != "typedef") {
570                 if (tok->str() == "(" && tok->strAt(1) == "typedef") {
571                     // Skip typedefs inside parentheses (#2453 and #4002)
572                     tok = tok->next();
573                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "class|struct|namespace %any%") &&
574                            (!tok->previous() || tok->previous()->str() != "enum")) {
575                     isNamespace = (tok->str() == "namespace");
576                     hasClass = true;
577                     className = tok->next()->str();
578                 } else if (hasClass && tok->str() == ";") {
579                     hasClass = false;
580                 } else if (hasClass && tok->str() == "{") {
581                     Space info;
582                     info.isNamespace = isNamespace;
583                     info.className = className;
584                     info.bodyEnd = tok->link();
585                     spaceInfo.push_back(info);
586     
587                     hasClass = false;
588                 } else if (!spaceInfo.empty() && tok->str() == "}" && spaceInfo.back().bodyEnd == tok) {
589                     spaceInfo.pop_back();
590                 }
591                 continue;
592             }
593     
594             // pull struct, union, enum or class definition out of typedef
595             // use typedef name for unnamed struct, union, enum or class
596             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "const| struct|enum|union|class %type%| {")) {
597                 Token *tok1 = splitDefinitionFromTypedef(tok, &mUnnamedCount);
598                 if (!tok1)
599                     continue;
600                 tok = tok1;
601             } else if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "const| struct|class %type% :")) {
602                 Token *tok1 = tok;
603                 while (tok1 && tok1->str() != ";" && tok1->str() != "{")
604                     tok1 = tok1->next();
605                 if (tok1 && tok1->str() == "{") {
606                     tok1 = splitDefinitionFromTypedef(tok, &mUnnamedCount);
607                     if (!tok1)
608                         continue;
609                     tok = tok1;
610                 }
611             }
612     
613             /** @todo add support for union */
614             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "enum %type% %type% ;") && tok->strAt(2) == tok->strAt(3)) {
615                 tok->deleteNext(3);
616                 tok->deleteThis();
617                 if (tok->next())
618                     tok->deleteThis();
619                 //now the next token to process is 'tok', not 'tok->next()';
620                 goback = true;
621                 continue;
622             }
623     
624             Token *typeName;
625             Token *typeStart = nullptr;
626             Token *typeEnd = nullptr;
627             Token *argStart = nullptr;
628             Token *argEnd = nullptr;
629             Token *arrayStart = nullptr;
630             Token *arrayEnd = nullptr;
631             Token *specStart = nullptr;
632             Token *specEnd = nullptr;
633             Token *typeDef = tok;
634             Token *argFuncRetStart = nullptr;
635             Token *argFuncRetEnd = nullptr;
636             Token *funcStart = nullptr;
637             Token *funcEnd = nullptr;
638             Token *tokOffset = tok->next();
639             bool function = false;
640             bool functionPtr = false;
641             bool functionRetFuncPtr = false;
642             bool functionPtrRetFuncPtr = false;
643             bool ptrToArray = false;
644             bool refToArray = false;
645             bool ptrMember = false;
646             bool typeOf = false;
647             Token *namespaceStart = nullptr;
648             Token *namespaceEnd = nullptr;
649     
650             // check for invalid input
651             if (!tokOffset)
652                 syntaxError(tok);
653     
654     
655             if (tokOffset->str() == "::") {
656                 typeStart = tokOffset;
657                 tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
658     
659                 while (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type% ::"))
660                     tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(2);
661     
662                 typeEnd = tokOffset;
663     
664                 if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type%"))
665                     tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
666             } else if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type% ::")) {
667                 typeStart = tokOffset;
668     
669                 do {
670                     tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(2);
671                 } while (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type% ::"));
672     
673                 typeEnd = tokOffset;
674     
675                 if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type%"))
676                     tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
677             } else if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type%")) {
678                 typeStart = tokOffset;
679     
680                 while (Token::Match(tokOffset, "const|struct|enum %type%") ||
681                        (tokOffset->next() && tokOffset->next()->isStandardType()))
682                     tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
683     
684                 typeEnd = tokOffset;
685                 tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
686     
687                 while (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type%") &&
688                        (tokOffset->isStandardType() || Token::Match(tokOffset, "unsigned|signed"))) {
689                     typeEnd = tokOffset;
690                     tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
691                 }
692     
693                 bool atEnd = false;
694                 while (!atEnd) {
695                     if (tokOffset && tokOffset->str() == "::") {
696                         typeEnd = tokOffset;
697                         tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
698                     }
699     
700                     if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type%") &&
701                         tokOffset->next() && !Token::Match(tokOffset->next(), "[|;|,|(")) {
702                         typeEnd = tokOffset;
703                         tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
704                     } else if (Token::simpleMatch(tokOffset, "const (")) {
705                         typeEnd = tokOffset;
706                         tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
707                         atEnd = true;
708                     } else
709                         atEnd = true;
710                 }
711             } else
712                 continue; // invalid input
713     
714             // check for invalid input
715             if (!tokOffset)
716                 syntaxError(tok);
717     
718             // check for template
719             if (!isC() && tokOffset->str() == "<") {
720                 typeEnd = tokOffset->findClosingBracket();
721     
722                 while (typeEnd && Token::Match(typeEnd->next(), ":: %type%"))
723                     typeEnd = typeEnd->tokAt(2);
724     
725                 if (!typeEnd) {
726                     // internal error
727                     return;
728                 }
729     
730                 while (Token::Match(typeEnd->next(), "const|volatile"))
731                     typeEnd = typeEnd->next();
732     
733                 tok = typeEnd;
734                 tokOffset = tok->next();
735             }
736     
737             std::list<std::string> pointers;
738             // check for pointers and references
739             while (Token::Match(tokOffset, "*|&|&&|const")) {
740                 pointers.push_back(tokOffset->str());
741                 tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
742             }
743     
744             // check for invalid input
745             if (!tokOffset)
746                 syntaxError(tok);
747     
748             if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type%")) {
749                 // found the type name
750                 typeName = tokOffset;
751                 tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
752     
753                 // check for array
754                 if (tokOffset && tokOffset->str() == "[") {
755                     arrayStart = tokOffset;
756     
757                     bool atEnd = false;
758                     while (!atEnd) {
759                         while (tokOffset->next() && !Token::Match(tokOffset->next(), ";|,")) {
760                             tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
761                         }
762     
763                         if (!tokOffset->next())
764                             return; // invalid input
765                         else if (tokOffset->next()->str() == ";")
766                             atEnd = true;
767                         else if (tokOffset->str() == "]")
768                             atEnd = true;
769                         else
770                             tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
771                     }
772     
773                     arrayEnd = tokOffset;
774                     tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
775                 }
776     
777                 // check for end or another
778                 if (Token::Match(tokOffset, ";|,"))
779                     tok = tokOffset;
780     
781                 // or a function typedef
782                 else if (tokOffset && tokOffset->str() == "(") {
783                     Token *tokOffset2 = nullptr;
784                     if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "( *|%name%")) {
785                         tokOffset2 = tokOffset->next();
786                         if (tokOffset2->str() == "typename")
787                             tokOffset2 = tokOffset2->next();
788                         while (Token::Match(tokOffset2, "%type% ::"))
789                             tokOffset2 = tokOffset2->tokAt(2);
790                     }
791     
792                     // unhandled typedef, skip it and continue
793                     if (typeName->str() == "void") {
794                         unsupportedTypedef(typeDef);
795                         tok = deleteInvalidTypedef(typeDef);
796                         if (tok == list.front())
797                             //now the next token to process is 'tok', not 'tok->next()';
798                             goback = true;
799                         continue;
800                     }
801     
802                     // function pointer
803                     else if (Token::Match(tokOffset2, "* %name% ) (")) {
804                         // name token wasn't a name, it was part of the type
805                         typeEnd = typeEnd->next();
806                         functionPtr = true;
807                         funcStart = funcEnd = tokOffset2; // *
808                         tokOffset = tokOffset2->tokAt(3); // (
809                         typeName = tokOffset->tokAt(-2);
810                         argStart = tokOffset;
811                         argEnd = tokOffset->link();
812                         tok = argEnd->next();
813                     }
814     
815                     // function
816                     else if (isFunctionHead(tokOffset->link(), ";,")) {
817                         function = true;
818                         if (tokOffset->link()->next()->str() == "const") {
819                             specStart = tokOffset->link()->next();
820                             specEnd = specStart;
821                         }
822                         argStart = tokOffset;
823                         argEnd = tokOffset->link();
824                         tok = argEnd->next();
825                         if (specStart)
826                             tok = tok->next();
827                     }
828     
829                     // syntax error
830                     else
831                         syntaxError(tok);
832                 }
833     
834                 // unhandled typedef, skip it and continue
835                 else {
836                     unsupportedTypedef(typeDef);
837                     tok = deleteInvalidTypedef(typeDef);
838                     if (tok == list.front())
839                         //now the next token to process is 'tok', not 'tok->next()';
840                         goback = true;
841                     continue;
842                 }
843             }
844     
845             // typeof: typedef __typeof__ ( ... ) type;
846             else if (Token::simpleMatch(tokOffset->previous(), "__typeof__ (") &&
847                      Token::Match(tokOffset->link(), ") %type% ;")) {
848                 argStart = tokOffset;
849                 argEnd = tokOffset->link();
850                 typeName = tokOffset->link()->next();
851                 tok = typeName->next();
852                 typeOf = true;
853             }
854     
855             // function: typedef ... ( ... type )( ... );
856             //           typedef ... (( ... type )( ... ));
857             //           typedef ... ( * ( ... type )( ... ));
858             else if (tokOffset->str() == "(" && (
859                          (tokOffset->link() && Token::Match(tokOffset->link()->previous(), "%type% ) (") &&
860                           Token::Match(tokOffset->link()->next()->link(), ") const|volatile|;")) ||
861                          (Token::simpleMatch(tokOffset, "( (") &&
862                           tokOffset->next() && Token::Match(tokOffset->next()->link()->previous(), "%type% ) (") &&
863                           Token::Match(tokOffset->next()->link()->next()->link(), ") const|volatile| ) ;|,")) ||
864                          (Token::simpleMatch(tokOffset, "( * (") &&
865                           tokOffset->linkAt(2) && Token::Match(tokOffset->linkAt(2)->previous(), "%type% ) (") &&
866                           Token::Match(tokOffset->linkAt(2)->next()->link(), ") const|volatile| ) ;|,")))) {
867                 if (tokOffset->next()->str() == "(")
868                     tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
869                 else if (Token::simpleMatch(tokOffset, "( * (")) {
870                     pointers.emplace_back("*");
871                     tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(2);
872                 }
873     
874                 if (tokOffset->link()->strAt(-2) == "*")
875                     functionPtr = true;
876                 else
877                     function = true;
878                 funcStart = tokOffset->next();
879                 tokOffset = tokOffset->link();
880                 funcEnd = tokOffset->tokAt(-2);
881                 typeName = tokOffset->previous();
882                 argStart = tokOffset->next();
883                 argEnd = tokOffset->next()->link();
884                 if (!argEnd)
885                     syntaxError(argStart);
886     
887                 tok = argEnd->next();
888                 Token *spec = tok;
889                 if (Token::Match(spec, "const|volatile")) {
890                     specStart = spec;
891                     specEnd = spec;
892                     while (Token::Match(spec->next(), "const|volatile")) {
893                         specEnd = spec->next();
894                         spec = specEnd;
895                     }
896                     tok = specEnd->next();
897                 }
898                 if (!tok)
899                     syntaxError(specEnd);
900     
901                 if (tok->str() == ")")
902                     tok = tok->next();
903             }
904     
905             else if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "( %type% (")) {
906                 function = true;
907                 if (tokOffset->link()->next()) {
908                     tok = tokOffset->link()->next();
909                     tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(2);
910                     typeName = tokOffset->previous();
911                     argStart = tokOffset;
912                     argEnd = tokOffset->link();
913                 } else {
914                     // internal error
915                     continue;
916                 }
917             }
918     
919             // pointer to function returning pointer to function
920             else if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "( * ( * %type% ) (") &&
921                      Token::simpleMatch(tokOffset->linkAt(6), ") ) (") &&
922                      Token::Match(tokOffset->linkAt(6)->linkAt(2), ") ;|,")) {
923                 functionPtrRetFuncPtr = true;
924     
925                 tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(6);
926                 typeName = tokOffset->tokAt(-2);
927                 argStart = tokOffset;
928                 argEnd = tokOffset->link();
929                 if (!argEnd)
930                     syntaxError(arrayStart);
931     
932                 argFuncRetStart = argEnd->tokAt(2);
933                 argFuncRetEnd = argFuncRetStart->link();
934                 if (!argFuncRetEnd)
935                     syntaxError(argFuncRetStart);
936     
937                 tok = argFuncRetEnd->next();
938             }
939     
940             // function returning pointer to function
941             else if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "( * %type% (") &&
942                      Token::simpleMatch(tokOffset->linkAt(3), ") ) (") &&
943                      Token::Match(tokOffset->linkAt(3)->linkAt(2), ") ;|,")) {
944                 functionRetFuncPtr = true;
945     
946                 tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(3);
947                 typeName = tokOffset->previous();
948                 argStart = tokOffset;
949                 argEnd = tokOffset->link();
950     
951                 argFuncRetStart = argEnd->tokAt(2);
952                 if (!argFuncRetStart)
953                     syntaxError(tokOffset);
954     
955                 argFuncRetEnd = argFuncRetStart->link();
956                 if (!argFuncRetEnd)
957                     syntaxError(tokOffset);
958     
959                 tok = argFuncRetEnd->next();
960             } else if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "( * ( %type% ) (")) {
961                 functionRetFuncPtr = true;
962     
963                 tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(5);
964                 typeName = tokOffset->tokAt(-2);
965                 argStart = tokOffset;
966                 argEnd = tokOffset->link();
967                 if (!argEnd)
968                     syntaxError(arrayStart);
969     
970                 argFuncRetStart = argEnd->tokAt(2);
971                 if (!argFuncRetStart)
972                     syntaxError(tokOffset);
973     
974                 argFuncRetEnd = argFuncRetStart->link();
975                 if (!argFuncRetEnd)
976                     syntaxError(tokOffset);
977     
978                 tok = argFuncRetEnd->next();
979             }
980     
981             // pointer/reference to array
982             else if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "( *|& %type% ) [")) {
983                 ptrToArray = (tokOffset->next()->str() == "*");
984                 refToArray = !ptrToArray;
985                 tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(2);
986                 typeName = tokOffset;
987                 arrayStart = tokOffset->tokAt(2);
988                 arrayEnd = arrayStart->link();
989                 if (!arrayEnd)
990                     syntaxError(arrayStart);
991     
992                 tok = arrayEnd->next();
993             }
994     
995             // pointer to class member
996             else if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "( %type% :: * %type% ) ;")) {
997                 tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(2);
998                 namespaceStart = tokOffset->previous();
999                 namespaceEnd = tokOffset;
1000                 ptrMember = true;
1001                 tokOffset = tokOffset->tokAt(2);
1002                 typeName = tokOffset;
1003                 tok = tokOffset->tokAt(2);
1004             }
1005     
1006             // unhandled typedef, skip it and continue
1007             else {
1008                 unsupportedTypedef(typeDef);
1009                 tok = deleteInvalidTypedef(typeDef);
1010                 if (tok == list.front())
1011                     //now the next token to process is 'tok', not 'tok->next()';
1012                     goback = true;
1013                 continue;
1014             }
1015     
1016             bool done = false;
1017             bool ok = true;
1018     
1019             while (!done) {
1020                 std::string pattern = typeName->str();
1021                 int scope = 0;
1022                 bool simplifyType = false;
1023                 bool inMemberFunc = false;
1024                 int memberScope = 0;
1025                 bool globalScope = false;
1026                 int classLevel = spaceInfo.size();
1027     
1028                 for (Token *tok2 = tok; tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
1029                     if (Settings::terminated())
1030                         return;
1031     
1032                     if (tok2->link()) { // Pre-check for performance
1033                         // check for end of scope
1034                         if (tok2->str() == "}") {
1035                             // check for end of member function
1036                             if (inMemberFunc) {
1037                                 --memberScope;
1038                                 if (memberScope == 0)
1039                                     inMemberFunc = false;
1040                             }
1041     
1042                             if (classLevel > 0 && tok2 == spaceInfo[classLevel - 1].bodyEnd) {
1043                                 --classLevel;
1044                                 pattern.clear();
1045     
1046                                 for (int i = classLevel; i < spaceInfo.size(); ++i)
1047                                     pattern += (spaceInfo[i].className + " :: ");
1048     
1049                                 pattern += typeName->str();
1050                             } else {
1051                                 if (scope == 0)
1052                                     break;
1053                                 --scope;
1054                             }
1055                         }
1056     
1057                         // check for member functions
1058                         else if (isCPP() && Token::Match(tok2, ")|] const| {")) {
1059                             const Token *temp = tok2;
1060                             while (temp && temp->str() == "]" && temp->link() && temp->link()->previous())
1061                                 temp = temp->link()->previous();
1062                             if (!temp || !temp->link() || !temp->link()->previous())
1063                                 continue;
1064                             const Token *func = temp->link()->previous();
1065                             if (temp->str() != ")")
1066                                 continue;
1067                             if (!func || !func->previous()) // Ticket #4239
1068                                 continue;
1069     
1070                             /** @todo add support for multi-token operators */
1071                             if (func->previous()->str() == "operator")
1072                                 func = func->previous();
1073     
1074                             if (!func->previous())
1075                                 syntaxError(func);
1076     
1077                             // check for qualifier
1078                             if (func->previous()->str() == "::") {
1079                                 // check for available and matching class name
1080                                 if (!spaceInfo.empty() && classLevel < spaceInfo.size() &&
1081                                     func->strAt(-2) == spaceInfo[classLevel].className) {
1082                                     memberScope = 0;
1083                                     inMemberFunc = true;
1084                                 }
1085                             }
1086                         }
1087     
1088                         // check for entering a new scope
1089                         else if (tok2->str() == "{") {
1090                             // check for entering a new namespace
1091                             if (isCPP() && tok2->strAt(-2) == "namespace") {
1092                                 if (classLevel < spaceInfo.size() &&
1093                                     spaceInfo[classLevel].isNamespace &&
1094                                     spaceInfo[classLevel].className == tok2->previous()->str()) {
1095                                     spaceInfo[classLevel].bodyEnd = tok2->link();
1096                                     ++classLevel;
1097                                     pattern.clear();
1098                                     for (int i = classLevel; i < spaceInfo.size(); ++i)
1099                                         pattern += spaceInfo[i].className + " :: ";
1100     
1101                                     pattern += typeName->str();
1102                                 }
1103                                 ++scope;
1104                             }
1105     
1106                             // keep track of scopes within member function
1107                             if (inMemberFunc)
1108                                 ++memberScope;
1109     
1110                             ++scope;
1111                         }
1112                     }
1113     
1114                     // check for operator typedef
1115                     /** @todo add support for multi-token operators */
1116                     else if (isCPP() &&
1117                              tok2->str() == "operator" &&
1118                              tok2->next() &&
1119                              tok2->next()->str() == typeName->str() &&
1120                              tok2->linkAt(2) &&
1121                              tok2->strAt(2) == "(" &&
1122                              Token::Match(tok2->linkAt(2), ") const| {")) {
1123                         // check for qualifier
1124                         if (tok2->previous()->str() == "::") {
1125                             // check for available and matching class name
1126                             if (!spaceInfo.empty() && classLevel < spaceInfo.size() &&
1127                                 tok2->strAt(-2) == spaceInfo[classLevel].className) {
1128                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1129                                 simplifyType = true;
1130                             }
1131                         }
1132                     }
1133     
1134                     // check for typedef that can be substituted
1135                     else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, pattern.c_str()) ||
1136                              (inMemberFunc && tok2->str() == typeName->str())) {
1137                         // member function class variables don't need qualification
1138                         if (!(inMemberFunc && tok2->str() == typeName->str()) && pattern.find("::") != std::string::npos) { // has a "something ::"
1139                             Token *start = tok2;
1140                             int count = 0;
1141                             int back = classLevel - 1;
1142                             bool good = true;
1143                             // check for extra qualification
1144                             while (back >= 0) {
1145                                 Token *qualificationTok = start->tokAt(-2);
1146                                 if (!Token::Match(qualificationTok, "%type% ::"))
1147                                     break;
1148                                 if (qualificationTok->str() == spaceInfo[back].className) {
1149                                     start = qualificationTok;
1150                                     back--;
1151                                     count++;
1152                                 } else {
1153                                     good = false;
1154                                     break;
1155                                 }
1156                             }
1157                             // check global namespace
1158                             if (good && back == 0 && start->strAt(-1) == "::")
1159                                 good = false;
1160     
1161                             if (good) {
1162                                 // remove any extra qualification if present
1163                                 while (count) {
1164                                     tok2->tokAt(-3)->deleteNext(2);
1165                                     --count;
1166                                 }
1167     
1168                                 // remove global namespace if present
1169                                 if (tok2->strAt(-1) == "::") {
1170                                     tok2->tokAt(-2)->deleteNext();
1171                                     globalScope = true;
1172                                 }
1173     
1174                                 // remove qualification if present
1175                                 for (int i = classLevel; i < spaceInfo.size(); ++i) {
1176                                     tok2->deleteNext(2);
1177                                 }
1178                                 simplifyType = true;
1179                             }
1180                         } else {
1181                             if (tok2->strAt(-1) == "::") {
1182                                 int relativeSpaceInfoSize = spaceInfo.size();
1183                                 Token * tokBeforeType = tok2->previous();
1184                                 while (relativeSpaceInfoSize != 0 &&
1185                                        tokBeforeType && tokBeforeType->str() == "::" &&
1186                                        tokBeforeType->strAt(-1) == spaceInfo[relativeSpaceInfoSize-1].className) {
1187                                     tokBeforeType = tokBeforeType->tokAt(-2);
1188                                     --relativeSpaceInfoSize;
1189                                 }
1190                                 if (tokBeforeType && tokBeforeType->str() != "::") {
1191                                     Token::eraseTokens(tokBeforeType, tok2);
1192                                     simplifyType = true;
1193                                 }
1194                             } else if (Token::Match(tok2->previous(), "case|;|{|} %type% :")) {
1195                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1196                             } else if (duplicateTypedef(&tok2, typeName, typeDef)) {
1197                                 // skip to end of scope if not already there
1198                                 if (tok2->str() != "}") {
1199                                     while (tok2->next()) {
1200                                         if (tok2->next()->str() == "{")
1201                                             tok2 = tok2->linkAt(1)->previous();
1202                                         else if (tok2->next()->str() == "}")
1203                                             break;
1204     
1205                                         tok2 = tok2->next();
1206                                     }
1207                                 }
1208                             } else if (Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-2), "%type% *|&")) {
1209                                 // Ticket #5868: Don't substitute variable names
1210                             } else if (tok2->previous()->str() != ".") {
1211                                 simplifyType = true;
1212                             }
1213                         }
1214                     }
1215     
1216                     if (simplifyType) {
1217                         // can't simplify 'operator functionPtr ()' and 'functionPtr operator ... ()'
1218                         if (functionPtr && (tok2->previous()->str() == "operator" ||
1219                                             (tok2->next() && tok2->next()->str() == "operator"))) {
1220                             simplifyType = false;
1221                             tok2 = tok2->next();
1222                             continue;
1223                         }
1224     
1225                         // There are 2 categories of typedef substitutions:
1226                         // 1. variable declarations that preserve the variable name like
1227                         //    global, local, and function parameters
1228                         // 2. not variable declarations that have no name like derived
1229                         //    classes, casts, operators, and template parameters
1230     
1231                         // try to determine which category this substitution is
1232                         bool inCast = false;
1233                         bool inTemplate = false;
1234                         bool inOperator = false;
1235                         bool inSizeof = false;
1236     
1237                         const bool sameStartEnd = (typeStart == typeEnd);
1238     
1239                         // check for derived class: class A : some_typedef {
1240                         const bool isDerived = Token::Match(tok2->previous(), "public|protected|private %type% {|,");
1241     
1242                         // check for cast: (some_typedef) A or static_cast<some_typedef>(A)
1243                         // todo: check for more complicated casts like: (const some_typedef *)A
1244                         if ((tok2->previous()->str() == "(" && tok2->next()->str() == ")" && tok2->strAt(-2) != "sizeof") ||
1245                             (tok2->previous()->str() == "<" && Token::simpleMatch(tok2->next(), "> (")) ||
1246                             Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-2), "( const %name% )"))
1247                             inCast = true;
1248     
1249                         // check for template parameters: t<some_typedef> t1
1250                         else if (Token::Match(tok2->previous(), "<|,") &&
1251                                  Token::Match(tok2->next(), "&|*| &|*| >|,"))
1252                             inTemplate = true;
1253     
1254                         else if (Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-2), "sizeof ( %type% )"))
1255                             inSizeof = true;
1256     
1257                         // check for operator
1258                         if (tok2->strAt(-1) == "operator" ||
1259                             Token::simpleMatch(tok2->tokAt(-2), "operator const"))
1260                             inOperator = true;
1261     
1262                         if (typeStart->str() == "typename" && tok2->strAt(-1)=="typename") {
1263                             // Remove one typename if it is already contained in the goal
1264                             typeStart = typeStart->next();
1265                         }
1266     
1267                         // skip over class or struct in derived class declaration
1268                         bool structRemoved = false;
1269                         if (isDerived && Token::Match(typeStart, "class|struct")) {
1270                             if (typeStart->str() == "struct")
1271                                 structRemoved = true;
1272                             typeStart = typeStart->next();
1273                         }
1274                         if (Token::Match(typeStart, "struct|class") && Token::Match(tok2, "%name% ::"))
1275                             typeStart = typeStart->next();
1276     
1277                         if (sameStartEnd)
1278                             typeEnd = typeStart;
1279     
1280                         // start substituting at the typedef name by replacing it with the type
1281                         tok2->str(typeStart->str());
1282     
1283                         // restore qualification if it was removed
1284                         if (typeStart->str() == "struct" || structRemoved) {
1285                             if (structRemoved)
1286                                 tok2 = tok2->previous();
1287     
1288                             if (globalScope) {
1289                                 tok2->insertToken("::");
1290                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1291                             }
1292     
1293                             for (int i = classLevel; i < spaceInfo.size(); ++i) {
1294                                 tok2->insertToken(spaceInfo[i].className);
1295                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1296                                 tok2->insertToken("::");
1297                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1298                             }
1299                         }
1300     
1301                         // add remainder of type
1302                         tok2 = TokenList::copyTokens(tok2, typeStart->next(), typeEnd);
1303     
1304                         if (!pointers.empty()) {
1305                             for (const std::string &p : pointers) {
1306                                 tok2->insertToken(p);
1307                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1308                             }
1309                         }
1310     
1311                         if (funcStart && funcEnd) {
1312                             tok2->insertToken("(");
1313                             tok2 = tok2->next();
1314                             Token *tok3 = tok2;
1315                             tok2 = TokenList::copyTokens(tok2, funcStart, funcEnd);
1316     
1317                             if (!inCast)
1318                                 tok2 = processFunc(tok2, inOperator);
1319     
1320                             if (!tok2)
1321                                 break;
1322     
1323                             tok2->insertToken(")");
1324                             tok2 = tok2->next();
1325                             Token::createMutualLinks(tok2, tok3);
1326     
1327                             tok2 = TokenList::copyTokens(tok2, argStart, argEnd);
1328     
1329                             if (specStart) {
1330                                 Token *spec = specStart;
1331                                 tok2->insertToken(spec->str());
1332                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1333                                 while (spec != specEnd) {
1334                                     spec = spec->next();
1335                                     tok2->insertToken(spec->str());
1336                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1337                                 }
1338                             }
1339                         }
1340     
1341                         else if (functionPtr || function) {
1342                             // don't add parentheses around function names because it
1343                             // confuses other simplifications
1344                             bool needParen = true;
1345                             if (!inTemplate && function && tok2->next() && tok2->next()->str() != "*")
1346                                 needParen = false;
1347                             if (needParen) {
1348                                 tok2->insertToken("(");
1349                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1350                             }
1351                             Token *tok3 = tok2;
1352                             if (namespaceStart) {
1353                                 const Token *tok4 = namespaceStart;
1354     
1355                                 while (tok4 != namespaceEnd) {
1356                                     tok2->insertToken(tok4->str());
1357                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1358                                     tok4 = tok4->next();
1359                                 }
1360                                 tok2->insertToken(namespaceEnd->str());
1361                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1362                             }
1363                             if (functionPtr) {
1364                                 tok2->insertToken("*");
1365                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1366                             }
1367     
1368                             if (!inCast)
1369                                 tok2 = processFunc(tok2, inOperator);
1370     
1371                             if (needParen) {
1372                                 if (!tok2)
1373                                     syntaxError(nullptr);
1374     
1375                                 tok2->insertToken(")");
1376                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1377                                 Token::createMutualLinks(tok2, tok3);
1378                             }
1379                             if (!tok2)
1380                                 syntaxError(nullptr);
1381     
1382                             tok2 = TokenList::copyTokens(tok2, argStart, argEnd);
1383                             if (inTemplate) {
1384                                 if (!tok2)
1385                                     syntaxError(nullptr);
1386     
1387                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1388                             }
1389     
1390                             if (specStart) {
1391                                 Token *spec = specStart;
1392                                 tok2->insertToken(spec->str());
1393                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1394                                 while (spec != specEnd) {
1395                                     spec = spec->next();
1396                                     tok2->insertToken(spec->str());
1397                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1398                                 }
1399                             }
1400                         } else if (functionRetFuncPtr || functionPtrRetFuncPtr) {
1401                             tok2->insertToken("(");
1402                             tok2 = tok2->next();
1403                             Token *tok3 = tok2;
1404                             tok2->insertToken("*");
1405                             tok2 = tok2->next();
1406     
1407                             Token * tok4 = nullptr;
1408                             if (functionPtrRetFuncPtr) {
1409                                 tok2->insertToken("(");
1410                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1411                                 tok4 = tok2;
1412                                 tok2->insertToken("*");
1413                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1414                             }
1415     
1416                             // skip over variable name if there
1417                             if (!inCast) {
1418                                 if (!tok2 || !tok2->next())
1419                                     syntaxError(nullptr);
1420     
1421                                 if (tok2->next()->str() != ")")
1422                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1423                             }
1424     
1425                             if (tok4 && functionPtrRetFuncPtr) {
1426                                 tok2->insertToken(")");
1427                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1428                                 Token::createMutualLinks(tok2, tok4);
1429                             }
1430     
1431                             tok2 = TokenList::copyTokens(tok2, argStart, argEnd);
1432     
1433                             tok2->insertToken(")");
1434                             tok2 = tok2->next();
1435                             Token::createMutualLinks(tok2, tok3);
1436     
1437                             tok2 = TokenList::copyTokens(tok2, argFuncRetStart, argFuncRetEnd);
1438                         } else if (ptrToArray || refToArray) {
1439                             tok2->insertToken("(");
1440                             tok2 = tok2->next();
1441                             Token *tok3 = tok2;
1442     
1443                             if (ptrToArray)
1444                                 tok2->insertToken("*");
1445                             else
1446                                 tok2->insertToken("&");
1447                             tok2 = tok2->next();
1448     
1449                             // skip over name
1450                             if (tok2->next() && tok2->next()->str() != ")") {
1451                                 if (tok2->next()->str() != "(")
1452                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1453     
1454                                 // check for function and skip over args
1455                                 if (tok2 && tok2->next() && tok2->next()->str() == "(")
1456                                     tok2 = tok2->next()->link();
1457     
1458                                 // check for array
1459                                 if (tok2 && tok2->next() && tok2->next()->str() == "[")
1460                                     tok2 = tok2->next()->link();
1461                             } else {
1462                                 // syntax error
1463                             }
1464     
1465                             tok2->insertToken(")");
1466                             Token::createMutualLinks(tok2->next(), tok3);
1467                         } else if (ptrMember) {
1468                             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "* (")) {
1469                                 tok2->insertToken("*");
1470                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1471                             } else {
1472                                 // This is the case of casting operator.
1473                                 // Name is not available, and () should not be
1474                                 // inserted
1475                                 const bool castOperator = inOperator && Token::Match(tok2, "%type% (");
1476                                 Token *openParenthesis = nullptr;
1477     
1478                                 if (!castOperator) {
1479                                     tok2->insertToken("(");
1480                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1481     
1482                                     openParenthesis = tok2;
1483                                 }
1484     
1485                                 const Token *tok4 = namespaceStart;
1486     
1487                                 while (tok4 != namespaceEnd) {
1488                                     tok2->insertToken(tok4->str());
1489                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1490                                     tok4 = tok4->next();
1491                                 }
1492                                 tok2->insertToken(namespaceEnd->str());
1493                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1494     
1495                                 tok2->insertToken("*");
1496                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
1497     
1498                                 if (openParenthesis) {
1499                                     // Skip over name, if any
1500                                     if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "%name%"))
1501                                         tok2 = tok2->next();
1502     
1503                                     tok2->insertToken(")");
1504                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1505     
1506                                     Token::createMutualLinks(tok2, openParenthesis);
1507                                 }
1508                             }
1509                         } else if (typeOf) {
1510                             tok2 = TokenList::copyTokens(tok2, argStart, argEnd);
1511                         } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "%name% [")) {
1512                             while (Token::Match(tok2, "%name%|] [")) {
1513                                 tok2 = tok2->linkAt(1);
1514                             }
1515                             tok2 = tok2->previous();
1516                         }
1517     
1518                         if (arrayStart && arrayEnd) {
1519                             do {
1520                                 if (!tok2->next())
1521                                     syntaxError(tok2); // can't recover so quit
1522     
1523                                 if (!inCast && !inSizeof && !inTemplate)
1524                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1525     
1526                                 if (tok2->str() == "const")
1527                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1528     
1529                                 // reference or pointer to array?
1530                                 if (tok2->str() == "&" || tok2->str() == "*") {
1531                                     tok2 = tok2->previous();
1532                                     tok2->insertToken("(");
1533                                     Token *tok3 = tok2->next();
1534     
1535                                     // handle missing variable name
1536                                     if (tok2->strAt(3) == ")" || tok2->strAt(3) == ",")
1537                                         tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
1538                                     else
1539                                         tok2 = tok2->tokAt(3);
1540                                     if (!tok2)
1541                                         syntaxError(nullptr);
1542     
1543                                     while (tok2->strAt(1) == "::")
1544                                         tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
1545     
1546                                     // skip over function parameters
1547                                     if (tok2->strAt(1) == "(") {
1548                                         tok2 = tok2->linkAt(1);
1549     
1550                                         if (tok2->strAt(1) == "const")
1551                                             tok2 = tok2->next();
1552                                     }
1553     
1554                                     tok2->insertToken(")");
1555                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
1556                                     Token::createMutualLinks(tok2, tok3);
1557                                 }
1558     
1559                                 if (!tok2->next())
1560                                     syntaxError(tok2); // can't recover so quit
1561     
1562                                 // skip over array dimensions
1563                                 while (tok2->next()->str() == "[")
1564                                     tok2 = tok2->linkAt(1);
1565     
1566                                 tok2 = TokenList::copyTokens(tok2, arrayStart, arrayEnd);
1567                                 if (!tok2->next())
1568                                     syntaxError(tok2);
1569     
1570                                 if (tok2->str() == "=") {
1571                                     if (!tok2->next())
1572                                         syntaxError(tok2);
1573                                     if (tok2->next()->str() == "{")
1574                                         tok2 = tok2->next()->link()->next();
1575                                     else if (tok2->next()->str().at(0) == '\"')
1576                                         tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
1577                                 }
1578                             } while (Token::Match(tok2, ", %name% ;|=|,"));
1579                         }
1580     
1581                         simplifyType = false;
1582                     }
1583                     if (!tok2)
1584                         break;
1585                 }
1586     
1587                 if (!tok)
1588                     syntaxError(nullptr);
1589     
1590                 if (tok->str() == ";")
1591                     done = true;
1592                 else if (tok->str() == ",") {
1593                     arrayStart = nullptr;
1594                     arrayEnd = nullptr;
1595                     tokOffset = tok->next();
1596                     pointers.clear();
1597     
1598                     while (Token::Match(tokOffset, "*|&")) {
1599                         pointers.push_back(tokOffset->str());
1600                         tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
1601                     }
1602     
1603                     if (Token::Match(tokOffset, "%type%")) {
1604                         typeName = tokOffset;
1605                         tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
1606     
1607                         if (tokOffset && tokOffset->str() == "[") {
1608                             arrayStart = tokOffset;
1609     
1610                             for (;;) {
1611                                 while (tokOffset->next() && !Token::Match(tokOffset->next(), ";|,"))
1612                                     tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
1613     
1614                                 if (!tokOffset->next())
1615                                     return; // invalid input
1616                                 else if (tokOffset->next()->str() == ";")
1617                                     break;
1618                                 else if (tokOffset->str() == "]")
1619                                     break;
1620                                 else
1621                                     tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
1622                             }
1623     
1624                             arrayEnd = tokOffset;
1625                             tokOffset = tokOffset->next();
1626                         }
1627     
1628                         if (Token::Match(tokOffset, ";|,"))
1629                             tok = tokOffset;
1630                         else {
1631                             // we encountered a typedef we don't support yet so just continue
1632                             done = true;
1633                             ok = false;
1634                         }
1635                     } else {
1636                         // we encountered a typedef we don't support yet so just continue
1637                         done = true;
1638                         ok = false;
1639                     }
1640                 } else {
1641                     // something is really wrong (internal error)
1642                     done = true;
1643                     ok = false;
1644                 }
1645             }
1646     
1647             if (ok) {
1648                 // remove typedef
1649                 Token::eraseTokens(typeDef, tok);
1650     
1651                 if (typeDef != list.front()) {
1652                     tok = typeDef->previous();
1653                     tok->deleteNext();
1654                     //no need to remove last token in the list
1655                     if (tok->tokAt(2))
1656                         tok->deleteNext();
1657                 } else {
1658                     list.front()->deleteThis();
1659                     //no need to remove last token in the list
1660                     if (list.front()->next())
1661                         list.front()->deleteThis();
1662                     tok = list.front();
1663                     //now the next token to process is 'tok', not 'tok->next()';
1664                     goback = true;
1665                 }
1666             }
1667         }
1668     }
1669     
1670     namespace {
1671         struct ScopeInfo3 {
1672             ScopeInfo3(const std::string &name_, const Token *bodyEnd_) : name(name_), bodyEnd(bodyEnd_) {}
1673             const std::string name;
1674             const Token * const bodyEnd;
1675             std::set<std::string> usingNamespaces;
1676         };
1677     
1678         std::string getScopeName(const std::list<ScopeInfo3> &scopeInfo)
1679         {
1680             std::string ret;
1681             for (const ScopeInfo3 &i : scopeInfo) {
1682                 if (!i.name.empty())
1683                     ret += (ret.empty() ? "" : " :: ") + i.name;
1684             }
1685             return ret;
1686         }
1687     
1688         void setScopeInfo(Token *tok, std::list<ScopeInfo3> *scopeInfo, bool all = false)
1689         {
1690             while (tok->str() == "}" && !scopeInfo->empty() && tok == scopeInfo->back().bodyEnd)
1691                 scopeInfo->pop_back();
1692             if (!Token::Match(tok, "namespace|class|struct|union %name% {|:|::")) {
1693                 // check for using namespace
1694                 if (Token::Match(tok, "using namespace %name% ;|::")) {
1695                     const Token * tok1 = tok->tokAt(2);
1696                     std::string nameSpace;
1697                     while (tok1 && tok1->str() != ";") {
1698                         if (!nameSpace.empty())
1699                             nameSpace += " ";
1700                         nameSpace += tok1->str();
1701                         tok1 = tok1->next();
1702                     }
1703                     scopeInfo->back().usingNamespaces.insert(nameSpace);
1704                 }
1705                 // check for member function
1706                 else if (tok->str() == "{") {
1707                     bool added = false;
1708                     Token *tok1 = tok;
1709                     while (Token::Match(tok1->previous(), "const|volatile|final|override|&|&&|noexcept"))
1710                         tok1 = tok1->previous();
1711                     if (tok1 && tok1->previous() && tok1->strAt(-1) == ")") {
1712                         tok1 = tok1->linkAt(-1);
1713                         if (Token::Match(tok1->previous(), "throw|noexcept")) {
1714                             tok1 = tok1->previous();
1715                             while (Token::Match(tok1->previous(), "const|volatile|final|override|&|&&|noexcept"))
1716                                 tok1 = tok1->previous();
1717                             if (tok1->strAt(-1) != ")")
1718                                 return;
1719                         } else if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), ":|, %name%")) {
1720                             tok1 = tok1->tokAt(-2);
1721                             if (tok1->strAt(-1) != ")")
1722                                 return;
1723                         }
1724                         if (tok1->strAt(-1) == ">")
