1725                             tok1 = tok1->previous()->findOpeningBracket();
1726                         if (tok1 && Token::Match(tok1->tokAt(-3), "%name% :: %name%")) {
1727                             tok1 = tok1->tokAt(-2);
1728                             std::string scope = tok1->strAt(-1);
1729                             while (Token::Match(tok1->tokAt(-2), ":: %name%")) {
1730                                 scope = tok1->strAt(-3) + " :: " + scope;
1731                                 tok1 = tok1->tokAt(-2);
1732                             }
1733                             scopeInfo->emplace_back(scope, tok->link());
1734                             added = true;
1735                         }
1736                     }
1737     
1738                     if (all && !added)
1739                         scopeInfo->emplace_back("", tok->link());
1740                 }
1741                 return;
1742             }
1743     
1744             tok = tok->next();
1745             std::string classname = tok->str();
1746             while (Token::Match(tok, "%name% :: %name%")) {
1747                 tok = tok->tokAt(2);
1748                 classname += " :: " + tok->str();
1749             }
1750             tok = tok->next();
1751             if (tok && tok->str() == ":") {
1752                 while (tok && !Token::Match(tok, ";|{"))
1753                     tok = tok->next();
1754             }
1755             if (tok && tok->str() == "{") {
1756                 scopeInfo->emplace_back(classname,tok->link());
1757             }
1758         }
1759     
1760         Token *findSemicolon(Token *tok)
1761         {
1762             int level = 0;
1763     
1764             for (; tok && (level > 0 || tok->str() != ";"); tok = tok->next()) {
1765                 if (tok->str() == "{")
1766                     ++level;
1767                 else if (level > 0 && tok->str() == "}")
1768                     --level;
1769             }
1770     
1771             return tok;
1772         }
1773     
1774         bool usingMatch(
1775             const Token *nameToken,
1776             const std::string &scope,
1777             Token **tok,
1778             const std::string &scope1,
1779             const std::list<ScopeInfo3> &scopeList1)
1780         {
1781             Token *tok1 = *tok;
1782     
1783             if (tok1 && tok1->str() != nameToken->str())
1784                 return false;
1785     
1786             // skip this using
1787             if (tok1 == nameToken) {
1788                 *tok = findSemicolon(tok1);
1789                 return false;
1790             }
1791     
1792             // skip other using with this name
1793             if (tok1->strAt(-1) == "using") {
1794                 // fixme: this is wrong
1795                 // skip to end of scope
1796                 if (scopeList1.back().bodyEnd)
1797                     *tok = scopeList1.back().bodyEnd->previous();
1798                 return false;
1799             }
1800     
1801             if (Token::Match(tok1->tokAt(-1), "class|struct|union|enum")) {
1802                 // fixme
1803                 return false;
1804             }
1805     
1806             // get qualification
1807             std::string qualification;
1808             const Token* tok2 = tok1;
1809             std::string::size_type index = scope.size();
1810             std::string::size_type new_index = std::string::npos;
1811             bool match = true;
1812             while (tok2->strAt(-1) == "::") {
1813                 std::string last;
1814                 if (match && !scope1.empty()) {
1815                     new_index = scope1.rfind(' ', index - 1);
1816                     if (new_index != std::string::npos)
1817                         last = scope1.substr(new_index, index - new_index);
1818                     else if (!qualification.empty())
1819                         last.clear();
1820                     else
1821                         last = scope1;
1822                 } else
1823                     match = false;
1824                 if (match && tok2->strAt(-2) == last)
1825                     index = new_index;
1826                 else {
1827                     if (!qualification.empty())
1828                         qualification = " :: " + qualification;
1829                     qualification = tok2->strAt(-2) + qualification;
1830                 }
1831                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(-2);
1832             }
1833     
1834             std::string fullScope1 = scope1;
1835             if (!scope1.empty() && !qualification.empty())
1836                 fullScope1 += " :: ";
1837             fullScope1 += qualification;
1838     
1839             if (scope == fullScope1)
1840                 return true;
1841     
1842             // check using namespace
1843             if (!scopeList1.back().usingNamespaces.empty()) {
1844                 if (qualification.empty()) {
1845                     if (scopeList1.back().usingNamespaces.find(scope) != scopeList1.back().usingNamespaces.end())
1846                         return true;
1847                 } else {
1848                     for (auto ns : scopeList1.back().usingNamespaces) {
1849                         if (scope == ns + " :: " + qualification)
1850                             return true;
1851                     }
1852                 }
1853             }
1854     
1855             std::string newScope1 = scope1;
1856     
1857             // scopes didn't match so try higher scopes
1858             while (!newScope1.empty()) {
1859                 std::string::size_type separator = newScope1.rfind(" :: ", index - 1);
1860                 if (separator != std::string::npos)
1861                     newScope1 = newScope1.substr(0, separator);
1862                 else
1863                     newScope1.clear();
1864     
1865                 std::string newFullScope1 = newScope1;
1866                 if (!newScope1.empty() && !qualification.empty())
1867                     newFullScope1 += " :: ";
1868                 newFullScope1 += qualification;
1869     
1870                 if (scope == newFullScope1)
1871                     return true;
1872             }
1873     
1874             return false;
1875         }
1876     } // namespace
1877     
1878     bool Tokenizer::simplifyUsing()
1879     {
1880         bool substitute = false;
1881         std::list<ScopeInfo3> scopeList;
1882         struct Using {
1883             Using(Token *start, Token *end) : startTok(start), endTok(end) { }
1884             Token *startTok;
1885             Token *endTok;
1886         };
1887         std::list<Using> usingList;
1888     
1889         scopeList.emplace_back("", nullptr);
1890     
1891         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
1892             if (mErrorLogger && !list.getFiles().empty())
1893                 mErrorLogger->reportProgress(list.getFiles()[0], "Tokenize (using)", tok->progressValue());
1894     
1895             if (Settings::terminated())
1896                 return substitute;
1897     
1898             if (Token::Match(tok, "{|}|namespace|class|struct|union") ||
1899                 Token::Match(tok, "using namespace %name% ;|::")) {
1900                 setScopeInfo(tok, &scopeList);
1901             }
1902     
1903             // skip template declarations
1904             if (Token::Match(tok, "template < !!>")) {
1905                 Token *endToken = TemplateSimplifier::findTemplateDeclarationEnd(tok);
1906                 if (endToken)
1907                     tok = endToken;
1908                 continue;
1909             }
1910     
1911             // look for non-template type aliases
1912             if (!(tok->strAt(-1) != ">" &&
1913                   (Token::Match(tok, "using %name% = ::| %name%") ||
1914                    (Token::Match(tok, "using %name% [ [") &&
1915                     Token::Match(tok->linkAt(2), "] ] = ::| %name%")))))
1916                 continue;
1917     
1918             std::list<ScopeInfo3> scopeList1;
1919             scopeList1.emplace_back("", nullptr);
1920             std::string name = tok->strAt(1);
1921             const Token *nameToken = tok->next();
1922             std::string scope = getScopeName(scopeList);
1923             Token *usingStart = tok;
1924             Token *start;
1925             if (tok->strAt(2) == "=")
1926                 start = tok->tokAt(3);
1927             else
1928                 start = tok->linkAt(2)->tokAt(3);
1929             Token *usingEnd = findSemicolon(start);
1930             if (!usingEnd)
1931                 continue;
1932     
1933             // Move struct defined in using out of using.
1934             // using T = struct t { }; => struct t { }; using T = struct t;
1935             // fixme: this doesn't handle attributes
1936             if (Token::Match(start, "struct|union|enum %name%| {")) {
1937                 if (start->strAt(1) != "{") {
1938                     Token *structEnd = start->linkAt(2);
1939                     structEnd->insertToken(";", "");
1940                     TokenList::copyTokens(structEnd->next(), tok, start->next());
1941                     usingStart = structEnd->tokAt(2);
1942                     nameToken = usingStart->next();
1943                     if (usingStart->strAt(2) == "=")
1944                         start = usingStart->tokAt(3);
1945                     else
1946                         start = usingStart->linkAt(2)->tokAt(3);
1947                     usingEnd = findSemicolon(start);
1948                     tok->deleteThis();
1949                     tok->deleteThis();
1950                     tok->deleteThis();
1951                     tok = usingStart;
1952                 } else {
1953                     Token *structEnd = start->linkAt(1);
1954                     structEnd->insertToken(";", "");
1955                     std::string newName;
1956                     if (structEnd->strAt(2) == ";")
1957                         newName = name;
1958                     else
1959                         newName = "Unnamed" + MathLib::toString(mUnnamedCount++);
1960                     TokenList::copyTokens(structEnd->next(), tok, start);
1961                     structEnd->tokAt(5)->insertToken(newName, "");
1962                     start->insertToken(newName, "");
1963     
1964                     usingStart = structEnd->tokAt(2);
1965                     nameToken = usingStart->next();
1966                     if (usingStart->strAt(2) == "=")
1967                         start = usingStart->tokAt(3);
1968                     else
1969                         start = usingStart->linkAt(2)->tokAt(3);
1970                     usingEnd = findSemicolon(start);
1971                     tok->deleteThis();
1972                     tok->deleteThis();
1973                     tok->deleteThis();
1974                     tok = usingStart;
1975                 }
1976             }
1977     
1978             // remove 'typename' and 'template'
1979             else if (start->str() == "typename") {
1980                 start->deleteThis();
1981                 Token *temp = start;
1982                 while (Token::Match(temp, "%name% ::"))
1983                     temp = temp->tokAt(2);
1984                 if (Token::Match(temp, "template %name%"))
1985                     temp->deleteThis();
1986             }
1987     
1988             // Unfortunately we have to start searching from the beginning
1989             // of the token stream because templates are instantiated at
1990             // the end of the token stream and it may be used before then.
1991             std::string scope1;
1992             bool skip = false; // don't erase type aliases we can't parse
1993             for (Token* tok1 = list.front(); tok1; tok1 = tok1->next()) {
1994                 if ((Token::Match(tok1, "{|}|namespace|class|struct|union") && tok1->strAt(-1) != "using") ||
1995                     Token::Match(tok1, "using namespace %name% ;|::")) {
1996                     setScopeInfo(tok1, &scopeList1, true);
1997                     scope1 = getScopeName(scopeList1);
1998                     continue;
1999                 }
2000     
2001                 // skip template definitions
2002                 if (Token::Match(tok1, "template < !!>")) {
2003                     Token *endToken = TemplateSimplifier::findTemplateDeclarationEnd(tok1);
2004                     if (endToken)
2005                         tok1 = endToken;
2006                     continue;
2007                 }
2008     
2009                 if (!usingMatch(nameToken, scope, &tok1, scope1, scopeList1))
2010                     continue;
2011     
2012                 // remove the qualification
2013                 std::string fullScope = scope;
2014                 while (tok1->strAt(-1) == "::") {
2015                     if (fullScope == tok1->strAt(-2)) {
2016                         tok1->deletePrevious();
2017                         tok1->deletePrevious();
2018                         break;
2019                     } else {
2020                         const std::string::size_type idx = fullScope.rfind(" ");
2021     
2022                         if (idx == std::string::npos)
2023                             break;
2024     
2025                         if (tok1->strAt(-2) == fullScope.substr(idx + 1)) {
2026                             tok1->deletePrevious();
2027                             tok1->deletePrevious();
2028                             fullScope.resize(idx - 3);
2029                         } else
2030                             break;
2031                     }
2032                 }
2033     
2034                 Token * arrayStart = nullptr;
2035     
2036                 // parse the type
2037                 Token *type = start;
2038                 if (type->str() == "::") {
2039                     type = type->next();
2040                     while (Token::Match(type, "%type% ::"))
2041                         type = type->tokAt(2);
2042                     if (Token::Match(type, "%type%"))
2043                         type = type->next();
2044                 } else if (Token::Match(type, "%type% ::")) {
2045                     do {
2046                         type = type->tokAt(2);
2047                     } while (Token::Match(type, "%type% ::"));
2048                     if (Token::Match(type, "%type%"))
2049                         type = type->next();
2050                 } else if (Token::Match(type, "%type%")) {
2051                     while (Token::Match(type, "const|struct|union|enum %type%") ||
2052                            (type->next() && type->next()->isStandardType()))
2053                         type = type->next();
2054     
2055                     type = type->next();
2056     
2057                     while (Token::Match(type, "%type%") &&
2058                            (type->isStandardType() || Token::Match(type, "unsigned|signed"))) {
2059                         type = type->next();
2060                     }
2061     
2062                     bool atEnd = false;
2063                     while (!atEnd) {
2064                         if (type && type->str() == "::") {
2065                             type = type->next();
2066                         }
2067     
2068                         if (Token::Match(type, "%type%") &&
2069                             type->next() && !Token::Match(type->next(), "[|;|,|(")) {
2070                             type = type->next();
2071                         } else if (Token::simpleMatch(type, "const (")) {
2072                             type = type->next();
2073                             atEnd = true;
2074                         } else
2075                             atEnd = true;
2076                     }
2077                 } else
2078                     syntaxError(type);
2079     
2080                 // check for invalid input
2081                 if (!type)
2082                     syntaxError(tok1);
2083     
2084                 // check for template
2085                 if (type->str() == "<") {
2086                     type = type->findClosingBracket();
2087     
2088                     while (type && Token::Match(type->next(), ":: %type%"))
2089                         type = type->tokAt(2);
2090     
2091                     if (!type) {
2092                         syntaxError(tok1);
2093                     }
2094     
2095                     while (Token::Match(type->next(), "const|volatile"))
2096                         type = type->next();
2097     
2098                     type = type->next();
2099                 }
2100     
2101                 // check for pointers and references
2102                 std::list<std::string> pointers;
2103                 while (Token::Match(type, "*|&|&&|const")) {
2104                     pointers.push_back(type->str());
2105                     type = type->next();
2106                 }
2107     
2108                 // check for array
2109                 if (type && type->str() == "[") {
2110                     do {
2111                         if (!arrayStart)
2112                             arrayStart = type;
2113     
2114                         bool atEnd = false;
2115                         while (!atEnd) {
2116                             while (type->next() && !Token::Match(type->next(), ";|,")) {
2117                                 type = type->next();
2118                             }
2119     
2120                             if (!type->next())
2121                                 syntaxError(type); // invalid input
2122                             else if (type->next()->str() == ";")
2123                                 atEnd = true;
2124                             else if (type->str() == "]")
2125                                 atEnd = true;
2126                             else
2127                                 type = type->next();
2128                         }
2129     
2130                         type = type->next();
2131                     } while (type && type->str() == "[");
2132                 }
2133     
2134                 Token* after = tok1->next();
2135                 // check if type was parsed
2136                 if (type && type == usingEnd) {
2137                     // check for array syntax and add type around variable
2138                     if (arrayStart) {
2139                         if (Token::Match(tok1->next(), "%name%")) {
2140                             TokenList::copyTokens(tok1->next(), arrayStart, usingEnd->previous());
2141                             TokenList::copyTokens(tok1, start, arrayStart->previous());
2142                             tok1->deleteThis();
2143                             substitute = true;
2144                         }
2145                     } else {
2146                         // just replace simple type aliases
2147                         TokenList::copyTokens(tok1, start, usingEnd->previous());
2148                         tok1->deleteThis();
2149                         substitute = true;
2150                     }
2151                 } else {
2152                     skip = true;
2153                     if (mSettings->debugwarnings && mErrorLogger) {
2154                         std::string str;
2155                         for (Token *tok3 = usingStart; tok3 && tok3 != usingEnd; tok3 = tok3->next()) {
2156                             if (!str.empty())
2157                                 str += ' ';
2158                             str += tok3->str();
2159                         }
2160                         str += " ;";
2161                         std::list<const Token *> callstack(1, usingStart);
2162                         mErrorLogger->reportErr(ErrorLogger::ErrorMessage(callstack, &list, Severity::debug, "debug",
2163                                                 "Failed to parse \'" + str + "\'. The checking continues anyway.", false));
2164                     }
2165                 }
2166                 tok1 = after;
2167             }
2168     
2169             if (!skip)
2170                 usingList.emplace_back(usingStart, usingEnd);
2171         }
2172     
2173         // delete all used type alias definitions
2174         for (std::list<Using>::reverse_iterator it = usingList.rbegin(); it != usingList.rend(); ++it) {
2175             Token *usingStart = it->startTok;
2176             Token *usingEnd = it->endTok;
2177             if (usingStart->previous()) {
2178                 if (usingEnd->next())
2179                     Token::eraseTokens(usingStart->previous(), usingEnd->next());
2180                 else {
2181                     Token::eraseTokens(usingStart->previous(), usingEnd);
2182                     usingEnd->deleteThis();
2183                 }
2184             } else {
2185                 if (usingEnd->next()) {
2186                     Token::eraseTokens(usingStart, usingEnd->next());
2187                     usingStart->deleteThis();
2188                 } else {
2189                     // this is the only code being checked so leave ';'
2190                     Token::eraseTokens(usingStart, usingEnd);
2191                     usingStart->deleteThis();
2192                 }
2193             }
2194         }
2195     
2196         return substitute;
2197     }
2198     void Tokenizer::simplifyMulAndParens()
2199     {
2200         if (!list.front())
2201             return;
2202         for (Token *tok = list.front()->tokAt(3); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2203             if (!tok->isName())
2204                 continue;
2205             //fix ticket #2784 - improved by ticket #3184
2206             int closedPars = 0;
2207             Token *tokend = tok->next();
2208             Token *tokbegin = tok->previous();
2209             while (tokend && tokend->str() == ")") {
2210                 ++closedPars;
2211                 tokend = tokend->next();
2212             }
2213             if (!tokend || !(tokend->isAssignmentOp()))
2214                 continue;
2215             while (Token::Match(tokbegin, "&|(")) {
2216                 if (tokbegin->str() == "&") {
2217                     if (Token::Match(tokbegin->tokAt(-2), "[;{}&(] *")) {
2218                         //remove '* &'
2219                         tokbegin = tokbegin->tokAt(-2);
2220                         tokbegin->deleteNext(2);
2221                     } else if (Token::Match(tokbegin->tokAt(-3), "[;{}&(] * (")) {
2222                         if (closedPars == 0)
2223                             break;
2224                         --closedPars;
2225                         //remove ')'
2226                         tok->deleteNext();
2227                         //remove '* ( &'
2228                         tokbegin = tokbegin->tokAt(-3);
2229                         tokbegin->deleteNext(3);
2230                     } else
2231                         break;
2232                 } else if (tokbegin->str() == "(") {
2233                     if (closedPars == 0)
2234                         break;
2235     
2236                     //find consecutive opening parentheses
2237                     int openPars = 0;
2238                     while (tokbegin && tokbegin->str() == "(" && openPars <= closedPars) {
2239                         ++openPars;
2240                         tokbegin = tokbegin->previous();
2241                     }
2242                     if (!tokbegin || openPars > closedPars)
2243                         break;
2244     
2245                     if ((openPars == closedPars && Token::Match(tokbegin, "[;{}]")) ||
2246                         Token::Match(tokbegin->tokAt(-2), "[;{}&(] * &") ||
2247                         Token::Match(tokbegin->tokAt(-3), "[;{}&(] * ( &")) {
2248                         //remove the excessive parentheses around the variable
2249                         while (openPars > 0) {
2250                             tok->deleteNext();
2251                             tokbegin->deleteNext();
2252                             --closedPars;
2253                             --openPars;
2254                         }
2255                     } else
2256                         break;
2257                 }
2258             }
2259         }
2260     }
2261     
2262     bool Tokenizer::createTokens(std::istream &code,
2263                                  const std::string& FileName)
2264     {
2265         // make sure settings specified
2266         assert(mSettings);
2267     
2268         return list.createTokens(code, FileName);
2269     }
2270     
2271     void Tokenizer::createTokens(const simplecpp::TokenList *tokenList)
2272     {
2273         // make sure settings specified
2274         assert(mSettings);
2275         list.createTokens(tokenList);
2276     }
2277     
2278     bool Tokenizer::simplifyTokens1(const std::string &configuration)
2279     {
2280         // Fill the map mTypeSize..
2281         fillTypeSizes();
2282     
2283         mConfiguration = configuration;
2284     
2285         if (!simplifyTokenList1(list.getFiles().front().c_str()))
2286             return false;
2287     
2288         if (mTimerResults) {
2289             Timer t("Tokenizer::simplifyTokens1::createAst", mSettings->showtime, mTimerResults);
2290             list.createAst();
2291             list.validateAst();
2292         } else {
2293             list.createAst();
2294             list.validateAst();
2295         }
2296     
2297         if (mTimerResults) {
2298             Timer t("Tokenizer::simplifyTokens1::createSymbolDatabase", mSettings->showtime, mTimerResults);
2299             createSymbolDatabase();
2300         } else {
2301             createSymbolDatabase();
2302         }
2303     
2304         // Use symbol database to identify rvalue references. Split && to & &. This is safe, since it doesn't delete any tokens (which might be referenced by symbol database)
2305         for (const Variable* var : mSymbolDatabase->variableList()) {
2306             if (var && var->isRValueReference()) {
2307                 Token* endTok = const_cast<Token*>(var->typeEndToken());
2308                 endTok->str("&");
2309                 endTok->astOperand1(nullptr);
2310                 endTok->astOperand2(nullptr);
2311                 endTok->insertToken("&");
2312                 endTok->next()->scope(endTok->scope());
2313             }
2314         }
2315     
2316         if (mTimerResults) {
2317             Timer t("Tokenizer::simplifyTokens1::setValueType", mSettings->showtime, mTimerResults);
2318             mSymbolDatabase->setValueTypeInTokenList(true);
2319         } else {
2320             mSymbolDatabase->setValueTypeInTokenList(true);
2321         }
2322     
2323         if (mTimerResults) {
2324             Timer t("Tokenizer::simplifyTokens1::ValueFlow", mSettings->showtime, mTimerResults);
2325             ValueFlow::setValues(&list, mSymbolDatabase, mErrorLogger, mSettings);
2326         } else {
2327             ValueFlow::setValues(&list, mSymbolDatabase, mErrorLogger, mSettings);
2328         }
2329     
2330         mSymbolDatabase->setArrayDimensionsUsingValueFlow();
2331     
2332         printDebugOutput(1);
2333     
2334         return true;
2335     }
2336     
2337     bool Tokenizer::tokenize(std::istream &code,
2338                              const char FileName[],
2339                              const std::string &configuration)
2340     {
2341         if (!createTokens(code, FileName))
2342             return false;
2343     
2344         return simplifyTokens1(configuration);
2345     }
2346     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2347     
2348     void Tokenizer::findComplicatedSyntaxErrorsInTemplates()
2349     {
2350         validate();
2351         mTemplateSimplifier->checkComplicatedSyntaxErrorsInTemplates();
2352     }
2353     
2354     void Tokenizer::checkForEnumsWithTypedef()
2355     {
2356         for (const Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2357             if (Token::Match(tok, "enum %name% {")) {
2358                 tok = tok->tokAt(2);
2359                 const Token *tok2 = Token::findsimplematch(tok, "typedef", tok->link());
2360                 if (tok2)
2361                     syntaxError(tok2);
2362                 tok = tok->link();
2363             }
2364         }
2365     }
2366     
2367     void Tokenizer::fillTypeSizes()
2368     {
2369         mTypeSize.clear();
2370         mTypeSize["char"] = 1;
2371         mTypeSize["_Bool"] = mSettings->sizeof_bool;
2372         mTypeSize["bool"] = mSettings->sizeof_bool;
2373         mTypeSize["short"] = mSettings->sizeof_short;
2374         mTypeSize["int"] = mSettings->sizeof_int;
2375         mTypeSize["long"] = mSettings->sizeof_long;
2376         mTypeSize["float"] = mSettings->sizeof_float;
2377         mTypeSize["double"] = mSettings->sizeof_double;
2378         mTypeSize["wchar_t"] = mSettings->sizeof_wchar_t;
2379         mTypeSize["size_t"] = mSettings->sizeof_size_t;
2380         mTypeSize["*"] = mSettings->sizeof_pointer;
2381     }
2382     
2383     void Tokenizer::combineOperators()
2384     {
2385         const bool cpp = isCPP();
2386     
2387         // Combine tokens..
2388         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok && tok->next(); tok = tok->next()) {
2389             const char c1 = tok->str()[0];
2390     
2391             if (tok->str().length() == 1 && tok->next()->str().length() == 1) {
2392                 const char c2 = tok->next()->str()[0];
2393     
2394                 // combine +-*/ and =
2395                 if (c2 == '=' && (std::strchr("+-*/%|^=!<>", c1))) {
2396                     // skip templates
2397                     if (cpp && tok->str() == ">") {
2398                         const Token *opening = tok->findOpeningBracket();
2399                         if (opening) {
2400                             if (Token::Match(opening->previous(), "%name%"))
2401                                 continue;
2402                         }
2403                     }
2404                     tok->str(tok->str() + c2);
2405                     tok->deleteNext();
2406                     continue;
2407                 }
2408             } else if (tok->next()->str() == "=") {
2409                 if (tok->str() == ">>") {
2410                     tok->str(">>=");
2411                     tok->deleteNext();
2412                 } else if (tok->str() == "<<") {
2413                     tok->str("<<=");
2414                     tok->deleteNext();
2415                 }
2416             } else if (cpp && (c1 == 'p' || c1 == '_') &&
2417                        Token::Match(tok, "private|protected|public|__published : !!:")) {
2418                 bool simplify = false;
2419                 int par = 0;
2420                 for (const Token *prev = tok->previous(); prev; prev = prev->previous()) {
2421                     if (prev->str() == ")") {
2422                         ++par;
2423                     } else if (prev->str() == "(") {
2424                         if (par == 0U)
2425                             break;
2426                         --par;
2427                     }
2428                     if (par != 0U || prev->str() == "(")
2429                         continue;
2430                     if (Token::Match(prev, "[;{}]")) {
2431                         simplify = true;
2432                         break;
2433                     }
2434                     if (prev->isName() && prev->isUpperCaseName())
2435                         continue;
2436                     if (prev->isName() && endsWith(prev->str(), ':'))
2437                         simplify = true;
2438                     break;
2439                 }
2440                 if (simplify) {
2441                     tok->str(tok->str() + ":");
2442                     tok->deleteNext();
2443                 }
2444             } else if (tok->str() == "->") {
2445                 // If the preceding sequence is "( & %name% )", replace it by "%name%"
2446                 Token *t = tok->tokAt(-4);
2447                 if (Token::Match(t, "( & %name% )")) {
2448                     t->deleteThis();
2449                     t->deleteThis();
2450                     t->deleteNext();
2451                 }
2452     
2453                 tok->str(".");
2454                 tok->originalName("->");
2455             }
2456         }
2457     }
2458     
2459     void Tokenizer::combineStringAndCharLiterals()
2460     {
2461         // Combine strings
2462         for (Token *tok = list.front();
2463              tok;
2464              tok = tok->next()) {
2465             if (tok->str()[0] != '"')
2466                 continue;
2467     
2468             tok->str(simplifyString(tok->str()));
2469             while (tok->next() && tok->next()->tokType() == Token::eString) {
2470                 // Two strings after each other, combine them
2471                 tok->concatStr(simplifyString(tok->next()->str()));
2472                 tok->deleteNext();
2473             }
2474         }
2475     }
2476     
2477     void Tokenizer::concatenateNegativeNumberAndAnyPositive()
2478     {
2479         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2480             if (!Token::Match(tok, "?|:|,|(|[|{|return|case|sizeof|%op% +|-") || tok->tokType() == Token::eIncDecOp)
2481                 continue;
2482     
2483             while (tok->str() != ">" && tok->next() && tok->next()->str() == "+")
2484                 tok->deleteNext();
2485     
2486             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "- %num%")) {
2487                 tok->deleteNext();
2488                 tok->next()->str("-" + tok->next()->str());
2489             }
2490         }
2491     }
2492     
2493     void Tokenizer::simplifyExternC()
2494     {
2495         if (isC())
2496             return;
2497         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2498             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "extern \"C\"")) {
2499                 if (tok->strAt(2) == "{") {
2500                     tok->linkAt(2)->deleteThis();
2501                     tok->deleteNext(2);
2502                 } else
2503                     tok->deleteNext();
2504                 tok->deleteThis();
2505             }
2506         }
2507     }
2508     
2509     void Tokenizer::simplifyRoundCurlyParentheses()
2510     {
2511         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2512             while (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}:] ( {") &&
2513                    Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(2), "} ) ;")) {
2514                 if (tok->str() == ":" && !Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2),"[;{}] %type% :"))
2515                     break;
2516                 Token *end = tok->linkAt(2)->tokAt(-3);
2517                 if (Token::Match(end, "[;{}] %num%|%str% ;"))
2518                     end->deleteNext(2);
2519                 tok->linkAt(2)->previous()->deleteNext(3);
2520                 tok->deleteNext(2);
2521             }
2522             if (Token::Match(tok, "( { %bool%|%char%|%num%|%str%|%name% ; } )")) {
2523                 tok->deleteNext();
2524                 tok->deleteThis();
2525                 tok->deleteNext(3);
2526             }
2527         }
2528     }
2529     
2530     void Tokenizer::simplifySQL()
2531     {
2532         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2533             if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok, "__CPPCHECK_EMBEDDED_SQL_EXEC__ SQL"))
2534                 continue;
2535     
2536             const Token *end = findSQLBlockEnd(tok);
2537             if (end == nullptr)
2538                 syntaxError(nullptr);
2539     
2540             const std::string instruction = tok->stringifyList(end);
2541             // delete all tokens until the embedded SQL block end
2542             Token::eraseTokens(tok, end);
2543     
2544             // insert "asm ( "instruction" ) ;"
2545             tok->str("asm");
2546             // it can happen that 'end' is NULL when wrong code is inserted
2547             if (!tok->next())
2548                 tok->insertToken(";");
2549             tok->insertToken(")");
2550             tok->insertToken("\"" + instruction + "\"");
2551             tok->insertToken("(");
2552             // jump to ';' and continue
2553             tok = tok->tokAt(3);
2554         }
2555     }
2556     
2557     void Tokenizer::simplifyArrayAccessSyntax()
2558     {
2559         // 0[a] -> a[0]
2560         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2561             if (tok->isNumber() && Token::Match(tok, "%num% [ %name% ]")) {
2562                 const std::string number(tok->str());
2563                 Token* indexTok = tok->tokAt(2);
2564                 tok->str(indexTok->str());
2565                 tok->varId(indexTok->varId());
2566                 indexTok->str(number);
2567             }
2568         }
2569     }
2570     
2571     void Tokenizer::simplifyParameterVoid()
2572     {
2573         for (Token* tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2574             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% ( void )"))
2575                 tok->next()->deleteNext();
2576         }
2577     }
2578     
2579     void Tokenizer::simplifyRedundantConsecutiveBraces()
2580     {
2581         // Remove redundant consecutive braces, i.e. '.. { { .. } } ..' -> '.. { .. } ..'.
2582         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok;) {
2583             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "= {")) {
2584                 tok = tok->linkAt(1);
2585             } else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "{ {") && Token::simpleMatch(tok->next()->link(), "} }")) {
2586                 //remove internal parentheses
2587                 tok->next()->link()->deleteThis();
2588                 tok->deleteNext();
2589             } else
2590                 tok = tok->next();
2591         }
2592     }
2593     
2594     void Tokenizer::simplifyDoublePlusAndDoubleMinus()
2595     {
2596         // Convert - - into + and + - into -
2597         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2598             while (tok->next()) {
2599                 if (tok->str() == "+") {
2600                     if (tok->next()->str()[0] == '-') {
2601                         tok = tok->next();
2602                         if (tok->str().size() == 1) {
2603                             tok = tok->previous();
2604                             tok->str("-");
2605                             tok->deleteNext();
2606                         } else if (tok->isNumber()) {
2607                             tok->str(tok->str().substr(1));
2608                             tok = tok->previous();
2609                             tok->str("-");
2610                         }
2611                         continue;
2612                     }
2613                 } else if (tok->str() == "-") {
2614                     if (tok->next()->str()[0] == '-') {
2615                         tok = tok->next();
2616                         if (tok->str().size() == 1) {
2617                             tok = tok->previous();
2618                             tok->str("+");
2619                             tok->deleteNext();
2620                         } else if (tok->isNumber()) {
2621                             tok->str(tok->str().substr(1));
2622                             tok = tok->previous();
2623                             tok->str("+");
2624                         }
2625                         continue;
2626                     }
2627                 }
2628     
2629                 break;
2630             }
2631         }
2632     }
2633     
2634     /** Specify array size if it hasn't been given */
2635     
2636     void Tokenizer::arraySize()
2637     {
2638         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2639             if (!tok->isName() || !Token::Match(tok, "%var% [ ] ="))
2640                 continue;
2641             bool addlength = false;
2642             if (Token::Match(tok, "%var% [ ] = { %str% } ;")) {
2643                 Token *t = tok->tokAt(3);
2644                 t->deleteNext();
2645                 t->next()->deleteNext();
2646                 addlength = true;
2647             }
2648     
2649             if (addlength || Token::Match(tok, "%var% [ ] = %str% ;")) {
2650                 tok = tok->next();
2651                 const int sz = Token::getStrSize(tok->tokAt(3));
2652                 tok->insertToken(MathLib::toString(sz));
2653                 tok = tok->tokAt(5);
2654             }
2655     
2656             else if (Token::Match(tok, "%var% [ ] = {")) {
2657                 MathLib::biguint sz = 1;
2658                 tok = tok->next();
2659                 Token *end = tok->linkAt(3);
2660                 for (Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(4); tok2 && tok2 != end; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
2661                     if (tok2->link() && Token::Match(tok2, "{|(|[|<")) {
2662                         if (tok2->str() == "[" && tok2->link()->strAt(1) == "=") { // designated initializer
2663                             if (Token::Match(tok2, "[ %num% ]"))
2664                                 sz = std::max(sz, MathLib::toULongNumber(tok2->strAt(1)) + 1U);
2665                             else {
2666                                 sz = 0;
2667                                 break;
2668                             }
2669                         }
2670                         tok2 = tok2->link();
2671                     } else if (tok2->str() == ",") {
2672                         if (!Token::Match(tok2->next(), "[},]"))
2673                             ++sz;
2674                         else {
2675                             tok2 = tok2->previous();
2676                             tok2->deleteNext();
2677                         }
2678                     }
2679                 }
2680     
2681                 if (sz != 0)
2682                     tok->insertToken(MathLib::toString(sz));
2683     
2684                 tok = end->next() ? end->next() : end;
2685             }
2686         }
2687     }
2688     
2689     static Token *skipTernaryOp(Token *tok)
2690     {
2691         int colonLevel = 1;
2692         while (nullptr != (tok = tok->next())) {
2693             if (tok->str() == "?") {
2694                 ++colonLevel;
2695             } else if (tok->str() == ":") {
2696                 --colonLevel;
2697                 if (colonLevel == 0) {
2698                     tok = tok->next();
2699                     break;
2700                 }
2701             }
2702             if (tok->link() && Token::Match(tok, "[(<]"))
2703                 tok = tok->link();
2704             else if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "[{};)]"))
2705                 break;
2706         }
2707         if (colonLevel > 0) // Ticket #5214: Make sure the ':' matches the proper '?'
2708             return nullptr;
2709         return tok;
2710     }
2711     
2712     const Token * Tokenizer::startOfExecutableScope(const Token * tok)
2713     {
2714         if (tok->str() != ")")
2715             return nullptr;
2716     
2717         tok = isFunctionHead(tok, ":{", true);
2718     
2719         if (Token::Match(tok, ": %name% [({]")) {
2720             while (Token::Match(tok, "[:,] %name% [({]"))
2721                 tok = tok->linkAt(2)->next();
2722         }
2723     
2724         return (tok && tok->str() == "{") ? tok : nullptr;
2725     }
2726     
2727     
2728     /** simplify labels and case|default in the code: add a ";" if not already in.*/
2729     
2730     void Tokenizer::simplifyLabelsCaseDefault()
2731     {
2732         const bool cpp = isCPP();
2733         bool executablescope = false;
2734         int indentLevel = 0;
2735         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2736             // Simplify labels in the executable scope..
2737             Token *start = const_cast<Token *>(startOfExecutableScope(tok));
2738             if (start) {
2739                 tok = start;
2740                 executablescope = true;
2741             }
2742     
2743             if (!executablescope)
2744                 continue;
2745     
2746             if (tok->str() == "{") {
2747                 if (tok->previous()->str() == "=")
2748                     tok = tok->link();
2749                 else
2750                     ++indentLevel;
2751             } else if (tok->str() == "}") {
2752                 --indentLevel;
2753                 if (indentLevel == 0) {
2754                     executablescope = false;
2755                     continue;
2756                 }
2757             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "(|["))
2758                 tok = tok->link();
2759     
2760             if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}:] case")) {
2761                 while (nullptr != (tok = tok->next())) {
2762                     if (Token::Match(tok, "(|[")) {
2763                         tok = tok->link();
2764                     } else if (tok->str() == "?") {
2765                         Token *tok1 = skipTernaryOp(tok);
2766                         if (!tok1) {
2767                             syntaxError(tok);
2768                         }
2769                         tok = tok1;
2770                     }
2771                     if (Token::Match(tok->next(),"[:{};]"))
2772                         break;
2773                 }
2774                 if (!tok)
2775                     break;
2776                 if (tok->str() != "case" && tok->next() && tok->next()->str() == ":") {
2777                     tok = tok->next();
2778                     if (!tok->next())
2779                         syntaxError(tok);
2780                     if (tok->next()->str() != ";" && tok->next()->str() != "case")
2781                         tok->insertToken(";");
2782                     else
2783                         tok = tok->previous();
2784                 } else {
2785                     syntaxError(tok);
2786                 }
2787             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] %name% : !!;")) {
2788                 if (!cpp || !Token::Match(tok->next(), "class|struct|enum")) {
2789                     tok = tok->tokAt(2);
2790                     tok->insertToken(";");
2791                 }
2792             }
2793         }
2794     }
2795     
2796     
2797     void Tokenizer::simplifyCaseRange()
2798     {
2799         for (Token* tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2800             if (Token::Match(tok, "case %num% ... %num% :")) {
2801                 const MathLib::bigint start = MathLib::toLongNumber(tok->strAt(1));
2802                 MathLib::bigint end = MathLib::toLongNumber(tok->strAt(3));
2803                 end = std::min(start + 50, end); // Simplify it 50 times at maximum
2804                 if (start < end) {
2805                     tok = tok->tokAt(2);
2806                     tok->str(":");
2807                     tok->insertToken("case");
2808                     for (MathLib::bigint i = end-1; i > start; i--) {
2809                         tok->insertToken(":");
2810                         tok->insertToken(MathLib::toString(i));
2811                         tok->insertToken("case");
2812                     }
2813                 }
2814             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "case %char% ... %char% :")) {
2815                 const char start = tok->strAt(1)[1];
2816                 const char end = tok->strAt(3)[1];
2817                 if (start < end) {
2818                     tok = tok->tokAt(2);
2819                     tok->str(":");
2820                     tok->insertToken("case");
2821                     for (char i = end - 1; i > start; i--) {
2822                         tok->insertToken(":");
2823                         if (i == '\\') {
2824                             tok->insertToken(std::string("\'\\") + i + '\'');
2825                         } else {
2826                             tok->insertToken(std::string(1, '\'') + i + '\'');
2827                         }
2828                         tok->insertToken("case");
2829                     }
2830                 }
2831             }
2832         }
2833     }
2834     
2835     void Tokenizer::calculateScopes()
2836     {
2837         for (auto tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next())
2838             tok->scopeInfo(nullptr);
2839     
2840         std::string nextScopeNameAddition;
2841         std::shared_ptr<ScopeInfo2> primaryScope = std::make_shared<ScopeInfo2>("", nullptr);
2842         list.front()->scopeInfo(primaryScope);
2843     
2844         for (Token* tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
2845             if (tok == list.front() || !tok->scopeInfo()) {
2846                 if (tok != list.front())
2847                     tok->scopeInfo(tok->previous()->scopeInfo());
2848     
2849                 if (Token::Match(tok, "using namespace %name% ::|<|;")) {
2850                     std::string usingNamespaceName;
2851                     for (const Token* namespaceNameToken = tok->tokAt(2);
2852                          !Token::simpleMatch(namespaceNameToken, ";");
2853                          namespaceNameToken = namespaceNameToken->next()) {
2854                         usingNamespaceName += namespaceNameToken->str();
2855                         usingNamespaceName += " ";
2856                     }
2857                     if (usingNamespaceName.length() > 0)
2858                         usingNamespaceName = usingNamespaceName.substr(0, usingNamespaceName.length() - 1);
2859                     tok->scopeInfo()->usingNamespaces.insert(usingNamespaceName);
2860                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "namespace|class|struct|union %name% {|::|:|<")) {
2861                     for (Token* nameTok = tok->next(); nameTok && !Token::Match(nameTok, "{|:"); nameTok = nameTok->next()) {
2862                         if (Token::Match(nameTok, ";|<")) {
2863                             nextScopeNameAddition = "";
2864                             break;
2865                         }
2866                         nextScopeNameAddition.append(nameTok->str());
2867                         nextScopeNameAddition.append(" ");
2868                     }
2869                     if (nextScopeNameAddition.length() > 0)
2870                         nextScopeNameAddition = nextScopeNameAddition.substr(0, nextScopeNameAddition.length() - 1);
2871                 }
2872     
2873                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "{")) {
2874                     // This might be the opening of a member function
2875                     Token *tok1 = tok;
2876                     while (Token::Match(tok1->previous(), "const|volatile|final|override|&|&&|noexcept"))
2877                         tok1 = tok1->previous();
2878                     if (tok1 && tok1->previous() && tok1->strAt(-1) == ")") {
2879                         bool member = true;
2880                         tok1 = tok1->linkAt(-1);
2881                         if (Token::Match(tok1->previous(), "throw|noexcept")) {
2882                             tok1 = tok1->previous();
2883                             while (Token::Match(tok1->previous(), "const|volatile|final|override|&|&&|noexcept"))
2884                                 tok1 = tok1->previous();
2885                             if (tok1->strAt(-1) != ")")
2886                                 member = false;
2887                         } else if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), ":|, %name%")) {
2888                             tok1 = tok1->tokAt(-2);
2889                             if (tok1->strAt(-1) != ")")
2890                                 member = false;
2891                         }
2892                         if (member) {
2893                             if (tok1->strAt(-1) == ">")
2894                                 tok1 = tok1->previous()->findOpeningBracket();
2895                             if (tok1 && Token::Match(tok1->tokAt(-3), "%name% :: %name%")) {
2896                                 tok1 = tok1->tokAt(-2);
2897                                 std::string scope = tok1->strAt(-1);
2898                                 while (Token::Match(tok1->tokAt(-2), ":: %name%")) {
2899                                     scope = tok1->strAt(-3) + " :: " + scope;
2900                                     tok1 = tok1->tokAt(-2);
2901                                 }
2902     
2903                                 if (!nextScopeNameAddition.empty() && !scope.empty())
2904                                     nextScopeNameAddition += " :: ";
2905                                 nextScopeNameAddition += scope;
2906                             }
2907                         }
2908                     }
2909     
2910                     // New scope is opening, record it here
2911                     std::shared_ptr<ScopeInfo2> newScopeInfo = std::make_shared<ScopeInfo2>(tok->scopeInfo()->name, tok->link(), tok->scopeInfo()->usingNamespaces);
2912     
2913                     if (newScopeInfo->name != "" && nextScopeNameAddition != "")
2914                         newScopeInfo->name.append(" :: ");
2915                     newScopeInfo->name.append(nextScopeNameAddition);
2916                     nextScopeNameAddition = "";
2917     
2918                     if (tok->link())
2919                         tok->link()->scopeInfo(tok->scopeInfo());
2920                     tok->scopeInfo(newScopeInfo);
2921                 }
2922             }
2923         }
2924     }
2925     
2926     void Tokenizer::simplifyTemplates()
2927     {
2928         if (isC())
2929             return;
2930     
2931         mTemplateSimplifier->simplifyTemplates(
2932     #ifdef MAXTIME
2933             mMaxTime,
2934     #else
2935             0, // ignored
2936     #endif
2937             mCodeWithTemplates);
2938     }
2939     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2940     
2941     
2942     static bool setVarIdParseDeclaration(const Token **tok, const std::map<std::string,int> &variableId, bool executableScope, bool cpp, bool c)
2943     {
2944         const Token *tok2 = *tok;
2945         if (!tok2->isName())
2946             return false;
2947     
2948         int typeCount = 0;
2949         int singleNameCount = 0;
2950         bool hasstruct = false;   // Is there a "struct" or "class"?
2951         bool bracket = false;
2952         bool ref = false;
2953         while (tok2) {
2954             if (tok2->isName()) {
2955                 if (cpp && Token::Match(tok2, "namespace|public|private|protected"))
2956                     return false;
2957                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "struct|union|enum") || (!c && Token::Match(tok2, "class|typename"))) {
2958                     hasstruct = true;
2959                     typeCount = 0;
2960                     singleNameCount = 0;
2961                 } else if (tok2->str() == "const") {
2962                     ;  // just skip "const"
2963                 } else if (!hasstruct && variableId.find(tok2->str()) != variableId.end() && tok2->previous()->str() != "::") {
2964                     ++typeCount;
2965                     tok2 = tok2->next();
2966                     if (!tok2 || tok2->str() != "::")
2967                         break;
2968                 } else {
2969                     if (tok2->str() != "void" || Token::Match(tok2, "void const| *|(")) // just "void" cannot be a variable type
2970                         ++typeCount;
2971                     ++singleNameCount;
2972                 }
2973             } else if (!c && ((TemplateSimplifier::templateParameters(tok2) > 0) ||
2974                               Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "< >") /* Ticket #4764 */)) {
2975                 const Token *start = *tok;
2976                 if (Token::Match(start->previous(), "%or%|%oror%|&&|&|^|+|-|*|/"))
2977                     return false;
2978                 const Token * const closingBracket = tok2->findClosingBracket();
2979                 if (closingBracket == nullptr) { /* Ticket #8151 */
2980                     throw tok2;
2981                 }
2982                 tok2 = closingBracket;
2983                 if (tok2->str() != ">")
2984                     break;
2985                 singleNameCount = 1;
2986                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "> %name% %or%|%oror%|&&|&|^|+|-|*|/") && !Token::Match(tok2, "> const [*&]"))
2987                     return false;
2988                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "> %name% )")) {
2989                     if (Token::Match(tok2->linkAt(2)->previous(), "if|for|while ("))
2990                         return false;
2991                     if (!Token::Match(tok2->linkAt(2)->previous(), "%name% ("))
2992                         return false;
2993                 }
2994             } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "&|&&")) {
2995                 ref = !bracket;
2996             } else if (singleNameCount == 1 && Token::Match(tok2, "( [*&]") && Token::Match(tok2->link()->next(), "(|[")) {
2997                 bracket = true; // Skip: Seems to be valid pointer to array or function pointer
2998             } else if (tok2->str() == "::") {
2999                 singleNameCount = 0;
3000             } else if (tok2->str() != "*" && tok2->str() != "::") {
3001                 break;
3002             }
3003             tok2 = tok2->next();
3004         }
3005     
3006         if (tok2) {
3007             bool isLambdaArg = false;
3008             {
3009                 const Token *tok3 = (*tok)->previous();
3010                 if (tok3 && tok3->str() == ",") {
3011                     while (tok3 && !Token::Match(tok3,";|(|[|{")) {
3012                         if (Token::Match(tok3, ")|]"))
3013                             tok3 = tok3->link();
3014                         tok3 = tok3->previous();
3015                     }
3016     
3017                     if (tok3 && executableScope && Token::Match(tok3->previous(), "%name% (")) {
3018                         const Token *fdecl = tok3->previous();
3019                         int count = 0;
3020                         while (Token::Match(fdecl, "%name%|*")) {
3021                             fdecl = fdecl->previous();
3022                             count++;
3023                         }
3024                         if (!Token::Match(fdecl, "[;{}] %name%") || count <= 1)
3025                             return false;
3026                     }
3027                 }
3028     
3029                 if (cpp && tok3 && Token::simpleMatch(tok3->previous(), "] (") && Token::simpleMatch(tok3->link(), ") {"))
3030                     isLambdaArg = true;
3031             }
3032     
3033     
3034             *tok = tok2;
3035     
3036             // In executable scopes, references must be assigned
3037             // Catching by reference is an exception
3038             if (executableScope && ref && !isLambdaArg) {
3039                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "(|=|{|:"))
3040                     ;   // reference is assigned => ok
3041                 else if (tok2->str() != ")" || tok2->link()->strAt(-1) != "catch")
3042                     return false;   // not catching by reference => not declaration
3043             }
3044         }
3045     
3046         // Check if array declaration is valid (#2638)
3047         // invalid declaration: AAA a[4] = 0;
3048         if (typeCount >= 2 && executableScope && tok2 && tok2->str() == "[") {
3049             const Token *tok3 = tok2->link()->next();
3050             while (tok3 && tok3->str() == "[") {
3051                 tok3 = tok3->link()->next();
3052             }
3053             if (Token::Match(tok3, "= %num%"))
3054                 return false;
3055         }
3056     
3057         return (typeCount >= 2 && tok2 && Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-2), "!!:: %type%"));
3058     }
3059     
3060     
3061     void Tokenizer::setVarIdStructMembers(Token **tok1,
3062                                           std::map<int, std::map<std::string, int> >& structMembers,
3063                                           nonneg int *varId)
3064     {
3065         Token *tok = *tok1;
3066     
3067         if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% = { . %name% =")) {
3068             const int struct_varid = tok->varId();
3069             if (struct_varid == 0)
3070                 return;
3071     
3072             std::map<std::string, int>& members = structMembers[struct_varid];
3073     
3074             tok = tok->tokAt(3);
3075             while (tok->str() != "}") {
3076                 if (Token::Match(tok, "{|[|("))
3077                     tok = tok->link();
3078                 if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[,{] . %name% =")) {
3079                     tok = tok->next();
3080                     const std::map<std::string, int>::iterator it = members.find(tok->str());
3081                     if (it == members.end()) {
3082                         members[tok->str()] = ++(*varId);
3083                         tok->varId(*varId);
3084                     } else {
3085                         tok->varId(it->second);
3086                     }
3087                 }
3088                 tok = tok->next();
3089             }
3090     
3091             return;
3092         }
3093     
3094         while (Token::Match(tok->next(), ")| . %name% !!(")) {
3095             // Don't set varid for trailing return type
3096             if (tok->strAt(1) == ")" && tok->linkAt(1)->previous()->isName() &&
3097                 isFunctionHead(tok->linkAt(1), "{|;")) {
3098                 tok = tok->tokAt(3);
3099                 continue;
3100             }
3101             const int struct_varid = tok->varId();
3102             tok = tok->tokAt(2);
3103             if (struct_varid == 0)
3104                 continue;
3105     
3106             if (tok->str() == ".")
3107                 tok = tok->next();
3108     
3109             // Don't set varid for template function
3110             if (TemplateSimplifier::templateParameters(tok->next()) > 0)
3111                 break;
3112     
3113             std::map<std::string, int>& members = structMembers[struct_varid];
3114             const std::map<std::string, int>::iterator it = members.find(tok->str());
3115             if (it == members.end()) {
3116                 members[tok->str()] = ++(*varId);
3117                 tok->varId(*varId);
3118             } else {
3119                 tok->varId(it->second);
3120             }
3121         }
3122         // tok can't be null
3123         *tok1 = tok;
3124     }
3125     
3126     
3127     void Tokenizer::setVarIdClassDeclaration(const Token * const startToken,
3128             const VariableMap &variableMap,
3129             const nonneg int scopeStartVarId,
3130             std::map<int, std::map<std::string,int> >& structMembers)
3131     {
3132         // end of scope
3133         const Token * const endToken = startToken->link();
3134     
3135         // determine class name
3136         std::string className;
3137         for (const Token *tok = startToken->previous(); tok; tok = tok->previous()) {
3138             if (!tok->isName() && tok->str() != ":")
3139                 break;
3140             if (Token::Match(tok, "class|struct|enum %type% [:{]")) {
3141                 className = tok->next()->str();
3142                 break;
3143             }
3144         }
3145     
3146         // replace varids..
3147         int indentlevel = 0;
3148         bool initList = false;
3149         bool inEnum = false;
3150         const Token *initListArgLastToken = nullptr;
3151         for (Token *tok = startToken->next(); tok != endToken; tok = tok->next()) {
3152             if (!tok)
3153                 syntaxError(nullptr);
3154             if (initList) {
3155                 if (tok == initListArgLastToken)
3156                     initListArgLastToken = nullptr;
3157                 else if (!initListArgLastToken &&
3158                          Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%name%|>|>> {|(") &&
3159                          Token::Match(tok->link(), "}|) ,|{"))
3160                     initListArgLastToken = tok->link();
3161             }
3162             if (tok->str() == "{") {
3163                 inEnum = isEnumStart(tok);
3164                 if (initList && !initListArgLastToken)
3165                     initList = false;
3166                 ++indentlevel;
3167             } else if (tok->str() == "}") {
3168                 --indentlevel;
3169                 inEnum = false;
3170             } else if (initList && indentlevel == 0 && Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[,:] %name% [({]")) {
3171                 const std::map<std::string, int>::const_iterator it = variableMap.find(tok->str());
3172                 if (it != variableMap.end()) {
3173                     tok->varId(it->second);
3174                 }
3175             } else if (tok->isName() && tok->varId() <= scopeStartVarId) {
3176                 if (indentlevel > 0 || initList) {
3177                     if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "::|.") && tok->strAt(-2) != "this" && !Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-5), "( * this ) ."))
3178                         continue;
3179                     if (!tok->next())
3180                         syntaxError(nullptr);
3181                     if (tok->next()->str() == "::") {
3182                         if (tok->str() == className)
3183                             tok = tok->tokAt(2);
3184                         else
3185                             continue;
3186                     }
3187     
3188                     if (!inEnum) {
3189                         const std::map<std::string, int>::const_iterator it = variableMap.find(tok->str());
3190                         if (it != variableMap.end()) {
3191                             tok->varId(it->second);
3192                             setVarIdStructMembers(&tok, structMembers, variableMap.getVarId());
3193                         }
3194                     }
3195                 }
3196             } else if (indentlevel == 0 && tok->str() == ":" && !initListArgLastToken)
3197                 initList = true;
3198         }
3199     }
3200     
3201     
3202     
3203     // Update the variable ids..
3204     // Parse each function..
3205     void Tokenizer::setVarIdClassFunction(const std::string &classname,
3206                                           Token * const startToken,
3207                                           const Token * const endToken,
3208                                           const std::map<std::string, int> &varlist,
3209                                           std::map<int, std::map<std::string, int> >& structMembers,
3210                                           nonneg int *varId_)
3211     {
3212         for (Token *tok2 = startToken; tok2 && tok2 != endToken; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
3213             if (tok2->varId() != 0 || !tok2->isName())
3214                 continue;
3215             if (Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-2), ("!!" + classname + " ::").c_str()))
3216                 continue;
3217             if (Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-4), "%name% :: %name% ::")) // Currently unsupported
3218                 continue;
3219             if (Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-2), "!!this .") && !Token::simpleMatch(tok2->tokAt(-5), "( * this ) ."))
3220                 continue;
3221     
3222             const std::map<std::string,int>::const_iterator it = varlist.find(tok2->str());
3223             if (it != varlist.end()) {
3224                 tok2->varId(it->second);
3225                 setVarIdStructMembers(&tok2, structMembers, varId_);
3226             }
3227         }
3228     }
3229     
3230     
3231     
3232     void Tokenizer::setVarId()
3233     {
3234         // Clear all variable ids
3235         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
3236             if (tok->isName())
3237                 tok->varId(0);
3238         }
3239     
3240         setPodTypes();
3241     
3242         setVarIdPass1();
3243     
3244         setVarIdPass2();
3245     }
3246     
3247     
3248     // Variable declarations can't start with "return" etc.
3249     #define NOTSTART_C "case", "default", "goto", "NOT", "return", "sizeof", "typedef"
3250     static const std::set<std::string> notstart_c = { NOTSTART_C };
3251     static const std::set<std::string> notstart_cpp = { NOTSTART_C,
3252                                                         "delete", "friend", "new", "throw", "using", "virtual", "explicit", "const_cast", "dynamic_cast", "reinterpret_cast", "static_cast", "template"
3253                                                       };
3254     
3255     void Tokenizer::setVarIdPass1()
3256     {
3257         // Variable declarations can't start with "return" etc.
3258         const std::set<std::string>& notstart = (isC()) ? notstart_c : notstart_cpp;
3259     
3260         VariableMap variableMap;
3261         std::map<int, std::map<std::string, int> > structMembers;
3262     
3263         std::stack<VarIdScopeInfo> scopeStack;
3264     
3265         scopeStack.push(VarIdScopeInfo());
3266         std::stack<const Token *> functionDeclEndStack;
3267         const Token *functionDeclEndToken = nullptr;
3268         bool initlist = false;
3269         bool inlineFunction = false;
3270         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
3271             if (tok->isOp())
3272                 continue;
3273             if (tok == functionDeclEndToken) {
3274                 functionDeclEndStack.pop();
3275                 functionDeclEndToken = functionDeclEndStack.empty() ? nullptr : functionDeclEndStack.top();
3276                 if (tok->str() == ":")
3277                     initlist = true;
3278                 else if (tok->str() == ";") {
3279                     if (!variableMap.leaveScope())
3280                         cppcheckError(tok);
3281                 } else if (tok->str() == "{")
3282                     scopeStack.push(VarIdScopeInfo(true, scopeStack.top().isStructInit || tok->strAt(-1) == "=", /*isEnum=*/false, *variableMap.getVarId()));
3283             } else if (!initlist && tok->str()=="(") {
3284                 const Token * newFunctionDeclEnd = nullptr;
3285                 if (!scopeStack.top().isExecutable)
3286                     newFunctionDeclEnd = isFunctionHead(tok, "{:;");
3287                 else {
3288                     Token const * const tokenLinkNext = tok->link()->next();
3289                     if (tokenLinkNext && tokenLinkNext->str() == "{") // might be for- or while-loop or if-statement
3290                         newFunctionDeclEnd = tokenLinkNext;
3291                 }
3292                 if (newFunctionDeclEnd && newFunctionDeclEnd != functionDeclEndToken) {
3293                     functionDeclEndStack.push(newFunctionDeclEnd);
3294                     functionDeclEndToken = newFunctionDeclEnd;
3295                     variableMap.enterScope();
3296                 }
3297             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "{|}")) {
3298                 inlineFunction = false;
3299     
3300                 const Token * const startToken = (tok->str() == "{") ? tok : tok->link();
3301     
3302                 // parse anonymous unions as part of the current scope
3303                 if (!Token::Match(startToken->previous(), "union|struct|enum {") &&
3304                     !(initlist && Token::Match(startToken->previous(), "%name%|>|>>") && Token::Match(startToken->link(), "} ,|{"))) {
3305     
3306                     if (tok->str() == "{") {
3307                         bool isExecutable;
3308                         const Token *prev = tok->previous();
3309                         while (Token::Match(prev, "%name%|."))
3310                             prev = prev->previous();
3311                         const bool isLambda = prev && prev->str() == ")" && Token::simpleMatch(prev->link()->previous(), "] (");
3312                         if ((!isLambda && (tok->strAt(-1) == ")" || Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), ") %type%"))) ||
3313                             (initlist && tok->strAt(-1) == "}")) {
3314                             isExecutable = true;
3315                         } else {
3316                             isExecutable = ((scopeStack.top().isExecutable || initlist || tok->strAt(-1) == "else") &&
3317                                             !isClassStructUnionEnumStart(tok));
3318                             if (!(scopeStack.top().isStructInit || tok->strAt(-1) == "="))
3319                                 variableMap.enterScope();
3320                         }
3321                         initlist = false;
3322                         scopeStack.push(VarIdScopeInfo(isExecutable, scopeStack.top().isStructInit || tok->strAt(-1) == "=", isEnumStart(tok), *variableMap.getVarId()));
3323                     } else { /* if (tok->str() == "}") */
3324                         bool isNamespace = false;
3325                         for (const Token *tok1 = tok->link()->previous(); tok1 && tok1->isName(); tok1 = tok1->previous()) {
3326                             if (tok1->str() == "namespace") {
3327                                 isNamespace = true;
3328                                 break;
3329                             }
3330                         }
3331                         // Set variable ids in class declaration..
3332                         if (!initlist && !isC() && !scopeStack.top().isExecutable && tok->link() && !isNamespace) {
3333                             setVarIdClassDeclaration(tok->link(),
3334                                                      variableMap,
3335                                                      scopeStack.top().startVarid,
3336                                                      structMembers);
3337                         }
3338     
3339                         if (!scopeStack.top().isStructInit) {
3340                             variableMap.leaveScope();
3341                         }
3342     
3343                         scopeStack.pop();
3344                         if (scopeStack.empty()) {  // should be impossible
3345                             scopeStack.push(VarIdScopeInfo());
3346                         }
3347                     }
3348                 }
3349             }
3350     
3351             if (!scopeStack.top().isStructInit &&
3352                 (tok == list.front() ||
3353                  Token::Match(tok, "[;{}]") ||
3354                  (tok->str() == "(" && isFunctionHead(tok,"{")) ||
3355                  (tok->str() == "(" && !scopeStack.top().isExecutable && isFunctionHead(tok,";:")) ||
3356                  (tok->str() == "," && (!scopeStack.top().isExecutable || inlineFunction)) ||
3357                  (tok->isName() && endsWith(tok->str(), ':')))) {
3358     
3359                 // No variable declarations in sizeof
3360                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->previous(), "sizeof (")) {
3361                     continue;
3362                 }
3363     
3364                 if (Settings::terminated())
3365                     return;
3366     
3367                 // locate the variable name..
3368                 const Token *tok2 = (tok->isName()) ? tok : tok->next();
3369     
3370                 // private: protected: public: etc
3371                 while (tok2 && endsWith(tok2->str(), ':')) {
3372                     tok2 = tok2->next();
3373                 }
3374                 if (!tok2)
3375                     break;
3376     
3377                 // Variable declaration can't start with "return", etc
3378                 if (notstart.find(tok2->str()) != notstart.end())
3379                     continue;
3380     
3381                 if (!isC() && Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "const new"))
3382                     continue;
3383     
3384                 bool decl;
3385                 try { /* Ticket #8151 */
3386                     decl = setVarIdParseDeclaration(&tok2, variableMap.map(), scopeStack.top().isExecutable, isCPP(), isC());
3387                 } catch (const Token * errTok) {
3388                     syntaxError(errTok);
3389                 }
3390                 if (decl) {
3391                     if (tok->str() == "(" && isFunctionHead(tok,"{") && scopeStack.top().isExecutable)
3392                         inlineFunction = true;
3393     
3394                     const Token* prev2 = tok2->previous();
3395                     if (Token::Match(prev2, "%type% [;[=,)]") && tok2->previous()->str() != "const")
3396                         ;
3397                     else if (Token::Match(prev2, "%type% :") && tok->strAt(-1) == "for")
3398                         ;
3399                     else if (Token::Match(prev2, "%type% ( !!)") && Token::simpleMatch(tok2->link(), ") ;")) {
3400                         // In C++ , a variable can't be called operator+ or something like that.
3401                         if (isCPP() &&
3402                             prev2->isOperatorKeyword())
3403                             continue;
3404     
3405                         const Token *tok3 = tok2->next();
3406                         if (!tok3->isStandardType() && tok3->str() != "void" && !Token::Match(tok3, "struct|union|class %type%") && tok3->str() != "." && !Token::Match(tok2->link()->previous(), "[&*]")) {
3407                             if (!scopeStack.top().isExecutable) {
3408                                 // Detecting initializations with () in non-executable scope is hard and often impossible to be done safely. Thus, only treat code as a variable that definitely is one.
3409                                 decl = false;
3410                                 bool rhs = false;
3411                                 for (; tok3; tok3 = tok3->nextArgumentBeforeCreateLinks2()) {
3412                                     if (tok3->str() == "=") {
3413                                         rhs = true;
3414                                         continue;
3415                                     }
3416     
3417                                     if (tok3->str() == ",") {
3418                                         rhs = false;
3419                                         continue;
3420                                     }
3421     
3422                                     if (rhs)
3423                                         continue;
3424     
3425                                     if (tok3->isLiteral() ||
3426                                         (tok3->isName() && variableMap.hasVariable(tok3->str())) ||
3427                                         tok3->isOp() ||
3428                                         tok3->str() == "(" ||
3429                                         notstart.find(tok3->str()) != notstart.end()) {
3430                                         decl = true;
3431                                         break;
3432                                     }
3433                                 }
3434                             }
3435                         } else
3436                             decl = false;
3437                     } else if (isCPP() && Token::Match(prev2, "%type% {") && Token::simpleMatch(tok2->link(), "} ;")) { // C++11 initialization style
3438                         if (Token::Match(prev2, "do|try|else") || Token::Match(prev2->tokAt(-2), "struct|class|:"))
3439                             continue;
3440                     } else
3441                         decl = false;
3442     
3443                     if (decl) {
3444                         variableMap.addVariable(prev2->str());
3445
