3446                         // set varid for template parameters..
3447                         tok = tok->next();
3448                         while (Token::Match(tok, "%name%|::"))
3449                             tok = tok->next();
3450                         if (tok && tok->str() == "<") {
3451                             const Token *end = tok->findClosingBracket();
3452                             while (tok != end) {
3453                                 if (tok->isName()) {
3454                                     const std::map<std::string, int>::const_iterator it = variableMap.find(tok->str());
3455                                     if (it != variableMap.end())
3456                                         tok->varId(it->second);
3457                                 }
3458                                 tok = tok->next();
3459                             }
3460                         }
3461     
3462                         tok = tok2->previous();
3463                     }
3464                 }
3465             }
3466     
3467             if (tok->isName()) {
3468                 // don't set variable id after a struct|enum|union
3469                 if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "struct|enum|union") || (isCPP() && tok->strAt(-1) == "class"))
3470                     continue;
3471     
3472                 if (!isC()) {
3473                     if (tok->previous() && tok->previous()->str() == "::")
3474                         continue;
3475                     if (tok->next() && tok->next()->str() == "::")
3476                         continue;
3477                     if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-2), ":: template"))
3478                         continue;
3479                 }
3480     
3481                 // function declaration inside executable scope? Function declaration is of form: type name "(" args ")"
3482                 if (scopeStack.top().isExecutable && Token::Match(tok, "%name% [,)]")) {
3483                     bool par = false;
3484                     const Token *start, *end;
3485     
3486                     // search begin of function declaration
3487                     for (start = tok; Token::Match(start, "%name%|*|&|,|("); start = start->previous()) {
3488                         if (start->str() == "(") {
3489                             if (par)
3490                                 break;
3491                             par = true;
3492                         }
3493                         if (Token::Match(start, "[(,]")) {
3494                             if (!Token::Match(start, "[(,] %type% %name%|*|&"))
3495                                 break;
3496                         }
3497                         if (start->varId() > 0)
3498                             break;
3499                     }
3500     
3501                     // search end of function declaration
3502                     for (end = tok->next(); Token::Match(end, "%name%|*|&|,"); end = end->next()) {}
3503     
3504                     // there are tokens which can't appear at the begin of a function declaration such as "return"
3505                     const bool isNotstartKeyword = start->next() && notstart.find(start->next()->str()) != notstart.end();
3506     
3507                     // now check if it is a function declaration
3508                     if (Token::Match(start, "[;{}] %type% %name%|*") && par && Token::simpleMatch(end, ") ;") && !isNotstartKeyword)
3509                         // function declaration => don't set varid
3510                         continue;
3511                 }
3512     
3513                 if (!scopeStack.top().isEnum) {
3514                     const std::map<std::string, int>::const_iterator it = variableMap.find(tok->str());
3515                     if (it != variableMap.end()) {
3516                         tok->varId(it->second);
3517                         setVarIdStructMembers(&tok, structMembers, variableMap.getVarId());
3518                     }
3519                 }
3520             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "::|. %name%")) {
3521                 // Don't set varid after a :: or . token
3522                 tok = tok->next();
3523             } else if (tok->str() == ":" && Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "class %type%")) {
3524                 do {
3525                     tok = tok->next();
3526                 } while (tok && (tok->isName() || tok->str() == ","));
3527                 if (!tok)
3528                     break;
3529                 tok = tok->previous();
3530             }
3531         }
3532     
3533         mVarId = *variableMap.getVarId();
3534     }
3535     
3536     namespace {
3537         struct Member {
3538             Member(const std::list<std::string> &s, const std::list<const Token *> &ns, Token *t) : usingnamespaces(ns), scope(s), tok(t) {}
3539             std::list<const Token *> usingnamespaces;
3540             std::list<std::string> scope;
3541             Token *tok;
3542         };
3543     }
3544     
3545     static std::string getScopeName(const std::list<ScopeInfo2> &scopeInfo)
3546     {
3547         std::string ret;
3548         for (const ScopeInfo2 &si : scopeInfo)
3549             ret += (ret.empty() ? "" : " :: ") + (si.name);
3550         return ret;
3551     }
3552     
3553     static Token * matchMemberName(const std::list<std::string> &scope, const Token *nsToken, Token *memberToken, const std::list<ScopeInfo2> &scopeInfo)
3554     {
3555         std::list<ScopeInfo2>::const_iterator scopeIt = scopeInfo.begin();
3556     
3557         // Current scope..
3558         for (std::list<std::string>::const_iterator it = scope.begin(); it != scope.end(); ++it) {
3559             if (scopeIt == scopeInfo.end() || scopeIt->name != *it)
3560                 return nullptr;
3561             ++scopeIt;
3562         }
3563     
3564         // using namespace..
3565         if (nsToken) {
3566             while (Token::Match(nsToken, "%name% ::")) {
3567                 if (scopeIt != scopeInfo.end() && nsToken->str() == scopeIt->name) {
3568                     nsToken = nsToken->tokAt(2);
3569                     ++scopeIt;
3570                 } else {
3571                     return nullptr;
3572                 }
3573             }
3574             if (!Token::Match(nsToken, "%name% ;"))
3575                 return nullptr;
3576             if (scopeIt == scopeInfo.end() || nsToken->str() != scopeIt->name)
3577                 return nullptr;
3578             ++scopeIt;
3579         }
3580     
3581         // Parse member tokens..
3582         while (scopeIt != scopeInfo.end()) {
3583             if (!Token::Match(memberToken, "%name% ::|<"))
3584                 return nullptr;
3585             if (memberToken->str() != scopeIt->name)
3586                 return nullptr;
3587             if (memberToken->next()->str() == "<") {
3588                 memberToken = memberToken->next()->findClosingBracket();
3589                 if (!Token::simpleMatch(memberToken, "> ::"))
3590                     return nullptr;
3591             }
3592             memberToken = memberToken->tokAt(2);
3593             ++scopeIt;
3594         }
3595     
3596         return Token::Match(memberToken, "~| %name%") ? memberToken : nullptr;
3597     }
3598     
3599     static Token * matchMemberName(const Member &member, const std::list<ScopeInfo2> &scopeInfo)
3600     {
3601         if (scopeInfo.empty())
3602             return nullptr;
3603     
3604         // Does this member match without "using namespace"..
3605         Token *ret = matchMemberName(member.scope, nullptr, member.tok, scopeInfo);
3606         if (ret)
3607             return ret;
3608     
3609         // Try to match member using the "using namespace ..." namespaces..
3610         for (const Token *ns : member.usingnamespaces) {
3611             ret = matchMemberName(member.scope, ns, member.tok, scopeInfo);
3612             if (ret)
3613                 return ret;
3614         }
3615     
3616         return nullptr;
3617     }
3618     
3619     static Token * matchMemberVarName(const Member &var, const std::list<ScopeInfo2> &scopeInfo)
3620     {
3621         Token *tok = matchMemberName(var, scopeInfo);
3622         return Token::Match(tok, "%name% !!(") ? tok : nullptr;
3623     }
3624     
3625     static Token * matchMemberFunctionName(const Member &func, const std::list<ScopeInfo2> &scopeInfo)
3626     {
3627         Token *tok = matchMemberName(func, scopeInfo);
3628         return Token::Match(tok, "~| %name% (") ? tok : nullptr;
3629     }
3630     
3631     void Tokenizer::setVarIdPass2()
3632     {
3633         std::map<int, std::map<std::string, int> > structMembers;
3634     
3635         // Member functions and variables in this source
3636         std::list<Member> allMemberFunctions;
3637         std::list<Member> allMemberVars;
3638         if (!isC()) {
3639             std::map<const Token *, std::string> endOfScope;
3640             std::list<std::string> scope;
3641             std::list<const Token *> usingnamespaces;
3642             for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
3643                 if (!tok->previous() || Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[;{}]")) {
3644                     if (Token::Match(tok, "using namespace %name% ::|;")) {
3645                         Token *endtok = tok->tokAt(2);
3646                         while (Token::Match(endtok, "%name% ::"))
3647                             endtok = endtok->tokAt(2);
3648                         if (Token::Match(endtok, "%name% ;"))
3649                             usingnamespaces.push_back(tok->tokAt(2));
3650                         tok = endtok;
3651                         continue;
3652                     } else if (Token::Match(tok, "namespace %name% {")) {
3653                         scope.push_back(tok->strAt(1));
3654                         endOfScope[tok->linkAt(2)] = tok->strAt(1);
3655                     }
3656                 }
3657     
3658                 if (tok->str() == "}") {
3659                     const std::map<const Token *, std::string>::iterator it = endOfScope.find(tok);
3660                     if (it != endOfScope.end())
3661                         scope.remove(it->second);
3662                 }
3663     
3664                 Token* const tok1 = tok;
3665                 if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "!!:: %name% :: ~| %name%"))
3666                     tok = tok->next();
3667                 else if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "!!:: %name% <") && Token::Match(tok->next()->findClosingBracket(),"> :: ~| %name%"))
3668                     tok = tok->next()->findClosingBracket()->next();
3669                 else
3670                     continue;
3671     
3672                 while (Token::Match(tok, ":: ~| %name%")) {
3673                     tok = tok->next();
3674                     if (tok->str() == "~")
3675                         tok = tok->next();
3676                     else if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% <") && Token::Match(tok->next()->findClosingBracket(),"> :: ~| %name%"))
3677                         tok = tok->next()->findClosingBracket()->next();
3678                     else if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% ::"))
3679                         tok = tok->next();
3680                     else
3681                         break;
3682                 }
3683                 if (!tok->next())
3684                     syntaxError(tok);
3685                 if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% ("))
3686                     allMemberFunctions.emplace_back(scope, usingnamespaces, tok1);
3687                 else
3688                     allMemberVars.emplace_back(scope, usingnamespaces, tok1);
3689             }
3690         }
3691     
3692         std::list<ScopeInfo2> scopeInfo;
3693     
3694         // class members..
3695         std::map<std::string, std::map<std::string, int> > varsByClass;
3696         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
3697             while (tok->str() == "}" && !scopeInfo.empty() && tok == scopeInfo.back().bodyEnd)
3698                 scopeInfo.pop_back();
3699     
3700             if (!Token::Match(tok, "namespace|class|struct %name% {|:|::"))
3701                 continue;
3702     
3703             const std::string &scopeName(getScopeName(scopeInfo));
3704             const std::string scopeName2(scopeName.empty() ? std::string() : (scopeName + " :: "));
3705     
3706             std::list<const Token *> classnameTokens;
3707             classnameTokens.push_back(tok->next());
3708             const Token* tokStart = tok->tokAt(2);
3709             while (Token::Match(tokStart, ":: %name%")) {
3710                 classnameTokens.push_back(tokStart->next());
3711                 tokStart = tokStart->tokAt(2);
3712             }
3713     
3714             std::string classname;
3715             for (const Token *it : classnameTokens)
3716                 classname += (classname.empty() ? "" : " :: ") + it->str();
3717     
3718             std::map<std::string, int> &thisClassVars = varsByClass[scopeName2 + classname];
3719             while (Token::Match(tokStart, ":|::|,|%name%")) {
3720                 if (Token::Match(tokStart, "%name% <")) {
3721                     tokStart = tokStart->next()->findClosingBracket();
3722                     if (tokStart)
3723                         tokStart = tokStart->next();
3724                     continue;
3725                 }
3726                 if (Token::Match(tokStart, "%name% ,|{")) {
3727                     const std::map<std::string, int>& baseClassVars = varsByClass[tokStart->str()];
3728                     thisClassVars.insert(baseClassVars.begin(), baseClassVars.end());
3729                 }
3730                 tokStart = tokStart->next();
3731             }
3732             if (!Token::simpleMatch(tokStart, "{"))
3733                 continue;
3734     
3735             // What member variables are there in this class?
3736             for (const Token *it : classnameTokens)
3737                 scopeInfo.emplace_back(it->str(), tokStart->link());
3738     
3739             for (Token *tok2 = tokStart->next(); tok2 && tok2 != tokStart->link(); tok2 = tok2->next()) {
3740                 // skip parentheses..
3741                 if (tok2->link()) {
3742                     if (tok2->str() == "{") {
3743                         if (tok2->strAt(-1) == ")" || tok2->strAt(-2) == ")")
3744                             setVarIdClassFunction(scopeName2 + classname, tok2, tok2->link(), thisClassVars, structMembers, &mVarId);
3745                         tok2 = tok2->link();
3746                     } else if (tok2->str() == "(" && tok2->link()->strAt(1) != "(") {
3747                         tok2 = tok2->link();
3748     
3749                         // Skip initialization list
3750                         while (Token::Match(tok2, ") [:,] %name% ("))
3751                             tok2 = tok2->linkAt(3);
3752                     }
3753                 }
3754     
3755                 // Found a member variable..
3756                 else if (tok2->varId() > 0)
3757                     thisClassVars[tok2->str()] = tok2->varId();
3758             }
3759     
3760             // Are there any member variables in this class?
3761             if (thisClassVars.empty())
3762                 continue;
3763     
3764             // Member variables
3765             for (const Member &var : allMemberVars) {
3766                 Token *tok2 = matchMemberVarName(var, scopeInfo);
3767                 if (!tok2)
3768                     continue;
3769                 tok2->varId(thisClassVars[tok2->str()]);
3770             }
3771     
3772             if (isC() || tok->str() == "namespace")
3773                 continue;
3774     
3775             // Set variable ids in member functions for this class..
3776             for (const Member &func : allMemberFunctions) {
3777                 Token *tok2 = matchMemberFunctionName(func, scopeInfo);
3778                 if (!tok2)
3779                     continue;
3780     
3781                 if (tok2->str() == "~")
3782                     tok2 = tok2->linkAt(2);
3783                 else
3784                     tok2 = tok2->linkAt(1);
3785     
3786                 // If this is a function implementation.. add it to funclist
3787                 Token * start = const_cast<Token *>(isFunctionHead(tok2, "{"));
3788                 if (start) {
3789                     setVarIdClassFunction(classname, start, start->link(), thisClassVars, structMembers, &mVarId);
3790                 }
3791     
3792                 if (Token::Match(tok2, ") %name% ("))
3793                     tok2 = tok2->linkAt(2);
3794     
3795                 // constructor with initializer list
3796                 if (!Token::Match(tok2, ") : ::| %name%"))
3797                     continue;
3798     
3799                 Token *tok3 = tok2;
3800                 while (Token::Match(tok3, "[)}] [,:]")) {
3801                     tok3 = tok3->tokAt(2);
3802                     if (Token::Match(tok3, ":: %name%"))
3803                         tok3 = tok3->next();
3804                     while (Token::Match(tok3, "%name% :: %name%"))
3805                         tok3 = tok3->tokAt(2);
3806                     if (!Token::Match(tok3, "%name% (|{|<"))
3807                         break;
3808     
3809                     // set varid
3810                     const std::map<std::string, int>::const_iterator varpos = thisClassVars.find(tok3->str());
3811                     if (varpos != thisClassVars.end())
3812                         tok3->varId(varpos->second);
3813     
3814                     // goto end of var
3815                     if (tok3->strAt(1) == "<") {
3816                         tok3 = tok3->next()->findClosingBracket();
3817                         if (tok3 && tok3->next() && tok3->next()->link())
3818                             tok3 = tok3->next()->link();
3819                     } else
3820                         tok3 = tok3->linkAt(1);
3821                 }
3822                 if (Token::Match(tok3, ")|} {")) {
3823                     setVarIdClassFunction(classname, tok2, tok3->next()->link(), thisClassVars, structMembers, &mVarId);
3824                 }
3825             }
3826         }
3827     }
3828     
3829     static void linkBrackets(const Tokenizer * const tokenizer, std::stack<const Token*>& type, std::stack<Token*>& links, Token * const token, const char open, const char close)
3830     {
3831         if (token->str()[0] == open) {
3832             links.push(token);
3833             type.push(token);
3834         } else if (token->str()[0] == close) {
3835             if (links.empty()) {
3836                 // Error, { and } don't match.
3837                 tokenizer->unmatchedToken(token);
3838             }
3839             if (type.top()->str()[0] != open) {
3840                 tokenizer->unmatchedToken(type.top());
3841             }
3842             type.pop();
3843     
3844             Token::createMutualLinks(links.top(), token);
3845             links.pop();
3846         }
3847     }
3848     
3849     void Tokenizer::createLinks()
3850     {
3851         std::stack<const Token*> type;
3852         std::stack<Token*> links1;
3853         std::stack<Token*> links2;
3854         std::stack<Token*> links3;
3855         for (Token *token = list.front(); token; token = token->next()) {
3856             if (token->link()) {
3857                 token->link(nullptr);
3858             }
3859     
3860             linkBrackets(this, type, links1, token, '{', '}');
3861     
3862             linkBrackets(this, type, links2, token, '(', ')');
3863     
3864             linkBrackets(this, type, links3, token, '[', ']');
3865         }
3866     
3867         if (!links1.empty()) {
3868             // Error, { and } don't match.
3869             unmatchedToken(links1.top());
3870         }
3871     
3872         if (!links2.empty()) {
3873             // Error, ( and ) don't match.
3874             unmatchedToken(links2.top());
3875         }
3876     
3877         if (!links3.empty()) {
3878             // Error, [ and ] don't match.
3879             unmatchedToken(links3.top());
3880         }
3881     }
3882     
3883     void Tokenizer::createLinks2()
3884     {
3885         if (isC())
3886             return;
3887     
3888         const Token * templateToken = nullptr;
3889         bool isStruct = false;
3890     
3891         std::stack<Token*> type;
3892         for (Token *token = list.front(); token; token = token->next()) {
3893             if (Token::Match(token, "%name%|> %name% [:<]"))
3894                 isStruct = true;
3895             else if (Token::Match(token, "[;{}]"))
3896                 isStruct = false;
3897     
3898             if (token->link()) {
3899                 if (Token::Match(token, "{|[|("))
3900                     type.push(token);
3901                 else if (!type.empty() && Token::Match(token, "}|]|)")) {
3902                     while (type.top()->str() == "<") {
3903                         if (templateToken && templateToken->next() == type.top())
3904                             templateToken = nullptr;
3905                         type.pop();
3906                     }
3907                     type.pop();
3908                 } else
3909                     token->link(nullptr);
3910             } else if (!templateToken && !isStruct && Token::Match(token, "%oror%|&&|;")) {
3911                 if (Token::Match(token, "&& [,>]"))
3912                     continue;
3913                 // If there is some such code:  A<B||C>..
3914                 // Then this is probably a template instantiation if either "B" or "C" has comparisons
3915                 if (token->tokType() == Token::eLogicalOp && !type.empty() && type.top()->str() == "<") {
3916                     const Token *prev = token->previous();
3917                     bool foundComparison = false;
3918                     while (Token::Match(prev, "%name%|%num%|%str%|%cop%|)|]") && prev != type.top()) {
3919                         if (prev->str() == ")" || prev->str() == "]")
3920                             prev = prev->link();
3921                         else if (prev->tokType() == Token::eLogicalOp)
3922                             break;
3923                         else if (prev->isComparisonOp())
3924                             foundComparison = true;
3925                         prev = prev->previous();
3926                     }
3927                     if (prev == type.top() && foundComparison)
3928                         continue;
3929                     const Token *next = token->next();
3930                     foundComparison = false;
3931                     while (Token::Match(next, "%name%|%num%|%str%|%cop%|(|[") && next->str() != ">") {
3932                         if (next->str() == "(" || next->str() == "[")
3933                             next = next->link();
3934                         else if (next->tokType() == Token::eLogicalOp)
3935                             break;
3936                         else if (next->isComparisonOp())
3937                             foundComparison = true;
3938                         next = next->next();
3939                     }
3940                     if (next && next->str() == ">" && foundComparison)
3941                         continue;
3942                 }
3943     
3944                 while (!type.empty() && type.top()->str() == "<") {
3945                     const Token* end = type.top()->findClosingBracket();
3946                     if (Token::Match(end, "> %comp%|;|.|=|{"))
3947                         break;
3948                     // Variable declaration
3949                     if (Token::Match(end, "> %var% ;") && (type.top()->tokAt(-2) == nullptr || Token::Match(type.top()->tokAt(-2), ";|}|{")))
3950                         break;
3951                     type.pop();
3952                 }
3953             } else if (token->str() == "<" &&
3954                        ((token->previous() && token->previous()->isName() && !token->previous()->varId()) ||
3955                         Token::Match(token->next(), ">|>>"))) {
3956                 type.push(token);
3957                 if (!templateToken && (token->previous()->str() == "template"))
3958                     templateToken = token;
3959             } else if (token->str() == ">" || token->str() == ">>") {
3960                 if (type.empty() || type.top()->str() != "<") // < and > don't match.
3961                     continue;
3962                 Token * const top1 = type.top();
3963                 type.pop();
3964                 Token * const top2 = type.empty() ? nullptr : type.top();
3965                 type.push(top1);
3966                 if (!top2 || top2->str() != "<") {
3967                     if (token->str() == ">>")
3968                         continue;
3969                     if (token->next() &&
3970                         !Token::Match(token->next(), "%name%|%comp%|&|&&|*|::|,|(|)|{|}|;|[|:|.|=") &&
3971                         !Token::simpleMatch(token->next(), "...") &&
3972                         !Token::Match(token->next(), "&& %name% ="))
3973                         continue;
3974                 }
3975                 // if > is followed by [ .. "new a<b>[" is expected
3976                 // unless this is from varidiac expansion
3977                 if (token->strAt(1) == "[" && !Token::simpleMatch(token->tokAt(-1), "... >")) {
3978                     Token *prev = type.top()->previous();
3979                     while (prev && Token::Match(prev->previous(), ":: %name%"))
3980                         prev = prev->tokAt(-2);
3981                     if (prev && prev->str() != "new")
3982                         prev = prev->previous();
3983                     if (!prev || prev->str() != "new")
3984                         continue;
3985                 }
3986     
3987                 if (token->str() == ">>") {
3988                     type.pop();
3989                     type.pop();
3990                     Token::createMutualLinks(top2, token);
3991                     if (top1 == templateToken || top2 == templateToken)
3992                         templateToken = nullptr;
3993                 } else {
3994                     type.pop();
3995                     if (Token::Match(token, "> %name%") && Token::Match(top1->tokAt(-2), "%op% %name% <"))
3996                         continue;
3997                     Token::createMutualLinks(top1, token);
3998                     if (top1 == templateToken)
3999                         templateToken = nullptr;
4000                 }
4001             }
4002         }
4003     }
4004     
4005     void Tokenizer::sizeofAddParentheses()
4006     {
4007         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4008             if (!Token::Match(tok, "sizeof !!("))
4009                 continue;
4010             if (tok->next()->isLiteral() || Token::Match(tok->next(), "%name%|*|~|!|&")) {
4011                 Token *endToken = tok->next();
4012                 while (Token::simpleMatch(endToken, "* *"))
4013                     endToken = endToken->next();
4014                 while (Token::Match(endToken->next(), "%name%|%num%|%str%|[|(|.|::|++|--|!|~") || (Token::Match(endToken, "%type% * %op%|?|:|const|;|,"))) {
4015                     if (Token::Match(endToken->next(), "(|["))
4016                         endToken = endToken->linkAt(1);
4017                     else
4018                         endToken = endToken->next();
4019                 }
4020     
4021                 // Add ( after sizeof and ) behind endToken
4022                 tok->insertToken("(");
4023                 endToken->insertToken(")");
4024                 Token::createMutualLinks(tok->next(), endToken->next());
4025             }
4026         }
4027     }
4028     
4029     bool Tokenizer::simplifySizeof()
4030     {
4031         // Locate variable declarations and calculate the size
4032         std::map<int, int> sizeOfVar;
4033         std::map<int, const Token *> declTokOfVar;
4034         for (const Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4035             if (tok->varId() != 0 && sizeOfVar.find(tok->varId()) == sizeOfVar.end()) {
4036                 const int varId = tok->varId();
4037                 if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-3), "[;{}(,] %type% * %name% [;,)]") ||
4038                     Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-4), "[;{}(,] const %type% * %name% [;),]") ||
4039                     Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "[;{}(,] %type% %name% [;),]") ||
4040                     Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-3), "[;{}(,] const %type% %name% [;),]")) {
4041                     const int size = sizeOfType(tok->previous());
4042                     if (size == 0) {
4043                         continue;
4044                     }
4045     
4046                     sizeOfVar[varId] = size;
4047                     declTokOfVar[varId] = tok;
4048                 }
4049     
4050                 else if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type% %name% [ %num% ] [[;=]") ||
4051                          Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "%type% * %name% [ %num% ] [[;=]")) {
4052                     int size = sizeOfType(tok->previous());
4053                     if (size == 0)
4054                         continue;
4055     
4056                     const Token* tok2 = tok->next();
4057                     do {
4058                         const MathLib::bigint num = MathLib::toLongNumber(tok2->strAt(1));
4059                         if (num<0)
4060                             break;
4061                         size *= num;
4062                         tok2 = tok2->tokAt(3);
4063                     } while (Token::Match(tok2, "[ %num% ]"));
4064                     if (Token::Match(tok2, "[;=]")) {
4065                         sizeOfVar[varId] = size;
4066                         declTokOfVar[varId] = tok;
4067                     }
4068                     if (!tok2) {
4069                         syntaxError(tok);
4070                     }
4071                     tok = tok2;
4072                 }
4073     
4074                 else if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type% %name% [ %num% ] [,)]") ||
4075                          Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "%type% * %name% [ %num% ] [,)]")) {
4076                     Token tempTok;
4077                     tempTok.str("*");
4078                     sizeOfVar[varId] = sizeOfType(&tempTok);
4079                     declTokOfVar[varId] = tok;
4080                 }
4081             }
4082         }
4083     
4084         bool ret = false;
4085         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4086             if (tok->str() != "sizeof")
4087                 continue;
4088     
4089             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->next(), "...")) {
4090                 //tok->deleteNext(3);
4091                 tok->deleteNext();
4092             }
4093     
4094             // sizeof('x')
4095             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %char% )")) {
4096                 tok->deleteNext();
4097                 tok->deleteThis();
4098                 tok->deleteNext();
4099                 std::ostringstream sz;
4100                 sz << ((isC()) ? mSettings->sizeof_int : 1);
4101                 tok->str(sz.str());
4102                 ret = true;
4103                 continue;
4104             }
4105     
4106             // sizeof ("text")
4107             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %str% )")) {
4108                 tok->deleteNext();
4109                 tok->deleteThis();
4110                 tok->deleteNext();
4111                 std::ostringstream ostr;
4112                 ostr << (Token::getStrLength(tok) + 1);
4113                 tok->str(ostr.str());
4114                 ret = true;
4115                 continue;
4116             }
4117     
4118             // sizeof(type *) => sizeof(*)
4119             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %type% * )")) {
4120                 tok->next()->deleteNext();
4121             }
4122     
4123             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->next(), "( * )")) {
4124                 tok->str(MathLib::toString(sizeOfType(tok->tokAt(2))));
4125                 tok->deleteNext(3);
4126                 ret = true;
4127             }
4128     
4129             // sizeof( a )
4130             else if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %var% )")) {
4131                 const std::map<int, int>::const_iterator sizeOfVarPos = sizeOfVar.find(tok->tokAt(2)->varId());
4132                 if (sizeOfVarPos != sizeOfVar.end()) {
4133                     tok->deleteNext();
4134                     tok->deleteThis();
4135                     tok->deleteNext();
4136                     tok->str(MathLib::toString(sizeOfVarPos->second));
4137                     ret = true;
4138                 } else {
4139                     // don't try to replace size of variable if variable has
4140                     // similar name with type (#329)
4141                 }
4142             }
4143     
4144             else if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %type% )")) {
4145                 const int size = sizeOfType(tok->tokAt(2));
4146                 if (size > 0) {
4147                     tok->str(MathLib::toString(size));
4148                     tok->deleteNext(3);
4149                     ret = true;
4150                 }
4151             }
4152     
4153             else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->next(), "( *") || Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %name% [")) {
4154                 int derefs = 0;
4155     
4156                 const Token* nametok = tok->tokAt(2);
4157                 if (nametok->str() == "*") {
4158                     do {
4159                         nametok = nametok->next();
4160                         derefs++;
4161                     } while (nametok && nametok->str() == "*");
4162     
4163                     if (!Token::Match(nametok, "%name% )"))
4164                         continue;
4165                 } else {
4166                     const Token* tok2 = nametok->next();
4167                     do {
4168                         tok2 = tok2->link()->next();
4169                         derefs++;
4170                     } while (tok2 && tok2->str() == "[");
4171     
4172                     if (!tok2 || tok2->str() != ")")
4173                         continue;
4174                 }
4175     
4176                 // Some default value
4177                 MathLib::biguint size = 0;
4178     
4179                 const int varid = nametok->varId();
4180                 if (derefs != 0 && varid != 0 && declTokOfVar.find(varid) != declTokOfVar.end()) {
4181                     // Try to locate variable declaration..
4182                     const Token *decltok = declTokOfVar[varid];
4183                     if (Token::Match(decltok->previous(), "%type%|* %name% [")) {
4184                         size = sizeOfType(decltok->previous());
4185                     } else if (Token::Match(decltok->tokAt(-2), "%type% * %name%")) {
4186                         size = sizeOfType(decltok->tokAt(-2));
4187                     }
4188                     // Multi-dimensional array..
4189                     if (Token::Match(decltok, "%name% [") && Token::simpleMatch(decltok->linkAt(1), "] [")) {
4190                         const Token *tok2 = decltok;
4191                         for (int i = 0; i < derefs; i++)
4192                             tok2 = tok2->linkAt(1); // Skip all dimensions that are dereferenced before the sizeof call
4193                         while (Token::Match(tok2, "] [ %num% ]")) {
4194                             size *= MathLib::toULongNumber(tok2->strAt(2));
4195                             tok2 = tok2->linkAt(1);
4196                         }
4197                         if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "] ["))
4198                             continue;
4199                     }
4200                 } else if (nametok->strAt(1) == "[" && nametok->isStandardType()) {
4201                     size = sizeOfType(nametok);
4202                     if (size == 0)
4203                         continue;
4204                     const Token *tok2 = nametok->next();
4205                     while (Token::Match(tok2, "[ %num% ]")) {
4206                         size *= MathLib::toULongNumber(tok2->strAt(1));
4207                         tok2 = tok2->link()->next();
4208                     }
4209                     if (!tok2 || tok2->str() != ")")
4210                         continue;
4211                 }
4212     
4213                 if (size > 0) {
4214                     tok->str(MathLib::toString(size));
4215                     Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->next()->link()->next());
4216                     ret = true;
4217                 }
4218             }
4219         }
4220         return ret;
4221     }
4222     
4223     bool Tokenizer::simplifyTokenList1(const char FileName[])
4224     {
4225         if (Settings::terminated())
4226             return false;
4227     
4228         // if MACRO
4229         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4230             if (Token::Match(tok, "if|for|while|BOOST_FOREACH %name% (")) {
4231                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "for each")) {
4232                     // 'for each ( )' -> 'asm ( )'
4233                     tok->str("asm");
4234                     tok->deleteNext();
4235                 } else if (tok->strAt(1) == "constexpr") {
4236                     tok->deleteNext();
4237                     tok->isConstexpr(true);
4238                 } else {
4239                     syntaxError(tok);
4240                 }
4241             }
4242         }
4243     
4244         // Is there C++ code in C file?
4245         validateC();
4246     
4247         // remove MACRO in variable declaration: MACRO int x;
4248         removeMacroInVarDecl();
4249     
4250         // Combine strings and character literals, e.g. L"string", L'c', "string1" "string2"
4251         combineStringAndCharLiterals();
4252     
4253         // replace inline SQL with "asm()" (Oracle PRO*C). Ticket: #1959
4254         simplifySQL();
4255     
4256         createLinks();
4257     
4258         simplifyHeaders();
4259     
4260         // Remove __asm..
4261         simplifyAsm();
4262     
4263         // foo < bar < >> => foo < bar < > >
4264         if (isCPP())
4265             mTemplateSimplifier->fixAngleBrackets();
4266     
4267         // Bail out if code is garbage
4268         if (mTimerResults) {
4269             Timer t("Tokenizer::tokenize::findGarbageCode", mSettings->showtime, mTimerResults);
4270             findGarbageCode();
4271         } else {
4272             findGarbageCode();
4273         }
4274     
4275         checkConfiguration();
4276     
4277         // if (x) MACRO() ..
4278         for (const Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4279             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "if (")) {
4280                 tok = tok->next()->link();
4281                 if (Token::Match(tok, ") %name% (") &&
4282                     tok->next()->isUpperCaseName() &&
4283                     Token::Match(tok->linkAt(2), ") {|else")) {
4284                     syntaxError(tok->next());
4285                 }
4286             }
4287         }
4288     
4289         if (Settings::terminated())
4290             return false;
4291     
4292         // convert C++17 style nested namespaces to old style namespaces
4293         simplifyNestedNamespace();
4294     
4295         // simplify namespace aliases
4296         simplifyNamespaceAliases();
4297     
4298         // Remove [[attribute]]
4299         simplifyCPPAttribute();
4300     
4301         // remove __attribute__((?))
4302         simplifyAttribute();
4303     
4304         // simplify cppcheck attributes __cppcheck_?__(?)
4305         simplifyCppcheckAttribute();
4306     
4307         // Combine tokens..
4308         combineOperators();
4309     
4310         // Simplify the C alternative tokens (and, or, etc.)
4311         simplifyCAlternativeTokens();
4312     
4313         // replace 'sin(0)' to '0' and other similar math expressions
4314         simplifyMathExpressions();
4315     
4316         // combine "- %num%"
4317         concatenateNegativeNumberAndAnyPositive();
4318     
4319         // remove extern "C" and extern "C" {}
4320         if (isCPP())
4321             simplifyExternC();
4322     
4323         // simplify weird but legal code: "[;{}] ( { code; } ) ;"->"[;{}] code;"
4324         simplifyRoundCurlyParentheses();
4325     
4326         // check for simple syntax errors..
4327         for (const Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4328             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "> struct {") &&
4329                 Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(2), "} ;")) {
4330                 syntaxError(tok);
4331             }
4332         }
4333     
4334         if (!simplifyAddBraces())
4335             return false;
4336     
4337         sizeofAddParentheses();
4338     
4339         // Simplify: 0[foo] -> *(foo)
4340         for (Token* tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4341             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "0 [") && tok->linkAt(1)) {
4342                 tok->str("*");
4343                 tok->next()->str("(");
4344                 tok->linkAt(1)->str(")");
4345             }
4346         }
4347     
4348         if (Settings::terminated())
4349             return false;
4350     
4351         // Remove __declspec()
4352         simplifyDeclspec();
4353         validate();
4354     
4355         // Remove "inline", "register", and "restrict"
4356         simplifyKeyword();
4357     
4358         // simplify simple calculations inside <..>
4359         if (isCPP()) {
4360             Token *lt = nullptr;
4361             for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4362                 if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}]"))
4363                     lt = nullptr;
4364                 else if (Token::Match(tok, "%type% <"))
4365                     lt = tok->next();
4366                 else if (lt && Token::Match(tok, ">|>> %name%|::|(")) {
4367                     const Token * const end = tok;
4368                     for (tok = lt; tok != end; tok = tok->next()) {
4369                         if (tok->isNumber())
4370                             TemplateSimplifier::simplifyNumericCalculations(tok);
4371                     }
4372                     lt = tok->next();
4373                 }
4374             }
4375         }
4376     
4377         // Convert K&R function declarations to modern C
4378         simplifyVarDecl(true);
4379         simplifyFunctionParameters();
4380     
4381         // simplify case ranges (gcc extension)
4382         simplifyCaseRange();
4383     
4384         // simplify labels and 'case|default'-like syntaxes
4385         simplifyLabelsCaseDefault();
4386     
4387         // simplify '[;{}] * & ( %any% ) =' to '%any% ='
4388         simplifyMulAndParens();
4389     
4390         if (!isC() && !mSettings->library.markupFile(FileName)) {
4391             findComplicatedSyntaxErrorsInTemplates();
4392         }
4393     
4394         if (Settings::terminated())
4395             return false;
4396     
4397         // remove calling conventions __cdecl, __stdcall..
4398         simplifyCallingConvention();
4399     
4400     
4401         // remove some unhandled macros in global scope
4402         removeMacrosInGlobalScope();
4403     
4404         // remove undefined macro in class definition:
4405         // class DLLEXPORT Fred { };
4406         // class Fred FINAL : Base { };
4407         removeMacroInClassDef();
4408     
4409         // That call here fixes #7190
4410         validate();
4411     
4412         // remove unnecessary member qualification..
4413         removeUnnecessaryQualification();
4414     
4415         // convert Microsoft memory functions
4416         simplifyMicrosoftMemoryFunctions();
4417     
4418         // convert Microsoft string functions
4419         simplifyMicrosoftStringFunctions();
4420     
4421         if (Settings::terminated())
4422             return false;
4423     
4424         // Remove Qt signals and slots
4425         simplifyQtSignalsSlots();
4426     
4427         // remove Borland stuff..
4428         simplifyBorland();
4429     
4430         // syntax error: enum with typedef in it
4431         checkForEnumsWithTypedef();
4432     
4433         // Add parentheses to ternary operator where necessary
4434         prepareTernaryOpForAST();
4435     
4436         // Change initialisation of variable to assignment
4437         simplifyInitVar();
4438     
4439         // Split up variable declarations.
4440         simplifyVarDecl(false);
4441     
4442         // typedef..
4443         if (mTimerResults) {
4444             Timer t("Tokenizer::tokenize::simplifyTypedef", mSettings->showtime, mTimerResults);
4445             simplifyTypedef();
4446         } else {
4447             simplifyTypedef();
4448         }
4449     
4450         // using A = B;
4451         while (simplifyUsing())
4452             ;
4453     
4454         // Add parentheses to ternary operator where necessary
4455         // TODO: this is only necessary if one typedef simplification had a comma and was used within ?:
4456         // If typedef handling is refactored and moved to symboldatabase someday we can remove this
4457         prepareTernaryOpForAST();
4458     
4459         for (Token* tok = list.front(); tok;) {
4460             if (Token::Match(tok, "union|struct|class union|struct|class"))
4461                 tok->deleteNext();
4462             else
4463                 tok = tok->next();
4464         }
4465     
4466         // class x y {
4467         if (isCPP() && mSettings->isEnabled(Settings::INFORMATION)) {
4468             for (const Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4469                 if (Token::Match(tok, "class %type% %type% [:{]")) {
4470                     unhandled_macro_class_x_y(tok);
4471                 }
4472             }
4473         }
4474     
4475         // catch bad typedef canonicalization
4476         //
4477         // to reproduce bad typedef, download upx-ucl from:
4478         // http://packages.debian.org/sid/upx-ucl
4479         // analyse the file src/stub/src/i386-linux.elf.interp-main.c
4480         validate();
4481     
4482         // The simplify enum have inner loops
4483         if (Settings::terminated())
4484             return false;
4485     
4486         // Put ^{} statements in asm()
4487         simplifyAsm2();
4488     
4489         // @..
4490         simplifyAt();
4491     
4492         // When the assembly code has been cleaned up, no @ is allowed
4493         for (const Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4494             if (tok->str() == "(") {
4495                 const Token *tok1 = tok;
4496                 tok = tok->link();
4497                 if (!tok)
4498                     syntaxError(tok1);
4499             } else if (tok->str() == "@") {
4500                 syntaxError(tok);
4501             }
4502         }
4503     
4504         // Order keywords "static" and "const"
4505         simplifyStaticConst();
4506     
4507         // convert platform dependent types to standard types
4508         // 32 bits: size_t -> unsigned long
4509         // 64 bits: size_t -> unsigned long long
4510         list.simplifyPlatformTypes();
4511     
4512         // collapse compound standard types into a single token
4513         // unsigned long long int => long (with _isUnsigned=true,_isLong=true)
4514         list.simplifyStdType();
4515     
4516         if (Settings::terminated())
4517             return false;
4518     
4519         // simplify bit fields..
4520         simplifyBitfields();
4521     
4522         if (Settings::terminated())
4523             return false;
4524     
4525         // struct simplification "struct S {} s; => struct S { } ; S s ;
4526         simplifyStructDecl();
4527     
4528         if (Settings::terminated())
4529             return false;
4530     
4531         // x = ({ 123; });  =>   { x = 123; }
4532         simplifyAssignmentBlock();
4533     
4534         if (Settings::terminated())
4535             return false;
4536     
4537         simplifyVariableMultipleAssign();
4538     
4539         // Collapse operator name tokens into single token
4540         // operator = => operator=
4541         simplifyOperatorName();
4542     
4543         // Remove redundant parentheses
4544         simplifyRedundantParentheses();
4545     
4546         if (isCPP())
4547             simplifyTypeIntrinsics();
4548     
4549         if (!isC()) {
4550             // Handle templates..
4551             if (mTimerResults) {
4552                 Timer t("Tokenizer::tokenize::simplifyTemplates", mSettings->showtime, mTimerResults);
4553                 simplifyTemplates();
4554             } else {
4555                 simplifyTemplates();
4556             }
4557     
4558             // The simplifyTemplates have inner loops
4559             if (Settings::terminated())
4560                 return false;
4561     
4562             // sometimes the "simplifyTemplates" fail and then unsimplified
4563             // function calls etc remain. These have the "wrong" syntax. So
4564             // this function will just fix so that the syntax is corrected.
4565             validate(); // #6847 - invalid code
4566             mTemplateSimplifier->cleanupAfterSimplify();
4567         }
4568     
4569         // Simplify pointer to standard types (C only)
4570         simplifyPointerToStandardType();
4571     
4572         // simplify function pointers
4573         simplifyFunctionPointers();
4574     
4575         // Change initialisation of variable to assignment
4576         simplifyInitVar();
4577     
4578         // Split up variable declarations.
4579         simplifyVarDecl(false);
4580     
4581         validate(); // #6772 "segmentation fault (invalid code) in Tokenizer::setVarId"
4582     
4583         if (mTimerResults) {
4584             Timer t("Tokenizer::tokenize::setVarId", mSettings->showtime, mTimerResults);
4585             setVarId();
4586         } else {
4587             setVarId();
4588         }
4589     
4590         // Link < with >
4591         createLinks2();
4592     
4593         // specify array size
4594         arraySize();
4595     
4596         // The simplify enum might have inner loops
4597         if (Settings::terminated())
4598             return false;
4599     
4600         // Add std:: in front of std classes, when using namespace std; was given
4601         simplifyNamespaceStd();
4602     
4603         // Change initialisation of variable to assignment
4604         simplifyInitVar();
4605     
4606         simplifyDoublePlusAndDoubleMinus();
4607     
4608         simplifyArrayAccessSyntax();
4609     
4610         Token::assignProgressValues(list.front());
4611     
4612         removeRedundantSemicolons();
4613     
4614         simplifyParameterVoid();
4615     
4616         simplifyRedundantConsecutiveBraces();
4617     
4618         simplifyEmptyNamespaces();
4619     
4620         elseif();
4621     
4622         SimplifyNamelessRValueReferences();
4623     
4624         validate();
4625     
4626         list.front()->assignIndexes();
4627     
4628         return true;
4629     }
4630     
4631     bool Tokenizer::simplifyTokenList2()
4632     {
4633         // clear the _functionList so it can't contain dead pointers
4634         deleteSymbolDatabase();
4635     
4636         // Clear AST,ValueFlow. These will be created again at the end of this function.
4637         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4638             tok->clearAst();
4639             tok->clearValueFlow();
4640         }
4641     
4642         // Convert e.g. atol("0") into 0
4643         simplifyMathFunctions();
4644     
4645         // f(x=g())   =>   x=g(); f(x)
4646         simplifyAssignmentInFunctionCall();
4647     
4648         // ";a+=b;" => ";a=a+b;"
4649         simplifyCompoundAssignment();
4650     
4651         simplifyCharAt();
4652     
4653         // simplify references
4654         simplifyReference();
4655     
4656         simplifyStd();
4657     
4658         if (Settings::terminated())
4659             return false;
4660     
4661         simplifySizeof();
4662     
4663         simplifyUndefinedSizeArray();
4664     
4665         simplifyCasts();
4666     
4667         // Simplify simple calculations before replace constants, this allows the replacement of constants that are calculated
4668         // e.g. const static int value = sizeof(X)/sizeof(Y);
4669         simplifyCalculations();
4670     
4671         if (Settings::terminated())
4672             return false;
4673     
4674         // Replace "*(ptr + num)" => "ptr[num]"
4675         simplifyOffsetPointerDereference();
4676     
4677         // Replace "&str[num]" => "(str + num)"
4678         simplifyOffsetPointerReference();
4679     
4680         removeRedundantAssignment();
4681     
4682         simplifyRealloc();
4683     
4684         // Change initialisation of variable to assignment
4685         simplifyInitVar();
4686     
4687         // Simplify variable declarations
4688         simplifyVarDecl(false);
4689     
4690         simplifyErrNoInWhile();
4691         simplifyIfAndWhileAssign();
4692         simplifyRedundantParentheses();
4693         simplifyNestedStrcat();
4694         simplifyFuncInWhile();
4695     
4696         simplifyIfAndWhileAssign();
4697     
4698         // replace strlen(str)
4699         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4700             if (Token::Match(tok, "strlen ( %str% )")) {
4701                 tok->str(MathLib::toString(Token::getStrLength(tok->tokAt(2))));
4702                 tok->deleteNext(3);
4703             }
4704         }
4705     
4706         bool modified = true;
4707         while (modified) {
4708             if (Settings::terminated())
4709                 return false;
4710     
4711             modified = false;
4712             modified |= simplifyConditions();
4713             modified |= simplifyFunctionReturn();
4714             modified |= simplifyKnownVariables();
4715             modified |= simplifyStrlen();
4716     
4717             modified |= removeRedundantConditions();
4718             modified |= simplifyRedundantParentheses();
4719             modified |= simplifyConstTernaryOp();
4720             modified |= simplifyCalculations();
4721             validate();
4722         }
4723     
4724         // simplify redundant loops
4725         simplifyWhile0();
4726         removeRedundantFor();
4727     
4728         // Remove redundant parentheses in return..
4729         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4730             while (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "return (")) {
4731                 Token *tok2 = tok->next()->link();
4732                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, ") ;")) {
4733                     tok->deleteNext();
4734                     tok2->deleteThis();
4735                 } else {
4736                     break;
4737                 }
4738             }
4739         }
4740     
4741         simplifyReturnStrncat();
4742     
4743         removeRedundantAssignment();
4744     
4745         simplifyComma();
4746     
4747         removeRedundantSemicolons();
4748     
4749         simplifyFlowControl();
4750     
4751         simplifyRedundantConsecutiveBraces();
4752     
4753         simplifyEmptyNamespaces();
4754     
4755         simplifyMathFunctions();
4756     
4757         validate();
4758     
4759         Token::assignProgressValues(list.front());
4760     
4761         list.createAst();
4762         // needed for #7208 (garbage code) and #7724 (ast max depth limit)
4763         list.validateAst();
4764     
4765         // Create symbol database and then remove const keywords
4766         createSymbolDatabase();
4767         mSymbolDatabase->setValueTypeInTokenList(true);
4768     
4769         ValueFlow::setValues(&list, mSymbolDatabase, mErrorLogger, mSettings);
4770     
4771         if (Settings::terminated())
4772             return false;
4773     
4774         printDebugOutput(2);
4775     
4776         return true;
4777     }
4778     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
4779     
4780     void Tokenizer::printDebugOutput(int simplification) const
4781     {
4782         const bool debug = (simplification != 1U && mSettings->debugSimplified) ||
4783                            (simplification != 2U && mSettings->debugnormal);
4784     
4785         if (debug && list.front()) {
4786             list.front()->printOut(nullptr, list.getFiles());
4787     
4788             if (mSettings->xml)
4789                 std::cout << "<debug>" << std::endl;
4790     
4791             if (mSymbolDatabase) {
4792                 if (mSettings->xml)
4793                     mSymbolDatabase->printXml(std::cout);
4794                 else if (mSettings->verbose) {
4795                     mSymbolDatabase->printOut("Symbol database");
4796                 }
4797             }
4798     
4799             if (mSettings->verbose)
4800                 list.front()->printAst(mSettings->verbose, mSettings->xml, std::cout);
4801     
4802             list.front()->printValueFlow(mSettings->xml, std::cout);
4803     
4804             if (mSettings->xml)
4805                 std::cout << "</debug>" << std::endl;
4806         }
4807     
4808         if (mSymbolDatabase && simplification == 2U && mSettings->debugwarnings) {
4809             printUnknownTypes();
4810     
4811             // the typeStartToken() should come before typeEndToken()
4812             for (const Variable *var : mSymbolDatabase->variableList()) {
4813                 if (!var)
4814                     continue;
4815     
4816                 const Token * typetok = var->typeStartToken();
4817                 while (typetok && typetok != var->typeEndToken())
4818                     typetok = typetok->next();
4819     
4820                 if (typetok != var->typeEndToken()) {
4821                     reportError(var->typeStartToken(),
4822                                 Severity::debug,
4823                                 "debug",
4824                                 "Variable::typeStartToken() of variable '" + var->name() + "' is not located before Variable::typeEndToken(). The location of the typeStartToken() is '" + var->typeStartToken()->str() + "' at line " + MathLib::toString(var->typeStartToken()->linenr()));
4825                 }
4826             }
4827         }
4828     }
4829     
4830     void Tokenizer::dump(std::ostream &out) const
4831     {
4832         // Create a xml data dump.
4833         // The idea is not that this will be readable for humans. It's a
4834         // data dump that 3rd party tools could load and get useful info from.
4835     
4836         // tokens..
4837         out << "  <tokenlist>" << std::endl;
4838         for (const Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4839             out << "    <token id=\"" << tok << "\" file=\"" << ErrorLogger::toxml(list.file(tok)) << "\" linenr=\"" << tok->linenr() << "\" column=\"" << tok->column() << "\"";
4840             out << " str=\"" << ErrorLogger::toxml(tok->str()) << '\"';
4841             out << " scope=\"" << tok->scope() << '\"';
4842             if (tok->isName()) {
4843                 out << " type=\"name\"";
4844                 if (tok->isUnsigned())
4845                     out << " isUnsigned=\"true\"";
4846                 else if (tok->isSigned())
4847                     out << " isSigned=\"true\"";
4848             } else if (tok->isNumber()) {
4849                 out << " type=\"number\"";
4850                 if (MathLib::isInt(tok->str()))
4851                     out << " isInt=\"True\"";
4852                 if (MathLib::isFloat(tok->str()))
4853                     out << " isFloat=\"True\"";
4854             } else if (tok->tokType() == Token::eString)
4855                 out << " type=\"string\" strlen=\"" << Token::getStrLength(tok) << '\"';
4856             else if (tok->tokType() == Token::eChar)
4857                 out << " type=\"char\"";
4858             else if (tok->isBoolean())
4859                 out << " type=\"boolean\"";
4860             else if (tok->isOp()) {
4861                 out << " type=\"op\"";
4862                 if (tok->isArithmeticalOp())
4863                     out << " isArithmeticalOp=\"True\"";
4864                 else if (tok->isAssignmentOp())
4865                     out << " isAssignmentOp=\"True\"";
4866                 else if (tok->isComparisonOp())
4867                     out << " isComparisonOp=\"True\"";
4868                 else if (tok->tokType() == Token::eLogicalOp)
4869                     out << " isLogicalOp=\"True\"";
4870             }
4871             if (tok->isExpandedMacro())
4872                 out << " isExpandedMacro=\"True\"";
4873             if (tok->link())
4874                 out << " link=\"" << tok->link() << '\"';
4875             if (tok->varId() > 0)
4876                 out << " varId=\"" << MathLib::toString(tok->varId()) << '\"';
4877             if (tok->variable())
4878                 out << " variable=\"" << tok->variable() << '\"';
4879             if (tok->function())
4880                 out << " function=\"" << tok->function() << '\"';
4881             if (!tok->values().empty())
4882                 out << " values=\"" << &tok->values() << '\"';
4883             if (tok->type())
4884                 out << " type-scope=\"" << tok->type()->classScope << '\"';
4885             if (tok->astParent())
4886                 out << " astParent=\"" << tok->astParent() << '\"';
4887             if (tok->astOperand1())
4888                 out << " astOperand1=\"" << tok->astOperand1() << '\"';
4889             if (tok->astOperand2())
4890                 out << " astOperand2=\"" << tok->astOperand2() << '\"';
4891             if (!tok->originalName().empty())
4892                 out << " originalName=\"" << tok->originalName() << '\"';
4893             if (tok->valueType()) {
4894                 const std::string vt = tok->valueType()->dump();
4895                 if (!vt.empty())
4896                     out << ' ' << vt;
4897             }
4898             out << "/>" << std::endl;
4899         }
4900         out << "  </tokenlist>" << std::endl;
4901     
4902         mSymbolDatabase->printXml(out);
4903         if (list.front())
4904             list.front()->printValueFlow(true, out);
4905     }
4906     
4907     void Tokenizer::simplifyHeaders()
4908     {
4909         // TODO : can we remove anything in headers here? Like unused declarations.
4910         // Maybe if --dump is used we want to have _everything_.
4911     
4912         if (mSettings->checkHeaders && mSettings->checkUnusedTemplates)
4913             // Full analysis. All information in the headers are kept.
4914             return;
4915     
4916         const bool checkHeaders = mSettings->checkHeaders;
4917         const bool removeUnusedIncludedFunctions = !mSettings->checkHeaders;
4918         const bool removeUnusedIncludedClasses   = !mSettings->checkHeaders;
4919         const bool removeUnusedIncludedTemplates = !mSettings->checkUnusedTemplates || !mSettings->checkHeaders;
4920         const bool removeUnusedTemplates = !mSettings->checkUnusedTemplates;
4921     
4922         // We want to remove selected stuff from the headers but not *everything*.
4923         // The intention here is to not damage the analysis of the source file.
4924         // You should get all warnings in the source file.
4925     
4926         // TODO: Remove unused types/variables/etc in headers..
4927     
4928         // functions and types to keep
4929         std::set<std::string> keep;
4930         for (const Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4931             if (!tok->isName())
4932                 continue;
4933     
4934             if (checkHeaders && tok->fileIndex() != 0)
4935                 continue;
4936     
4937             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% (") && !Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(1), ") {")) {
4938                 keep.insert(tok->str());
4939                 continue;
4940             }
4941     
4942             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% %name%|::|*|&|<")) {
4943                 keep.insert(tok->str());
4944             }
4945         }
4946     
4947         const std::set<std::string> functionStart{"static", "const", "unsigned", "signed", "void", "bool", "char", "short", "int", "long", "float", "*"};
4948     
4949         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
4950             const bool isIncluded = (tok->fileIndex() != 0);
4951     
4952             // Remove executable code
4953             if (isIncluded && !mSettings->checkHeaders && tok->str() == "{") {
4954                 // TODO: We probably need to keep the executable code if this function is called from the source file.
4955                 const Token *prev = tok->previous();
4956                 while (prev && prev->isName())
4957                     prev = prev->previous();
4958                 if (Token::simpleMatch(prev, ")")) {
4959                     // Replace all tokens from { to } with a ";".
4960                     Token::eraseTokens(tok,tok->link()->next());
4961                     tok->str(";");
4962                     tok->link(nullptr);
4963                 }
4964             }
4965     
4966             if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}]")) {
4967                 // Remove unused function declarations
4968                 if (isIncluded && removeUnusedIncludedFunctions) {
4969                     while (1) {
4970                         Token *start = tok->next();
4971                         while (start && functionStart.find(start->str()) != functionStart.end())
4972                             start = start->next();
4973                         if (Token::Match(start, "%name% (") && Token::Match(start->linkAt(1), ") const| ;") && keep.find(start->str()) == keep.end())
4974                             Token::eraseTokens(tok, start->linkAt(1)->tokAt(2));
4975                         else
4976                             break;
4977                     }
4978                 }
4979     
4980                 if (isIncluded && removeUnusedIncludedClasses) {
4981                     if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] class|struct %name% [:{]") && keep.find(tok->strAt(2)) == keep.end()) {
4982                         // Remove this class/struct
4983                         const Token *endToken = tok->tokAt(3);
4984                         if (endToken->str() == ":") {
4985                             endToken = endToken->next();
4986                             while (Token::Match(endToken, "%name%|,"))
4987                                 endToken = endToken->next();
4988                         }
4989                         if (endToken && endToken->str() == "{" && Token::simpleMatch(endToken->link(), "} ;"))
4990                             Token::eraseTokens(tok, endToken->link()->next());
4991                     }
4992                 }
4993     
4994                 if (removeUnusedTemplates || (isIncluded && removeUnusedIncludedTemplates)) {
4995                     if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "template < %name%")) {
4996                         const Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(3);
4997                         while (Token::Match(tok2, "%name% %name% [,=>]") || Token::Match(tok2, "typename ... %name% [,>]")) {
4998                             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "typename ..."))
4999                                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(3);
5000                             else
5001                                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
5002                             if (Token::Match(tok2, "= %name% [,>]"))
5003                                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
5004                             if (tok2->str() == ",")
5005                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
5006                         }
5007                         if (Token::Match(tok2, "> class|struct %name% [;:{]") && keep.find(tok2->strAt(2)) == keep.end()) {
5008                             const Token *endToken = tok2->tokAt(3);
5009                             if (endToken->str() == ":") {
5010                                 endToken = endToken->next();
5011                                 while (Token::Match(endToken, "%name%|,"))
5012                                     endToken = endToken->next();
5013                             }
5014                             if (endToken && endToken->str() == "{")
5015                                 endToken = endToken->link()->next();
5016                             if (endToken && endToken->str() == ";")
5017                                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, endToken);
5018                         } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "> %type% %name% (") && Token::simpleMatch(tok2->linkAt(3), ") {") && keep.find(tok2->strAt(2)) == keep.end()) {
5019                             const Token *endToken = tok2->linkAt(3)->linkAt(1)->next();
5020                             Token::eraseTokens(tok, endToken);
5021                         }
5022                     }
5023                 }
5024             }
5025         }
5026     }
5027     
5028     void Tokenizer::removeMacrosInGlobalScope()
5029     {
5030         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5031             if (tok->str() == "(") {
5032                 tok = tok->link();
5033                 if (Token::Match(tok, ") %type% {") &&
5034                     !Token::Match(tok->next(), "const|namespace|class|struct|union|noexcept|override|final|volatile"))
5035                     tok->deleteNext();
5036             }
5037     
5038             if (Token::Match(tok, "%type%") && tok->isUpperCaseName() &&
5039                 (!tok->previous() || Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[;{}]") || (tok->previous()->isName() && endsWith(tok->previous()->str(), ':')))) {
5040                 const Token *tok2 = tok->next();
5041                 if (tok2 && tok2->str() == "(")
5042                     tok2 = tok2->link()->next();
5043     
5044                 // Several unknown macros...
5045                 while (Token::Match(tok2, "%type% (") && tok2->isUpperCaseName())
5046                     tok2 = tok2->linkAt(1)->next();
5047     
5048                 if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% (") && Token::Match(tok2, "%name% *|&|::|<| %name%") && !Token::Match(tok2, "namespace|class|struct|union"))
5049                     unknownMacroError(tok);
5050     
5051                 if (Token::Match(tok, "%type% (") && Token::Match(tok2, "%type% (") && !Token::Match(tok2, "noexcept|throw") && isFunctionHead(tok2->next(), ":;{"))
5052                     unknownMacroError(tok);
5053     
5054                 // remove unknown macros before namespace|class|struct|union
5055                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "namespace|class|struct|union")) {
5056                     // is there a "{" for?
5057                     const Token *tok3 = tok2;
5058                     while (tok3 && !Token::Match(tok3,"[;{}()]"))
5059                         tok3 = tok3->next();
5060                     if (tok3 && tok3->str() == "{") {
5061                         Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok2);
5062                         tok->deleteThis();
5063                     }
5064                     continue;
5065                 }
5066     
5067                 // replace unknown macros before foo(
5068                 /*
5069                             if (Token::Match(tok2, "%type% (") && isFunctionHead(tok2->next(), "{")) {
5070                                 std::string typeName;
5071                                 for (const Token* tok3 = tok; tok3 != tok2; tok3 = tok3->next())
5072                                     typeName += tok3->str();
5073                                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok2);
5074                                 tok->str(typeName);
5075                             }
5076                 */
5077                 // remove unknown macros before foo::foo(
5078                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "%type% :: %type%")) {
5079                     const Token *tok3 = tok2;
5080                     while (Token::Match(tok3, "%type% :: %type% ::"))
5081                         tok3 = tok3->tokAt(2);
5082                     if (Token::Match(tok3, "%type% :: %type% (") && tok3->str() == tok3->strAt(2)) {
5083                         Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok2);
5084                         tok->deleteThis();
5085                     }
5086                     continue;
5087                 }
5088             }
5089     
5090             // Skip executable scopes
5091             if (tok->str() == "{") {
5092                 const Token *prev = tok->previous();
5093                 while (prev && prev->isName())
5094                     prev = prev->previous();
5095                 if (prev && prev->str() == ")")
5096                     tok = tok->link();
5097             }
5098         }
5099     }
5100     
5101     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
5102     
5103     void Tokenizer::removeMacroInClassDef()
5104     {
5105         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5106             if (!Token::Match(tok, "class|struct %name% %name% {|:"))
5107                 continue;
5108     
5109             const bool nextIsUppercase = tok->next()->isUpperCaseName();
5110             const bool afterNextIsUppercase = tok->tokAt(2)->isUpperCaseName();
5111             if (nextIsUppercase && !afterNextIsUppercase)
5112                 tok->deleteNext();
5113             else if (!nextIsUppercase && afterNextIsUppercase)
5114                 tok->next()->deleteNext();
5115         }
5116     }
5117     
5118     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
5119     
5120     void Tokenizer::removeMacroInVarDecl()
5121     {
5122         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5123             if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] %name% (") && tok->next()->isUpperCaseName()) {
5124                 // goto ')' parentheses
5125                 const Token *tok2 = tok;
5126                 int parlevel = 0;
5127                 while (tok2) {
5128                     if (tok2->str() == "(")
5129                         ++parlevel;
5130                     else if (tok2->str() == ")") {
5131                         if (--parlevel <= 0)
5132                             break;
5133                     }
5134                     tok2 = tok2->next();
5135                 }
5136                 tok2 = tok2 ? tok2->next() : nullptr;
5137     
5138                 // check if this is a variable declaration..
5139                 const Token *tok3 = tok2;
5140                 while (tok3 && tok3->isUpperCaseName())
5141                     tok3 = tok3->next();
5142                 if (tok3 && (tok3->isStandardType() || Token::Match(tok3,"const|static|struct|union|class")))
5143                     Token::eraseTokens(tok,tok2);
5144             }
5145         }
5146     }
5147     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
5148     
5149     void Tokenizer::removeRedundantAssignment()
5150     {
5151         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5152             if (tok->str() == "{")
5153                 tok = tok->link();
5154     
5155             const Token * const start = const_cast<Token *>(startOfExecutableScope(tok));
5156             if (start) {
5157                 tok = start->previous();
5158                 // parse in this function..
5159                 std::set<int> localvars;
5160                 const Token * const end = tok->next()->link();
5161                 for (Token * tok2 = tok->next(); tok2 && tok2 != end; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
5162                     // skip local class or struct
5163                     if (Token::Match(tok2, "class|struct %type% {|:")) {
5164                         // skip to '{'
5165                         tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
5166                         while (tok2 && tok2->str() != "{")
5167                             tok2 = tok2->next();
5168     
5169                         if (tok2)
5170                             tok2 = tok2->link(); // skip local class or struct
5171                         else
5172                             return;
5173                     } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}] %type% * %name% ;") && tok2->next()->str() != "return") {
5174                         tok2 = tok2->tokAt(3);
5175                         localvars.insert(tok2->varId());
5176                     } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}] %type% %name% ;") && tok2->next()->isStandardType()) {
5177                         tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
5178                         localvars.insert(tok2->varId());
5179                     } else if (tok2->varId() &&
5180                                !Token::Match(tok2->previous(), "[;{}] %name% = %char%|%num%|%name% ;")) {
5181                         localvars.erase(tok2->varId());
5182                     }
5183                 }
5184                 localvars.erase(0);
5185                 if (!localvars.empty()) {
5186                     for (Token *tok2 = tok->next(); tok2 && tok2 != end;) {
5187                         if (Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}] %type% %name% ;") && localvars.find(tok2->tokAt(2)->varId()) != localvars.end()) {
5188                             tok2->deleteNext(3);
5189                         } else if ((Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}] %type% * %name% ;") &&
5190                                     localvars.find(tok2->tokAt(3)->varId()) != localvars.end()) ||
5191                                    (Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}] %name% = %any% ;") &&
5192                                     localvars.find(tok2->next()->varId()) != localvars.end())) {
5193                             tok2->deleteNext(4);
5194                         } else
5195                             tok2 = tok2->next();
5196                     }
5197                 }
5198             }
5199         }
5200     }
5201     
5202     void Tokenizer::simplifyRealloc()
5203     {
5204         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5205             if (Token::Match(tok, "(|[") ||
5206                 (tok->str() == "{" && tok->previous() && tok->previous()->str() == "="))
5207                 tok = tok->link();
5208             else if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] %name% = realloc (")) {
5209                 tok = tok->tokAt(3);
5210                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->next(), "( 0 ,")) {
5211                     //no "x = realloc(0,);"
5212                     if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok->next()->link(), ") ;") || tok->next()->link()->previous() == tok->tokAt(3))
5213                         continue;
5214     
5215                     // delete "0 ,"
5216                     tok->next()->deleteNext(2);
5217     
5218                     // Change function name "realloc" to "malloc"
5219                     tok->str("malloc");
5220                     tok = tok->next()->link();
5221                 } else {
