5222                     Token *tok2 = tok->next()->link()->tokAt(-2);
5223                     //no "x = realloc(,0);"
5224                     if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok2, ", 0 ) ;") || tok2 == tok->tokAt(2))
5225                         continue;
5226     
5227                     //remove ", 0"
5228                     tok2 = tok2->previous();
5229                     tok2->deleteNext(2);
5230                     //change "realloc" to "free"
5231                     tok->str("free");
5232                     //insert "0" after "var ="
5233                     tok = tok->previous();
5234                     tok->insertToken("0");
5235                     //move "var = 0" between "free(...)" and ";"
5236                     tok2 = tok2->next();
5237                     Token::move(tok->previous(), tok->next(), tok2);
5238                     //add missing ";" after "free(...)"
5239                     tok2->insertToken(";");
5240                     //goto before last ";" and continue
5241                     tok = tok->next();
5242                 }
5243             }
5244         }
5245     }
5246     
5247     void Tokenizer::simplifyEmptyNamespaces()
5248     {
5249         if (isC())
5250             return;
5251     
5252         bool goback = false;
5253         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok ? tok->next() : nullptr) {
5254             if (goback) {
5255                 tok = tok->previous();
5256                 goback = false;
5257             }
5258             if (Token::Match(tok, "(|[|{")) {
5259                 tok = tok->link();
5260                 continue;
5261             }
5262             if (!Token::Match(tok, "namespace %name% {"))
5263                 continue;
5264             if (tok->strAt(3) == "}") {
5265                 tok->deleteNext(3);             // remove '%name% { }'
5266                 if (!tok->previous()) {
5267                     // remove 'namespace' or replace it with ';' if isolated
5268                     tok->deleteThis();
5269                     goback = true;
5270                 } else {                    // '%any% namespace %any%'
5271                     tok = tok->previous();  // goto previous token
5272                     tok->deleteNext();      // remove next token: 'namespace'
5273                 }
5274             } else {
5275                 tok = tok->tokAt(2);
5276             }
5277         }
5278     }
5279     
5280     void Tokenizer::simplifyFlowControl()
5281     {
5282         for (Token *begin = list.front(); begin; begin = begin->next()) {
5283     
5284             if (Token::Match(begin, "(|[") ||
5285                 (begin->str() == "{" && begin->previous() && begin->strAt(-1) == "="))
5286                 begin = begin->link();
5287     
5288             //function scope
5289             if (!Token::simpleMatch(begin, ") {") && !Token::Match(begin, ") %name% {"))
5290                 continue;
5291     
5292             Token* end = begin->linkAt(1+(begin->next()->str() == "{" ? 0 : 1));
5293             int indentLevel = 0;
5294             bool stilldead = false;
5295     
5296             for (Token *tok = begin; tok && tok != end; tok = tok->next()) {
5297                 if (Token::Match(tok, "(|[")) {
5298                     tok = tok->link();
5299                     continue;
5300                 }
5301     
5302                 if (tok->str() == "{") {
5303                     if (tok->previous() && tok->previous()->str() == "=") {
5304                         tok = tok->link();
5305                         continue;
5306                     }
5307                     ++indentLevel;
5308                 } else if (tok->str() == "}") {
5309                     if (indentLevel == 0)
5310                         break;
5311                     --indentLevel;
5312                     if (stilldead) {
5313                         eraseDeadCode(tok, nullptr);
5314                         if (indentLevel == 1 || tok->next()->str() != "}" || !Token::Match(tok->next()->link()->previous(), ";|{|}|do {"))
5315                             stilldead = false;
5316                         continue;
5317                     }
5318                 }
5319     
5320                 if (indentLevel == 0)
5321                     continue;
5322     
5323                 if (Token::Match(tok,"continue|break ;")) {
5324                     tok = tok->next();
5325                     eraseDeadCode(tok, nullptr);
5326     
5327                 } else if (Token::Match(tok,"return|goto") ||
5328                            (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[;{}] %name% (") &&
5329                             mSettings->library.isnoreturn(tok)) ||
5330                            (isCPP() && tok->str() == "throw")) {
5331                     if (tok->next()->str() == "}")
5332                         syntaxError(tok->next()); // invalid code like in #6731
5333                     //TODO: ensure that we exclude user-defined 'exit|abort|throw', except for 'noreturn'
5334                     //catch the first ';'
5335                     for (Token *tok2 = tok->next(); tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
5336                         if (Token::Match(tok2, "(|[")) {
5337                             tok2 = tok2->link();
5338                         } else if (tok2->str() == ";") {
5339                             tok = tok2;
5340                             eraseDeadCode(tok, nullptr);
5341                             break;
5342                         } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "[{}]"))
5343                             break;
5344                     }
5345                     //if everything is removed, then remove also the code after an inferior scope
5346                     //only if the actual scope is not special
5347                     if (indentLevel > 1 && tok->next()->str() == "}" && Token::Match(tok->next()->link()->previous(), ";|{|}|do {"))
5348                         stilldead = true;
5349                 }
5350             }
5351             begin = end;
5352         }
5353     }
5354     
5355     
5356     bool Tokenizer::removeRedundantConditions()
5357     {
5358         // Return value for function. Set to true if there are any simplifications
5359         bool ret = false;
5360     
5361         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5362             if (!Token::Match(tok, "if ( %bool% ) {"))
5363                 continue;
5364     
5365             // Find matching else
5366             Token *elseTag = tok->linkAt(4)->next();
5367     
5368             const bool boolValue = (tok->strAt(2) == "true");
5369     
5370             // Handle if with else
5371             if (Token::simpleMatch(elseTag, "else {")) {
5372                 // Handle else
5373                 if (!boolValue) {
5374                     // Convert "if( false ) {aaa;} else {bbb;}" => "{bbb;}"
5375     
5376                     //remove '(false)'
5377                     tok->deleteNext(3);
5378                     //delete dead code inside scope
5379                     eraseDeadCode(tok, elseTag);
5380                     //remove 'else'
5381                     elseTag->deleteThis();
5382                     //remove 'if'
5383                     tok->deleteThis();
5384                 } else {
5385                     // Convert "if( true ) {aaa;} else {bbb;}" => "{aaa;}"
5386                     const Token *end = elseTag->next()->link()->next();
5387     
5388                     // Remove "else { bbb; }"
5389                     elseTag = elseTag->previous();
5390                     eraseDeadCode(elseTag, end);
5391     
5392                     // Remove "if( true )"
5393                     tok->deleteNext(3);
5394                     tok->deleteThis();
5395                 }
5396     
5397                 ret = true;
5398             }
5399     
5400             // Handle if without else
5401             else {
5402                 if (!boolValue) {
5403                     //remove '(false)'
5404                     tok->deleteNext(3);
5405                     //delete dead code inside scope
5406                     eraseDeadCode(tok, elseTag);
5407                     //remove 'if'
5408                     tok->deleteThis();
5409                 } else {
5410                     // convert "if( true ) {aaa;}" => "{aaa;}"
5411                     tok->deleteNext(3);
5412                     tok->deleteThis();
5413                 }
5414     
5415                 ret = true;
5416             }
5417         }
5418     
5419         return ret;
5420     }
5421     
5422     void Tokenizer::removeRedundantFor()
5423     {
5424         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5425             if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] for ( %name% = %num% ; %name% < %num% ; ++| %name% ++| ) {") ||
5426                 Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] for ( %type% %name% = %num% ; %name% < %num% ; ++| %name% ++| ) {")) {
5427                 // Same variable name..
5428                 const Token* varTok = tok->tokAt(3);
5429                 const bool type = varTok->next()->isName();
5430                 if (type)
5431                     varTok = varTok->next();
5432                 const std::string varname(varTok->str());
5433                 const int varid(varTok->varId());
5434                 if (varname != varTok->strAt(4))
5435                     continue;
5436                 const Token *vartok2 = tok->linkAt(2)->previous();
5437                 if (vartok2->str() == "++")
5438                     vartok2 = vartok2->previous();
5439                 else if (vartok2->strAt(-1) != "++")
5440                     continue;
5441                 if (varname != vartok2->str())
5442                     continue;
5443     
5444                 // Check that the difference of the numeric values is 1
5445                 const MathLib::bigint num1(MathLib::toLongNumber(varTok->strAt(2)));
5446                 const MathLib::bigint num2(MathLib::toLongNumber(varTok->strAt(6)));
5447                 if (num1 + 1 != num2)
5448                     continue;
5449     
5450                 // check how loop variable is used in loop..
5451                 bool read = false;
5452                 bool write = false;
5453                 const Token* end = tok->linkAt(2)->next()->link();
5454                 for (const Token *tok2 = tok->linkAt(2); tok2 != end; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
5455                     if (tok2->str() == varname) {
5456                         if (tok2->previous()->isArithmeticalOp() &&
5457                             tok2->next() &&
5458                             (tok2->next()->isArithmeticalOp() || tok2->next()->str() == ";")) {
5459                             read = true;
5460                         } else {
5461                             read = write = true;
5462                             break;
5463                         }
5464                     }
5465                 }
5466     
5467                 // Simplify loop if loop variable isn't written
5468                 if (!write) {
5469                     Token* bodyBegin = tok->linkAt(2)->next();
5470                     // remove "for ("
5471                     tok->deleteNext(2);
5472     
5473                     // If loop variable is read then keep assignment before
5474                     // loop body..
5475                     if (type) {
5476                         tok->insertToken("{");
5477                         Token::createMutualLinks(tok->next(), bodyBegin->link());
5478                         bodyBegin->deleteThis();
5479                         tok = tok->tokAt(6);
5480                     } else if (read) {
5481                         // goto ";"
5482                         tok = tok->tokAt(4);
5483                     } else {
5484                         // remove "x = 0 ;"
5485                         tok->deleteNext(4);
5486                     }
5487     
5488                     // remove "x < 1 ; x ++ )"
5489                     tok->deleteNext(7);
5490     
5491                     if (!type) {
5492                         // Add assignment after the loop body so the loop variable
5493                         // get the correct end value
5494                         Token *tok2 = tok->next()->link();
5495                         tok2->insertToken(";");
5496                         tok2->insertToken(MathLib::toString(num2));
5497                         tok2->insertToken("=");
5498                         tok2->insertToken(varname);
5499                         tok2->next()->varId(varid);
5500                     }
5501                 }
5502             }
5503         }
5504     }
5505     
5506     
5507     void Tokenizer::removeRedundantSemicolons()
5508     {
5509         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5510             if (tok->link() && tok->str() == "(") {
5511                 tok = tok->link();
5512                 continue;
5513             }
5514             for (;;) {
5515                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "; ;")) {
5516                     tok->deleteNext();
5517                 } else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "; { ; }")) {
5518                     tok->deleteNext(3);
5519                 } else {
5520                     break;
5521                 }
5522             }
5523         }
5524     }
5525     
5526     
5527     bool Tokenizer::simplifyAddBraces()
5528     {
5529         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5530             Token const * tokRet=simplifyAddBracesToCommand(tok);
5531             if (!tokRet)
5532                 return false;
5533         }
5534         return true;
5535     }
5536     
5537     Token *Tokenizer::simplifyAddBracesToCommand(Token *tok)
5538     {
5539         Token * tokEnd=tok;
5540         if (Token::Match(tok,"for|switch|BOOST_FOREACH")) {
5541             tokEnd=simplifyAddBracesPair(tok,true);
5542         } else if (tok->str()=="while") {
5543             Token *tokPossibleDo=tok->previous();
5544             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->previous(), "{"))
5545                 tokPossibleDo = nullptr;
5546             else if (Token::simpleMatch(tokPossibleDo,"}"))
5547                 tokPossibleDo = tokPossibleDo->link();
5548             if (!tokPossibleDo || tokPossibleDo->strAt(-1) != "do")
5549                 tokEnd=simplifyAddBracesPair(tok,true);
5550         } else if (tok->str()=="do") {
5551             tokEnd=simplifyAddBracesPair(tok,false);
5552             if (tokEnd!=tok) {
5553                 // walk on to next token, i.e. "while"
5554                 // such that simplifyAddBracesPair does not close other braces
5555                 // before the "while"
5556                 if (tokEnd) {
5557                     tokEnd=tokEnd->next();
5558                     if (!tokEnd || tokEnd->str()!="while") // no while
5559                         syntaxError(tok);
5560                 }
5561             }
5562         } else if (tok->str()=="if" && !Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-2), "operator \"\"")) {
5563             tokEnd=simplifyAddBracesPair(tok,true);
5564             if (!tokEnd)
5565                 return nullptr;
5566             if (tokEnd->strAt(1) == "else") {
5567                 Token * tokEndNextNext= tokEnd->tokAt(2);
5568                 if (!tokEndNextNext || tokEndNextNext->str() == "}")
5569                     syntaxError(tokEndNextNext);
5570                 if (tokEndNextNext->str() == "if")
5571                     // do not change "else if ..." to "else { if ... }"
5572                     tokEnd=simplifyAddBracesToCommand(tokEndNextNext);
5573                 else
5574                     tokEnd=simplifyAddBracesPair(tokEnd->next(),false);
5575             }
5576         }
5577     
5578         return tokEnd;
5579     }
5580     
5581     Token *Tokenizer::simplifyAddBracesPair(Token *tok, bool commandWithCondition)
5582     {
5583         Token * tokCondition=tok->next();
5584         if (!tokCondition) // Missing condition
5585             return tok;
5586     
5587         Token *tokAfterCondition=tokCondition;
5588         if (commandWithCondition) {
5589             if (tokCondition->str()=="(")
5590                 tokAfterCondition=tokCondition->link();
5591             else
5592                 syntaxError(tok); // Bad condition
5593     
5594             if (!tokAfterCondition || tokAfterCondition->strAt(1) == "]")
5595                 syntaxError(tok); // Bad condition
5596     
5597             tokAfterCondition=tokAfterCondition->next();
5598             if (!tokAfterCondition || Token::Match(tokAfterCondition, ")|}|,")) {
5599                 // No tokens left where to add braces around
5600                 return tok;
5601             }
5602         }
5603         Token * tokBracesEnd=nullptr;
5604         if (tokAfterCondition->str()=="{") {
5605             // already surrounded by braces
5606             tokBracesEnd=tokAfterCondition->link();
5607         } else if (Token::simpleMatch(tokAfterCondition, "try {") &&
5608                    Token::simpleMatch(tokAfterCondition->linkAt(1), "} catch (")) {
5609             tokAfterCondition->previous()->insertToken("{");
5610             Token * tokOpenBrace = tokAfterCondition->previous();
5611             Token * tokEnd = tokAfterCondition->linkAt(1)->linkAt(2)->linkAt(1);
5612             if (!tokEnd) {
5613                 syntaxError(tokAfterCondition);
5614             }
5615             tokEnd->insertToken("}");
5616             Token * tokCloseBrace = tokEnd->next();
5617     
5618             Token::createMutualLinks(tokOpenBrace, tokCloseBrace);
5619             tokBracesEnd = tokCloseBrace;
5620         } else if (Token::Match(tokAfterCondition, "%name% : {")) {
5621             tokAfterCondition->previous()->insertToken("{");
5622             tokAfterCondition->linkAt(2)->insertToken("}");
5623             tokBracesEnd = tokAfterCondition->linkAt(2)->next();
5624             Token::createMutualLinks(tokAfterCondition->previous(), tokBracesEnd);
5625         } else {
5626             Token * tokEnd = simplifyAddBracesToCommand(tokAfterCondition);
5627             if (!tokEnd) // Ticket #4887
5628                 return tok;
5629             if (tokEnd->str()!="}") {
5630                 // Token does not end with brace
5631                 // Look for ; to add own closing brace after it
5632                 while (tokEnd && !Token::Match(tokEnd, ";|)|}")) {
5633                     if (tokEnd->tokType()==Token::eBracket || tokEnd->str() == "(") {
5634                         tokEnd = tokEnd->link();
5635                         if (!tokEnd) {
5636                             // Inner bracket does not close
5637                             return tok;
5638                         }
5639                     }
5640                     tokEnd=tokEnd->next();
5641                 }
5642                 if (!tokEnd || tokEnd->str() != ";") {
5643                     // No trailing ;
5644                     return tok;
5645                 }
5646             }
5647     
5648             tokAfterCondition->previous()->insertToken("{");
5649             Token * tokOpenBrace=tokAfterCondition->previous();
5650     
5651             tokEnd->insertToken("}");
5652             Token * TokCloseBrace=tokEnd->next();
5653     
5654             Token::createMutualLinks(tokOpenBrace,TokCloseBrace);
5655             tokBracesEnd=TokCloseBrace;
5656         }
5657     
5658         return tokBracesEnd;
5659     }
5660     
5661     void Tokenizer::simplifyCompoundAssignment()
5662     {
5663         // Simplify compound assignments:
5664         // "a+=b" => "a = a + b"
5665         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5666             if (!Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] (| *| (| %name%"))
5667                 continue;
5668             if (tok->next()->str() == "return")
5669                 continue;
5670             // backup current token..
5671             Token * const tok1 = tok;
5672     
5673             if (tok->next()->str() == "*")
5674                 tok = tok->next();
5675     
5676             if (tok->next() && tok->next()->str() == "(") {
5677                 tok = tok->next()->link()->next();
5678             } else {
5679                 // variable..
5680                 tok = tok->tokAt(2);
5681                 while (Token::Match(tok, ". %name%") ||
5682                        Token::Match(tok, "[|(")) {
5683                     if (tok->str() == ".")
5684                         tok = tok->tokAt(2);
5685                     else {
5686                         // goto "]" or ")"
5687                         tok = tok->link();
5688     
5689                         // goto next token..
5690                         tok = tok ? tok->next() : nullptr;
5691                     }
5692                 }
5693             }
5694             if (!tok)
5695                 break;
5696     
5697             // Is current token at a compound assignment: +=|-=|.. ?
5698             const std::string &str = tok->str();
5699             std::string op;  // operator used in assignment
5700             if (tok->isAssignmentOp() && str.size() == 2)
5701                 op = str.substr(0, 1);
5702             else if (tok->isAssignmentOp() && str.size() == 3)
5703                 op = str.substr(0, 2);
5704             else {
5705                 tok = tok1;
5706                 continue;
5707             }
5708     
5709             // Remove the whole statement if it says: "+=0;", "-=0;", "*=1;" or "/=1;"
5710             if (Token::Match(tok, "+=|-= 0 ;") ||
5711                 Token::simpleMatch(tok, "|= 0 ;") ||
5712                 Token::Match(tok, "*=|/= 1 ;")) {
5713                 tok = tok1;
5714                 while (tok->next()->str() != ";")
5715                     tok->deleteNext();
5716             } else {
5717                 // Enclose the rhs in parentheses..
5718                 if (!Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "[;)]")) {
5719                     // Only enclose rhs in parentheses if there is some operator
5720                     bool someOperator = false;
5721                     for (Token *tok2 = tok->next(); tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
5722                         if (tok2->link() && Token::Match(tok2, "{|[|("))
5723                             tok2 = tok2->link();
5724     
5725                         if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "[;)]")) {
5726                             if (someOperator) {
5727                                 tok->insertToken("(");
5728                                 tok2->insertToken(")");
5729                                 Token::createMutualLinks(tok->next(), tok2->next());
5730                             }
5731                             break;
5732                         }
5733     
5734                         someOperator |= (tok2->isOp() || tok2->str() == "?");
5735                     }
5736                 }
5737     
5738                 // simplify the compound assignment..
5739                 tok->str("=");
5740                 tok->insertToken(op);
5741     
5742                 std::stack<Token *> tokend;
5743                 for (Token *tok2 = tok->previous(); tok2 && tok2 != tok1; tok2 = tok2->previous()) {
5744                     // Don't duplicate ++ and --. Put preincrement in lhs. Put
5745                     // postincrement in rhs.
5746                     if (tok2->tokType() == Token::eIncDecOp) {
5747                         // pre increment/decrement => don't copy
5748                         if (tok2->next()->isName()) {
5749                             continue;
5750                         }
5751     
5752                         // post increment/decrement => move from lhs to rhs
5753                         tok->insertToken(tok2->str());
5754                         tok2->deleteThis();
5755                         continue;
5756                     }
5757     
5758                     // Copy token from lhs to rhs
5759                     tok->insertToken(tok2->str());
5760                     tok->next()->varId(tok2->varId());
5761                     if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "]|)|}"))
5762                         tokend.push(tok->next());
5763                     else if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "(|[|{")) {
5764                         Token::createMutualLinks(tok->next(), tokend.top());
5765                         tokend.pop();
5766                     }
5767                 }
5768             }
5769         }
5770     }
5771     
5772     bool Tokenizer::simplifyConditions()
5773     {
5774         bool ret = false;
5775     
5776         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5777             if (Token::Match(tok, "! %bool%|%num%")) {
5778                 tok->deleteThis();
5779                 if (Token::Match(tok, "0|false"))
5780                     tok->str("true");
5781                 else
5782                     tok->str("false");
5783     
5784                 ret = true;
5785             }
5786     
5787             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "&& true &&")) {
5788                 tok->deleteNext(2);
5789                 ret = true;
5790             }
5791     
5792             else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "|| false ||")) {
5793                 tok->deleteNext(2);
5794                 ret = true;
5795             }
5796     
5797             else if (Token::Match(tok, "(|&& true && true &&|)")) {
5798                 tok->deleteNext(2);
5799                 ret = true;
5800             }
5801     
5802             else if (Token::Match(tok, "%oror%|( false %oror% false %oror%|)")) {
5803                 tok->deleteNext(2);
5804                 ret = true;
5805             }
5806     
5807             else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "( true ||") ||
5808                      Token::simpleMatch(tok, "( false &&")) {
5809                 Token::eraseTokens(tok->next(), tok->link());
5810                 ret = true;
5811             }
5812     
5813             else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "|| true )") ||
5814                      Token::simpleMatch(tok, "&& false )")) {
5815                 tok = tok->next();
5816                 Token::eraseTokens(tok->next()->link(), tok);
5817                 ret = true;
5818             }
5819     
5820             else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "&& false &&") ||
5821                      Token::simpleMatch(tok, "|| true ||")) {
5822                 //goto '('
5823                 Token *tok2 = tok;
5824                 while (tok2->previous()) {
5825                     if (tok2->previous()->str() == ")")
5826                         tok2 = tok2->previous()->link();
5827                     else {
5828                         tok2 = tok2->previous();
5829                         if (tok2->str() == "(")
5830                             break;
5831                     }
5832                 }
5833                 if (!tok2)
5834                     continue;
5835                 //move tok to 'true|false' position
5836                 tok = tok->next();
5837                 //remove everything before 'true|false'
5838                 Token::eraseTokens(tok2, tok);
5839                 //remove everything after 'true|false'
5840                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok2->link());
5841                 ret = true;
5842             }
5843     
5844             // Change numeric constant in condition to "true" or "false"
5845             if (Token::Match(tok, "if|while ( %num% )|%oror%|&&")) {
5846                 tok->tokAt(2)->str((tok->strAt(2) != "0") ? "true" : "false");
5847                 ret = true;
5848             }
5849             if (Token::Match(tok, "&&|%oror% %num% )|%oror%|&&")) {
5850                 tok->next()->str((tok->next()->str() != "0") ? "true" : "false");
5851                 ret = true;
5852             }
5853     
5854             // Reduce "(%num% == %num%)" => "(true)"/"(false)"
5855             if (Token::Match(tok, "&&|%oror%|(") &&
5856                 (Token::Match(tok->next(), "%num% %any% %num%") ||
5857                  Token::Match(tok->next(), "%bool% %any% %bool%")) &&
5858                 Token::Match(tok->tokAt(4), "&&|%oror%|)|?")) {
5859                 std::string cmp = tok->strAt(2);
5860                 bool result = false;
5861                 if (tok->next()->isNumber()) {
5862                     // Compare numbers
5863     
5864                     if (cmp == "==" || cmp == "!=") {
5865                         const std::string& op1(tok->next()->str());
5866                         const std::string& op2(tok->strAt(3));
5867     
5868                         bool eq = false;
5869                         if (MathLib::isInt(op1) && MathLib::isInt(op2))
5870                             eq = (MathLib::toLongNumber(op1) == MathLib::toLongNumber(op2));
5871                         else {
5872                             eq = (op1 == op2);
5873     
5874                             // It is inconclusive whether two unequal float representations are numerically equal
5875                             if (!eq && MathLib::isFloat(op1))
5876                                 cmp.clear();
5877                         }
5878     
5879                         if (cmp == "==")
5880                             result = eq;
5881                         else
5882                             result = !eq;
5883                     } else {
5884                         const double op1 = MathLib::toDoubleNumber(tok->next()->str());
5885                         const double op2 = MathLib::toDoubleNumber(tok->strAt(3));
5886                         if (cmp == ">=")
5887                             result = (op1 >= op2);
5888                         else if (cmp == ">")
5889                             result = (op1 > op2);
5890                         else if (cmp == "<=")
5891                             result = (op1 <= op2);
5892                         else if (cmp == "<")
5893                             result = (op1 < op2);
5894                         else
5895                             cmp.clear();
5896                     }
5897                 } else {
5898                     // Compare boolean
5899                     const bool op1 = (tok->next()->str() == std::string("true"));
5900                     const bool op2 = (tok->strAt(3) == std::string("true"));
5901     
5902                     if (cmp == "==")
5903                         result = (op1 == op2);
5904                     else if (cmp == "!=")
5905                         result = (op1 != op2);
5906                     else if (cmp == ">=")
5907                         result = (op1 >= op2);
5908                     else if (cmp == ">")
5909                         result = (op1 > op2);
5910                     else if (cmp == "<=")
5911                         result = (op1 <= op2);
5912                     else if (cmp == "<")
5913                         result = (op1 < op2);
5914                     else
5915                         cmp.clear();
5916                 }
5917     
5918                 if (! cmp.empty()) {
5919                     tok = tok->next();
5920                     tok->deleteNext(2);
5921     
5922                     tok->str(result ? "true" : "false");
5923                     ret = true;
5924                 }
5925             }
5926         }
5927     
5928         return ret;
5929     }
5930     
5931     bool Tokenizer::simplifyConstTernaryOp()
5932     {
5933         bool ret = false;
5934         const Token *templateParameterEnd = nullptr; // The end of the current template parameter list, if any
5935         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
5936             if (tok->str() == "<" && TemplateSimplifier::templateParameters(tok))
5937                 templateParameterEnd = tok->findClosingBracket();
5938             if (tok == templateParameterEnd)
5939                 templateParameterEnd = nullptr; // End of the current template parameter list
5940             if (tok->str() != "?")
5941                 continue;
5942     
5943             if (!Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "<|=|,|(|[|{|}|;|case|return %bool%|%num%") &&
5944                 !Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-4), "<|=|,|(|[|{|}|;|case|return ( %bool%|%num% )"))
5945                 continue;
5946     
5947             const int offset = (tok->previous()->str() == ")") ? 2 : 1;
5948     
5949             if (tok->strAt(-2*offset) == "<") {
5950                 if (isC() || !TemplateSimplifier::templateParameters(tok->tokAt(-2*offset)))
5951                     continue; // '<' is less than; the condition is not a constant
5952             }
5953     
5954             // Find the token ":" then go to the next token
5955             Token *colon = skipTernaryOp(tok);
5956             if (!colon || colon->previous()->str() != ":" || !colon->next())
5957                 continue;
5958     
5959             //handle the GNU extension: "x ? : y" <-> "x ? x : y"
5960             if (colon->previous() == tok->next())
5961                 tok->insertToken(tok->strAt(-offset));
5962     
5963             // go back before the condition, if possible
5964             tok = tok->tokAt(-2);
5965             if (offset == 2) {
5966                 // go further back before the "("
5967                 tok = tok->tokAt(-2);
5968                 //simplify the parentheses
5969                 tok->deleteNext();
5970                 tok->next()->deleteNext();
5971             }
5972     
5973             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "false|0")) {
5974                 // Use code after colon, remove code before it.
5975                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, colon);
5976     
5977                 tok = tok->next();
5978                 ret = true;
5979             }
5980     
5981             // The condition is true. Delete the operator after the ":"..
5982             else {
5983                 // delete the condition token and the "?"
5984                 tok->deleteNext(2);
5985     
5986                 int ternaryOplevel = 0;
5987                 for (const Token *endTok = colon; endTok; endTok = endTok->next()) {
5988                     if (Token::Match(endTok, "(|[|{"))
5989                         endTok = endTok->link();
5990                     else if (endTok->str() == "<" && (endTok->strAt(1) == ">" || TemplateSimplifier::templateParameters(endTok)))
5991                         endTok = endTok->findClosingBracket();
5992                     else if (endTok->str() == "?")
5993                         ++ternaryOplevel;
5994                     else if (Token::Match(endTok, ")|}|]|;|,|:|>")) {
5995                         if (endTok->str() == ":" && ternaryOplevel)
5996                             --ternaryOplevel;
5997                         else if (endTok->str() == ">" && !templateParameterEnd)
5998                             ;
5999                         else {
6000                             Token::eraseTokens(colon->tokAt(-2), endTok);
6001                             ret = true;
6002                             break;
6003                         }
6004                     }
6005                 }
6006             }
6007         }
6008         return ret;
6009     }
6010     
6011     void Tokenizer::simplifyUndefinedSizeArray()
6012     {
6013         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6014             if (Token::Match(tok, "%type%")) {
6015                 Token *tok2 = tok->next();
6016                 while (tok2 && tok2->str() == "*")
6017                     tok2 = tok2->next();
6018                 if (!Token::Match(tok2, "%name% [ ] ;|["))
6019                     continue;
6020     
6021                 tok = tok2->previous();
6022                 Token *end = tok2->next();
6023                 int count = 0;
6024                 do {
6025                     end = end->tokAt(2);
6026                     ++count;
6027                 } while (Token::Match(end, "[ ] [;=[]"));
6028                 if (Token::Match(end, "[;=]")) {
6029                     do {
6030                         tok2->deleteNext(2);
6031                         tok->insertToken("*");
6032                     } while (--count);
6033                     tok = end;
6034                 } else
6035                     tok = tok->tokAt(3);
6036             }
6037         }
6038     }
6039     
6040     void Tokenizer::simplifyCasts()
6041     {
6042         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6043             // Don't remove cast in such cases:
6044             // *((char *)a + 1) = 0;
6045             // Remove cast when casting a function pointer:
6046             // (*(void (*)(char *))fp)(x);
6047             if (!tok->isName() &&
6048                 Token::simpleMatch(tok->next(), "* (") &&
6049                 !Token::Match(tok->linkAt(2), ") %name%|&")) {
6050                 tok = tok->linkAt(2);
6051                 continue;
6052             }
6053             // #3935 : don't remove cast in such cases:
6054             // ((char *)a)[1] = 0;
6055             if (tok->str() == "(" && Token::simpleMatch(tok->link(), ") [")) {
6056                 tok = tok->link();
6057                 continue;
6058             }
6059             // #4164 : ((unsigned char)1) => (1)
6060             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %type% ) %num%") && tok->next()->link()->previous()->isStandardType()) {
6061                 const MathLib::bigint value = MathLib::toLongNumber(tok->next()->link()->next()->str());
6062                 int bits = mSettings->char_bit * mTypeSize[tok->next()->link()->previous()->str()];
6063                 if (!tok->tokAt(2)->isUnsigned() && bits > 0)
6064                     bits--;
6065                 if (bits < 31 && value >= 0 && value < (1LL << bits)) {
6066                     tok->linkAt(1)->next()->isCast(true);
6067                     Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->next()->link()->next());
6068                 }
6069                 continue;
6070             }
6071     
6072             while ((Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %type% *| *| *|&| ) *|&| %name%") && (tok->str() != ")" || tok->tokAt(2)->isStandardType())) ||
6073                    Token::Match(tok->next(), "( const| %type% * *| *|&| ) *|&| %name%") ||
6074                    Token::Match(tok->next(), "( const| %type% %type% *| *| *|&| ) *|&| %name%") ||
6075                    (!tok->isName() && (Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %type% * *| *|&| ) (") ||
6076                                        Token::Match(tok->next(), "( const| %type% %type% * *| *|&| ) (")))) {
6077                 if (tok->isName() && tok->str() != "return")
6078                     break;
6079     
6080                 if (isCPP() && tok->strAt(-1) == "operator")
6081                     break;
6082     
6083                 // Remove cast..
6084                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->next()->link()->next());
6085     
6086                 // Set isCasted flag.
6087                 Token *tok2 = tok->next();
6088                 if (!Token::Match(tok2, "%name% [|."))
6089                     tok2->isCast(true);
6090                 else {
6091                     // TODO: handle more complex expressions
6092                     tok2->next()->isCast(true);
6093                 }
6094     
6095                 // Remove '* &'
6096                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "* &")) {
6097                     tok->deleteNext();
6098                     tok->deleteThis();
6099                 }
6100     
6101                 if (tok->str() == ")" && tok->link()->previous()) {
6102                     // If there was another cast before this, go back
6103                     // there to check it also. e.g. "(int)(char)x"
6104                     tok = tok->link()->previous();
6105                 }
6106             }
6107     
6108             // Replace pointer casts of 0.. "(char *)0" => "0"
6109             while (Token::Match(tok->next(), "( %type% %type%| * *| ) 0")) {
6110                 tok->linkAt(1)->next()->isCast(true);
6111                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->next()->link()->next());
6112                 if (tok->str() == ")" && tok->link()->previous()) {
6113                     // If there was another cast before this, go back
6114                     // there to check it also. e.g. "(char*)(char*)0"
6115                     tok = tok->link()->previous();
6116                 }
6117             }
6118     
6119             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "dynamic_cast|reinterpret_cast|const_cast|static_cast <")) {
6120                 Token *tok2 = tok->linkAt(2);
6121                 if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "> ("))
6122                     break;
6123     
6124                 tok2->tokAt(2)->isCast(true);
6125                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok2->next());
6126             }
6127         }
6128     }
6129     
6130     
6131     void Tokenizer::simplifyFunctionParameters()
6132     {
6133         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6134             if (tok->link() && Token::Match(tok, "{|[|(")) {
6135                 tok = tok->link();
6136             }
6137     
6138             // Find the function e.g. foo( x ) or foo( x, y )
6139             else if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% ( %name% [,)]") &&
6140                      !(tok->strAt(-1) == ":" || tok->strAt(-1) == ",")) {
6141                 // We have found old style function, now we need to change it
6142     
6143                 // First step: Get list of argument names in parentheses
6144                 std::map<std::string, Token *> argumentNames;
6145                 bool bailOut = false;
6146                 Token * tokparam = nullptr;
6147     
6148                 //take count of the function name..
6149                 const std::string& funcName(tok->str());
6150     
6151                 //floating token used to check for parameters
6152                 Token *tok1 = tok;
6153     
6154                 while (nullptr != (tok1 = tok1->tokAt(2))) {
6155                     if (!Token::Match(tok1, "%name% [,)]")) {
6156                         bailOut = true;
6157                         break;
6158                     }
6159     
6160                     //same parameters: take note of the parameter
6161                     if (argumentNames.find(tok1->str()) != argumentNames.end())
6162                         tokparam = tok1;
6163                     else if (tok1->str() != funcName)
6164                         argumentNames[tok1->str()] = tok1;
6165                     else {
6166                         if (tok1->next()->str() == ")") {
6167                             if (tok1->previous()->str() == ",") {
6168                                 tok1 = tok1->tokAt(-2);
6169                                 tok1->deleteNext(2);
6170                             } else {
6171                                 tok1 = tok1->previous();
6172                                 tok1->deleteNext();
6173                                 bailOut = true;
6174                                 break;
6175                             }
6176                         } else {
6177                             tok1 = tok1->tokAt(-2);
6178                             tok1->next()->deleteNext(2);
6179                         }
6180                     }
6181     
6182                     if (tok1->next()->str() == ")") {
6183                         tok1 = tok1->tokAt(2);
6184                         //expect at least a type name after round brace..
6185                         if (!tok1 || !tok1->isName())
6186                             bailOut = true;
6187                         break;
6188                     }
6189                 }
6190     
6191                 //goto '('
6192                 tok = tok->next();
6193     
6194                 if (bailOut) {
6195                     tok = tok->link();
6196                     continue;
6197                 }
6198     
6199                 tok1 = tok->link()->next();
6200     
6201                 // there should be the sequence '; {' after the round parentheses
6202                 for (const Token* tok2 = tok1; tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
6203                     if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "; {"))
6204                         break;
6205                     else if (tok2->str() == "{") {
6206                         bailOut = true;
6207                         break;
6208                     }
6209                 }
6210     
6211                 if (bailOut) {
6212                     tok = tok->link();
6213                     continue;
6214                 }
6215     
6216                 // Last step: check out if the declarations between ')' and '{' match the parameters list
6217                 std::map<std::string, Token *> argumentNames2;
6218     
6219                 while (tok1 && tok1->str() != "{") {
6220                     if (Token::Match(tok1, "(|)")) {
6221                         bailOut = true;
6222                         break;
6223                     }
6224                     if (tok1->str() == ";") {
6225                         if (tokparam) {
6226                             syntaxError(tokparam);
6227                         }
6228                         Token *tok2 = tok1->previous();
6229                         while (tok2->str() == "]")
6230                             tok2 = tok2->link()->previous();
6231     
6232                         //it should be a name..
6233                         if (!tok2->isName()) {
6234                             bailOut = true;
6235                             break;
6236                         }
6237     
6238                         if (argumentNames2.find(tok2->str()) != argumentNames2.end()) {
6239                             //same parameter names...
6240                             syntaxError(tok1);
6241                         } else
6242                             argumentNames2[tok2->str()] = tok2;
6243     
6244                         if (argumentNames.find(tok2->str()) == argumentNames.end()) {
6245                             //non-matching parameter... bailout
6246                             bailOut = true;
6247                             break;
6248                         }
6249                     }
6250                     tok1 = tok1->next();
6251                 }
6252     
6253                 if (bailOut || !tok1) {
6254                     tok = tok->link();
6255                     continue;
6256                 }
6257     
6258                 //the two containers may not hold the same size...
6259                 //in that case, the missing parameters are defined as 'int'
6260                 if (argumentNames.size() != argumentNames2.size()) {
6261                     //move back 'tok1' to the last ';'
6262                     tok1 = tok1->previous();
6263                     for (std::map<std::string, Token *>::iterator it = argumentNames.begin(); it != argumentNames.end(); ++it) {
6264                         if (argumentNames2.find(it->first) == argumentNames2.end()) {
6265                             //add the missing parameter argument declaration
6266                             tok1->insertToken(";");
6267                             tok1->insertToken(it->first);
6268                             //register the change inside argumentNames2
6269                             argumentNames2[it->first] = tok1->next();
6270                             tok1->insertToken("int");
6271                         }
6272                     }
6273                 }
6274     
6275                 while (tok->str() != ")") {
6276                     //initialize start and end tokens to be moved
6277                     Token *declStart = argumentNames2[tok->next()->str()];
6278                     Token *declEnd = declStart;
6279                     while (declStart->previous()->str() != ";" && declStart->previous()->str() != ")")
6280                         declStart = declStart->previous();
6281                     while (declEnd->next()->str() != ";" && declEnd->next()->str() != "{")
6282                         declEnd = declEnd->next();
6283     
6284                     //remove ';' after declaration
6285                     declEnd->deleteNext();
6286     
6287                     //replace the parameter name in the parentheses with all the declaration
6288                     Token::replace(tok->next(), declStart, declEnd);
6289     
6290                     //since there are changes to tokens, put tok where tok1 is
6291                     tok = declEnd->next();
6292                 }
6293                 //goto forward and continue
6294                 tok = tok->next()->link();
6295             }
6296         }
6297     }
6298     
6299     void Tokenizer::simplifyPointerToStandardType()
6300     {
6301         if (!isC())
6302             return;
6303     
6304         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6305             if (!Token::Match(tok, "& %name% [ 0 ] !!["))
6306                 continue;
6307     
6308             if (!Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[,(=]"))
6309                 continue;
6310     
6311             // Remove '[ 0 ]' suffix
6312             Token::eraseTokens(tok->next(), tok->tokAt(5));
6313             // Remove '&' prefix
6314             tok = tok->previous();
6315             if (!tok)
6316                 break;
6317             tok->deleteNext();
6318         }
6319     }
6320     
6321     void Tokenizer::simplifyFunctionPointers()
6322     {
6323         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6324             // #2873 - do not simplify function pointer usage here:
6325             // (void)(xy(*p)(0));
6326             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, ") (")) {
6327                 tok = tok->next()->link();
6328                 continue;
6329             }
6330     
6331             // check for function pointer cast
6332             if (Token::Match(tok, "( %type% %type%| *| *| ( * ) (") ||
6333                 Token::Match(tok, "static_cast < %type% %type%| *| *| ( * ) (")) {
6334                 Token *tok1 = tok;
6335     
6336                 if (isCPP() && tok1->str() == "static_cast")
6337                     tok1 = tok1->next();
6338     
6339                 tok1 = tok1->next();
6340     
6341                 if (Token::Match(tok1->next(), "%type%"))
6342                     tok1 = tok1->next();
6343     
6344                 while (tok1->next()->str() == "*")
6345                     tok1 = tok1->next();
6346     
6347                 // check that the cast ends
6348                 if (!Token::Match(tok1->linkAt(4), ") )|>"))
6349                     continue;
6350     
6351                 // ok simplify this function pointer cast to an ordinary pointer cast
6352                 tok1->deleteNext();
6353                 tok1->next()->deleteNext();
6354                 Token::eraseTokens(tok1->next(), tok1->linkAt(2)->next());
6355                 continue;
6356             }
6357     
6358             // check for start of statement
6359             else if (tok->previous() && !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "{|}|;|,|(|public:|protected:|private:"))
6360                 continue;
6361     
6362             if (Token::Match(tok, "delete|else|return|throw|typedef"))
6363                 continue;
6364     
6365             while (Token::Match(tok, "%type%|:: %type%|::"))
6366                 tok = tok->next();
6367     
6368             Token *tok2 = (tok && tok->isName()) ? tok->next() : nullptr;
6369             while (Token::Match(tok2, "*|&"))
6370                 tok2 = tok2->next();
6371             if (!tok2 || tok2->str() != "(")
6372                 continue;
6373             while (Token::Match(tok2, "(|:: %type%"))
6374                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
6375             if (!Token::Match(tok2, "(|:: * *| %name%"))
6376                 continue;
6377             tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
6378             if (tok2->str() == "*")
6379                 tok2 = tok2->next();
6380             while (Token::Match(tok2, "%type%|:: %type%|::"))
6381                 tok2 = tok2->next();
6382     
6383             if (!Token::Match(tok2, "%name% ) (") &&
6384                 !Token::Match(tok2, "%name% [ ] ) (") &&
6385                 !(Token::Match(tok2, "%name% (") && Token::simpleMatch(tok2->linkAt(1), ") ) (")))
6386                 continue;
6387     
6388             while (tok->str() != "(")
6389                 tok = tok->next();
6390     
6391             // check that the declaration ends
6392             if (!tok || !tok->link() || !tok->link()->next()) {
6393                 syntaxError(nullptr);
6394             }
6395             Token *endTok = tok->link()->next()->link();
6396             if (Token::simpleMatch(endTok, ") throw ("))
6397                 endTok = endTok->linkAt(2);
6398             if (!Token::Match(endTok, ") const|volatile| const|volatile| ;|,|)|=|[|{"))
6399                 continue;
6400     
6401             while (Token::Match(endTok->next(), "const|volatile"))
6402                 endTok->deleteNext();
6403     
6404             // ok simplify this function pointer to an ordinary pointer
6405             Token::eraseTokens(tok->link(), endTok->next());
6406             tok->link()->deleteThis();
6407             while (Token::Match(tok, "( %type% ::"))
6408                 tok->deleteNext(2);
6409             tok->deleteThis();
6410         }
6411     }
6412     
6413     
6414     bool Tokenizer::simplifyFunctionReturn()
6415     {
6416         std::map<std::string, const Token*> functions;
6417     
6418         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6419             if (tok->str() == "{")
6420                 tok = tok->link();
6421     
6422             else if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% ( ) { return %bool%|%char%|%num%|%str% ; }") && tok->strAt(-1) != "::") {
6423                 const Token* const any = tok->tokAt(5);
6424                 functions[tok->str()] = any;
6425                 tok = any;
6426             }
6427         }
6428     
6429         if (functions.empty())
6430             return false;
6431     
6432         bool ret = false;
6433         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6434             if (Token::Match(tok, "(|[|=|return|%op% %name% ( ) ;|]|)|%cop%")) {
6435                 tok = tok->next();
6436                 auto it = functions.find(tok->str());
6437                 if (it != functions.cend()) {
6438                     tok->str(it->second->str());
6439                     tok->deleteNext(2);
6440                     ret = true;
6441                 }
6442             }
6443         }
6444     
6445         return ret;
6446     }
6447     
6448     void Tokenizer::simplifyVarDecl(const bool only_k_r_fpar)
6449     {
6450         simplifyVarDecl(list.front(), nullptr, only_k_r_fpar);
6451     }
6452     
6453     void Tokenizer::simplifyVarDecl(Token * tokBegin, const Token * const tokEnd, const bool only_k_r_fpar)
6454     {
6455         const bool isCPP11  = mSettings->standards.cpp >= Standards::CPP11;
6456     
6457         // Split up variable declarations..
6458         // "int a=4;" => "int a; a=4;"
6459         bool finishedwithkr = true;
6460         for (Token *tok = tokBegin; tok != tokEnd; tok = tok->next()) {
6461             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "= {")) {
6462                 tok = tok->next()->link();
6463             }
6464             if (!tok) {
6465                 syntaxError(tokBegin);
6466             }
6467             if (only_k_r_fpar && finishedwithkr) {
6468                 if (Token::Match(tok, "(|[|{")) {
6469                     tok = tok->link();
6470                     if (tok->next() && Token::Match(tok, ") !!{"))
6471                         tok = tok->next();
6472                     else
6473                         continue;
6474                 } else
6475                     continue;
6476             } else if (tok->str() == "(") {
6477                 if (isCPP()) {
6478                     for (Token * tok2 = tok; tok2 && tok2 != tok->link(); tok2 = tok2->next()) {
6479                         if (Token::Match(tok2, "[(,] [")) {
6480                             // lambda function at tok2->next()
6481                             // find start of lambda body
6482                             Token * lambdaBody = tok2;
6483                             while (lambdaBody && lambdaBody != tok2->link() && lambdaBody->str() != "{")
6484                                 lambdaBody = lambdaBody->next();
6485                             if (lambdaBody && lambdaBody != tok2->link() && lambdaBody->link())
6486                                 simplifyVarDecl(lambdaBody, lambdaBody->link()->next(), only_k_r_fpar);
6487                         }
6488                     }
6489                 }
6490                 tok = tok->link();
6491             }
6492     
6493             if (!tok)
6494                 syntaxError(nullptr); // #7043 invalid code
6495             if (tok->previous() && !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "{|}|;|)|public:|protected:|private:"))
6496                 continue;
6497             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "template <"))
6498                 continue;
6499     
6500             Token *type0 = tok;
6501             if (!Token::Match(type0, "::|extern| %type%"))
6502                 continue;
6503             if (Token::Match(type0, "else|return|public:|protected:|private:"))
6504                 continue;
6505             if (isCPP11 && type0->str() == "using")
6506                 continue;
6507             if (isCPP() && type0->str() == "namespace")
6508                 continue;
6509     
6510             bool isconst = false;
6511             bool isstatic = false;
6512             Token *tok2 = type0;
6513             int typelen = 1;
6514     
6515             if (Token::Match(tok2, "::|extern")) {
6516                 tok2 = tok2->next();
6517                 typelen++;
6518             }
6519     
6520             //check if variable is declared 'const' or 'static' or both
6521             while (tok2) {
6522                 if (!Token::Match(tok2, "const|static") && Token::Match(tok2, "%type% const|static")) {
6523                     tok2 = tok2->next();
6524                     ++typelen;
6525                 }
6526     
6527                 if (tok2->str() == "const")
6528                     isconst = true;
6529     
6530                 else if (tok2->str() == "static")
6531                     isstatic = true;
6532     
6533                 else if (Token::Match(tok2, "%type% :: %type%")) {
6534                     tok2 = tok2->next();
6535                     ++typelen;
6536                 }
6537     
6538                 else
6539                     break;
6540     
6541                 if (tok2->strAt(1) == "*")
6542                     break;
6543     
6544                 if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "& %name% ,"))
6545                     break;
6546     
6547                 tok2 = tok2->next();
6548                 ++typelen;
6549             }
6550     
6551             // strange looking variable declaration => don't split up.
6552             if (Token::Match(tok2, "%type% *|&| %name% , %type% *|&| %name%"))
6553                 continue;
6554     
6555             if (Token::Match(tok2, "struct|union|class %type%")) {
6556                 tok2 = tok2->next();
6557                 ++typelen;
6558             }
6559     
6560             // check for qualification..
6561             if (Token::Match(tok2,  ":: %type%")) {
6562                 ++typelen;
6563                 tok2 = tok2->next();
6564             }
6565     
6566             //skip combinations of templates and namespaces
6567             while (!isC() && (Token::Match(tok2, "%type% <") || Token::Match(tok2, "%type% ::"))) {
6568                 if (tok2->next()->str() == "<" && !TemplateSimplifier::templateParameters(tok2->next())) {
6569                     tok2 = nullptr;
6570                     break;
6571                 }
6572                 typelen += 2;
6573                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
6574                 if (tok2 && tok2->previous()->str() == "::")
6575                     continue;
6576                 int indentlevel = 0;
6577                 int parens = 0;
6578     
6579                 for (Token *tok3 = tok2; tok3; tok3 = tok3->next()) {
6580                     ++typelen;
6581     
6582                     if (!parens && tok3->str() == "<") {
6583                         ++indentlevel;
6584                     } else if (!parens && tok3->str() == ">") {
6585                         if (indentlevel == 0) {
6586                             tok2 = tok3->next();
6587                             break;
6588                         }
6589                         --indentlevel;
6590                     } else if (!parens && tok3->str() == ">>") {
6591                         if (indentlevel <= 1) {
6592                             tok2 = tok3->next();
6593                             break;
6594                         }
6595                         indentlevel -= 2;
6596                     } else if (tok3->str() == "(") {
6597                         ++parens;
6598                     } else if (tok3->str() == ")") {
6599                         if (!parens) {
6600                             tok2 = nullptr;
6601                             break;
6602                         }
6603                         --parens;
6604                     } else if (tok3->str() == ";") {
6605                         break;
6606                     }
6607                 }
6608     
6609                 if (Token::Match(tok2,  ":: %type%")) {
6610                     ++typelen;
6611                     tok2 = tok2->next();
6612                 }
6613             }
6614     
6615             //pattern: "%type% *| ... *| const| %name% ,|="
6616             if (Token::Match(tok2, "%type%") ||
6617                 (tok2 && tok2->previous() && tok2->previous()->str() == ">")) {
6618                 Token *varName = tok2;
6619                 if (!tok2->previous() || tok2->previous()->str() != ">")
6620                     varName = varName->next();
6621                 else
6622                     --typelen;
6623                 //skip all the pointer part
6624                 bool isPointerOrRef = false;
6625                 while (Token::simpleMatch(varName, "*") || Token::Match(varName, "& %name% ,")) {
6626                     isPointerOrRef = true;
6627                     varName = varName->next();
6628                 }
6629     
6630                 while (Token::Match(varName, "%type% %type%")) {
6631                     if (varName->str() != "const") {
6632                         ++typelen;
6633                     }
6634                     varName = varName->next();
6635                 }
6636                 //non-VLA case
6637                 if (Token::Match(varName, "%name% ,|=")) {
6638                     if (varName->str() != "operator") {
6639                         tok2 = varName->next(); // The ',' or '=' token
6640     
6641                         if (tok2->str() == "=" && (isstatic || (isconst && !isPointerOrRef))) {
6642                             //do not split const non-pointer variables..
6643                             while (tok2 && tok2->str() != "," && tok2->str() != ";") {
6644                                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "{|(|["))
6645                                     tok2 = tok2->link();
6646                                 if (!isC() && tok2->str() == "<" && TemplateSimplifier::templateParameters(tok2) > 0) {
6647                                     tok2 = tok2->findClosingBracket();
6648                                 }
6649                                 if (!tok2)
6650                                     syntaxError(nullptr); // #6881 invalid code
6651                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
6652                             }
6653                             if (tok2 && tok2->str() == ";")
6654                                 tok2 = nullptr;
6655                         }
6656                     } else
6657                         tok2 = nullptr;
6658                 }
6659     
6660                 //VLA case
6661                 else if (Token::Match(varName, "%name% [")) {
6662                     tok2 = varName->next();
6663     
6664                     while (Token::Match(tok2->link(), "] ,|=|["))
6665                         tok2 = tok2->link()->next();
6666                     if (!Token::Match(tok2, "=|,"))
6667                         tok2 = nullptr;
6668                     if (tok2 && tok2->str() == "=") {
6669                         while (tok2 && tok2->str() != "," && tok2->str() != ";") {
6670                             if (Token::Match(tok2, "{|(|["))
6671                                 tok2 = tok2->link();
6672                             tok2 = tok2->next();
6673                         }
6674                         if (tok2 && tok2->str() == ";")
6675                             tok2 = nullptr;
6676                     }
6677                 }
6678     
6679                 // brace initialization
6680                 else if (Token::Match(varName, "%name% {")) {
6681                     tok2 = varName->next();
6682                     tok2 = tok2->link();
6683                     if (tok2)
6684                         tok2 = tok2->next();
6685                     if (tok2 && tok2->str() != ",")
6686                         tok2 = nullptr;
6687                 }
6688     
6689                 // parenthesis, functions can't be declared like:
6690                 // int f1(a,b), f2(c,d);
6691                 // so if there is a comma assume this is a variable declaration
6692                 else if (Token::Match(varName, "%name% (") && Token::simpleMatch(varName->linkAt(1), ") ,")) {
6693                     tok2 = varName->linkAt(1)->next();
6694                 }
6695     
6696                 else
6697                     tok2 = nullptr;
6698             } else {
6699                 tok2 = nullptr;
6700             }
6701     
6702             if (!tok2) {
6703                 if (only_k_r_fpar)
6704                     finishedwithkr = false;
6705                 continue;
6706             }
6707     
6708             if (tok2->str() == ",") {
6709                 tok2->str(";");
6710                 //TODO: should we have to add also template '<>' links?
6711                 TokenList::insertTokens(tok2, type0, typelen);
6712             }
6713     
6714             else {
6715                 Token *eq = tok2;
6716     
6717                 while (tok2) {
6718                     if (Token::Match(tok2, "{|(|["))
6719                         tok2 = tok2->link();
6720     
6721                     else if (!isC() && tok2->str() == "<" && tok2->previous()->isName() && !tok2->previous()->varId())
6722                         tok2 = tok2->findClosingBracket();
6723     
6724                     else if (std::strchr(";,", tok2->str()[0])) {
6725                         // "type var ="   =>   "type var; var ="
6726                         const Token *varTok = type0->tokAt(typelen);
6727                         while (Token::Match(varTok, "*|&|const|volatile"))
6728                             varTok = varTok->next();
6729                         if (!varTok)
6730                             syntaxError(tok2); // invalid code
6731                         TokenList::insertTokens(eq, varTok, 2);
6732                         eq->str(";");
6733     
6734                         // "= x, "   =>   "= x; type "
6735                         if (tok2->str() == ",") {
6736                             tok2->str(";");
6737                             TokenList::insertTokens(tok2, type0, typelen);
6738                         }
6739                         break;
6740                     }
6741                     if (tok2)
6742                         tok2 = tok2->next();
6743                 }
6744             }
6745             finishedwithkr = (only_k_r_fpar && tok2 && tok2->strAt(1) == "{");
6746         }
6747     }
6748     
6749     void Tokenizer::simplifyStaticConst()
6750     {
6751         // This function will simplify the token list so that the qualifiers "extern", "static"
6752         // and "const" appear in the same order as in the array below.
6753         const std::string qualifiers[] = {"extern", "static", "const"};
6754     
6755         // Move 'const' before all other qualifiers and types and then
6756         // move 'static' before all other qualifiers and types, ...
6757         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6758             bool continue2 = false;
6759             for (int i = 0; i < sizeof(qualifiers)/sizeof(qualifiers[0]); i++) {
6760     
6761                 // Keep searching for a qualifier
6762                 if (!tok->next() || tok->next()->str() != qualifiers[i])
6763                     continue;
6764     
6765                 // Look backwards to find the beginning of the declaration
6766                 Token* leftTok = tok;
6767                 bool behindOther = false;
6768                 for (; leftTok; leftTok = leftTok->previous()) {
6769                     for (int j = 0; j <= i; j++) {
6770                         if (leftTok->str() == qualifiers[j]) {
6771                             behindOther = true;
6772                             break;
6773                         }
6774                     }
6775                     if (behindOther)
6776                         break;
6777                     if (!Token::Match(leftTok, "%type%|struct|::") ||
6778                         (isCPP() && Token::Match(leftTok, "private:|protected:|public:|operator|template"))) {
6779                         break;
6780                     }
6781                 }
6782     
6783                 // The token preceding the declaration should indicate the start of a declaration
6784                 if (leftTok == tok)
6785                     continue;
6786     
6787                 if (leftTok && !behindOther && !Token::Match(leftTok, ";|{|}|(|,|private:|protected:|public:")) {
6788                     continue2 = true;
6789                     break;
6790                 }
6791     
6792                 // Move the qualifier to the left-most position in the declaration
6793                 tok->deleteNext();
6794                 if (!leftTok) {
6795                     list.front()->insertToken(qualifiers[i], emptyString, false);
6796                     list.front()->swapWithNext();
6797                     tok = list.front();
6798                 } else if (leftTok->next()) {
6799                     leftTok->next()->insertToken(qualifiers[i], emptyString, true);
6800                     tok = leftTok->next();
6801                 } else {
6802                     leftTok->insertToken(qualifiers[i]);
6803                     tok = leftTok;
6804                 }
6805             }
6806             if (continue2)
6807                 continue;
6808         }
6809     }
6810     
6811     void Tokenizer::simplifyIfAndWhileAssign()
6812     {
6813         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6814             if (!Token::Match(tok->next(), "if|while ("))
6815                 continue;
6816     
6817             const Token* tokAt3 = tok->tokAt(3);
6818             if (!Token::Match(tokAt3, "!| (| %name% =") &&
6819                 !Token::Match(tokAt3, "!| (| %name% . %name% =") &&
6820                 !Token::Match(tokAt3, "0 == (| %name% =") &&
6821                 !Token::Match(tokAt3, "0 == (| %name% . %name% ="))
6822                 continue;
6823     
6824             // simplifying a "while(cond) { }" condition ?
6825             const bool iswhile(tok->next()->str() == "while");
6826     
6827             // simplifying a "do { } while(cond);" condition ?
6828             const bool isDoWhile = iswhile && Token::simpleMatch(tok, "}") && Token::simpleMatch(tok->link()->previous(), "do");
6829             Token* openBraceTok = tok->link();
6830     
6831             // delete the "if|while"
6832             tok->deleteNext();
6833     
6834             // Remember if there is a "!" or not. And delete it if there are.
6835             const bool isNot(Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "!|0"));
6836             if (isNot)
6837                 tok->next()->deleteNext((tok->strAt(2) == "0") ? 2 : 1);
6838     
6839             // Delete parentheses.. and remember how many there are with
6840             // their links.
6841             std::stack<Token *> braces;
6842             while (tok->next()->str() == "(") {
6843                 braces.push(tok->next()->link());
6844                 tok->deleteNext();
6845             }
6846     
6847             // Skip the "%name% = ..."
6848             Token *tok2;
6849             for (tok2 = tok->next(); tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
6850                 if (tok2->str() == "(")
6851                     tok2 = tok2->link();
6852                 else if (tok2->str() == ")")
6853                     break;
6854             }
6855     
6856             // Insert "; if|while ( .."
6857             tok2 = tok2->previous();
6858             if (tok->strAt(2) == ".") {
6859                 tok2->insertToken(tok->strAt(3));
6860                 tok2->next()->varId(tok->tokAt(3)->varId());
6861                 tok2->insertToken(".");
6862             }
6863             tok2->insertToken(tok->next()->str());
6864             tok2->next()->varId(tok->next()->varId());
6865     
6866             while (! braces.empty()) {
6867                 tok2->insertToken("(");
6868                 Token::createMutualLinks(tok2->next(), braces.top());
6869                 braces.pop();
6870             }
6871     
6872             if (isNot)
6873                 tok2->next()->insertToken("!");
6874             tok2->insertToken(iswhile ? "while" : "if");
6875             if (isDoWhile) {
6876                 tok2->insertToken("}");
6877                 Token::createMutualLinks(openBraceTok, tok2->next());
6878             }
6879     
6880             tok2->insertToken(";");
6881     
6882             // delete the extra "}"
6883             if (isDoWhile)
6884                 tok->deleteThis();
6885     
6886             // If it's a while loop, insert the assignment in the loop
6887             if (iswhile && !isDoWhile) {
6888                 int indentlevel = 0;
6889                 Token *tok3 = tok2;
6890     
6891                 for (; tok3; tok3 = tok3->next()) {
6892                     if (tok3->str() == "{")
6893                         ++indentlevel;
6894                     else if (tok3->str() == "}") {
6895                         if (indentlevel <= 1)
6896                             break;
6897                         --indentlevel;
6898                     }
6899                 }
6900     
6901                 if (tok3 && indentlevel == 1) {
6902                     tok3 = tok3->previous();
6903                     std::stack<Token *> braces2;
6904     
6905                     for (tok2 = tok2->next(); tok2 && tok2 != tok; tok2 = tok2->previous()) {
6906                         tok3->insertToken(tok2->str());
6907                         Token *newTok = tok3->next();
6908     
6909                         newTok->varId(tok2->varId());
6910                         newTok->fileIndex(tok2->fileIndex());
6911                         newTok->linenr(tok2->linenr());
6912     
6913                         // link() new tokens manually
6914                         if (tok2->link()) {
6915                             if (Token::Match(newTok, "}|)|]|>")) {
6916                                 braces2.push(newTok);
6917                             } else {
6918                                 Token::createMutualLinks(newTok, braces2.top());
6919                                 braces2.pop();
6920                             }
6921                         }
6922                     }
6923                 }
6924             }
6925         }
6926     }
6927     
6928     void Tokenizer::simplifyVariableMultipleAssign()
6929     {
6930         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6931             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% = %name% = %num%|%name% ;")) {
6932                 // skip intermediate assignments
6933                 Token *tok2 = tok->previous();
6934                 while (tok2 &&
6935                        tok2->str() == "=" &&
6936                        Token::Match(tok2->previous(), "%name%")) {
6937                     tok2 = tok2->tokAt(-2);
6938                 }
6939     
6940                 if (!tok2 || tok2->str() != ";") {
6941                     continue;
6942                 }
6943     
6944                 Token *stopAt = tok->tokAt(2);
6945                 const Token *valueTok = stopAt->tokAt(2);
6946                 const std::string& value(valueTok->str());
6947                 tok2 = tok2->next();
6948     
6949                 while (tok2 != stopAt) {
6950                     tok2->next()->insertToken(";");
6951                     tok2->next()->insertToken(value);
6952                     tok2 = tok2->tokAt(4);
6953                 }
6954             }
6955         }
6956     }
6957     
6958     // Binary operators simplification map
6959     static const std::map<std::string, std::string> cAlternativeTokens = {
6960         std::make_pair("and", "&&")
6961         , std::make_pair("and_eq", "&=")
6962         , std::make_pair("bitand", "&")
6963         , std::make_pair("bitor", "|")
6964         , std::make_pair("not_eq", "!=")
6965         , std::make_pair("or", "||")
6966         , std::make_pair("or_eq", "|=")
6967         , std::make_pair("xor", "^")
6968         , std::make_pair("xor_eq", "^=")
6969     };
6970     
6971     // Simplify the C alternative tokens:
6972     //  and      =>     &&
6973     //  and_eq   =>     &=
6974     //  bitand   =>     &
6975     //  bitor    =>     |
6976     //  compl    =>     ~
6977     //  not      =>     !
6978     //  not_eq   =>     !=
6979     //  or       =>     ||
6980     //  or_eq    =>     |=
6981     //  xor      =>     ^
6982     //  xor_eq   =>     ^=
6983     bool Tokenizer::simplifyCAlternativeTokens()
6984     {
6985         /* executable scope level */
6986         int executableScopeLevel = 0;
6987     
6988         bool ret = false;
6989         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
6990             if (tok->str() == "{") {
6991                 if (executableScopeLevel > 0 || Token::simpleMatch(tok->previous(), ") {"))
6992                     ++executableScopeLevel;
6993                 continue;
6994             }
6995     
6996             if (tok->str() == "}") {
6997                 if (executableScopeLevel > 0)
6998                     --executableScopeLevel;
6999                 continue;
7000             }
7001     
7002             if (!tok->isName())
7003                 continue;
7004     
7005             const std::map<std::string, std::string>::const_iterator cOpIt = cAlternativeTokens.find(tok->str());
7006             if (cOpIt != cAlternativeTokens.end()) {
7007                 if (!Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%name%|%num%|%char%|)|]|> %name% %name%|%num%|%char%|%op%|("))
7008                     continue;
7009                 if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "%assign%|%or%|%oror%|&&|*|/|%|^"))
7010                     continue;
7011                 tok->str(cOpIt->second);
7012                 ret = true;
