7013             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "not|compl")) {
7014                 // Don't simplify 'not p;' (in case 'not' is a type)
7015                 if (!Token::Match(tok->next(), "%name%|(") ||
7016                     Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[;{}]") ||
7017                     (executableScopeLevel == 0U && tok->strAt(-1) == "("))
7018                     continue;
7019                 tok->str((tok->str() == "not") ? "!" : "~");
7020                 ret = true;
7021             }
7022         }
7023         return ret;
7024     }
7025     
7026     // int i(0); => int i; i = 0;
7027     // int i(0), j; => int i; i = 0; int j;
7028     void Tokenizer::simplifyInitVar()
7029     {
7030         if (isC())
7031             return;
7032     
7033         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
7034             if (!tok->isName() || (tok->previous() && !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[;{}]")))
7035                 continue;
7036     
7037             if (tok->str() == "return")
7038                 continue;
7039     
7040             if (Token::Match(tok, "class|struct|union| %type% *| %name% ( &| %any% ) ;")) {
7041                 tok = initVar(tok);
7042             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "%type% *| %name% ( %type% (")) {
7043                 const Token* tok2 = tok->tokAt(2);
7044                 if (!tok2->link())
7045                     tok2 = tok2->next();
7046                 if (!tok2->link() || (tok2->link()->strAt(1) == ";" && !Token::simpleMatch(tok2->linkAt(2), ") (")))
7047                     tok = initVar(tok);
7048             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "class|struct|union| %type% *| %name% ( &| %any% ) ,")) {
7049                 Token *tok1 = tok->tokAt(5);
7050                 while (tok1->str() != ",")
7051                     tok1 = tok1->next();
7052                 tok1->str(";");
7053     
7054                 const int numTokens = (Token::Match(tok, "class|struct|union")) ? 2U : 1U;
7055                 TokenList::insertTokens(tok1, tok, numTokens);
7056                 tok = initVar(tok);
7057             }
7058         }
7059     }
7060     
7061     Token * Tokenizer::initVar(Token * tok)
7062     {
7063         // call constructor of class => no simplification
7064         if (Token::Match(tok, "class|struct|union")) {
7065             if (tok->strAt(2) != "*")
7066                 return tok;
7067     
7068             tok = tok->next();
7069         } else if (!tok->isStandardType() && tok->next()->str() != "*")
7070             return tok;
7071     
7072         // goto variable name..
7073         tok = tok->next();
7074         if (tok->str() == "*")
7075             tok = tok->next();
7076     
7077         // sizeof is not a variable name..
7078         if (tok->str() == "sizeof")
7079             return tok;
7080     
7081         // check initializer..
7082         if (tok->tokAt(2)->isStandardType() || tok->strAt(2) == "void")
7083             return tok;
7084         else if (!tok->tokAt(2)->isNumber() && !Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "%type% (") && tok->strAt(2) != "&" && tok->tokAt(2)->varId() == 0)
7085             return tok;
7086     
7087         // insert '; var ='
7088         tok->insertToken(";");
7089         tok->next()->insertToken(tok->str());
7090         tok->tokAt(2)->varId(tok->varId());
7091         tok = tok->tokAt(2);
7092         tok->insertToken("=");
7093     
7094         // goto '('..
7095         tok = tok->tokAt(2);
7096     
7097         // delete ')'
7098         tok->link()->deleteThis();
7099     
7100         // delete this
7101         tok->deleteThis();
7102     
7103         return tok;
7104     }
7105     
7106     
7107     bool Tokenizer::simplifyKnownVariables()
7108     {
7109         // return value for function. Set to true if any simplifications are made
7110         bool ret = false;
7111     
7112         // constants..
7113         {
7114             std::unordered_map<int, std::string> constantValues;
7115             std::map<int, Token*> constantVars;
7116             std::unordered_map<int, std::list<Token*>> constantValueUsages;
7117             bool goback = false;
7118             for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
7119                 if (goback) {
7120                     tok = tok->previous();
7121                     goback = false;
7122                 }
7123                 // Reference to variable
7124                 if (Token::Match(tok, "%type%|* & %name% = %name% ;")) {
7125                     Token *start = tok->previous();
7126                     while (Token::Match(start,"%type%|*|&"))
7127                         start = start->previous();
7128                     if (!Token::Match(start,"[;{}]"))
7129                         continue;
7130                     const Token *reftok = tok->tokAt(2);
7131                     const Token *vartok = reftok->tokAt(2);
7132                     int level = 0;
7133                     for (Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(6); tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
7134                         if (tok2->str() == "{") {
7135                             ++level;
7136                         } else if (tok2->str() == "}") {
7137                             if (level <= 0)
7138                                 break;
7139                             --level;
7140                         } else if (tok2->varId() == reftok->varId()) {
7141                             tok2->str(vartok->str());
7142                             tok2->varId(vartok->varId());
7143                         }
7144                     }
7145                     Token::eraseTokens(start, tok->tokAt(6));
7146                     tok = start;
7147                 }
7148     
7149                 if (tok->isName() && (Token::Match(tok, "static| const| static| %type% const| %name% = %any% ;") ||
7150                                       Token::Match(tok, "static| const| static| %type% const| %name% ( %any% ) ;"))) {
7151                     bool isconst = false;
7152                     for (const Token *tok2 = tok; (tok2->str() != "=") && (tok2->str() != "("); tok2 = tok2->next()) {
7153                         if (tok2->str() == "const") {
7154                             isconst = true;
7155                             break;
7156                         }
7157                     }
7158                     if (!isconst)
7159                         continue;
7160     
7161                     Token *tok1 = tok;
7162     
7163                     // start of statement
7164                     if (tok != list.front() && !Token::Match(tok->previous(),";|{|}|private:|protected:|public:"))
7165                         continue;
7166                     // skip "const" and "static"
7167                     while (Token::Match(tok, "const|static"))
7168                         tok = tok->next();
7169                     // pod type
7170                     if (!tok->isStandardType())
7171                         continue;
7172     
7173                     Token * const vartok = (tok->next() && tok->next()->str() == "const") ? tok->tokAt(2) : tok->next();
7174                     const Token * const valuetok = vartok->tokAt(2);
7175                     if (Token::Match(valuetok, "%bool%|%char%|%num%|%str% )| ;")) {
7176                         // record a constant value for this variable
7177                         constantValues[vartok->varId()] = valuetok->str();
7178                         constantVars[vartok->varId()] = tok1;
7179                     }
7180                 } else if (tok->varId()) {
7181                     // find the entry for the known variable, if any.  Exclude the location where the variable is assigned with next == "="
7182                     if (constantValues.find(tok->varId()) != constantValues.end() && tok->next()->str() != "=") {
7183                         constantValueUsages[tok->varId()].push_back(tok);
7184                     }
7185                 }
7186             }
7187     
7188             for (auto constantVar = constantVars.rbegin(); constantVar != constantVars.rend(); constantVar++) {
7189                 bool referenceFound = false;
7190                 std::list<Token*> usageList = constantValueUsages[constantVar->first];
7191                 for (Token* usage : usageList) {
7192                     // check if any usages of each known variable are a reference
7193                     if (Token::Match(usage->tokAt(-2), "(|[|,|{|return|%op% & %varid%", constantVar->first)) {
7194                         referenceFound = true;
7195                         break;
7196                     }
7197                 }
7198     
7199                 if (!referenceFound) {
7200                     // replace all usages of non-referenced known variables with their value
7201                     for (Token* usage : usageList) {
7202                         usage->str(constantValues[constantVar->first]);
7203                     }
7204     
7205                     Token* startTok = constantVar->second;
7206                     // remove variable assignment statement
7207                     while (startTok->next()->str() != ";")
7208                         startTok->deleteNext();
7209                     startTok->deleteNext();
7210     
7211                     // #8579 if we can we want another token to delete startTok. if we can't it doesn't matter
7212                     if (startTok->previous()) {
7213                         startTok->previous()->deleteNext();
7214                     } else if (startTok->next()) {
7215                         startTok->next()->deletePrevious();
7216                     } else {
7217                         startTok->deleteThis();
7218                     }
7219                     startTok = nullptr;
7220     
7221                     constantVar->second = nullptr;
7222                     ret = true;
7223                 }
7224             }
7225         }
7226     
7227         // variable id for local, float/double, array variables
7228         std::set<int> localvars;
7229         std::set<int> floatvars;
7230         std::set<int> arrays;
7231     
7232         // auto variables..
7233         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
7234             // Search for a block of code
7235             Token * const start = const_cast<Token *>(startOfExecutableScope(tok));
7236             if (!start)
7237                 continue;
7238     
7239             for (const Token *tok2 = start->previous(); tok2 && !Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}]"); tok2 = tok2->previous()) {
7240                 if (tok2->varId() != 0)
7241                     localvars.insert(tok2->varId());
7242             }
7243     
7244             tok = start;
7245             // parse the block of code..
7246             int indentlevel = 0;
7247             Token *tok2 = tok;
7248             for (; tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
7249                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}] %type% %name%|*")) {
7250                     bool isfloat = false;
7251                     bool ispointer = false;
7252                     const Token *vartok = tok2->next();
7253                     while (Token::Match(vartok, "%name%|* %name%|*")) {
7254                         if (Token::Match(vartok, "float|double"))
7255                             isfloat = true;
7256                         if (vartok->str() == "*")
7257                             ispointer = true;
7258                         vartok = vartok->next();
7259                     }
7260                     if (Token::Match(vartok, "%var% ;|["))
7261                         localvars.insert(vartok->varId());
7262                     if (isfloat && !ispointer && Token::Match(vartok, "%var% ;"))
7263                         floatvars.insert(vartok->varId());
7264                     if (Token::Match(vartok, "%var% ["))
7265                         arrays.insert(vartok->varId());
7266                 }
7267     
7268                 if (tok2->str() == "{")
7269                     ++indentlevel;
7270     
7271                 else if (tok2->str() == "}") {
7272                     --indentlevel;
7273                     if (indentlevel <= 0)
7274                         break;
7275                 }
7276     
7277                 else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "for ("))
7278                     tok2 = tok2->next()->link();
7279     
7280                 else if (tok2->previous()->str() != "*" && !Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-2), "* --|++") &&
7281                          (Token::Match(tok2, "%name% = %bool%|%char%|%num%|%str%|%name% ;") ||
7282                           Token::Match(tok2, "%name% [ %num%| ] = %str% ;") ||
7283                           Token::Match(tok2, "%name% = & %name% ;") ||
7284                           (Token::Match(tok2, "%name% = & %name% [ 0 ] ;") && arrays.find(tok2->tokAt(3)->varId()) != arrays.end()))) {
7285                     const int varid = tok2->varId();
7286                     if (varid == 0)
7287                         continue;
7288     
7289                     if (Token::Match(tok2->previous(), "[;{}]") && localvars.find(varid) == localvars.end())
7290                         continue;
7291     
7292                     // initialization of static variable => the value is not *known*
7293                     {
7294                         bool isstatic = false;
7295                         const Token *decl = tok2->previous();
7296                         while (decl && (decl->isName() || decl->str() == "*")) {
7297                             if (decl->str() == "static") {
7298                                 isstatic = true;
7299                                 break;
7300                             }
7301                             decl = decl->previous();
7302                         }
7303                         if (isstatic)
7304                             continue;
7305                     }
7306     
7307                     // skip loop variable
7308                     if (Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-2), "(|:: %type%")) {
7309                         const Token *tok3 = tok2->previous();
7310                         do {
7311                             tok3 = tok3->tokAt(-2);
7312                         } while (Token::Match(tok3->previous(), ":: %type%"));
7313                         if (Token::Match(tok3->tokAt(-2), "for ( %type%"))
7314                             continue;
7315                     }
7316     
7317                     // struct name..
7318                     if (Token::Match(tok2, "%varid% = &| %varid%", tok2->varId()))
7319                         continue;
7320     
7321                     const std::string structname = Token::Match(tok2->tokAt(-3), "[;{}] %name% .") ?
7322                                                    std::string(tok2->strAt(-2) + " .") :
7323                                                    std::string();
7324     
7325                     const Token * const valueToken = tok2->tokAt(2);
7326     
7327                     std::string value;
7328                     nonneg int valueVarId = 0;
7329     
7330                     Token *tok3 = nullptr;
7331                     bool valueIsPointer = false;
7332     
7333                     // there could be a hang here if tok2 is moved back by the function calls below for some reason
7334                     if (Settings::terminated())
7335                         return false;
7336     
7337                     if (!simplifyKnownVariablesGetData(varid, &tok2, &tok3, value, valueVarId, valueIsPointer, floatvars.find(tok2->varId()) != floatvars.end()))
7338                         continue;
7339     
7340                     if (valueVarId > 0 && arrays.find(valueVarId) != arrays.end())
7341                         continue;
7342     
7343                     ret |= simplifyKnownVariablesSimplify(&tok2, tok3, varid, structname, value, valueVarId, valueIsPointer, valueToken, indentlevel);
7344                 }
7345     
7346                 else if (Token::Match(tok2, "strcpy|sprintf ( %name% , %str% ) ;")) {
7347                     const int varid(tok2->tokAt(2)->varId());
7348                     if (varid == 0)
7349                         continue;
7350     
7351                     const Token * const valueToken = tok2->tokAt(4);
7352                     std::string value(valueToken->str());
7353                     if (tok2->str() == "sprintf") {
7354                         std::string::size_type n = 0;
7355                         while ((n = value.find("%%", n)) != std::string::npos) {
7356                             // Replace "%%" with "%" - erase the first '%' and continue past the second '%'
7357                             value.erase(n, 1);
7358                             ++n;
7359                         }
7360                     }
7361                     const int valueVarId(0);
7362                     const bool valueIsPointer(false);
7363                     Token *tok3 = tok2->tokAt(6);
7364                     ret |= simplifyKnownVariablesSimplify(&tok2, tok3, varid, emptyString, value, valueVarId, valueIsPointer, valueToken, indentlevel);
7365     
7366                     // there could be a hang here if tok2 was moved back by the function call above for some reason
7367                     if (Settings::terminated())
7368                         return false;
7369                 }
7370             }
7371     
7372             if (tok2)
7373                 tok = tok2->previous();
7374         }
7375     
7376         return ret;
7377     }
7378     
7379     bool Tokenizer::simplifyKnownVariablesGetData(nonneg int varid, Token **_tok2, Token **_tok3, std::string &value, nonneg int &valueVarId, bool &valueIsPointer, bool floatvar)
7380     {
7381         Token *tok2 = *_tok2;
7382         Token *tok3 = nullptr;
7383     
7384         if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2->tokAt(-2), "for (")) {
7385             // only specific for loops is handled
7386             if (!Token::Match(tok2, "%varid% = %num% ; %varid% <|<= %num% ; ++| %varid% ++| ) {", varid))
7387                 return false;
7388     
7389             // is there a "break" in the for loop?
7390             bool hasbreak = false;
7391             const Token* end4 = tok2->linkAt(-1)->linkAt(1);
7392             for (const Token *tok4 = tok2->previous()->link(); tok4 != end4; tok4 = tok4->next()) {
7393                 if (tok4->str() == "break") {
7394                     hasbreak = true;
7395                     break;
7396                 }
7397             }
7398             if (hasbreak)
7399                 return false;
7400     
7401             // no break => the value of the counter value is known after the for loop..
7402             const Token* compareTok = tok2->tokAt(5);
7403             if (compareTok->str() == "<") {
7404                 value = compareTok->next()->str();
7405                 valueVarId = compareTok->next()->varId();
7406             } else
7407                 value = MathLib::toString(MathLib::toLongNumber(compareTok->next()->str()) + 1);
7408     
7409             // Skip for-body..
7410             tok3 = tok2->previous()->link()->next()->link()->next();
7411         } else {
7412             value = tok2->strAt(2);
7413             valueVarId = tok2->tokAt(2)->varId();
7414             if (tok2->strAt(1) == "[") {
7415                 value = tok2->next()->link()->strAt(2);
7416                 valueVarId = 0;
7417             } else if (value == "&") {
7418                 value = tok2->strAt(3);
7419                 valueVarId = tok2->tokAt(3)->varId();
7420     
7421                 // *ptr = &var; *ptr = 5;
7422                 // equals
7423                 // var = 5; not *var = 5;
7424                 if (tok2->strAt(4) == ";")
7425                     valueIsPointer = true;
7426             }
7427     
7428             // Add a '.0' to a decimal value and therefore convert it to an floating point number.
7429             else if (MathLib::isDec(tok2->strAt(2)) && floatvar) {
7430                 value += ".0";
7431             }
7432     
7433             // float variable: convert true/false to 1.0 / 0.0
7434             else if (tok2->tokAt(2)->isBoolean() && floatvar) {
7435                 value = (value == "true") ? "1.0" : "0.0";
7436             }
7437     
7438             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2->next(), "= &"))
7439                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(3);
7440     
7441             tok3 = tok2->next();
7442         }
7443         *_tok2 = tok2;
7444         *_tok3 = tok3;
7445         return true;
7446     }
7447     
7448     bool Tokenizer::simplifyKnownVariablesSimplify(Token **tok2, Token *tok3, nonneg int varid, const std::string &structname, std::string &value, nonneg int valueVarId, bool valueIsPointer, const Token * const valueToken, int indentlevel) const
7449     {
7450         const bool pointeralias(valueToken->isName() || Token::Match(valueToken, "& %name% ["));
7451         const bool varIsGlobal = (indentlevel == 0);
7452         const bool printDebug = mSettings->debugwarnings;
7453     
7454         if (mErrorLogger && !list.getFiles().empty())
7455             mErrorLogger->reportProgress(list.getFiles()[0], "Tokenize (simplifyKnownVariables)", tok3->progressValue());
7456     
7457         if (isMaxTime())
7458             return false;
7459     
7460         bool ret = false;
7461     
7462         Token* bailOutFromLoop = nullptr;
7463         int indentlevel3 = indentlevel;
7464         bool ret3 = false;
7465         for (; tok3; tok3 = tok3->next()) {
7466             if (tok3->str() == "{") {
7467                 ++indentlevel3;
7468             } else if (tok3->str() == "}") {
7469                 --indentlevel3;
7470                 if (indentlevel3 < indentlevel) {
7471                     if (Token::Match((*tok2)->tokAt(-7), "%type% * %name% ; %name% = & %name% ;") &&
7472                         (*tok2)->strAt(-5) == (*tok2)->strAt(-3)) {
7473                         (*tok2) = (*tok2)->tokAt(-4);
7474                         Token::eraseTokens((*tok2), (*tok2)->tokAt(6));
7475                     }
7476                     break;
7477                 }
7478             }
7479     
7480             // Stop if there is a pointer alias and a shadow variable is
7481             // declared in an inner scope (#3058)
7482             if (valueIsPointer && tok3->varId() > 0 &&
7483                 tok3->previous() && (tok3->previous()->isName() || tok3->previous()->str() == "*") &&
7484                 valueToken->str() == "&" &&
7485                 valueToken->next() &&
7486                 valueToken->next()->isName() &&
7487                 tok3->str() == valueToken->next()->str() &&
7488                 tok3->varId() > valueToken->next()->varId()) {
7489                 // more checking if this is a variable declaration
7490                 bool decl = true;
7491                 for (const Token *tok4 = tok3->previous(); tok4; tok4 = tok4->previous()) {
7492                     if (Token::Match(tok4, "[;{}]"))
7493                         break;
7494     
7495                     else if (tok4->isName()) {
7496                         if (tok4->varId() > 0) {
7497                             decl = false;
7498                             break;
7499                         }
7500                     }
7501     
7502                     else if (!Token::Match(tok4, "[&*]")) {
7503                         decl = false;
7504                         break;
7505                     }
7506                 }
7507                 if (decl)
7508                     break;
7509             }
7510     
7511             // Stop if label is found
7512             if (Token::Match(tok3, "; %type% : ;"))
7513                 break;
7514     
7515             // Stop if break/continue is found ..
7516             if (Token::Match(tok3, "break|continue"))
7517                 break;
7518             if ((indentlevel3 > 1 || !Token::simpleMatch(Token::findsimplematch(tok3,";"), "; }")) && tok3->str() == "return")
7519                 ret3 = true;
7520             if (ret3 && tok3->str() == ";")
7521                 break;
7522     
7523             if (pointeralias && Token::Match(tok3, ("!!= " + value).c_str()))
7524                 break;
7525     
7526             // Stop if a loop is found
7527             if (pointeralias && Token::Match(tok3, "do|for|while"))
7528                 break;
7529     
7530             // Stop if unknown function call is seen and the variable is global: it might be
7531             // changed by the function call
7532             if (varIsGlobal && tok3->str() == ")" && tok3->link() &&
7533                 Token::Match(tok3->link()->tokAt(-2), "[;{}] %name% (") &&
7534                 !Token::Match(tok3->link()->previous(), "if|for|while|switch|BOOST_FOREACH"))
7535                 break;
7536     
7537             // Stop if something like 'while (--var)' is found
7538             if (Token::Match(tok3, "for|while|do")) {
7539                 const Token *endpar = tok3->next()->link();
7540                 if (Token::simpleMatch(endpar, ") {"))
7541                     endpar = endpar->next()->link();
7542                 bool bailout = false;
7543                 for (const Token *tok4 = tok3; tok4 && tok4 != endpar; tok4 = tok4->next()) {
7544                     if (Token::Match(tok4, "++|-- %varid%", varid) ||
7545                         Token::Match(tok4, "%varid% ++|--|=", varid)) {
7546                         bailout = true;
7547                         break;
7548                     }
7549                 }
7550                 if (bailout)
7551                     break;
7552             }
7553     
7554             if (bailOutFromLoop) {
7555                 // This could be a loop, skip it, but only if it doesn't contain
7556                 // the variable we are checking for. If it contains the variable
7557                 // we will bail out.
7558                 if (tok3->varId() == varid) {
7559                     // Continue
7560                     //tok2 = bailOutFromLoop;
7561                     break;
7562                 } else if (tok3 == bailOutFromLoop) {
7563                     // We have skipped the loop
7564                     bailOutFromLoop = nullptr;
7565                     continue;
7566                 }
7567     
7568                 continue;
7569             } else if (tok3->str() == "{" && tok3->previous()->str() == ")") {
7570                 // There is a possible loop after the assignment. Try to skip it.
7571                 if (tok3->previous()->link() &&
7572                     tok3->previous()->link()->strAt(-1) != "if")
7573                     bailOutFromLoop = tok3->link();
7574                 continue;
7575             }
7576     
7577             // Variable used in realloc (see Ticket #1649)
7578             if (Token::Match(tok3, "%name% = realloc ( %name% ,") &&
7579                 tok3->varId() == varid &&
7580                 tok3->tokAt(4)->varId() == varid) {
7581                 tok3->tokAt(4)->str(value);
7582                 ret = true;
7583             }
7584     
7585             // condition "(|&&|%OROR% %varid% )|&&|%OROR%|;
7586             if (!Token::Match(tok3->previous(), "( %name% )") &&
7587                 Token::Match(tok3->previous(), "&&|(|%oror% %varid% &&|%oror%|)|;", varid)) {
7588                 tok3->str(value);
7589                 tok3->varId(valueVarId);
7590                 ret = true;
7591             }
7592     
7593             // parameter in function call..
7594             if (tok3->varId() == varid && Token::Match(tok3->previous(), "[(,] %name% [,)]")) {
7595                 // If the parameter is passed by value then simplify it
7596                 if (isFunctionParameterPassedByValue(tok3)) {
7597                     tok3->str(value);
7598                     tok3->varId(valueVarId);
7599                     ret = true;
7600                 }
7601             }
7602     
7603             // Variable is used somehow in a non-defined pattern => bail out
7604             if (tok3->varId() == varid) {
7605                 // This is a really generic bailout so let's try to avoid this.
7606                 // There might be lots of false negatives.
7607                 if (printDebug) {
7608                     // FIXME: Fix all the debug warnings for values and then
7609                     // remove this bailout
7610                     if (pointeralias)
7611                         break;
7612     
7613                     // suppress debug-warning when calling member function
7614                     if (Token::Match(tok3->next(), ". %name% ("))
7615                         break;
7616     
7617                     // suppress debug-warning when assignment
7618                     if (tok3->strAt(1) == "=")
7619                         break;
7620     
7621                     // taking address of variable..
7622                     if (Token::Match(tok3->tokAt(-2), "return|= & %name% ;"))
7623                         break;
7624     
7625                     // parameter in function call..
7626                     if (Token::Match(tok3->tokAt(-2), "%name% ( %name% ,|)") ||
7627                         Token::Match(tok3->previous(), ", %name% ,|)"))
7628                         break;
7629     
7630                     // conditional increment
7631                     if (Token::Match(tok3->tokAt(-3), ") { ++|--") ||
7632                         Token::Match(tok3->tokAt(-2), ") { %name% ++|--"))
7633                         break;
7634     
7635                     reportError(tok3, Severity::debug, "debug",
7636                                 "simplifyKnownVariables: bailing out (variable="+tok3->str()+", value="+value+")");
7637                 }
7638     
7639                 break;
7640             }
7641     
7642             // Using the variable in condition..
7643             if (Token::Match(tok3->previous(), ("if ( " + structname + " %varid% %cop%|)").c_str(), varid) ||
7644                 Token::Match(tok3, ("( " + structname + " %varid% %comp%").c_str(), varid) ||
7645                 Token::Match(tok3, ("%comp%|!|= " + structname + " %varid% %cop%|)|;").c_str(), varid) ||
7646                 Token::Match(tok3->previous(), "strlen|free ( %varid% )", varid)) {
7647                 if (value[0] == '\"' && tok3->previous()->str() != "strlen") {
7648                     // bail out if value is a string unless if it's just given
7649                     // as parameter to strlen
7650                     break;
7651                 }
7652                 if (!structname.empty()) {
7653                     tok3->deleteNext(2);
7654                 }
7655                 if (Token::Match(valueToken, "& %name% ;")) {
7656                     tok3->insertToken("&");
7657                     tok3 = tok3->next();
7658                 }
7659                 tok3 = tok3->next();
7660                 tok3->str(value);
7661                 tok3->varId(valueVarId);
7662                 ret = true;
7663             }
7664     
7665             // pointer alias used in condition..
7666             if (Token::Match(valueToken,"& %name% ;") && Token::Match(tok3, ("( * " + structname + " %varid% %cop%").c_str(), varid)) {
7667                 tok3->deleteNext();
7668                 if (!structname.empty())
7669                     tok3->deleteNext(2);
7670                 tok3 = tok3->next();
7671                 tok3->str(value);
7672                 tok3->varId(valueVarId);
7673                 ret = true;
7674             }
7675     
7676             // Delete pointer alias
7677             if (isCPP() && pointeralias && (tok3->str() == "delete") && tok3->next() &&
7678                 (Token::Match(tok3->next(), "%varid% ;", varid) ||
7679                  Token::Match(tok3->next(), "[ ] %varid%", varid))) {
7680                 tok3 = (tok3->next()->str() == "[") ? tok3->tokAt(3) : tok3->next();
7681                 tok3->str(value);
7682                 tok3->varId(valueVarId);
7683                 ret = true;
7684             }
7685     
7686             // Variable is used in function call..
7687             if (Token::Match(tok3, ("%name% ( " + structname + " %varid% ,").c_str(), varid)) {
7688                 static const char * const functionName[] = {
7689                     // always simplify
7690                     "strcmp", "strdup",
7691                     // don't simplify buffer value
7692                     "memcmp","memcpy","memmove","memset","strcpy","strncmp","strncpy"
7693                 };
7694                 for (int i = 0; i < (sizeof(functionName) / sizeof(*functionName)); ++i) {
7695                     if (valueVarId == 0U && i >= 2)
7696                         break;
7697                     if (tok3->str() == functionName[i]) {
7698                         Token *par1 = tok3->tokAt(2);
7699                         if (!structname.empty()) {
7700                             par1->deleteNext();
7701                             par1->deleteThis();
7702                         }
7703                         par1->str(value);
7704                         par1->varId(valueVarId);
7705                         break;
7706                     }
7707                 }
7708             }
7709     
7710             // Variable is used as 2nd parameter in function call..
7711             if (Token::Match(tok3, ("%name% ( %any% , " + structname + " %varid% ,|)").c_str(), varid)) {
7712                 static const char * const functionName[] = {
7713                     // always simplify
7714                     "strcmp","strcpy","strncmp","strncpy",
7715                     // don't simplify buffer value
7716                     "memcmp","memcpy","memmove"
7717                 };
7718                 for (int i = 0; i < (sizeof(functionName) / sizeof(*functionName)); ++i) {
7719                     if (valueVarId == 0U && i >= 4)
7720                         break;
7721                     if (tok3->str() == functionName[i]) {
7722                         Token *par = tok3->tokAt(4);
7723                         if (!structname.empty()) {
7724                             par->deleteNext();
7725                             par->deleteThis();
7726                         }
7727                         par->str(value);
7728                         par->varId(valueVarId);
7729                         break;
7730                     }
7731                 }
7732             }
7733     
7734             // array usage
7735             if (value[0] != '\"' && Token::Match(tok3, ("[(,] " + structname + " %varid% [|%cop%").c_str(), varid)) {
7736                 if (!structname.empty()) {
7737                     tok3->deleteNext(2);
7738                 }
7739                 tok3 = tok3->next();
7740                 tok3->str(value);
7741                 tok3->varId(valueVarId);
7742                 ret = true;
7743             }
7744     
7745             // The >> operator is sometimes used to assign a variable in C++
7746             if (isCPP() && Token::Match(tok3, (">> " + structname + " %varid%").c_str(), varid)) {
7747                 // bailout for such code:   ; std :: cin >> i ;
7748                 const Token *prev = tok3->previous();
7749                 while (prev && prev->str() != "return" && Token::Match(prev, "%name%|::|*"))
7750                     prev = prev->previous();
7751                 if (Token::Match(prev, ";|{|}|>>"))
7752                     break;
7753             }
7754     
7755             // Variable is used in calculation..
7756             if (((tok3->previous()->varId() > 0) && Token::Match(tok3, ("& " + structname + " %varid%").c_str(), varid)) ||
7757                 (Token::Match(tok3, ("[=+-*/%^|[] " + structname + " %varid% [=?+-*/%^|;])]").c_str(), varid) && !Token::Match(tok3, ("= " + structname + " %name% =").c_str())) ||
7758                 Token::Match(tok3, ("[(=+-*/%^|[] " + structname + " %varid% <<|>>").c_str(), varid) ||
7759                 Token::Match(tok3, ("<<|>> " + structname + " %varid% %cop%|;|]|)").c_str(), varid) ||
7760                 Token::Match(tok3->previous(), ("[=+-*/%^|[] ( " + structname + " %varid% !!=").c_str(), varid)) {
7761                 if (value[0] == '\"')
7762                     break;
7763                 if (!structname.empty()) {
7764                     tok3->deleteNext(2);
7765                     ret = true;
7766                 }
7767                 tok3 = tok3->next();
7768                 if (tok3->str() != value)
7769                     ret = true;
7770                 tok3->str(value);
7771                 tok3->varId(valueVarId);
7772                 if (tok3->previous()->str() == "*" && (valueIsPointer || Token::Match(valueToken, "& %name% ;"))) {
7773                     tok3 = tok3->previous();
7774                     tok3->deleteThis();
7775                     ret = true;
7776                 } else if (Token::Match(valueToken, "& %name% ;"))
7777                     tok3->insertToken("&", emptyString, true);
7778             }
7779     
7780             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok3, "= {")) {
7781                 const Token* const end4 = tok3->linkAt(1);
7782                 for (const Token *tok4 = tok3; tok4 != end4; tok4 = tok4->next()) {
7783                     if (Token::Match(tok4, "{|, %varid% ,|}", varid)) {
7784                         tok4->next()->str(value);
7785                         tok4->next()->varId(valueVarId);
7786                         ret = true;
7787                     }
7788                 }
7789             }
7790     
7791             // Using the variable in for-condition..
7792             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok3, "for (")) {
7793                 for (Token *tok4 = tok3->tokAt(2); tok4; tok4 = tok4->next()) {
7794                     if (Token::Match(tok4, "(|)"))
7795                         break;
7796     
7797                     // Replace variable used in condition..
7798                     if (Token::Match(tok4, "; %name% <|<=|!= %name% ; ++| %name% ++| )")) {
7799                         const Token *inctok = tok4->tokAt(5);
7800                         if (inctok->str() == "++")
7801                             inctok = inctok->next();
7802                         if (inctok->varId() == varid)
7803                             break;
7804     
7805                         if (tok4->next()->varId() == varid) {
7806                             tok4->next()->str(value);
7807                             tok4->next()->varId(valueVarId);
7808                             ret = true;
7809                         }
7810                         if (tok4->tokAt(3)->varId() == varid) {
7811                             tok4->tokAt(3)->str(value);
7812                             tok4->tokAt(3)->varId(valueVarId);
7813                             ret = true;
7814                         }
7815                     }
7816                 }
7817             }
7818     
7819             if (indentlevel == indentlevel3 && Token::Match(tok3->next(), "%varid% ++|--", varid) && MathLib::isInt(value)) {
7820                 const std::string op(tok3->strAt(2));
7821                 if (Token::Match(tok3, "[{};] %any% %any% ;")) {
7822                     tok3->deleteNext(3);
7823                 } else {
7824                     tok3 = tok3->next();
7825                     tok3->str(value);
7826                     tok3->varId(valueVarId);
7827                     tok3->deleteNext();
7828                 }
7829                 value = MathLib::incdec(value, op);
7830                 if (!Token::simpleMatch((*tok2)->tokAt(-2), "for (")) {
7831                     (*tok2)->tokAt(2)->str(value);
7832                     (*tok2)->tokAt(2)->varId(valueVarId);
7833                 }
7834                 ret = true;
7835             }
7836     
7837             if (indentlevel == indentlevel3 && Token::Match(tok3->next(), "++|-- %varid%", varid) && MathLib::isInt(value) &&
7838                 !Token::Match(tok3->tokAt(3), "[.[]")) {
7839                 value = MathLib::incdec(value, tok3->next()->str());
7840                 (*tok2)->tokAt(2)->str(value);
7841                 (*tok2)->tokAt(2)->varId(valueVarId);
7842                 if (Token::Match(tok3, "[;{}] %any% %any% ;")) {
7843                     tok3->deleteNext(3);
7844                 } else {
7845                     tok3->deleteNext();
7846                     tok3->next()->str(value);
7847                     tok3->next()->varId(valueVarId);
7848                 }
7849                 tok3 = tok3->next();
7850                 ret = true;
7851             }
7852     
7853             // return variable..
7854             if (Token::Match(tok3, "return %varid% %any%", varid) &&
7855                 valueToken->str() != "&" &&
7856                 (tok3->tokAt(2)->isExtendedOp() || tok3->strAt(2) == ";") &&
7857                 value[0] != '\"') {
7858                 tok3->next()->str(value);
7859                 tok3->next()->varId(valueVarId);
7860             }
7861     
7862             else if (pointeralias && Token::Match(tok3, "return * %varid% ;", varid) && value[0] != '\"') {
7863                 tok3->deleteNext();
7864                 tok3->next()->str(value);
7865                 tok3->next()->varId(valueVarId);
7866             }
7867         }
7868         return ret;
7869     }
7870     
7871     
7872     void Tokenizer::elseif()
7873     {
7874         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
7875             if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok, "else if"))
7876                 continue;
7877     
7878             for (Token *tok2 = tok; tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
7879                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "(|{|["))
7880                     tok2 = tok2->link();
7881     
7882                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "}|;")) {
7883                     if (tok2->next() && tok2->next()->str() != "else") {
7884                         tok->insertToken("{");
7885                         tok2->insertToken("}");
7886                         Token::createMutualLinks(tok->next(), tok2->next());
7887                         break;
7888                     }
7889                 }
7890             }
7891         }
7892     }
7893     
7894     
7895     bool Tokenizer::simplifyRedundantParentheses()
7896     {
7897         bool ret = false;
7898         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
7899             if (tok->str() != "(")
7900                 continue;
7901     
7902             if (isCPP() && Token::simpleMatch(tok->previous(), "} (") &&
7903                 Token::Match(tok->previous()->link()->previous(), "%name%|> {"))
7904                 continue;
7905     
7906             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "( {"))
7907                 continue;
7908     
7909             if (Token::Match(tok->link(), ") %num%")) {
7910                 tok = tok->link();
7911                 continue;
7912             }
7913     
7914             // !!operator = ( x ) ;
7915             if (tok->strAt(-2) != "operator" &&
7916                 tok->previous() && tok->previous()->str() == "=" &&
7917                 tok->next() && tok->next()->str() != "{" &&
7918                 Token::simpleMatch(tok->link(), ") ;")) {
7919                 tok->link()->deleteThis();
7920                 tok->deleteThis();
7921                 continue;
7922             }
7923     
7924             while (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "( (") &&
7925                    tok->link() && tok->link()->previous() == tok->next()->link()) {
7926                 // We have "(( *something* ))", remove the inner
7927                 // parentheses
7928                 tok->deleteNext();
7929                 tok->link()->tokAt(-2)->deleteNext();
7930                 ret = true;
7931             }
7932     
7933             if (isCPP() && Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "[;{}=(] new (") && Token::Match(tok->link(), ") [;,{}[]")) {
7934                 // Remove the parentheses in "new (type)" constructs
7935                 tok->link()->deleteThis();
7936                 tok->deleteThis();
7937                 ret = true;
7938             }
7939     
7940             if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "! ( %name% )")) {
7941                 // Remove the parentheses
7942                 tok->deleteThis();
7943                 tok->deleteNext();
7944                 ret = true;
7945             }
7946     
7947             if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[(,;{}] ( %name% ) .")) {
7948                 // Remove the parentheses
7949                 tok->deleteThis();
7950                 tok->deleteNext();
7951                 ret = true;
7952             }
7953     
7954             if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[(,;{}] ( %name% (") &&
7955                 tok->link()->previous() == tok->linkAt(2)) {
7956                 // We have "( func ( *something* ))", remove the outer
7957                 // parentheses
7958                 tok->link()->deleteThis();
7959                 tok->deleteThis();
7960                 ret = true;
7961             }
7962     
7963             if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[,;{}] ( delete [| ]| %name% ) ;")) {
7964                 // We have "( delete [| ]| var )", remove the outer
7965                 // parentheses
7966                 tok->link()->deleteThis();
7967                 tok->deleteThis();
7968                 ret = true;
7969             }
7970     
7971             if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-2), "operator delete") &&
7972                 Token::Match(tok->previous(), "delete|; (") &&
7973                 (tok->previous()->str() != "delete" || tok->next()->varId() > 0) &&
7974                 Token::Match(tok->link(), ") ;|,")) {
7975                 tok->link()->deleteThis();
7976                 tok->deleteThis();
7977                 ret = true;
7978             }
7979     
7980             if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[(!*;{}] ( %name% )") &&
7981                 (tok->next()->varId() != 0 || Token::Match(tok->tokAt(3), "[+-/=]")) && !tok->next()->isStandardType()) {
7982                 // We have "( var )", remove the parentheses
7983                 tok->deleteThis();
7984                 tok->deleteNext();
7985                 ret = true;
7986             }
7987     
7988             while (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[;{}[(,!*] ( %name% .")) {
7989                 Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(2);
7990                 while (Token::Match(tok2, ". %name%")) {
7991                     tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
7992                 }
7993                 if (tok2 != tok->link())
7994                     break;
7995                 // We have "( var . var . ... . var )", remove the parentheses
7996                 tok = tok->previous();
7997                 tok->deleteNext();
7998                 tok2->deleteThis();
7999                 ret = true;
8000             }
8001     
8002             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->previous(), "? (") && Token::simpleMatch(tok->link(), ") :")) {
8003                 const Token *tok2 = tok->next();
8004                 while (tok2 && (Token::Match(tok2,"%bool%|%num%|%name%") || tok2->isArithmeticalOp()))
8005                     tok2 = tok2->next();
8006                 if (tok2 && tok2->str() == ")") {
8007                     tok->link()->deleteThis();
8008                     tok->deleteThis();
8009                     ret = true;
8010                     continue;
8011                 }
8012             }
8013     
8014             while (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[{([,] ( !!{") &&
8015                    Token::Match(tok->link(), ") [;,])]") &&
8016                    !Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-2), "operator ,") && // Ticket #5709
8017                    !Token::findsimplematch(tok, ",", tok->link())) {
8018                 // We have "( ... )", remove the parentheses
8019                 tok->link()->deleteThis();
8020                 tok->deleteThis();
8021                 ret = true;
8022             }
8023     
8024             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->previous(), ", (") &&
8025                 Token::simpleMatch(tok->link(), ") =")) {
8026                 tok->link()->deleteThis();
8027                 tok->deleteThis();
8028                 ret = true;
8029             }
8030     
8031             // Simplify "!!operator !!%name%|)|>|>> ( %num%|%bool% ) %op%|;|,|)"
8032             if (Token::Match(tok, "( %bool%|%num% ) %cop%|;|,|)") &&
8033                 tok->strAt(-2) != "operator" &&
8034                 tok->previous() &&
8035                 !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%name%|)") &&
8036                 (!(isCPP() && Token::Match(tok->previous(),">|>>")))) {
8037                 tok->link()->deleteThis();
8038                 tok->deleteThis();
8039                 ret = true;
8040             }
8041     
8042             if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "*|& ( %name% )")) {
8043                 // We may have a variable declaration looking like "type_name *(var_name)"
8044                 Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(-2);
8045                 while (Token::Match(tok2, "%type%|static|const|extern") && tok2->str() != "operator") {
8046                     tok2 = tok2->previous();
8047                 }
8048                 if (tok2 && !Token::Match(tok2, "[;,{]")) {
8049                     // Not a variable declaration
8050                 } else {
8051                     tok->deleteThis();
8052                     tok->deleteNext();
8053                 }
8054             }
8055         }
8056         return ret;
8057     }
8058     
8059     void Tokenizer::simplifyTypeIntrinsics()
8060     {
8061         static const std::unordered_map<std::string, std::string> intrinsics = {
8062             { "__has_nothrow_assign", "has_nothrow_assign" },
8063             { "__has_nothrow_constructor", "has_nothrow_constructor" },
8064             { "__has_nothrow_copy", "has_nothrow_copy" },
8065             { "__has_trivial_assign", "has_trivial_assign" },
8066             { "__has_trivial_constructor", "has_trivial_constructor" },
8067             { "__has_trivial_copy", "has_trivial_copy" },
8068             { "__has_trivial_destructor", "has_trivial_destructor" },
8069             { "__has_virtual_destructor", "has_virtual_destructor" },
8070             { "__is_abstract", "is_abstract" },
8071             { "__is_aggregate", "is_aggregate" },
8072             { "__is_assignable", "is_assignable" },
8073             { "__is_base_of", "is_base_of" },
8074             { "__is_class", "is_class" },
8075             { "__is_constructible", "is_constructible" },
8076             { "__is_convertible_to", "is_convertible_to" },
8077             { "__is_destructible", "is_destructible" },
8078             { "__is_empty", "is_empty" },
8079             { "__is_enum", "is_enum" },
8080             { "__is_final", "is_final" },
8081             { "__is_nothrow_assignable", "is_nothrow_assignable" },
8082             { "__is_nothrow_constructible", "is_nothrow_constructible" },
8083             { "__is_nothrow_destructible", "is_nothrow_destructible" },
8084             { "__is_pod", "is_pod" },
8085             { "__is_polymorphic", "is_polymorphic" },
8086             { "__is_trivially_assignable", "is_trivially_assignable" },
8087             { "__is_trivially_constructible", "is_trivially_constructible" },
8088             { "__is_union", "is_union" },
8089         };
8090         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8091             if (!Token::Match(tok, "%name% ("))
8092                 continue;
8093             auto p = intrinsics.find(tok->str());
8094             if (p == intrinsics.end())
8095                 continue;
8096             Token * end = tok->next()->link();
8097             Token * prev = tok->previous();
8098             tok->str(p->second);
8099             prev->insertToken("::");
8100             prev->insertToken("std");
8101             tok->next()->str("<");
8102             end->str(">");
8103             end->insertToken("}");
8104             end->insertToken("{");
8105             Token::createMutualLinks(end->tokAt(1), end->tokAt(2));
8106         }
8107     }
8108     
8109     void Tokenizer::simplifyCharAt()
8110     {
8111         // Replace "string"[0] with 's'
8112         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8113             if (Token::Match(tok, "%str% [ %num% ]")) {
8114                 const MathLib::bigint index = MathLib::toLongNumber(tok->strAt(2));
8115                 // Check within range
8116                 if (index >= 0 && index <= Token::getStrLength(tok)) {
8117                     tok->str("'" + Token::getCharAt(tok, index) + "'");
8118                     tok->deleteNext(3);
8119                 }
8120             }
8121         }
8122     }
8123     
8124     void Tokenizer::simplifyReference()
8125     {
8126         if (isC())
8127             return;
8128     
8129         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8130             // starting executable scope..
8131             Token *start = const_cast<Token *>(startOfExecutableScope(tok));
8132             if (start) {
8133                 tok = start;
8134                 // replace references in this scope..
8135                 Token * const end = tok->link();
8136                 for (Token *tok2 = tok; tok2 && tok2 != end; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
8137                     // found a reference..
8138                     if (Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}] %type% & %name% (|= %name% )| ;")) {
8139                         const int refId = tok2->tokAt(3)->varId();
8140                         if (!refId)
8141                             continue;
8142     
8143                         // replace reference in the code..
8144                         for (Token *tok3 = tok2->tokAt(7); tok3 && tok3 != end; tok3 = tok3->next()) {
8145                             if (tok3->varId() == refId) {
8146                                 tok3->str(tok2->strAt(5));
8147                                 tok3->varId(tok2->tokAt(5)->varId());
8148                             }
8149                         }
8150     
8151                         tok2->deleteNext(6+(tok2->strAt(6)==")" ? 1 : 0));
8152                     }
8153                 }
8154                 tok = end;
8155             }
8156         }
8157     }
8158     
8159     bool Tokenizer::simplifyCalculations()
8160     {
8161         return mTemplateSimplifier->simplifyCalculations(nullptr, nullptr, false);
8162     }
8163     
8164     void Tokenizer::simplifyOffsetPointerDereference()
8165     {
8166         // Replace "*(str + num)" => "str[num]" and
8167         // Replace "*(str - num)" => "str[-num]"
8168         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8169             if (!tok->isName() && !tok->isLiteral()
8170                 && !Token::Match(tok, "]|)|++|--")
8171                 && Token::Match(tok->next(), "* ( %name% +|- %num%|%name% )")) {
8172     
8173                 // remove '* ('
8174                 tok->deleteNext(2);
8175     
8176                 // '+'->'['
8177                 tok = tok->tokAt(2);
8178                 Token* const openBraceTok = tok;
8179                 const bool isNegativeIndex = (tok->str() == "-");
8180                 tok->str("[");
8181     
8182                 // Insert a "-" in front of the number or variable
8183                 if (isNegativeIndex) {
8184                     if (tok->next()->isName()) {
8185                         tok->insertToken("-");
8186                         tok = tok->next();
8187                     } else
8188                         tok->next()->str(std::string("-") + tok->next()->str());
8189                 }
8190     
8191                 tok = tok->tokAt(2);
8192                 tok->str("]");
8193                 Token::createMutualLinks(openBraceTok, tok);
8194             }
8195         }
8196     }
8197     
8198     void Tokenizer::simplifyOffsetPointerReference()
8199     {
8200         std::set<int> pod;
8201         for (const Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8202             if (tok->isStandardType()) {
8203                 tok = tok->next();
8204                 while (tok && (tok->str() == "*" || tok->isName())) {
8205                     if (tok->varId() > 0) {
8206                         pod.insert(tok->varId());
8207                         break;
8208                     }
8209                     tok = tok->next();
8210                 }
8211                 if (!tok)
8212                     break;
8213             }
8214         }
8215     
8216         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8217             if (!Token::Match(tok, "%num%|%name%|]|)") &&
8218                 (Token::Match(tok->next(), "& %name% [ %num%|%name% ] !!["))) {
8219                 tok = tok->next();
8220     
8221                 if (tok->next()->varId()) {
8222                     if (pod.find(tok->next()->varId()) == pod.end()) {
8223                         tok = tok->tokAt(5);
8224                         if (!tok)
8225                             syntaxError(tok);
8226                         continue;
8227                     }
8228                 }
8229     
8230                 // '&' => '('
8231                 tok->str("(");
8232     
8233                 tok = tok->next();
8234                 // '[' => '+'
8235                 tok->deleteNext();
8236                 tok->insertToken("+");
8237     
8238                 tok = tok->tokAt(3);
8239                 //remove ']'
8240                 tok->str(")");
8241                 Token::createMutualLinks(tok->tokAt(-4), tok);
8242             }
8243         }
8244     }
8245     
8246     void Tokenizer::simplifyNestedStrcat()
8247     {
8248         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8249             if (! Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] strcat ( strcat (")) {
8250                 continue;
8251             }
8252     
8253             // find inner strcat call
8254             Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(3);
8255             while (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "strcat ( strcat"))
8256                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
8257     
8258             if (tok2->strAt(3) != ",")
8259                 continue;
8260     
8261             // If we have this code:
8262             //   strcat(strcat(dst, foo), bar);
8263             // We move this part of code before all strcat() calls: strcat(dst, foo)
8264             // And place "dst" token where the code was.
8265             Token *prevTok = tok2->previous();
8266     
8267             // Move tokens to new place
8268             Token::move(tok2, tok2->next()->link(), tok);
8269             tok = tok2->next()->link();
8270     
8271             // Insert the "dst" token
8272             prevTok->insertToken(tok2->strAt(2));
8273             prevTok->next()->varId(tok2->tokAt(2)->varId());
8274     
8275             // Insert semicolon after the moved strcat()
8276             tok->insertToken(";");
8277         }
8278     }
8279     
8280     // Check if this statement is a duplicate definition.  A duplicate
8281     // definition will hide the enumerator within it's scope so just
8282     // skip the entire scope of the duplicate.
8283     bool Tokenizer::duplicateDefinition(Token ** tokPtr)
8284     {
8285         // check for an end of definition
8286         const Token * tok = *tokPtr;
8287         if (tok && Token::Match(tok->next(), ";|,|[|=|)|>")) {
8288             const Token * end = tok->next();
8289     
8290             if (end->str() == "[") {
8291                 end = end->link()->next();
8292             } else if (end->str() == ",") {
8293                 // check for function argument
8294                 if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "(|,"))
8295                     return false;
8296     
8297                 // find end of definition
8298                 int level = 0;
8299                 while (end->next() && (!Token::Match(end->next(), ";|)|>") ||
8300                                        (end->next()->str() == ")" && level == 0))) {
8301                     if (end->next()->str() == "(")
8302                         ++level;
8303                     else if (end->next()->str() == ")")
8304                         --level;
8305     
8306                     end = end->next();
8307                 }
8308             } else if (end->str() == ")") {
8309                 // check for function argument
8310                 if (tok->previous()->str() == ",")
8311                     return false;
8312             }
8313     
8314             if (end) {
8315                 if (Token::simpleMatch(end, ") {")) { // function parameter ?
8316                     // make sure it's not a conditional
8317                     if (Token::Match(end->link()->previous(), "if|for|while|switch|BOOST_FOREACH") || Token::Match(end->link()->tokAt(-2), ":|,"))
8318                         return false;
8319     
8320                     // look backwards
8321                     if (tok->previous()->str() == "enum" ||
8322                         (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type%") &&
8323                          tok->previous()->str() != "return") ||
8324                         Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "%type% &|*")) {
8325                         // duplicate definition so skip entire function
8326                         *tokPtr = end->next()->link();
8327                         return true;
8328                     }
8329                 } else if (end->str() == ">") { // template parameter ?
8330                     // look backwards
8331                     if (tok->previous()->str() == "enum" ||
8332                         (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type%") &&
8333                          tok->previous()->str() != "return")) {
8334                         // duplicate definition so skip entire template
8335                         while (end && end->str() != "{")
8336                             end = end->next();
8337                         if (end) {
8338                             *tokPtr = end->link();
8339                             return true;
8340                         }
8341                     }
8342                 } else {
8343                     if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "enum|,"))
8344                         return true;
8345                     else if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type%")) {
8346                         // look backwards
8347                         const Token *back = tok;
8348                         while (back && back->isName())
8349                             back = back->previous();
8350                         if (!back || (Token::Match(back, "[(,;{}]") && !Token::Match(back->next(),"return|throw")))
8351                             return true;
8352                     }
8353                 }
8354             }
8355         }
8356         return false;
8357     }
8358     
8359     static const std::set<std::string> stdFunctionsPresentInC = {
8360         "strcat",
8361         "strcpy",
8362         "strncat",
8363         "strncpy",
8364         "free",
8365         "malloc",
8366         "strdup"
8367     };
8368     
8369     void Tokenizer::simplifyStd()
8370     {
8371         if (isC())
8372             return;
8373     
8374         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8375             if (tok->str() != "std")
8376                 continue;
8377     
8378             if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[(,{};] std :: %name% (") &&
8379                 stdFunctionsPresentInC.find(tok->strAt(2)) != stdFunctionsPresentInC.end()) {
8380                 tok->deleteNext();
8381                 tok->deleteThis();
8382             }
8383         }
8384     }
8385     
8386     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
8387     // Helper functions for handling the tokens list
8388     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
8389     
8390     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
8391     
8392     bool Tokenizer::IsScopeNoReturn(const Token *endScopeToken, bool *unknown) const
8393     {
8394         std::string unknownFunc;
8395         const bool ret = mSettings->library.isScopeNoReturn(endScopeToken,&unknownFunc);
8396         if (unknown)
8397             *unknown = !unknownFunc.empty();
8398         if (!unknownFunc.empty() && mSettings->checkLibrary && mSettings->isEnabled(Settings::INFORMATION)) {
8399             // Is function global?
8400             bool globalFunction = true;
8401             if (Token::simpleMatch(endScopeToken->tokAt(-2), ") ; }")) {
8402                 const Token * const ftok = endScopeToken->linkAt(-2)->previous();
8403                 if (ftok &&
8404                     ftok->isName() &&
8405                     ftok->function() &&
8406                     ftok->function()->nestedIn &&
8407                     ftok->function()->nestedIn->type != Scope::eGlobal) {
8408                     globalFunction = false;
8409                 }
8410             }
8411     
8412             // don't warn for nonglobal functions (class methods, functions hidden in namespaces) since they can't be configured yet
8413             // FIXME: when methods and namespaces can be configured properly, remove the "globalFunction" check
8414             if (globalFunction) {
8415                 reportError(endScopeToken->previous(),
8416                             Severity::information,
8417                             "checkLibraryNoReturn",
8418                             "--check-library: Function " + unknownFunc + "() should have <noreturn> configuration");
8419             }
8420         }
8421         return ret;
8422     }
8423     
8424     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
8425     
8426     bool Tokenizer::isFunctionParameterPassedByValue(const Token *fpar) const
8427     {
8428         // TODO: If symbol database is available, use it.
8429         const Token *ftok;
8430     
8431         // Look at function call, what parameter number is it?
8432         int parameter = 1;
8433         for (ftok = fpar->previous(); ftok; ftok = ftok->previous()) {
8434             if (ftok->str() == "(")
8435                 break;
8436             else if (ftok->str() == ")")
8437                 ftok = ftok->link();
8438             else if (ftok->str() == ",")
8439                 ++parameter;
8440             else if (Token::Match(ftok, "[;{}]"))
8441                 break;
8442         }
8443     
8444         // Is this a function call?
8445         if (ftok && Token::Match(ftok->tokAt(-2), "[;{}=] %name% (")) {
8446             const std::string& functionName(ftok->previous()->str());
8447     
8448             if (functionName == "return")
8449                 return true;
8450     
8451             // Locate function declaration..
8452             for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8453                 if (tok->str() == "{")
8454                     tok = tok->link();
8455                 else if (Token::Match(tok, "%type% (") && tok->str() == functionName) {
8456                     // Goto parameter
8457                     tok = tok->tokAt(2);
8458                     int par = 1;
8459                     while (tok && par < parameter) {
8460                         if (tok->str() == ")")
8461                             break;
8462                         if (tok->str() == ",")
8463                             ++par;
8464                         tok = tok->next();
8465                     }
8466                     if (!tok)
8467                         return false;
8468     
8469                     // If parameter was found, determine if it's passed by value
8470                     if (par == parameter) {
8471                         bool knowntype = false;
8472                         while (tok && tok->isName()) {
8473                             knowntype |= tok->isStandardType();
8474                             knowntype |= (tok->str() == "struct");
8475                             tok = tok->next();
8476                         }
8477                         if (!tok || !knowntype)
8478                             return false;
8479                         if (tok->str() != "," && tok->str() != ")")
8480                             return false;
8481                         return true;
8482                     }
8483                 }
8484             }
8485         }
8486         return false;
8487     }
8488     
8489     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
8490     
8491     void Tokenizer::eraseDeadCode(Token *begin, const Token *end)
8492     {
8493         if (!begin)
8494             return;
8495         const bool isgoto = Token::Match(begin->tokAt(-2), "goto %name% ;");
8496         int indentlevel = 1;
8497         int indentcase = 0;
8498         int indentswitch = 0;
8499         int indentlabel = 0;
8500         int roundbraces = 0;
8501         int indentcheck = 0;
8502         std::vector<int> switchindents;
8503         bool checklabel = false;
8504         Token *tok = begin;
8505         Token *tokcheck = nullptr;
8506         while (tok->next() && tok->next() != end) {
8507             if (tok->next()->str() == "(") {
8508                 ++roundbraces;
8509                 tok->deleteNext();
8510                 continue;
8511             } else if (tok->next()->str() == ")") {
8512                 if (!roundbraces)
8513                     break;  //too many ending round parentheses
8514                 --roundbraces;
8515                 tok->deleteNext();
8516                 continue;
8517             }
8518     
8519             if (roundbraces) {
8520                 tok->deleteNext();
8521                 continue;
8522             }
8523     
8524             if (Token::Match(tok, "[{};] switch (")) {
8525                 if (!checklabel) {
8526                     if (!indentlabel) {
8527                         //remove 'switch ( ... )'
8528                         Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->linkAt(2)->next());
8529                     } else {
8530                         tok = tok->linkAt(2);
8531                     }
8532                     if (tok->next()->str() == "{") {
8533                         ++indentswitch;
8534                         indentcase = indentlevel + 1;
8535                         switchindents.push_back(indentcase);
8536                     }
8537                 } else {
8538                     tok = tok->linkAt(2);
8539                     if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, ") {")) {
8540                         ++indentswitch;
8541                         indentcase = indentlevel + 1;
8542                         switchindents.push_back(indentcase);
8543                     }
8544                 }
8545             } else if (tok->next()->str() == "{") {
8546                 ++indentlevel;
8547                 if (!checklabel) {
8548                     checklabel = true;
8549                     tokcheck = tok;
8550                     indentcheck = indentlevel;
8551                     indentlabel = 0;
8552                 }
8553                 tok = tok->next();
8554             } else if (tok->next()->str() == "}") {
8555                 --indentlevel;
8556                 if (!indentlevel)
8557                     break;
8558     
8559                 if (!checklabel) {
8560                     tok->deleteNext();
8561                 } else {
8562                     if (indentswitch && indentlevel == indentcase)
8563                         --indentlevel;
8564                     if (indentlevel < indentcheck) {
8565                         const Token *end2 = tok->next();
8566                         tok = end2->link()->previous();  //return to initial '{'
8567                         if (indentswitch && Token::simpleMatch(tok, ") {") && Token::Match(tok->link()->tokAt(-2), "[{};] switch ("))
8568                             tok = tok->link()->tokAt(-2);       //remove also 'switch ( ... )'
8569                         Token::eraseTokens(tok, end2->next());
8570                         checklabel = false;
8571                         tokcheck = nullptr;
8572                         indentcheck = 0;
8573                     } else {
8574                         tok = tok->next();
8575                     }
8576                 }
8577                 if (indentswitch && indentlevel <= indentcase) {
8578                     --indentswitch;
8579                     switchindents.pop_back();
8580                     if (!indentswitch)
8581                         indentcase = 0;
8582                     else
8583                         indentcase = switchindents[indentswitch-1];
8584                 }
8585             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "[{};:] case")) {
8586                 const Token *tok2 = Token::findsimplematch(tok->next(), ": ;", end);
8587                 if (!tok2) {
8588                     tok->deleteNext();
8589                     continue;
8590                 }
8591                 if (indentlevel == 1)
8592                     break;      //it seems like the function was called inside a case-default block.
8593                 if (indentlevel == indentcase)
8594                     ++indentlevel;
8595                 tok2 = tok2->next();
8596                 if (!checklabel || !indentswitch) {
8597                     Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok2->next());
8598                 } else {
8599                     tok = const_cast<Token *>(tok2);
8600                 }
8601             }  else if (Token::Match(tok, "[{};] default : ;")) {
8602                 if (indentlevel == 1)
8603                     break;      //it seems like the function was called inside a case-default block.
8604                 if (indentlevel == indentcase)
8605                     ++indentlevel;
8606                 if (!checklabel || !indentswitch) {
8607                     tok->deleteNext(3);
8608                 } else {
8609                     tok = tok->tokAt(3);
8610                 }
8611             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "[{};] %name% : ;") && tok->next()->str() != "default") {
8612                 if (checklabel) {
8613                     indentlabel = indentlevel;
8614                     tok = tokcheck->next();
8615                     checklabel = false;
8616                     indentlevel = indentcheck;
8617                 } else {
8618                     if (indentswitch) {
8619                         //Before stopping the function, since the 'switch()'
8620                         //instruction is removed, there's no sense to keep the
8621                         //case instructions. Remove them, if there are any.
8622                         Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(3);
8623                         int indentlevel2 = indentlevel;
8624                         while (tok2->next() && tok2->next() != end) {
8625                             if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "{|[|(")) {
8626                                 tok2 = tok2->next()->link();
8627                             } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "[{};:] case")) {
8628                                 const Token *tok3 = Token::findsimplematch(tok2->next(), ": ;", end);
8629                                 if (!tok3) {
8630                                     tok2 = tok2->next();
8631                                     continue;
8632                                 }
8633                                 Token::eraseTokens(tok2, tok3->next());
8634                             } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "[{};] default : ;")) {
8635                                 tok2->deleteNext(3);
8636                             } else if (tok2->next()->str() == "}") {
8637                                 --indentlevel2;
8638                                 if (indentlevel2 <= indentcase)
8639                                     break;
8640                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
8641                             } else {
8642                                 tok2 = tok2->next();
8643                             }
8644                         }
8645                     }
8646                     break;  //stop removing tokens, we arrived to the label.
8647                 }
8648             } else if (isgoto && Token::Match(tok, "[{};] do|while|for|BOOST_FOREACH")) {
8649                 //it's possible that code inside loop is not dead,
8650                 //because of the possible presence of the label pointed by 'goto'
8651                 const Token *start = tok->tokAt(2);
8652                 if (start && start->str() == "(")
8653                     start = start->link()->next();
8654                 if (start && start->str() == "{") {
8655                     std::string labelpattern = "[{};] " + begin->previous()->str() + " : ;";
8656                     bool simplify = true;
8657                     for (Token *tok2 = start->next(); tok2 != start->link(); tok2 = tok2->next()) {
8658                         if (Token::Match(tok2, labelpattern.c_str())) {
8659                             simplify = false;
8660                             break;
8661                         }
8662                     }
8663                     //bailout for now
8664                     if (!simplify)
8665                         break;
8666                 }
8667                 tok->deleteNext();
8668             } else {
8669                 // no need to keep the other strings, remove them.
8670                 if (tok->strAt(1) == "while") {
8671                     if (tok->str() == "}" && tok->link()->strAt(-1) == "do")
8672                         tok->link()->previous()->deleteThis();
8673                 }
8674                 tok->deleteNext();
8675             }
8676         }
8677     }
8678     
8679     //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
8680     
8681     void Tokenizer::syntaxError(const Token *tok, const std::string &code) const
8682     {
8683         printDebugOutput(0);
8684         throw InternalError(tok, code.empty() ? "syntax error" : "syntax error: " + code, InternalError::SYNTAX);
8685     }
8686     
8687     void Tokenizer::unmatchedToken(const Token *tok) const
8688     {
8689         printDebugOutput(0);
8690         throw InternalError(tok,
8691                             "Unmatched '" + tok->str() + "'. Configuration: '" + mConfiguration + "'.",
8692                             InternalError::SYNTAX);
8693     }
8694     
8695     void Tokenizer::syntaxErrorC(const Token *tok, const std::string &what) const
8696     {
8697         printDebugOutput(0);
8698         throw InternalError(tok, "Code '"+what+"' is invalid C code. Use --std or --language to configure the language.", InternalError::SYNTAX);
8699     }
8700     
8701     void Tokenizer::unknownMacroError(const Token *tok1) const
8702     {
8703         printDebugOutput(0);
8704         throw InternalError(tok1, "There is an unknown macro here somewhere. Configuration is required. If " + tok1->str() + " is a macro then please configure it.", InternalError::UNKNOWN_MACRO);
8705     }
8706     
8707     void Tokenizer::unhandled_macro_class_x_y(const Token *tok) const
8708     {
8709         reportError(tok,
8710                     Severity::information,
8711                     "class_X_Y",
8712                     "The code '" +
8713                     tok->str() + " " +
