8714                     tok->strAt(1) + " " +
8715                     tok->strAt(2) + " " +
8716                     tok->strAt(3) + "' is not handled. You can use -I or --include to add handling of this code.");
8717     }
8718     
8719     void Tokenizer::macroWithSemicolonError(const Token *tok, const std::string &macroName) const
8720     {
8721         reportError(tok,
8722                     Severity::information,
8723                     "macroWithSemicolon",
8724                     "Ensure that '" + macroName + "' is defined either using -I, --include or -D.");
8725     }
8726     
8727     void Tokenizer::cppcheckError(const Token *tok) const
8728     {
8729         printDebugOutput(0);
8730         throw InternalError(tok, "Analysis failed. If the code is valid then please report this failure.", InternalError::INTERNAL);
8731     }
8732     /**
8733      * Helper function to check whether number is equal to integer constant X
8734      * or floating point pattern X.0
8735      * @param s the string to check
8736      * @param intConstant the integer constant to check against
8737      * @param floatConstant the string with stringified float constant to check against
8738      * @return true in case s is equal to X or X.0 and false otherwise.
8739      */
8740     static bool isNumberOneOf(const std::string &s, const MathLib::bigint& intConstant, const char* floatConstant)
8741     {
8742         if (MathLib::isInt(s)) {
8743             if (MathLib::toLongNumber(s) == intConstant)
8744                 return true;
8745         } else if (MathLib::isFloat(s)) {
8746             if (MathLib::toString(MathLib::toDoubleNumber(s)) == floatConstant)
8747                 return true;
8748         }
8749         return false;
8750     }
8751     
8752     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
8753     // Helper function to check whether number is zero (0 or 0.0 or 0E+0) or not?
8754     // @param s the string to check
8755     // @return true in case s is zero and false otherwise.
8756     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
8757     bool Tokenizer::isZeroNumber(const std::string &s)
8758     {
8759         return isNumberOneOf(s, 0L, "0.0");
8760     }
8761     
8762     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
8763     // Helper function to check whether number is one (1 or 0.1E+1 or 1E+0) or not?
8764     // @param s the string to check
8765     // @return true in case s is one and false otherwise.
8766     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
8767     bool Tokenizer::isOneNumber(const std::string &s)
8768     {
8769         if (!MathLib::isPositive(s))
8770             return false;
8771         return isNumberOneOf(s, 1L, "1.0");
8772     }
8773     
8774     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
8775     // Helper function to check whether number is two (2 or 0.2E+1 or 2E+0) or not?
8776     // @param s the string to check
8777     // @return true in case s is two and false otherwise.
8778     // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
8779     bool Tokenizer::isTwoNumber(const std::string &s)
8780     {
8781         if (!MathLib::isPositive(s))
8782             return false;
8783         return isNumberOneOf(s, 2L, "2.0");
8784     }
8785     
8786     // ------------------------------------------------------
8787     // Simplify math functions.
8788     // It simplifies the following functions: atol(), fmin(),
8789     // fminl(), fminf(), fmax(), fmaxl(), fmaxf(), pow(),
8790     // powf(), powl(), cbrt(), cbrtl(), cbtrf(), sqrt(),
8791     // sqrtf(), sqrtl(), exp(), expf(), expl(), exp2(),
8792     // exp2f(), exp2l(), log2(), log2f(), log2l(), log1p(),
8793     // log1pf(), log1pl(), log10(), log10l(), log10f(),
8794     // log(), logf(), logl(), logb(), logbf(), logbl(), acosh()
8795     // acoshf(), acoshl(), acos(), acosf(), acosl(), cosh()
8796     // coshf(), coshf(), cos(), cosf(), cosl(), erfc(),
8797     // erfcf(), erfcl(), ilogb(), ilogbf(), ilogbf(), erf(),
8798     // erfl(), erff(), asin(), asinf(), asinf(), asinh(),
8799     // asinhf(), asinhl(), tan(), tanf(), tanl(), tanh(),
8800     // tanhf(), tanhl(), atan(), atanf(), atanl(), atanh(),
8801     // atanhf(), atanhl(), expm1(), expm1l(), expm1f(), sin(),
8802     // sinf(), sinl(), sinh(), sinhf(), sinhl()
8803     // in the tokenlist.
8804     //
8805     // Reference:
8806     // - http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cmath/
8807     // ------------------------------------------------------
8808     void Tokenizer::simplifyMathFunctions()
8809     {
8810         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8811             if (tok->isName() && !tok->varId() && tok->strAt(1) == "(") { // precondition for function
8812                 bool simplifcationMade = false;
8813                 if (Token::Match(tok, "atol ( %str% )")) { //@todo Add support for atoll()
8814                     if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-2), "std ::")) {
8815                         tok = tok->tokAt(-2);// set token index two steps back
8816                         tok->deleteNext(2);  // delete "std ::"
8817                     }
8818                     const std::string& strNumber = tok->tokAt(2)->strValue(); // get number
8819                     const bool isNotAnInteger = (!MathLib::isInt(strNumber));// check: is not an integer
8820                     if (strNumber.empty() || isNotAnInteger) {
8821                         // Ignore strings which we can't convert
8822                         continue;
8823                     }
8824                     // Convert string into a number and insert into token list
8825                     tok->str(MathLib::toString(MathLib::toLongNumber(strNumber)));
8826                     // remove ( %num% )
8827                     tok->deleteNext(3);
8828                     simplifcationMade = true;
8829                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "sqrt|sqrtf|sqrtl|cbrt|cbrtf|cbrtl ( %num% )")) {
8830                     // Simplify: sqrt(0) = 0 and cbrt(0) == 0
8831                     //           sqrt(1) = 1 and cbrt(1) == 1
8832                     // get number string
8833                     const std::string& parameter(tok->strAt(2));
8834                     // is parameter 0 ?
8835                     if (isZeroNumber(parameter)) {
8836                         tok->deleteNext(3);  // delete tokens
8837                         tok->str("0"); // insert result into token list
8838                         simplifcationMade = true;
8839                     } else if (isOneNumber(parameter)) {
8840                         tok->deleteNext(3);  // delete tokens
8841                         tok->str("1"); // insert result into token list
8842                         simplifcationMade = true;
8843                     }
8844                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "exp|expf|expl|exp2|exp2f|exp2l|cos|cosf|cosl|cosh|coshf|coshl|erfc|erfcf|erfcl ( %num% )")) {
8845                     // Simplify: exp[f|l](0)  = 1 and exp2[f|l](0) = 1
8846                     //           cosh[f|l](0) = 1 and cos[f|l](0)  = 1
8847                     //           erfc[f|l](0) = 1
8848                     // get number string
8849                     const std::string& parameter(tok->strAt(2));
8850                     // is parameter 0 ?
8851                     if (isZeroNumber(parameter)) {
8852                         tok->deleteNext(3);  // delete tokens
8853                         tok->str("1"); // insert result into token list
8854                         simplifcationMade = true;
8855                     }
8856                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "log1p|log1pf|log1pl|sin|sinf|sinl|sinh|sinhf|sinhl|erf|erff|erfl|asin|asinf|asinl|asinh|asinhf|asinhl|tan|tanf|tanl|tanh|tanhf|tanhl|atan|atanf|atanl|atanh|atanhf|atanhl|expm1|expm1f|expm1l ( %num% )")) {
8857                     // Simplify: log1p[f|l](0) = 0 and sin[f|l](0)  = 0
8858                     //           sinh[f|l](0)  = 0 and erf[f|l](0)  = 0
8859                     //           asin[f|l](0)  = 0 and sinh[f|l](0) = 0
8860                     //           tan[f|l](0)   = 0 and tanh[f|l](0) = 0
8861                     //           atan[f|l](0)  = 0 and atanh[f|l](0)= 0
8862                     //           expm1[f|l](0) = 0
8863                     // get number string
8864                     const std::string& parameter(tok->strAt(2));
8865                     // is parameter 0 ?
8866                     if (isZeroNumber(parameter)) {
8867                         tok->deleteNext(3);  // delete tokens
8868                         tok->str("0"); // insert result into token list
8869                         simplifcationMade = true;
8870                     }
8871                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "log2|log2f|log2l|log|logf|logl|log10|log10f|log10l|logb|logbf|logbl|acosh|acoshf|acoshl|acos|acosf|acosl|ilogb|ilogbf|ilogbl ( %num% )")) {
8872                     // Simplify: log2[f|l](1)  = 0 , log10[f|l](1)  = 0
8873                     //           log[f|l](1)   = 0 , logb10[f|l](1) = 0
8874                     //           acosh[f|l](1) = 0 , acos[f|l](1)   = 0
8875                     //           ilogb[f|l](1) = 0
8876                     // get number string
8877                     const std::string& parameter(tok->strAt(2));
8878                     // is parameter 1 ?
8879                     if (isOneNumber(parameter)) {
8880                         tok->deleteNext(3);  // delete tokens
8881                         tok->str("0"); // insert result into token list
8882                         simplifcationMade = true;
8883                     }
8884                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "fmin|fminl|fminf ( %num% , %num% )")) {
8885                     // @todo if one of the parameters is NaN the other is returned
8886                     // e.g. printf ("fmin (NaN, -1.0) = %f\n", fmin(NaN,-1.0));
8887                     // e.g. printf ("fmin (-1.0, NaN) = %f\n", fmin(-1.0,NaN));
8888                     const std::string& strLeftNumber(tok->strAt(2));
8889                     const std::string& strRightNumber(tok->strAt(4));
8890                     const bool isLessEqual =  MathLib::isLessEqual(strLeftNumber, strRightNumber);
8891                     // case: left <= right ==> insert left
8892                     if (isLessEqual) {
8893                         tok->str(strLeftNumber); // insert e.g. -1.0
8894                         tok->deleteNext(5);      // delete e.g. fmin ( -1.0, 1.0 )
8895                         simplifcationMade = true;
8896                     } else { // case left > right ==> insert right
8897                         tok->str(strRightNumber); // insert e.g. 0.0
8898                         tok->deleteNext(5);       // delete e.g. fmin ( 1.0, 0.0 )
8899                         simplifcationMade = true;
8900                     }
8901                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "fmax|fmaxl|fmaxf ( %num% , %num% )")) {
8902                     // @todo if one of the parameters is NaN the other is returned
8903                     // e.g. printf ("fmax (NaN, -1.0) = %f\n", fmax(NaN,-1.0));
8904                     // e.g. printf ("fmax (-1.0, NaN) = %f\n", fmax(-1.0,NaN));
8905                     const std::string& strLeftNumber(tok->strAt(2));
8906                     const std::string& strRightNumber(tok->strAt(4));
8907                     const bool isLessEqual =  MathLib::isLessEqual(strLeftNumber, strRightNumber);
8908                     // case: left <= right ==> insert right
8909                     if (isLessEqual) {
8910                         tok->str(strRightNumber);// insert e.g. 1.0
8911                         tok->deleteNext(5);      // delete e.g. fmax ( -1.0, 1.0 )
8912                         simplifcationMade = true;
8913                     } else { // case left > right ==> insert left
8914                         tok->str(strLeftNumber);  // insert e.g. 1.0
8915                         tok->deleteNext(5);       // delete e.g. fmax ( 1.0, 0.0 )
8916                         simplifcationMade = true;
8917                     }
8918                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "pow|powf|powl (")) {
8919                     if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "%num% , %num% )")) {
8920                         // In case of pow ( 0 , anyNumber > 0): It can be simplified to 0
8921                         // In case of pow ( 0 , 0 ): It simplified to 1
8922                         // In case of pow ( 1 , anyNumber ): It simplified to 1
8923                         const std::string& leftNumber(tok->strAt(2)); // get the left parameter
8924                         const std::string& rightNumber(tok->strAt(4)); // get the right parameter
8925                         const bool isLeftNumberZero = isZeroNumber(leftNumber);
8926                         const bool isLeftNumberOne = isOneNumber(leftNumber);
8927                         const bool isRightNumberZero = isZeroNumber(rightNumber);
8928                         if (isLeftNumberZero && !isRightNumberZero && MathLib::isPositive(rightNumber)) { // case: 0^(y) = 0 and y > 0
8929                             tok->deleteNext(5); // delete tokens
8930                             tok->str("0");  // insert simplified result
8931                             simplifcationMade = true;
8932                         } else if (isLeftNumberZero && isRightNumberZero) { // case: 0^0 = 1
8933                             tok->deleteNext(5); // delete tokens
8934                             tok->str("1");  // insert simplified result
8935                             simplifcationMade = true;
8936                         } else if (isLeftNumberOne) { // case 1^(y) = 1
8937                             tok->deleteNext(5); // delete tokens
8938                             tok->str("1");  // insert simplified result
8939                             simplifcationMade = true;
8940                         }
8941                     }
8942                     if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "%any% , %num% )")) {
8943                         // In case of pow( x , 1 ): It can be simplified to x.
8944                         const std::string& leftParameter(tok->strAt(2)); // get the left parameter
8945                         const std::string& rightNumber(tok->strAt(4)); // get right number
8946                         if (isOneNumber(rightNumber)) { // case: x^(1) = x
8947                             tok->str(leftParameter);  // insert simplified result
8948                             tok->deleteNext(5); // delete tokens
8949                             simplifcationMade = true;
8950                         } else if (isZeroNumber(rightNumber)) { // case: x^(0) = 1
8951                             tok->deleteNext(5); // delete tokens
8952                             tok->str("1");  // insert simplified result
8953                             simplifcationMade = true;
8954                         }
8955                     }
8956                 }
8957                 // Jump back to begin of statement if a simplification was performed
8958                 if (simplifcationMade) {
8959                     while (tok->previous() && tok->str() != ";") {
8960                         tok = tok->previous();
8961                     }
8962                 }
8963             }
8964         }
8965     }
8966     
8967     void Tokenizer::simplifyComma()
8968     {
8969         bool inReturn = false;
8970     
8971         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
8972     
8973             // skip enums
8974             if (Token::Match(tok, "enum class|struct| %name%| :|{")) {
8975                 skipEnumBody(&tok);
8976             }
8977             if (!tok)
8978                 syntaxError(nullptr); // invalid code like in #4195
8979     
8980             if (Token::Match(tok, "(|[") || Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%name%|= {")) {
8981                 tok = tok->link();
8982                 continue;
8983             }
8984     
8985             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "= (") && Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(1), ") {")) {
8986                 tok = tok->linkAt(1)->linkAt(1);
8987                 continue;
8988             }
8989     
8990             // Skip unhandled template specifiers..
8991             if (tok->link() && tok->str() == "<")
8992                 tok = tok->link();
8993     
8994             if (tok->str() == "return" && Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[;{}]"))
8995                 inReturn = true;
8996     
8997             if (inReturn && Token::Match(tok, "[;{}?:]"))
8998                 inReturn = false;
8999     
9000             if (!tok->next() || tok->str() != ",")
9001                 continue;
9002     
9003             // We must not accept just any keyword, e.g. accepting int
9004             // would cause function parameters to corrupt.
9005             if (isCPP() && tok->strAt(1) == "delete") {
9006                 // Handle "delete a, delete b;"
9007                 tok->str(";");
9008             }
9009     
9010             if (isCPP() && Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "delete %name% , %name% ;") &&
9011                 tok->next()->varId() != 0) {
9012                 // Handle "delete a, b;" - convert to delete a; b;
9013                 tok->str(";");
9014             } else if (!inReturn && tok->tokAt(-2)) {
9015                 bool replace = false;
9016                 for (Token *tok2 = tok->previous(); tok2; tok2 = tok2->previous()) {
9017                     if (tok2->str() == "=") {
9018                         // Handle "a = 0, b = 0;"
9019                         replace = true;
9020                     } else if (isCPP() && (Token::Match(tok2, "delete %name%") ||
9021                                            Token::Match(tok2, "delete [ ] %name%"))) {
9022                         // Handle "delete a, a = 0;"
9023                         replace = true;
9024                     } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "[?:;,{}()]")) {
9025                         if (replace && Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}]"))
9026                             tok->str(";");
9027                         break;
9028                     }
9029                 }
9030             }
9031     
9032             // find token where return ends and also count commas
9033             if (inReturn) {
9034                 Token *startFrom = nullptr;    // "[;{}]" token before "return"
9035                 Token *endAt = nullptr;        // first ";" token after "[;{}] return"
9036     
9037                 // find "; return" pattern before comma
9038                 for (Token *tok2 = tok->previous(); tok2; tok2 = tok2->previous()) {
9039                     if (tok2->str() == "return") {
9040                         startFrom = tok2->previous();
9041                         break;
9042                     }
9043                 }
9044                 if (!startFrom)
9045                     // to be very sure...
9046                     return;
9047                 int commaCounter = 0;
9048                 for (Token *tok2 = startFrom->next(); tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
9049                     if (tok2->str() == ";") {
9050                         endAt = tok2;
9051                         break;
9052     
9053                     } else if (Token::Match(tok2, "(|[") ||
9054                                (tok2->str() == "{" && tok2->previous() && tok2->previous()->str() == "=")) {
9055                         tok2 = tok2->link();
9056     
9057                     } else if (tok2->str() == ",") {
9058                         ++commaCounter;
9059                     }
9060                 }
9061     
9062                 if (!endAt)
9063                     //probably a syntax error
9064                     return;
9065     
9066                 if (commaCounter) {
9067                     // change tokens:
9068                     // "; return a ( ) , b ( ) , c ;"
9069                     // to
9070                     // "; a ( ) ; b ( ) ; return c ;"
9071     
9072                     // remove "return"
9073                     startFrom->deleteNext();
9074                     for (Token *tok2 = startFrom->next(); tok2 != endAt; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
9075                         if (Token::Match(tok2, "(|[") ||
9076                             (tok2->str() == "{" && tok2->previous() && tok2->previous()->str() == "=")) {
9077                             tok2 = tok2->link();
9078     
9079                         } else if (tok2->str() == ",") {
9080                             tok2->str(";");
9081                             --commaCounter;
9082                             if (commaCounter == 0) {
9083                                 tok2->insertToken("return");
9084                             }
9085                         }
9086                     }
9087                     tok = endAt;
9088                 }
9089             }
9090         }
9091     }
9092     
9093     void Tokenizer::checkConfiguration() const
9094     {
9095         if (!mSettings->checkConfiguration)
9096             return;
9097         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9098             if (!Token::Match(tok, "%name% ("))
9099                 continue;
9100             if (tok->isControlFlowKeyword())
9101                 continue;
9102             for (const Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(2); tok2 && tok2->str() != ")"; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
9103                 if (tok2->str() == ";") {
9104                     macroWithSemicolonError(tok, tok->str());
9105                     break;
9106                 }
9107                 if (Token::Match(tok2, "(|{"))
9108                     tok2 = tok2->link();
9109             }
9110         }
9111     }
9112     
9113     void Tokenizer::validateC() const
9114     {
9115         if (isCPP())
9116             return;
9117         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9118             // That might trigger false positives, but it's much faster to have this truncated pattern
9119             if (Token::Match(tok, "const_cast|dynamic_cast|reinterpret_cast|static_cast <"))
9120                 syntaxErrorC(tok, "C++ cast <...");
9121             // Template function..
9122             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% < %name% > (")) {
9123                 const Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(5);
9124                 while (tok2 && !Token::Match(tok2, "[()]"))
9125                     tok2 = tok2->next();
9126                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, ") {"))
9127                     syntaxErrorC(tok, tok->str() + '<' + tok->strAt(2) + ">() {}");
9128             }
9129             if (tok->previous() && !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[;{}]"))
9130                 continue;
9131             if (Token::Match(tok, "using namespace %name% ;"))
9132                 syntaxErrorC(tok, "using namespace " + tok->strAt(2));
9133             if (Token::Match(tok, "template < class|typename %name% [,>]"))
9134                 syntaxErrorC(tok, "template<...");
9135             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% :: %name%"))
9136                 syntaxErrorC(tok, tok->str() + tok->strAt(1) + tok->strAt(2));
9137             if (Token::Match(tok, "class|namespace %name% [:{]"))
9138                 syntaxErrorC(tok, tok->str() + tok->strAt(1) + tok->strAt(2));
9139         }
9140     }
9141     
9142     void Tokenizer::validate() const
9143     {
9144         std::stack<const Token *> linkTokens;
9145         const Token *lastTok = nullptr;
9146         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9147             lastTok = tok;
9148             if (Token::Match(tok, "[{([]") || (tok->str() == "<" && tok->link())) {
9149                 if (tok->link() == nullptr)
9150                     cppcheckError(tok);
9151     
9152                 linkTokens.push(tok);
9153             }
9154     
9155             else if (Token::Match(tok, "[})]]") || (Token::Match(tok, ">|>>") && tok->link())) {
9156                 if (tok->link() == nullptr)
9157                     cppcheckError(tok);
9158     
9159                 if (linkTokens.empty() == true)
9160                     cppcheckError(tok);
9161     
9162                 if (tok->link() != linkTokens.top())
9163                     cppcheckError(tok);
9164     
9165                 if (tok != tok->link()->link())
9166                     cppcheckError(tok);
9167     
9168                 linkTokens.pop();
9169             }
9170     
9171             else if (tok->link() != nullptr)
9172                 cppcheckError(tok);
9173         }
9174     
9175         if (!linkTokens.empty())
9176             cppcheckError(linkTokens.top());
9177     
9178         // Validate that the Tokenizer::list.back() is updated correctly during simplifications
9179         if (lastTok != list.back())
9180             cppcheckError(lastTok);
9181     }
9182     
9183     static const Token *findUnmatchedTernaryOp(const Token * const begin, const Token * const end, int depth = 0)
9184     {
9185         std::stack<const Token *> ternaryOp;
9186         for (const Token *tok = begin; tok != end && tok->str() != ";"; tok = tok->next()) {
9187             if (tok->str() == "?")
9188                 ternaryOp.push(tok);
9189             else if (!ternaryOp.empty() && tok->str() == ":")
9190                 ternaryOp.pop();
9191             else if (depth < 100 && Token::Match(tok,"(|[")) {
9192                 const Token *inner = findUnmatchedTernaryOp(tok->next(), tok->link(), depth+1);
9193                 if (inner)
9194                     return inner;
9195                 tok = tok->link();
9196             }
9197         }
9198         return ternaryOp.empty() ? nullptr : ternaryOp.top();
9199     }
9200     
9201     void Tokenizer::findGarbageCode() const
9202     {
9203         // initialization: = {
9204         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9205             if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok, "= {"))
9206                 continue;
9207             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(1), "} ("))
9208                 syntaxError(tok->linkAt(1));
9209         }
9210     
9211         // Inside [] there can't be ; or various keywords
9212         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9213             if (tok->str() != "[")
9214                 continue;
9215             for (const Token *inner = tok->next(); inner != tok->link(); inner = inner->next()) {
9216                 if (Token::Match(inner, "(|["))
9217                     inner = inner->link();
9218                 else if (Token::Match(inner, ";|goto|return|typedef"))
9219                     syntaxError(inner);
9220             }
9221         }
9222     
9223         // UNKNOWN_MACRO(return)
9224         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9225             if (Token::Match(tok, "throw|return )") && Token::Match(tok->linkAt(1)->previous(), "%name% ("))
9226                 unknownMacroError(tok->linkAt(1)->previous());
9227         }
9228     
9229         // UNKNOWN_MACRO(return)
9230         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9231             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% throw|return") && std::isupper(tok->str()[0]))
9232                 unknownMacroError(tok);
9233         }
9234     
9235         // Assign/increment/decrement literal
9236         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9237             if (Token::Match(tok, "!!) %num%|%str%|%char% %assign%|++|--"))
9238                 syntaxError(tok, tok->next()->str() + " " + tok->strAt(2));
9239         }
9240     
9241         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9242             if (Token::Match(tok, "if|while|for|switch")) { // if|while|for|switch (EXPR) { ... }
9243                 if (tok->previous() && !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%name%|:|;|{|}|(|)|,")) {
9244                     if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-2), "operator \"\" if"))
9245                         syntaxError(tok);
9246                 }
9247                 if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[(,]"))
9248                     continue;
9249                 if (!Token::Match(tok->next(), "( !!)"))
9250                     syntaxError(tok);
9251                 if (tok->str() != "for") {
9252                     if (isGarbageExpr(tok->next(), tok->linkAt(1), mSettings->standards.cpp>=Standards::cppstd_t::CPP17))
9253                         syntaxError(tok);
9254                 }
9255             }
9256         }
9257     
9258         // keyword keyword
9259         const std::set<std::string> nonConsecutiveKeywords{"break",
9260             "continue",
9261             "for",
9262             "goto",
9263             "if",
9264             "return",
9265             "switch",
9266             "throw",
9267             "typedef",
9268             "while"};
9269         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9270             if (!tok->isName() || nonConsecutiveKeywords.count(tok->str()) == 0)
9271                 continue;
9272             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% %name%") && nonConsecutiveKeywords.count(tok->next()->str()) == 1)
9273                 syntaxError(tok);
9274             const Token *prev = tok;
9275             while (prev && prev->isName())
9276                 prev = prev->previous();
9277             if (Token::Match(prev, "%op%|%num%|%str%|%char%")) {
9278                 if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-2), "operator \"\" if"))
9279                     syntaxError(tok, prev == tok->previous() ? (prev->str() + " " + tok->str()) : (prev->str() + " .. " + tok->str()));
9280             }
9281         }
9282     
9283         // case keyword must be inside switch
9284         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9285             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "switch (")) {
9286                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(1), ") {")) {
9287                     tok = tok->linkAt(1)->linkAt(1);
9288                     continue;
9289                 }
9290                 const Token *switchToken = tok;
9291                 tok = tok->linkAt(1);
9292                 if (!tok)
9293                     syntaxError(switchToken);
9294                 // Look for the end of the switch statement, i.e. the first semi-colon or '}'
9295                 for (; tok ; tok = tok->next()) {
9296                     if (tok->str() == "{") {
9297                         tok = tok->link();
9298                     }
9299                     if (Token::Match(tok, ";|}")) {
9300                         // We're at the end of the switch block
9301                         if (tok->str() == "}" && tok->strAt(-1) == ":") // Invalid case
9302                             syntaxError(switchToken);
9303                         break;
9304                     }
9305                 }
9306                 if (!tok)
9307                     break;
9308             } else if (tok->str() == "(") {
9309                 tok = tok->link();
9310             } else if (tok->str() == "case") {
9311                 syntaxError(tok);
9312             }
9313         }
9314     
9315         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok ; tok = tok->next()) {
9316             if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok, "for (")) // find for loops
9317                 continue;
9318             // count number of semicolons
9319             int semicolons = 0;
9320             const Token* const startTok = tok;
9321             tok = tok->next()->link()->previous(); // find ")" of the for-loop
9322             // walk backwards until we find the beginning (startTok) of the for() again
9323             for (; tok != startTok; tok = tok->previous()) {
9324                 if (tok->str() == ";") { // do the counting
9325                     semicolons++;
9326                 } else if (tok->str() == ")") { // skip pairs of ( )
9327                     tok = tok->link();
9328                 }
9329             }
9330             // if we have an invalid number of semicolons inside for( ), assume syntax error
9331             if ((semicolons == 1) || (semicolons > 2)) {
9332                 syntaxError(tok);
9333             }
9334         }
9335     
9336         // Operators without operands..
9337         const Token *templateEndToken = nullptr;
9338         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9339             if (!templateEndToken) {
9340                 if (tok->str() == "<" && isCPP())
9341                     templateEndToken = tok->findClosingBracket();
9342             } else {
9343                 if (templateEndToken == tok)
9344                     templateEndToken = nullptr;
9345                 if (Token::Match(tok, "> %cop%"))
9346                     continue;
9347             }
9348             if (Token::Match(tok, "%or%|%oror%|==|!=|+|-|/|!|>=|<=|~|^|++|--|::|sizeof|throw|decltype|typeof {|if|else|try|catch|while|do|for|return|switch|break|namespace"))
9349                 syntaxError(tok);
9350             if (Token::Match(tok, "( %any% )") && tok->next()->isKeyword() && !Token::simpleMatch(tok->next(), "void"))
9351                 syntaxError(tok);
9352             if (Token::Match(tok, "%num%|%bool%|%char%|%str% %num%|%bool%|%char%|%str%") && !Token::Match(tok, "%str% %str%"))
9353                 syntaxError(tok);
9354             if (Token::Match(tok, "%assign% typename|class %assign%"))
9355                 syntaxError(tok);
9356             if (Token::Match(tok, "%cop%|=|,|[ %or%|%oror%|/|%"))
9357                 syntaxError(tok);
9358             if (Token::Match(tok, ";|(|[ %comp%"))
9359                 syntaxError(tok);
9360             if (Token::Match(tok, "%cop%|= ]") && !(isCPP() && Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[|, &|= ]")))
9361                 syntaxError(tok);
9362             if (Token::Match(tok, "[+-] [;,)]}]") && !(isCPP() && Token::Match(tok->previous(), "operator [+-] ;")))
9363                 syntaxError(tok);
9364             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, ",") &&
9365                 !Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "[ = , &|%name%")) {
9366                 if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "(|[|{|<|%assign%|%or%|%oror%|==|!=|+|-|/|!|>=|<=|~|^|::|sizeof|throw|decltype|typeof"))
9367                     syntaxError(tok);
9368                 if (Token::Match(tok->next(), ")|]|>|%assign%|%or%|%oror%|==|!=|/|>=|<=|&&"))
9369                     syntaxError(tok);
9370             }
9371             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, ".") &&
9372                 !Token::simpleMatch(tok->previous(), ".") &&
9373                 !Token::simpleMatch(tok->next(), ".") &&
9374                 !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "{|, . %name% [=.]") &&
9375                 !Token::Match(tok->previous(), ", . %name%")) {
9376                 if (!Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%name%|)|]|>|}"))
9377                     syntaxError(tok, tok->strAt(-1) + " " + tok->str() + " " + tok->strAt(1));
9378                 if (!Token::Match(tok->next(), "%name%|*|~"))
9379                     syntaxError(tok, tok->strAt(-1) + " " + tok->str() + " " + tok->strAt(1));
9380             }
9381         }
9382     
9383         // ternary operator without :
9384         if (const Token *ternaryOp = findUnmatchedTernaryOp(tokens(), nullptr))
9385             syntaxError(ternaryOp);
9386     
9387         // Code must not start with an arithmetical operand
9388         if (Token::Match(list.front(), "%cop%"))
9389             syntaxError(list.front());
9390     
9391         // Code must end with } ; ) NAME
9392         if (!Token::Match(list.back(), "%name%|;|}|)"))
9393             syntaxError(list.back());
9394         if (list.back()->str() == ")" && !Token::Match(list.back()->link()->previous(), "%name% ("))
9395             syntaxError(list.back());
9396         for (const Token *end = list.back(); end && end->isName(); end = end->previous()) {
9397             if (Token::Match(end, "void|char|short|int|long|float|double|const|volatile|static|inline|struct|class|enum|union|template|sizeof|case|break|continue|typedef"))
9398                 syntaxError(list.back());
9399         }
9400         if ((list.back()->str()==")" || list.back()->str()=="}") && list.back()->previous() && list.back()->previous()->isControlFlowKeyword())
9401             syntaxError(list.back()->previous());
9402     
9403         // Garbage templates..
9404         if (isCPP()) {
9405             for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9406                 if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok, "template <"))
9407                     continue;
9408                 if (tok->previous() && !Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[:;{})>]")) {
9409                     if (tok->previous()->isUpperCaseName())
9410                         unknownMacroError(tok->previous());
9411                     else
9412                         syntaxError(tok);
9413                 }
9414                 const Token * const tok1 = tok;
9415                 tok = tok->next()->findClosingBracket();
9416                 if (!tok)
9417                     syntaxError(tok1);
9418                 if (!Token::Match(tok, ">|>> ::|...| %name%") &&
9419                     !Token::Match(tok, ">|>> [ [ %name%") &&
9420                     !Token::Match(tok, "> >|*"))
9421                     syntaxError(tok->next() ? tok->next() : tok1);
9422             }
9423         }
9424     
9425         // Objective C/C++
9426         for (const Token *tok = tokens(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9427             if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] [ %name% %name% ] ;"))
9428                 syntaxError(tok->next());
9429         }
9430     }
9431     
9432     
9433     bool Tokenizer::isGarbageExpr(const Token *start, const Token *end, bool allowSemicolon)
9434     {
9435         for (const Token *tok = start; tok != end; tok = tok->next()) {
9436             if (tok->isControlFlowKeyword())
9437                 return true;
9438             if (!allowSemicolon && tok->str() == ";")
9439                 return true;
9440             if (tok->str() == "{")
9441                 tok = tok->link();
9442         }
9443         return false;
9444     }
9445     
9446     std::string Tokenizer::simplifyString(const std::string &source)
9447     {
9448         std::string str = source;
9449     
9450         for (std::string::size_type i = 0; i + 1U < str.size(); ++i) {
9451             if (str[i] != '\\')
9452                 continue;
9453     
9454             int c = 'a';   // char
9455             int sz = 0;    // size of stringdata
9456             if (str[i+1] == 'x') {
9457                 sz = 2;
9458                 while (sz < 4 && std::isxdigit((unsigned char)str[i+sz]))
9459                     sz++;
9460                 if (sz > 2) {
9461                     std::istringstream istr(str.substr(i+2, sz-2));
9462                     istr >> std::hex >> c;
9463                 }
9464             } else if (MathLib::isOctalDigit(str[i+1])) {
9465                 sz = 2;
9466                 while (sz < 4 && MathLib::isOctalDigit(str[i+sz]))
9467                     sz++;
9468                 std::istringstream istr(str.substr(i+1, sz-1));
9469                 istr >> std::oct >> c;
9470                 str = str.substr(0,i) + (char)c + str.substr(i+sz);
9471                 continue;
9472             }
9473     
9474             if (sz <= 2)
9475                 i++;
9476             else if (i+sz < str.size())
9477                 str.replace(i, sz, std::string(1U, (char)c));
9478             else
9479                 str.replace(i, str.size() - i - 1U, "a");
9480         }
9481     
9482         return str;
9483     }
9484     
9485     void Tokenizer::simplifyWhile0()
9486     {
9487         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9488             // while (0)
9489             const bool while0(Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[{};] while ( 0|false )"));
9490     
9491             // for (0) - not banal, ticket #3140
9492             const bool for0((Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[{};] for ( %name% = %num% ; %name% < %num% ;") &&
9493                              tok->strAt(2) == tok->strAt(6) && tok->strAt(4) == tok->strAt(8)) ||
9494                             (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "[{};] for ( %type% %name% = %num% ; %name% < %num% ;") &&
9495                              tok->strAt(3) == tok->strAt(7) && tok->strAt(5) == tok->strAt(9)));
9496     
9497             if (!while0 && !for0)
9498                 continue;
9499     
9500             if (while0 && tok->previous()->str() == "}") {
9501                 // find "do"
9502                 Token *tok2 = tok->previous()->link();
9503                 tok2 = tok2->previous();
9504                 if (tok2 && tok2->str() == "do") {
9505                     const bool flowmatch = Token::findmatch(tok2, "continue|break", tok) != nullptr;
9506                     // delete "do ({)"
9507                     tok2->deleteThis();
9508                     if (!flowmatch)
9509                         tok2->deleteThis();
9510     
9511                     // delete "(}) while ( 0 ) (;)"
9512                     tok = tok->previous();
9513                     tok->deleteNext(4);  // while ( 0 )
9514                     if (tok->next() && tok->next()->str() == ";")
9515                         tok->deleteNext(); // ;
9516                     if (!flowmatch)
9517                         tok->deleteThis(); // }
9518     
9519                     continue;
9520                 }
9521             }
9522     
9523             // remove "while (0) { .. }"
9524             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->next()->link(), ") {")) {
9525                 Token *end = tok->next()->link(), *old_prev = tok->previous();
9526                 end = end->next()->link();
9527                 if (Token::Match(tok, "for ( %name% ="))
9528                     old_prev = end->link();
9529                 eraseDeadCode(old_prev, end->next());
9530                 if (old_prev && old_prev->next())
9531                     tok = old_prev->next();
9532                 else
9533                     break;
9534             }
9535         }
9536     }
9537     
9538     void Tokenizer::simplifyErrNoInWhile()
9539     {
9540         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9541             if (tok->str() != "errno")
9542                 continue;
9543     
9544             Token *endpar = nullptr;
9545             if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "&& errno == EINTR ) { ;| }"))
9546                 endpar = tok->tokAt(3);
9547             else if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "&& ( errno == EINTR ) ) { ;| }"))
9548                 endpar = tok->tokAt(4);
9549             else
9550                 continue;
9551     
9552             if (Token::simpleMatch(endpar->link()->previous(), "while (")) {
9553                 Token *tok1 = tok->previous();
9554                 if (tok1->str() == "(")
9555                     tok1 = tok1->previous();
9556     
9557                 // erase "&& errno == EINTR"
9558                 tok1 = tok1->previous();
9559                 Token::eraseTokens(tok1, endpar);
9560     
9561                 // tok is invalid.. move to endpar
9562                 tok = endpar;
9563             }
9564         }
9565     }
9566     
9567     
9568     void Tokenizer::simplifyFuncInWhile()
9569     {
9570         int count = 0;
9571         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9572             if (!Token::Match(tok, "while ( %name% ( %name% ) ) {"))
9573                 continue;
9574     
9575             Token *func = tok->tokAt(2);
9576             const Token * const var = tok->tokAt(4);
9577             Token * const end = tok->next()->link()->next()->link();
9578     
9579             const int varid = ++mVarId; // Create new variable
9580             const std::string varname("cppcheck:r" + MathLib::toString(++count));
9581             tok->str("int");
9582             tok->next()->insertToken(varname);
9583             tok->tokAt(2)->varId(varid);
9584             tok->insertToken("while");
9585             tok->insertToken(";");
9586             tok->insertToken(")");
9587             tok->insertToken(var->str());
9588             tok->next()->varId(var->varId());
9589             tok->insertToken("(");
9590             tok->insertToken(func->str());
9591             tok->insertToken("=");
9592             tok->insertToken(varname);
9593             tok->next()->varId(varid);
9594             Token::createMutualLinks(tok->tokAt(4), tok->tokAt(6));
9595             end->previous()->insertToken(varname);
9596             end->previous()->varId(varid);
9597             end->previous()->insertToken("=");
9598             Token::move(func, func->tokAt(3), end->previous());
9599             end->previous()->insertToken(";");
9600     
9601             tok = end;
9602         }
9603     }
9604     
9605     void Tokenizer::simplifyStructDecl()
9606     {
9607         const bool cpp = isCPP();
9608     
9609         // A counter that is used when giving unique names for anonymous structs.
9610         int count = 0;
9611     
9612         // Skip simplification of unions in class definition
9613         std::stack<bool> skip; // true = in function, false = not in function
9614         skip.push(false);
9615     
9616         // Add names for anonymous structs
9617         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9618             if (!tok->isName())
9619                 continue;
9620             // check for anonymous struct/union
9621             if (Token::Match(tok, "struct|union {")) {
9622                 if (Token::Match(tok->next()->link(), "} const| *|&| const| %type% ,|;|[|(|{|=")) {
9623                     tok->insertToken("Anonymous" + MathLib::toString(count++));
9624                 }
9625             }
9626             // check for derived anonymous class/struct
9627             else if (cpp && Token::Match(tok, "class|struct :")) {
9628                 const Token *tok1 = Token::findsimplematch(tok, "{");
9629                 if (tok1 && Token::Match(tok1->link(), "} const| *|&| const| %type% ,|;|[|(|{")) {
9630                     tok->insertToken("Anonymous" + MathLib::toString(count++));
9631                 }
9632             }
9633             // check for anonymous enum
9634             else if ((Token::simpleMatch(tok, "enum {") &&
9635                       !Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-3), "using %name% =") &&
9636                       Token::Match(tok->next()->link(), "} %type%| ,|;|[|(|{")) ||
9637                      (Token::Match(tok, "enum : %type% {") && Token::Match(tok->linkAt(3), "} %type%| ,|;|[|(|{"))) {
9638                 tok->insertToken("Anonymous" + MathLib::toString(count++));
9639             }
9640         }
9641     
9642         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9643     
9644             // check for start of scope and determine if it is in a function
9645             if (tok->str() == "{")
9646                 skip.push(Token::Match(tok->previous(), "const|)"));
9647     
9648             // end of scope
9649             else if (tok->str() == "}" && !skip.empty())
9650                 skip.pop();
9651     
9652             // check for named struct/union
9653             else if (Token::Match(tok, "class|struct|union|enum %type% :|{")) {
9654                 Token *start = tok;
9655                 while (Token::Match(start->previous(), "%type%"))
9656                     start = start->previous();
9657                 const Token * const type = tok->next();
9658                 Token *next = tok->tokAt(2);
9659     
9660                 while (next && next->str() != "{")
9661                     next = next->next();
9662                 if (!next)
9663                     continue;
9664                 skip.push(false);
9665                 tok = next->link();
9666                 if (!tok)
9667                     break; // see #4869 segmentation fault in Tokenizer::simplifyStructDecl (invalid code)
9668                 Token *restart = next;
9669     
9670                 // check for named type
9671                 if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "const| *|&| const| %type% ,|;|[|=|(|{")) {
9672                     tok->insertToken(";");
9673                     tok = tok->next();
9674                     while (!Token::Match(start, "struct|class|union|enum")) {
9675                         tok->insertToken(start->str());
9676                         tok = tok->next();
9677                         start->deleteThis();
9678                     }
9679                     if (!tok)
9680                         break; // see #4869 segmentation fault in Tokenizer::simplifyStructDecl (invalid code)
9681                     tok->insertToken(type->str());
9682                     if (start->str() != "class") {
9683                         tok->insertToken(start->str());
9684                         tok = tok->next();
9685                     }
9686     
9687                     tok = tok->tokAt(2);
9688     
9689                     // check for initialization
9690                     if (tok && (tok->next()->str() == "(" || tok->next()->str() == "{")) {
9691                         tok->insertToken("=");
9692                         tok = tok->next();
9693     
9694                         if (start->str() == "enum") {
9695                             if (tok->next()->str() == "{") {
9696                                 tok->next()->str("(");
9697                                 tok->linkAt(1)->str(")");
9698                             }
9699                         }
9700                     }
9701                 }
9702     
9703                 tok = restart;
9704             }
9705     
9706             // check for anonymous struct/union
9707             else if (Token::Match(tok, "struct|union {")) {
9708                 const bool inFunction = skip.top();
9709                 skip.push(false);
9710                 Token *tok1 = tok;
9711     
9712                 Token *restart = tok->next();
9713                 tok = tok->next()->link();
9714     
9715                 // unnamed anonymous struct/union so possibly remove it
9716                 if (tok && tok->next() && tok->next()->str() == ";") {
9717                     if (inFunction && tok1->str() == "union") {
9718                         // Try to create references in the union..
9719                         Token *tok2 = tok1->tokAt(2);
9720                         while (tok2) {
9721                             if (Token::Match(tok2, "%type% %name% ;"))
9722                                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(3);
9723                             else
9724                                 break;
9725                         }
9726                         if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "} ;"))
9727                             continue;
9728                         Token *vartok = nullptr;
9729                         tok2 = tok1->tokAt(2);
9730                         while (Token::Match(tok2, "%type% %name% ;")) {
9731                             if (!vartok) {
9732                                 vartok = tok2->next();
9733                                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(3);
9734                             } else {
9735                                 tok2->insertToken("&");
9736                                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
9737                                 tok2->insertToken(vartok->str());
9738                                 tok2->next()->varId(vartok->varId());
9739                                 tok2->insertToken("=");
9740                                 tok2 = tok2->tokAt(4);
9741                             }
9742                         }
9743                     }
9744     
9745                     // don't remove unnamed anonymous unions from a class, struct or union
9746                     if (!(!inFunction && tok1->str() == "union") && !Token::Match(tok1->tokAt(-3), "using %name% =")) {
9747                         skip.pop();
9748                         tok1->deleteThis();
9749                         if (tok1->next() == tok) {
9750                             tok1->deleteThis();
9751                             tok = tok1;
9752                         } else
9753                             tok1->deleteThis();
9754                         restart = tok1->previous();
9755                         tok->deleteThis();
9756                         if (tok->next())
9757                             tok->deleteThis();
9758                     }
9759                 }
9760     
9761                 if (!restart) {
9762                     simplifyStructDecl();
9763                     return;
9764                 } else if (!restart->next())
9765                     return;
9766     
9767                 tok = restart;
9768             }
9769         }
9770     }
9771     
9772     void Tokenizer::simplifyCallingConvention()
9773     {
9774         const bool windows = mSettings->isWindowsPlatform();
9775     
9776         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9777             while (Token::Match(tok, "__cdecl|__stdcall|__fastcall|__thiscall|__clrcall|__syscall|__pascal|__fortran|__far|__near") || (windows && Token::Match(tok, "WINAPI|APIENTRY|CALLBACK"))) {
9778                 tok->deleteThis();
9779             }
9780         }
9781     }
9782     
9783     void Tokenizer::simplifyDeclspec()
9784     {
9785         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9786             while (Token::Match(tok, "__declspec|_declspec (") && tok->next()->link() && tok->next()->link()->next()) {
9787                 if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "noreturn|nothrow")) {
9788                     Token *tok1 = tok->next()->link()->next();
9789                     while (tok1 && !Token::Match(tok1, "%name%")) {
9790                         tok1 = tok1->next();
9791                     }
9792                     if (tok1) {
9793                         if (tok->strAt(2) == "noreturn")
9794                             tok1->isAttributeNoreturn(true);
9795                         else
9796                             tok1->isAttributeNothrow(true);
9797                     }
9798                 } else if (tok->strAt(2) == "property")
9799                     tok->next()->link()->insertToken("__property");
9800     
9801                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->next()->link()->next());
9802                 tok->deleteThis();
9803             }
9804         }
9805     }
9806     
9807     void Tokenizer::simplifyAttribute()
9808     {
9809         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9810             if (Token::Match(tok, "%type% (") && !mSettings->library.isNotLibraryFunction(tok)) {
9811                 if (mSettings->library.isFunctionConst(tok->str(), true))
9812                     tok->isAttributePure(true);
9813                 if (mSettings->library.isFunctionConst(tok->str(), false))
9814                     tok->isAttributeConst(true);
9815             }
9816             while (Token::Match(tok, "__attribute__|__attribute (") && tok->next()->link() && tok->next()->link()->next()) {
9817                 if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "( constructor|__constructor__")) {
9818                     // prototype for constructor is: void func(void);
9819                     if (!tok->next()->link()->next())
9820                         syntaxError(tok);
9821     
9822                     if (tok->next()->link()->next()->str() == "void") { // __attribute__((constructor)) void func() {}
9823                         if (!tok->next()->link()->next()->next())
9824                             syntaxError(tok);
9825     
9826                         tok->next()->link()->next()->next()->isAttributeConstructor(true);
9827                     } else if (tok->next()->link()->next()->str() == ";" && tok->linkAt(-1) && tok->previous()->link()->previous()) // void func() __attribute__((constructor));
9828                         tok->previous()->link()->previous()->isAttributeConstructor(true);
9829                     else // void __attribute__((constructor)) func() {}
9830                         tok->next()->link()->next()->isAttributeConstructor(true);
9831                 }
9832     
9833                 else if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "( destructor|__destructor__")) {
9834                     // prototype for destructor is: void func(void);
9835                     if (!tok->next()->link()->next())
9836                         syntaxError(tok);
9837     
9838                     if (tok->next()->link()->next()->str() == "void") // __attribute__((destructor)) void func() {}
9839                         tok->next()->link()->next()->next()->isAttributeDestructor(true);
9840                     else if (tok->next()->link()->next()->str() == ";" && tok->linkAt(-1) && tok->previous()->link()->previous()) // void func() __attribute__((destructor));
9841                         tok->previous()->link()->previous()->isAttributeDestructor(true);
9842                     else // void __attribute__((destructor)) func() {}
9843                         tok->next()->link()->next()->isAttributeDestructor(true);
9844                 }
9845     
9846                 else if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "( unused|__unused__|used|__used__ )")) {
9847                     Token *vartok = nullptr;
9848     
9849                     // check if after variable name
9850                     if (Token::Match(tok->next()->link()->next(), ";|=")) {
9851                         if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type%"))
9852                             vartok = tok->previous();
9853                     }
9854     
9855                     // check if before variable name
9856                     else if (Token::Match(tok->next()->link()->next(), "%type%"))
9857                         vartok = tok->next()->link()->next();
9858     
9859                     if (vartok) {
9860                         const std::string &attribute(tok->strAt(3));
9861                         if (attribute.find("unused") != std::string::npos)
9862                             vartok->isAttributeUnused(true);
9863                         else
9864                             vartok->isAttributeUsed(true);
9865                     }
9866                 }
9867     
9868                 else if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "( pure|__pure__|const|__const__|noreturn|__noreturn__|nothrow|__nothrow__|warn_unused_result )")) {
9869                     Token *functok = nullptr;
9870     
9871                     // type func(...) __attribute__((attribute));
9872                     if (tok->previous() && tok->previous()->link() && Token::Match(tok->previous()->link()->previous(), "%name% ("))
9873                         functok = tok->previous()->link()->previous();
9874     
9875                     // type __attribute__((attribute)) func() { }
9876                     else {
9877                         Token *tok2 = tok->next()->link();
9878                         while (Token::Match(tok2, ") __attribute__|__attribute ("))
9879                             tok2 = tok2->linkAt(2);
9880                         if (Token::Match(tok2, ") %name% ("))
9881                             functok = tok2->next();
9882                     }
9883     
9884                     if (functok) {
9885                         const std::string &attribute(tok->strAt(3));
9886                         if (attribute.find("pure") != std::string::npos)
9887                             functok->isAttributePure(true);
9888                         else if (attribute.find("const") != std::string::npos)
9889                             functok->isAttributeConst(true);
9890                         else if (attribute.find("noreturn") != std::string::npos)
9891                             functok->isAttributeNoreturn(true);
9892                         else if (attribute.find("nothrow") != std::string::npos)
9893                             functok->isAttributeNothrow(true);
9894                         else if (attribute.find("warn_unused_result") != std::string::npos)
9895                             functok->isAttributeNodiscard(true);
9896                     }
9897                 }
9898     
9899                 else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->previous(), "} __attribute__ ( ( packed )")) {
9900                     tok->previous()->isAttributePacked(true);
9901                 }
9902     
9903                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->next()->link()->next());
9904                 tok->deleteThis();
9905             }
9906         }
9907     }
9908     
9909     void Tokenizer::simplifyCppcheckAttribute()
9910     {
9911         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9912             if (tok->str() != "(")
9913                 continue;
9914             if (!tok->previous())
9915                 continue;
9916             const std::string &attr = tok->previous()->str();
9917             if (attr.compare(0, 11, "__cppcheck_") != 0) // TODO: starts_with("__cppcheck_")
9918                 continue;
9919             if (attr.compare(attr.size()-2, 2, "__") != 0) // TODO: ends_with("__")
9920                 continue;
9921     
9922             Token *vartok = tok->link();
9923             while (Token::Match(vartok->next(), "%name%|*|&|::")) {
9924                 vartok = vartok->next();
9925                 if (Token::Match(vartok, "%name% (") && vartok->str().compare(0,11,"__cppcheck_") == 0)
9926                     vartok = vartok->linkAt(1);
9927             }
9928     
9929             if (vartok->isName()) {
9930                 if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "__cppcheck_low__ ( %num% )"))
9931                     vartok->setCppcheckAttribute(TokenImpl::CppcheckAttributes::Type::LOW, MathLib::toLongNumber(tok->next()->str()));
9932                 else if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "__cppcheck_high__ ( %num% )"))
9933                     vartok->setCppcheckAttribute(TokenImpl::CppcheckAttributes::Type::HIGH, MathLib::toLongNumber(tok->next()->str()));
9934             }
9935     
9936             // Delete cppcheck attribute..
9937             if (tok->tokAt(-2)) {
9938                 tok = tok->tokAt(-2);
9939                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->linkAt(2)->next());
9940             } else {
9941                 tok = tok->previous();
9942                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->linkAt(1)->next());
9943                 tok->str(";");
9944             }
9945         }
9946     }
9947     
9948     void Tokenizer::simplifyCPPAttribute()
9949     {
9950         if (mSettings->standards.cpp < Standards::CPP11 || isC())
9951             return;
9952     
9953         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
9954             if (!tok->link() || !Token::Match(tok, "[ [ %name%"))
9955                 continue;
9956             if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "noreturn|nodiscard")) {
9957                 const Token * head = tok->link()->next();
9958                 while (Token::Match(head, "%name%|::|*|&"))
9959                     head = head->next();
9960                 if (head && head->str() == "(" && isFunctionHead(head, "{|;")) {
9961                     if (tok->strAt(2) == "noreturn")
9962                         head->previous()->isAttributeNoreturn(true);
9963                     else
9964                         head->previous()->isAttributeNodiscard(true);
9965                 }
9966             } else if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), ") [ [ expects|ensures|assert default|audit|axiom| : %name% <|<=|>|>= %num% ] ]")) {
9967                 const Token *vartok = tok->tokAt(4);
9968                 if (vartok->str() == ":")
9969                     vartok = vartok->next();
9970                 Token *argtok = tok->tokAt(-2);
9971                 while (argtok && argtok->str() != "(") {
9972                     if (argtok->str() == vartok->str())
9973                         break;
9974                     if (argtok->str() == ")")
9975                         argtok = argtok->link();
9976                     argtok = argtok->previous();
9977                 }
9978                 if (argtok && argtok->str() == vartok->str()) {
9979                     if (vartok->next()->str() == ">=")
9980                         argtok->setCppcheckAttribute(TokenImpl::CppcheckAttributes::Type::LOW, MathLib::toLongNumber(vartok->strAt(2)));
9981                     else if (vartok->next()->str() == ">")
9982                         argtok->setCppcheckAttribute(TokenImpl::CppcheckAttributes::Type::LOW, MathLib::toLongNumber(vartok->strAt(2))+1);
9983                     else if (vartok->next()->str() == "<=")
9984                         argtok->setCppcheckAttribute(TokenImpl::CppcheckAttributes::Type::HIGH, MathLib::toLongNumber(vartok->strAt(2)));
9985                     else if (vartok->next()->str() == "<")
9986                         argtok->setCppcheckAttribute(TokenImpl::CppcheckAttributes::Type::HIGH, MathLib::toLongNumber(vartok->strAt(2))-1);
9987                 }
9988             }
9989             Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->link()->next());
9990             tok->deleteThis();
9991         }
9992     }
9993     
9994     static const std::set<std::string> keywords = {
9995         "inline"
9996         , "_inline"
9997         , "__inline"
9998         , "__forceinline"
9999         , "register"
10000         , "__restrict"
10001         , "__restrict__"
10002         , "__thread"
10003     };
10004     // Remove "inline", "register", "restrict", "override", "static" and "constexpr"
10005     // "restrict" keyword
10006     //   - New to 1999 ANSI/ISO C standard
10007     //   - Not in C++ standard yet
10008     void Tokenizer::simplifyKeyword()
10009     {
10010         // FIXME: There is a risk that "keywords" are removed by mistake. This
10011         // code should be fixed so it doesn't remove variables etc. Nonstandard
10012         // keywords should be defined with a library instead. For instance the
10013         // linux kernel code at least uses "_inline" as struct member name at some
10014         // places.
10015     
10016         const bool c99 = isC() && mSettings->standards.c >= Standards::C99;
10017         const bool cpp11 = isCPP() && mSettings->standards.cpp >= Standards::CPP11;
10018     
10019         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10020             if (keywords.find(tok->str()) != keywords.end()) {
10021                 // Don't remove struct members
10022                 if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok->previous(), "."))
10023                     tok->deleteThis(); // Simplify..
10024             }
10025     
10026             if (isC() || mSettings->standards.cpp == Standards::CPP03) {
10027                 if (tok->str() == "auto")
10028                     tok->deleteThis();
10029             }
10030     
10031             // simplify static keyword:
10032             // void foo( int [ static 5 ] ); ==> void foo( int [ 5 ] );
10033             if (Token::Match(tok, "[ static %num%"))
10034                 tok->deleteNext();
10035     
10036             if (c99) {
10037                 while (tok->str() == "restrict")
10038                     tok->deleteThis();
10039     
10040                 if (mSettings->standards.c >= Standards::C11) {
10041                     while (tok->str() == "_Atomic")
10042                         tok->deleteThis();
10043                 }
10044             }
10045     
10046             else if (cpp11) {
10047                 if (tok->str() == "constexpr") {
10048                     tok->originalName(tok->str());
10049                     tok->str("const");
10050                 }
10051     
10052                 // final:
10053                 // 1) struct name final { };   <- struct is final
10054                 if (Token::Match(tok->previous(), "struct|class|union %type% final [:{]")) {
10055                     tok->deleteNext();
10056                 }
10057     
10058                 // noexcept -> noexcept(true)
10059                 // 2) void f() noexcept; -> void f() noexcept(true);
10060                 else if (Token::Match(tok, ") noexcept :|{|;|const|override|final")) {
10061                     // Insertion is done in inverse order
10062                     // The brackets are linked together accordingly afterwards
10063                     Token * tokNoExcept = tok->next();
10064                     tokNoExcept->insertToken(")");
10065                     Token * braceEnd = tokNoExcept->next();
10066                     tokNoExcept->insertToken("true");
10067                     tokNoExcept->insertToken("(");
10068                     Token * braceStart = tokNoExcept->next();
10069                     tok = tok->tokAt(3);
10070                     Token::createMutualLinks(braceStart, braceEnd);
10071                 }
10072     
10073                 // 3) thread_local -> static
10074                 //    on single thread thread_local has the effect of static
10075                 else if (tok->str() == "thread_local") {
10076                     tok->originalName(tok->str());
10077                     tok->str("static");
10078                 }
10079             }
10080         }
10081     }
10082     
10083     void Tokenizer::simplifyAssignmentInFunctionCall()
10084     {
10085         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10086             if (tok->str() == "(")
10087                 tok = tok->link();
10088     
10089             // Find 'foo(var='. Exclude 'assert(var=' to allow tests to check that assert(...) does not contain side-effects
10090             else if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] %name% ( %name% =") &&
10091                      Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(2), ") ;") &&
10092                      !Token::Match(tok->next(), "assert|while")) {
10093                 const std::string& funcname(tok->next()->str());
10094                 Token* const vartok = tok->tokAt(3);
10095     
10096                 // Goto ',' or ')'..
10097                 for (Token *tok2 = vartok->tokAt(2); tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
10098                     if (tok2->link() && Token::Match(tok2, "(|[|{"))
10099                         tok2 = tok2->link();
10100                     else if (tok2->str() == ";")
10101                         break;
10102                     else if (Token::Match(tok2, ")|,")) {
10103                         tok2 = tok2->previous();
10104     
10105                         tok2->insertToken(vartok->str());
10106                         tok2->next()->varId(vartok->varId());
10107     
10108                         tok2->insertToken("(");
10109                         Token::createMutualLinks(tok2->next(), tok->linkAt(2));
10110     
10111                         tok2->insertToken(funcname);
10112                         tok2->insertToken(";");
10113     
10114                         Token::eraseTokens(tok, vartok);
10115                         break;
10116                     }
10117                 }
10118             }
10119         }
10120     }
10121     
10122     void Tokenizer::simplifyAssignmentBlock()
10123     {
10124         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10125             if (Token::Match(tok, "[;{}] %name% = ( {")) {
10126                 const std::string &varname = tok->next()->str();
10127     
10128                 // goto the "} )"
10129                 int indentlevel = 0;
10130                 Token *tok2 = tok;
10131                 while (nullptr != (tok2 = tok2->next())) {
10132                     if (Token::Match(tok2, "(|{"))
10133                         ++indentlevel;
10134                     else if (Token::Match(tok2, ")|}")) {
10135                         if (indentlevel <= 2)
10136                             break;
10137                         --indentlevel;
10138                     } else if (indentlevel == 2 && tok2->str() == varname && Token::Match(tok2->previous(), "%type%|*"))
10139                         // declaring variable in inner scope with same name as lhs variable
10140                         break;
10141                 }
10142                 if (indentlevel == 2 && Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "} )")) {
10143                     tok2 = tok2->tokAt(-3);
10144                     if (Token::Match(tok2, "[;{}] %num%|%name% ;")) {
10145                         tok2->insertToken("=");
10146                         tok2->insertToken(tok->next()->str());
10147                         tok2->next()->varId(tok->next()->varId());
10148                         tok->deleteNext(3);
10149                         tok2->tokAt(5)->deleteNext();
10150                     }
10151                 }
10152             }
10153         }
10154     }
10155     
10156     // Remove __asm..
10157     void Tokenizer::simplifyAsm()
10158     {
10159         std::string instruction;
10160         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10161             if (Token::Match(tok, "__asm|_asm|asm {") &&
10162                 tok->next()->link()->next()) {
10163                 instruction = tok->tokAt(2)->stringifyList(tok->next()->link());
10164                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->next()->link()->next());
10165             }
10166     
10167             else if (Token::Match(tok, "asm|__asm|__asm__ volatile|__volatile|__volatile__| (")) {
10168                 // Goto "("
10169                 Token *partok = tok->next();
10170                 if (partok->str() != "(")
10171                     partok = partok->next();
10172                 instruction = partok->next()->stringifyList(partok->link());
10173                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, partok->link()->next());
10174             }
10175     
10176             else if (Token::Match(tok, "_asm|__asm")) {
10177                 Token *endasm = tok->next();
10178                 const Token *firstSemiColon = nullptr;
10179                 int comment = 0;
10180                 while (Token::Match(endasm, "%num%|%name%|,|:|;") || (endasm && endasm->linenr() == comment)) {
10181                     if (Token::Match(endasm, "_asm|__asm|__endasm"))
10182                         break;
10183                     if (endasm->str() == ";") {
10184                         comment = endasm->linenr();
10185                         if (!firstSemiColon)
10186                             firstSemiColon = endasm;
10187                     }
10188                     endasm = endasm->next();
10189                 }
10190                 if (Token::simpleMatch(endasm, "__endasm")) {
10191                     instruction = tok->next()->stringifyList(endasm);
10192                     Token::eraseTokens(tok, endasm->next());
10193                     if (!Token::simpleMatch(tok->next(), ";"))
10194                         tok->insertToken(";");
10195                 } else if (firstSemiColon) {
10196                     instruction = tok->next()->stringifyList(firstSemiColon);
10197                     Token::eraseTokens(tok, firstSemiColon);
10198                 } else if (!endasm) {
10199                     instruction = tok->next()->stringifyList(endasm);
10200                     Token::eraseTokens(tok, endasm);
10201                     tok->insertToken(";");
10202                 } else
10203                     continue;
10204             }
10205     
10206             else
10207                 continue;
10208     
10209             // insert "asm ( "instruction" )"
10210             tok->str("asm");
10211             if (tok->strAt(1) != ";" && tok->strAt(1) != "{")
10212                 tok->insertToken(";");
10213             tok->insertToken(")");
10214             tok->insertToken("\"" + instruction + "\"");
10215             tok->insertToken("(");
10216     
10217             tok = tok->next();
10218             Token::createMutualLinks(tok, tok->tokAt(2));
10219     
10220             //move the new tokens in the same line as ";" if available
10221             tok = tok->tokAt(2);
10222             if (tok->next() && tok->next()->str() == ";" &&
10223                 tok->next()->linenr() != tok->linenr()) {
10224                 const int endposition = tok->next()->linenr();
10225                 tok = tok->tokAt(-3);
10226                 for (int i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
10227                     tok = tok->next();
10228                     tok->linenr(endposition);
10229                 }
10230             }
10231         }
10232     }
10233     
10234     void Tokenizer::simplifyAsm2()
10235     {
10236         // Block declarations: ^{}
10237         // A C extension used to create lambda like closures.
10238     
10239         // Put ^{} statements in asm()
10240         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10241             if (tok->str() != "^")
10242                 continue;
10243     
10244             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "^ {") || (Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(1), ") {") && tok->strAt(-1) != "operator")) {
10245                 Token * start = tok;
10246                 while (start && !Token::Match(start, "[,(;{}=]")) {
10247                     if (start->link() && Token::Match(start, ")|]|>"))
10248                         start = start->link();
10249                     start = start->previous();
10250                 }
10251     
10252                 const Token *last = tok->next()->link();
10253                 if (Token::simpleMatch(last, ") {"))
10254                     last = last->linkAt(1);
10255                 last = last->next();
10256                 while (last && !Token::Match(last, "%cop%|,|;|{|}|)")) {
10257                     if (Token::Match(last, "(|["))
10258                         last = last->link();
10259                     last = last->next();
10260                 }
10261     
10262                 if (start && last) {
10263                     std::string asmcode;
10264                     while (start->next() != last) {
10265                         asmcode += start->next()->str();
10266                         start->deleteNext();
10267                     }
10268                     if (last->str() == "}")
10269                         start->insertToken(";");
10270                     start->insertToken(")");
10271                     start->insertToken("\"" + asmcode + "\"");
10272                     start->insertToken("(");
10273                     start->insertToken("asm");
10274                     start->tokAt(2)->link(start->tokAt(4));
10275                     start->tokAt(4)->link(start->tokAt(2));
10276                     tok = start->tokAt(4);
10277                 }
10278             }
10279         }
10280     }
10281     
10282     void Tokenizer::simplifyAt()
10283     {
10284         std::set<std::string> var;
10285     
10286         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10287             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% @ %num% ;")) {
10288                 var.insert(tok->str());
10289                 tok->isAtAddress(true);
10290                 Token::eraseTokens(tok,tok->tokAt(3));
10291             }
10292             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% @ %num% : %num% ;")) {
10293                 var.insert(tok->str());
10294                 tok->isAtAddress(true);
10295                 Token::eraseTokens(tok,tok->tokAt(5));
10296             }
10297             if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% @ %name% : %num% ;") && var.find(tok->strAt(2)) != var.end()) {
