10298                 var.insert(tok->str());
10299                 tok->isAtAddress(true);
10300                 Token::eraseTokens(tok,tok->tokAt(5));
10301             }
10302     
10303             // array declaration
10304             if (Token::Match(tok, "] @ %num% ;")) {
10305                 tok->isAtAddress(true);
10306                 Token::eraseTokens(tok,tok->tokAt(3));
10307             }
10308     
10309             // keywords in compiler from cosmic software for STM8
10310             // TODO: Should use platform configuration.
10311             if (Token::Match(tok, "@ builtin|eeprom|far|inline|interrupt|near|noprd|nostack|nosvf|packed|stack|svlreg|tiny|vector")) {
10312                 tok->str(tok->next()->str() + "@");
10313                 tok->deleteNext();
10314             }
10315         }
10316     }
10317     
10318     // Simplify bitfields
10319     void Tokenizer::simplifyBitfields()
10320     {
10321         bool goback = false;
10322         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10323             if (goback) {
10324                 goback = false;
10325                 tok = tok->previous();
10326             }
10327             Token *last = nullptr;
10328     
10329             if (!Token::Match(tok, ";|{|}|public:|protected:|private:"))
10330                 continue;
10331     
10332             bool isEnum = false;
10333             if (tok->str() == "}") {
10334                 const Token *type = tok->link()->previous();
10335                 while (type && type->isName()) {
10336                     if (type->str() == "enum") {
10337                         isEnum = true;
10338                         break;
10339                     }
10340                     type = type->previous();
10341                 }
10342             }
10343     
10344             if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "const| %type% %name% :") &&
10345                 !Token::Match(tok->next(), "case|public|protected|private|class|struct") &&
10346                 !Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(2), "default :")) {
10347                 Token *tok1 = (tok->next()->str() == "const") ? tok->tokAt(3) : tok->tokAt(2);
10348                 if (Token::Match(tok1, "%name% : %num% ;"))
10349                     tok1->setBits(MathLib::toLongNumber(tok1->strAt(2)));
10350                 if (tok1 && tok1->tokAt(2) &&
10351                     (Token::Match(tok1->tokAt(2), "%bool%|%num%") ||
10352                      !Token::Match(tok1->tokAt(2), "public|protected|private| %type% ::|<|,|{|;"))) {
10353                     while (tok1->next() && !Token::Match(tok1->next(), "[;,)]{}]")) {
10354                         if (Token::Match(tok1->next(), "[([]"))
10355                             Token::eraseTokens(tok1, tok1->next()->link());
10356                         tok1->deleteNext();
10357                     }
10358     
10359                     last = tok1->next();
10360                 }
10361             } else if (isEnum && Token::Match(tok, "} %name%| : %num% ;")) {
10362                 if (tok->next()->str() == ":") {
10363                     tok->deleteNext(2);
10364                     tok->insertToken("Anonymous");
10365                 } else {
10366                     tok->next()->deleteNext(2);
10367                 }
10368             } else if (Token::Match(tok->next(), "const| %type% : %num%|%bool% ;") &&
10369                        tok->next()->str() != "default") {
10370                 const int offset = (tok->next()->str() == "const") ? 1 : 0;
10371                 if (!Token::Match(tok->tokAt(3 + offset), "[{};()]")) {
10372                     tok->deleteNext(4 + offset);
10373                     goback = true;
10374                 }
10375             }
10376     
10377             if (last && last->str() == ",") {
10378                 Token * tok1 = last;
10379                 tok1->str(";");
10380     
10381                 const Token *const tok2 = tok->next();
10382                 tok1->insertToken(tok2->str());
10383                 tok1 = tok1->next();
10384                 tok1->isSigned(tok2->isSigned());
10385                 tok1->isUnsigned(tok2->isUnsigned());
10386                 tok1->isLong(tok2->isLong());
10387             }
10388         }
10389     }
10390     
10391     
10392     // Types and objects in std namespace that are neither functions nor templates
10393     static const std::set<std::string> stdTypes = {
10394         "string", "wstring", "u16string", "u32string",
10395         "iostream", "ostream", "ofstream", "ostringstream",
10396         "istream", "ifstream", "istringstream", "fstream", "stringstream",
10397         "wstringstream", "wistringstream", "wostringstream", "wstringbuf",
10398         "stringbuf", "streambuf", "ios", "filebuf", "ios_base",
10399         "exception", "bad_exception", "bad_alloc",
10400         "logic_error", "domain_error", "invalid_argument_", "length_error",
10401         "out_of_range", "runtime_error", "range_error", "overflow_error", "underflow_error",
10402         "locale",
10403         "cout", "cerr", "clog", "cin",
10404         "wcerr", "wcin", "wclog", "wcout",
10405         "endl", "ends", "flush",
10406         "boolalpha", "noboolalpha", "showbase", "noshowbase",
10407         "showpoint", "noshowpoint", "showpos", "noshowpos",
10408         "skipws", "noskipws", "unitbuf", "nounitbuf", "uppercase", "nouppercase",
10409         "dec", "hex", "oct",
10410         "fixed", "scientific",
10411         "internal", "left", "right",
10412         "fpos", "streamoff", "streampos", "streamsize"
10413     };
10414     
10415     static const std::set<std::string> stdTemplates = {
10416         "array", "basic_string", "bitset", "deque", "list", "map", "multimap",
10417         "priority_queue", "queue", "set", "multiset", "stack", "vector", "pair",
10418         "iterator", "iterator_traits",
10419         "unordered_map", "unordered_multimap", "unordered_set", "unordered_multiset",
10420         "tuple", "function"
10421     };
10422     static const std::set<std::string> stdFunctions = {
10423         "getline",
10424         "for_each", "find", "find_if", "find_end", "find_first_of",
10425         "adjacent_find", "count", "count_if", "mismatch", "equal", "search", "search_n",
10426         "copy", "copy_backward", "swap", "swap_ranges", "iter_swap", "transform", "replace",
10427         "replace_if", "replace_copy", "replace_copy_if", "fill", "fill_n", "generate", "generate_n", "remove",
10428         "remove_if", "remove_copy", "remove_copy_if",
10429         "unique", "unique_copy", "reverse", "reverse_copy",
10430         "rotate", "rotate_copy", "random_shuffle", "partition", "stable_partition",
10431         "sort", "stable_sort", "partial_sort", "partial_sort_copy", "nth_element",
10432         "lower_bound", "upper_bound", "equal_range", "binary_search", "merge", "inplace_merge", "includes",
10433         "set_union", "set_intersection", "set_difference",
10434         "set_symmetric_difference", "push_heap", "pop_heap", "make_heap", "sort_heap",
10435         "min", "max", "min_element", "max_element", "lexicographical_compare", "next_permutation", "prev_permutation",
10436         "advance", "back_inserter", "distance", "front_inserter", "inserter",
10437         "make_pair", "make_shared", "make_tuple"
10438     };
10439     
10440     
10441     // Add std:: in front of std classes, when using namespace std; was given
10442     void Tokenizer::simplifyNamespaceStd()
10443     {
10444         if (!isCPP())
10445             return;
10446     
10447         const bool isCPP11  = mSettings->standards.cpp == Standards::CPP11;
10448     
10449         std::set<std::string> userFunctions;
10450     
10451         for (const Token* tok = Token::findsimplematch(list.front(), "using namespace std ;"); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10452             bool insert = false;
10453             if (Token::Match(tok, "enum class|struct| %name%| :|{")) { // Don't replace within enum definitions
10454                 skipEnumBody(&tok);
10455             }
10456             if (!Token::Match(tok->previous(), ".|::")) {
10457                 if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% (")) {
10458                     if (isFunctionHead(tok->next(), "{"))
10459                         userFunctions.insert(tok->str());
10460                     else if (isFunctionHead(tok->next(), ";")) {
10461                         const Token *start = tok;
10462                         while (Token::Match(start->previous(), "%type%|*|&"))
10463                             start = start->previous();
10464                         if (start != tok && start->isName() && (!start->previous() || Token::Match(start->previous(), "[;{}]")))
10465                             userFunctions.insert(tok->str());
10466                     }
10467                     if (userFunctions.find(tok->str()) == userFunctions.end() && stdFunctions.find(tok->str()) != stdFunctions.end())
10468                         insert = true;
10469                 } else if (Token::Match(tok, "%name% <") && stdTemplates.find(tok->str()) != stdTemplates.end())
10470                     insert = true;
10471                 else if (tok->isName() && !tok->varId() && !Token::Match(tok->next(), "(|<") && stdTypes.find(tok->str()) != stdTypes.end())
10472                     insert = true;
10473             }
10474     
10475             if (insert) {
10476                 tok->previous()->insertToken("std");
10477                 tok->previous()->linenr(tok->linenr()); // For stylistic reasons we put the std:: in the same line as the following token
10478                 tok->previous()->fileIndex(tok->fileIndex());
10479                 tok->previous()->insertToken("::");
10480             } else if (isCPP11 && Token::Match(tok, "!!:: tr1 ::"))
10481                 tok->next()->str("std");
10482         }
10483     
10484         for (Token* tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10485             if (isCPP11 && Token::simpleMatch(tok, "std :: tr1 ::"))
10486                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->tokAt(3));
10487     
10488             else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "using namespace std ;")) {
10489                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok->tokAt(4));
10490                 tok->deleteThis();
10491             }
10492         }
10493     }
10494     
10495     
10496     void Tokenizer::simplifyMicrosoftMemoryFunctions()
10497     {
10498         // skip if not Windows
10499         if (!mSettings->isWindowsPlatform())
10500             return;
10501     
10502         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10503             if (tok->strAt(1) != "(")
10504                 continue;
10505     
10506             if (Token::Match(tok, "CopyMemory|RtlCopyMemory|RtlCopyBytes")) {
10507                 tok->str("memcpy");
10508             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "MoveMemory|RtlMoveMemory")) {
10509                 tok->str("memmove");
10510             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "FillMemory|RtlFillMemory|RtlFillBytes")) {
10511                 // FillMemory(dst, len, val) -> memset(dst, val, len)
10512                 tok->str("memset");
10513     
10514                 Token *tok1 = tok->tokAt(2);
10515                 if (tok1)
10516                     tok1 = tok1->nextArgument(); // Second argument
10517                 if (tok1) {
10518                     Token *tok2 = tok1->nextArgument(); // Third argument
10519     
10520                     if (tok2)
10521                         Token::move(tok1->previous(), tok2->tokAt(-2), tok->next()->link()->previous()); // Swap third with second argument
10522                 }
10523             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "ZeroMemory|RtlZeroMemory|RtlZeroBytes|RtlSecureZeroMemory")) {
10524                 // ZeroMemory(dst, len) -> memset(dst, 0, len)
10525                 tok->str("memset");
10526     
10527                 Token *tok1 = tok->tokAt(2);
10528                 if (tok1)
10529                     tok1 = tok1->nextArgument(); // Second argument
10530     
10531                 if (tok1) {
10532                     tok1 = tok1->previous();
10533                     tok1->insertToken("0");
10534                     tok1 = tok1->next();
10535                     tok1->insertToken(",");
10536                 }
10537             } else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "RtlCompareMemory")) {
10538                 // RtlCompareMemory(src1, src2, len) -> memcmp(src1, src2, len)
10539                 tok->str("memcmp");
10540                 // For the record, when memcmp returns 0, both strings are equal.
10541                 // When RtlCompareMemory returns len, both strings are equal.
10542                 // It might be needed to improve this replacement by something
10543                 // like ((len - memcmp(src1, src2, len)) % (len + 1)) to
10544                 // respect execution path (if required)
10545             }
10546         }
10547     }
10548     
10549     namespace {
10550         struct triplet {
10551             triplet(const char* m, const char* u) :  mbcs(m), unicode(u) {}
10552             std::string mbcs, unicode;
10553         };
10554     
10555         const std::map<std::string, triplet> apis = {
10556             std::make_pair("_topen", triplet("open", "_wopen")),
10557             std::make_pair("_tsopen_s", triplet("_sopen_s", "_wsopen_s")),
10558             std::make_pair("_tfopen", triplet("fopen", "_wfopen")),
10559             std::make_pair("_tfopen_s", triplet("fopen_s", "_wfopen_s")),
10560             std::make_pair("_tfreopen", triplet("freopen", "_wfreopen")),
10561             std::make_pair("_tfreopen_s", triplet("freopen_s", "_wfreopen_s")),
10562             std::make_pair("_tcscat", triplet("strcat", "wcscat")),
10563             std::make_pair("_tcschr", triplet("strchr", "wcschr")),
10564             std::make_pair("_tcscmp", triplet("strcmp", "wcscmp")),
10565             std::make_pair("_tcsdup", triplet("strdup", "wcsdup")),
10566             std::make_pair("_tcscpy", triplet("strcpy", "wcscpy")),
10567             std::make_pair("_tcslen", triplet("strlen", "wcslen")),
10568             std::make_pair("_tcsncat", triplet("strncat", "wcsncat")),
10569             std::make_pair("_tcsncpy", triplet("strncpy", "wcsncpy")),
10570             std::make_pair("_tcsnlen", triplet("strnlen", "wcsnlen")),
10571             std::make_pair("_tcsrchr", triplet("strrchr", "wcsrchr")),
10572             std::make_pair("_tcsstr", triplet("strstr", "wcsstr")),
10573             std::make_pair("_tcstok", triplet("strtok", "wcstok")),
10574             std::make_pair("_ftprintf", triplet("fprintf", "fwprintf")),
10575             std::make_pair("_tprintf", triplet("printf", "wprintf")),
10576             std::make_pair("_stprintf", triplet("sprintf", "swprintf")),
10577             std::make_pair("_sntprintf", triplet("_snprintf", "_snwprintf")),
10578             std::make_pair("_ftscanf", triplet("fscanf", "fwscanf")),
10579             std::make_pair("_tscanf", triplet("scanf", "wscanf")),
10580             std::make_pair("_stscanf", triplet("sscanf", "swscanf")),
10581             std::make_pair("_ftprintf_s", triplet("fprintf_s", "fwprintf_s")),
10582             std::make_pair("_tprintf_s", triplet("printf_s", "wprintf_s")),
10583             std::make_pair("_stprintf_s", triplet("sprintf_s", "swprintf_s")),
10584             std::make_pair("_sntprintf_s", triplet("_snprintf_s", "_snwprintf_s")),
10585             std::make_pair("_ftscanf_s", triplet("fscanf_s", "fwscanf_s")),
10586             std::make_pair("_tscanf_s", triplet("scanf_s", "wscanf_s")),
10587             std::make_pair("_stscanf_s", triplet("sscanf_s", "swscanf_s"))
10588         };
10589     }
10590     
10591     void Tokenizer::simplifyMicrosoftStringFunctions()
10592     {
10593         // skip if not Windows
10594         if (!mSettings->isWindowsPlatform())
10595             return;
10596     
10597         const bool ansi = mSettings->platformType == Settings::Win32A;
10598         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10599             if (tok->strAt(1) != "(")
10600                 continue;
10601     
10602             const std::map<std::string, triplet>::const_iterator match = apis.find(tok->str());
10603             if (match!=apis.end()) {
10604                 tok->str(ansi ? match->second.mbcs : match->second.unicode);
10605                 tok->originalName(match->first);
10606             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "_T|_TEXT|TEXT ( %char%|%str% )")) {
10607                 tok->deleteNext();
10608                 tok->deleteThis();
10609                 tok->deleteNext();
10610                 if (!ansi)
10611                     tok->isLong(true);
10612                 while (Token::Match(tok->next(), "_T|_TEXT|TEXT ( %char%|%str% )")) {
10613                     tok->next()->deleteNext();
10614                     tok->next()->deleteThis();
10615                     tok->next()->deleteNext();
10616                     tok->concatStr(tok->next()->str());
10617                     tok->deleteNext();
10618                 }
10619             }
10620         }
10621     }
10622     
10623     // Remove Borland code
10624     void Tokenizer::simplifyBorland()
10625     {
10626         // skip if not Windows
10627         if (!mSettings->isWindowsPlatform())
10628             return;
10629         if (isC())
10630             return;
10631         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10632             if (Token::Match(tok, "( __closure * %name% )")) {
10633                 tok->deleteNext();
10634             }
10635         }
10636     
10637         // I think that these classes are always declared at the outer scope
10638         // I save some time by ignoring inner classes.
10639         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10640             if (tok->str() == "{" && !Token::Match(tok->tokAt(-2), "namespace %type%")) {
10641                 tok = tok->link();
10642                 if (!tok)
10643                     break;
10644             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "class %name% :|{")) {
10645                 while (tok && tok->str() != "{" && tok->str() != ";")
10646                     tok = tok->next();
10647                 if (!tok)
10648                     break;
10649                 if (tok->str() == ";")
10650                     continue;
10651     
10652                 const Token* end = tok->link()->next();
10653                 for (Token *tok2 = tok->next(); tok2 != end; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
10654                     if (tok2->str() == "__property" &&
10655                         Token::Match(tok2->previous(), ";|{|}|protected:|public:|__published:")) {
10656                         while (tok2->next() && !Token::Match(tok2->next(), "{|;"))
10657                             tok2->deleteNext();
10658                         tok2->deleteThis();
10659                         if (tok2->str() == "{") {
10660                             Token::eraseTokens(tok2, tok2->link());
10661                             tok2->deleteNext();
10662                             tok2->deleteThis();
10663     
10664                             // insert "; __property ;"
10665                             tok2->previous()->insertToken(";");
10666                             tok2->previous()->insertToken("__property");
10667                             tok2->previous()->insertToken(";");
10668                         }
10669                     }
10670                 }
10671             }
10672         }
10673     }
10674     
10675     // Remove Qt signals and slots
10676     void Tokenizer::simplifyQtSignalsSlots()
10677     {
10678         if (isC())
10679             return;
10680         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10681             // check for emit which can be outside of class
10682             if (Token::Match(tok, "emit|Q_EMIT %name% (") &&
10683                 Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(2), ") ;")) {
10684                 tok->deleteThis();
10685             } else if (!Token::Match(tok, "class %name% :"))
10686                 continue;
10687     
10688             if (tok->previous() && tok->previous()->str() == "enum") {
10689                 tok = tok->tokAt(2);
10690                 continue;
10691             }
10692     
10693             // count { and } for tok2
10694             int indentlevel = 0;
10695             for (Token *tok2 = tok; tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
10696                 if (tok2->str() == "{") {
10697                     ++indentlevel;
10698                     if (indentlevel == 1)
10699                         tok = tok2;
10700                     else
10701                         tok2 = tok2->link();
10702                 } else if (tok2->str() == "}") {
10703                     if (indentlevel<2)
10704                         break;
10705                     else
10706                         --indentlevel;
10707                 }
10708                 if (tok2->strAt(1) == "Q_OBJECT")
10709                     tok2->deleteNext();
10710     
10711                 if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "public|protected|private slots|Q_SLOTS :")) {
10712                     tok2 = tok2->next();
10713                     tok2->str(tok2->str() + ":");
10714                     tok2->deleteNext(2);
10715                     tok2 = tok2->previous();
10716                 } else if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "signals|Q_SIGNALS :")) {
10717                     tok2 = tok2->next();
10718                     tok2->str("protected:");
10719                     tok2->deleteNext();
10720                 } else if (Token::Match(tok2->next(), "emit|Q_EMIT %name% (") &&
10721                            Token::simpleMatch(tok2->linkAt(3), ") ;")) {
10722                     tok2->deleteNext();
10723                 }
10724             }
10725         }
10726     }
10727     
10728     void Tokenizer::createSymbolDatabase()
10729     {
10730         if (!mSymbolDatabase)
10731             mSymbolDatabase = new SymbolDatabase(this, mSettings, mErrorLogger);
10732         mSymbolDatabase->validate();
10733     }
10734     
10735     void Tokenizer::deleteSymbolDatabase()
10736     {
10737         delete mSymbolDatabase;
10738         mSymbolDatabase = nullptr;
10739     }
10740     
10741     static bool operatorEnd(const Token * tok)
10742     {
10743         if (tok && tok->str() == ")") {
10744             tok = tok->next();
10745             while (tok && !Token::Match(tok, "[=;{),]")) {
10746                 if (Token::Match(tok, "const|volatile")) {
10747                     tok = tok->next();
10748                 } else if (tok->str() == "noexcept") {
10749                     tok = tok->next();
10750                     if (tok && tok->str() == "(") {
10751                         tok = tok->link()->next();
10752                     }
10753                 } else if (tok->str() == "throw" && tok->next() && tok->next()->str() == "(") {
10754                     tok = tok->next()->link()->next();
10755                 }
10756                 // unknown macros ") MACRO {" and ") MACRO(...) {"
10757                 else if (tok->isUpperCaseName()) {
10758                     tok = tok->next();
10759                     if (tok && tok->str() == "(") {
10760                         tok = tok->link()->next();
10761                     }
10762                 } else
10763                     return false;
10764             }
10765     
10766             return true;
10767         }
10768     
10769         return false;
10770     }
10771     
10772     void Tokenizer::simplifyOperatorName()
10773     {
10774         if (isC())
10775             return;
10776     
10777         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10778             if (Token::Match(tok, "using|:: operator %op% ;")) {
10779                 tok->next()->str("operator" + tok->strAt(2));
10780                 tok->next()->deleteNext();
10781                 continue;
10782             }
10783     
10784             if (tok->str() != "operator")
10785                 continue;
10786             // operator op
10787             std::string op;
10788             Token *par = tok->next();
10789             bool done = false;
10790             while (!done && par) {
10791                 done = true;
10792                 if (par->isName()) {
10793                     op += par->str();
10794                     par = par->next();
10795                     // merge namespaces eg. 'operator std :: string () const {'
10796                     if (Token::Match(par, ":: %name%|%op%|.")) {
10797                         op += par->str();
10798                         par = par->next();
10799                     }
10800                     done = false;
10801                 } else if (Token::Match(par, ".|%op%|,")) {
10802                     // check for operator in template
10803                     if (!(Token::Match(par, "<|>") && !op.empty())) {
10804                         op += par->str();
10805                         par = par->next();
10806                         done = false;
10807                     }
10808                 } else if (Token::simpleMatch(par, "[ ]")) {
10809                     op += "[]";
10810                     par = par->tokAt(2);
10811                     done = false;
10812                 } else if (Token::Match(par, "( *| )")) {
10813                     // break out and simplify..
10814                     if (operatorEnd(par->next()))
10815                         break;
10816     
10817                     while (par->str() != ")") {
10818                         op += par->str();
10819                         par = par->next();
10820                     }
10821                     op += ")";
10822                     par = par->next();
10823                     done = false;
10824                 } else if (Token::Match(par, "\"\" %name% (")) {
10825                     op += "\"\"";
10826                     op += par->strAt(1);
10827                     par = par->tokAt(2);
10828                     done = true;
10829                 }
10830             }
10831     
10832             if (par && (Token::Match(par, "<|>") || isFunctionHead(par, "{|;"))) {
10833                 tok->str("operator" + op);
10834                 Token::eraseTokens(tok, par);
10835             }
10836     
10837             if (!op.empty())
10838                 tok->isOperatorKeyword(true);
10839         }
10840     
10841         if (mSettings->debugwarnings) {
10842             const Token *tok = list.front();
10843     
10844             while ((tok = Token::findsimplematch(tok, "operator")) != nullptr) {
10845                 reportError(tok, Severity::debug, "debug",
10846                             "simplifyOperatorName: found unsimplified operator name");
10847                 tok = tok->next();
10848             }
10849         }
10850     }
10851     
10852     // remove unnecessary member qualification..
10853     void Tokenizer::removeUnnecessaryQualification()
10854     {
10855         if (isC())
10856             return;
10857     
10858         std::vector<Space> classInfo;
10859         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10860             if (Token::Match(tok, "class|struct|namespace %type% :|{") &&
10861                 (!tok->previous() || tok->previous()->str() != "enum")) {
10862                 Space info;
10863                 info.isNamespace = tok->str() == "namespace";
10864                 tok = tok->next();
10865                 info.className = tok->str();
10866                 tok = tok->next();
10867                 while (tok && tok->str() != "{")
10868                     tok = tok->next();
10869                 if (!tok)
10870                     return;
10871                 info.bodyEnd = tok->link();
10872                 classInfo.push_back(info);
10873             } else if (!classInfo.empty()) {
10874                 if (tok == classInfo.back().bodyEnd)
10875                     classInfo.pop_back();
10876                 else if (tok->str() == classInfo.back().className &&
10877                          !classInfo.back().isNamespace && tok->previous()->str() != ":" &&
10878                          (Token::Match(tok, "%type% :: ~| %type% (") ||
10879                           Token::Match(tok, "%type% :: operator"))) {
10880                     const Token *tok1 = tok->tokAt(3);
10881                     if (tok->strAt(2) == "operator") {
10882                         // check for operator ()
10883                         if (tok1->str() == "(")
10884                             tok1 = tok1->next();
10885     
10886                         while (tok1 && tok1->str() != "(") {
10887                             if (tok1->str() == ";")
10888                                 break;
10889                             tok1 = tok1->next();
10890                         }
10891                         if (!tok1 || tok1->str() != "(")
10892                             continue;
10893                     } else if (tok->strAt(2) == "~")
10894                         tok1 = tok1->next();
10895     
10896                     if (!tok1 || !Token::Match(tok1->link(), ") const| {|;|:")) {
10897                         continue;
10898                     }
10899     
10900                     const bool isConstructorOrDestructor =
10901                         Token::Match(tok, "%type% :: ~| %type%") && (tok->strAt(2) == tok->str() || (tok->strAt(2) == "~" && tok->strAt(3) == tok->str()));
10902                     if (!isConstructorOrDestructor) {
10903                         bool isPrependedByType = Token::Match(tok->previous(), "%type%");
10904                         if (!isPrependedByType) {
10905                             const Token* tok2 = tok->tokAt(-2);
10906                             isPrependedByType = Token::Match(tok2, "%type% *|&");
10907                         }
10908                         if (!isPrependedByType) {
10909                             const Token* tok3 = tok->tokAt(-3);
10910                             isPrependedByType = Token::Match(tok3, "%type% * *|&");
10911                         }
10912                         if (!isPrependedByType) {
10913                             // It's not a constructor declaration and it's not a function declaration so
10914                             // this is a function call which can have all the qualifiers just fine - skip.
10915                             continue;
10916                         }
10917                     }
10918                 }
10919             }
10920         }
10921     }
10922     
10923     void Tokenizer::simplifyReturnStrncat()
10924     {
10925         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
10926             if (Token::simpleMatch(tok, "return strncat (") &&
10927                 Token::simpleMatch(tok->linkAt(2), ") ;") &&
10928                 tok->strAt(3) != ")" && tok->strAt(3) != ",") {
10929     
10930                 //first argument
10931                 Token *tok2 = tok->tokAt(3);
10932     
10933                 //check if there are at least three arguments
10934                 for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
10935                     tok2 = tok2->nextArgument();
10936                     if (!tok2) {
10937                         tok = tok->linkAt(2)->next();
10938                         break;
10939                     }
10940                 }
10941                 if (!tok2)
10942                     continue;
10943     
10944                 tok2 = tok2->nextArgument();
10945                 //we want only three arguments
10946                 if (tok2) {
10947                     tok = tok->linkAt(2)->next();
10948                     continue;
10949                 }
10950     
10951                 // Remove 'return'
10952                 tok->deleteThis();
10953     
10954                 // Add 'return arg1 ;' after 'strncat(arg1, arg2, arg3);'
10955                 tok = tok->next();
10956     
10957                 tok2 = tok->link()->next();
10958                 tok2->insertToken(";");
10959     
10960                 //the last token of the first argument before ','
10961                 const Token * const end = tok->next()->nextArgument()->tokAt(-2);
10962     
10963                 //all the first argument is copied
10964                 TokenList::copyTokens(tok2, tok->next(), end);
10965                 tok2->insertToken("return");
10966             }
10967         }
10968     }
10969     
10970     void Tokenizer::printUnknownTypes() const
10971     {
10972         if (!mSymbolDatabase)
10973             return;
10974     
10975         std::multimap<std::string, const Token *> unknowns;
10976     
10977         for (int i = 1; i <= mVarId; ++i) {
10978             const Variable *var = mSymbolDatabase->getVariableFromVarId(i);
10979             if (!var)
10980                 continue;
10981             // is unknown type?
10982             if (var->type() || var->typeStartToken()->isStandardType())
10983                 continue;
10984     
10985             std::string name;
10986             const Token * nameTok;
10987     
10988             // single token type?
10989             if (var->typeStartToken() == var->typeEndToken()) {
10990                 nameTok = var->typeStartToken();
10991                 name = nameTok->str();
10992             }
10993     
10994             // complicated type
10995             else {
10996                 const Token *tok = var->typeStartToken();
10997                 int level = 0;
10998     
10999                 nameTok =  tok;
11000     
11001                 while (tok) {
11002                     // skip pointer and reference part of type
11003                     if (level == 0 && Token::Match(tok, "*|&"))
11004                         break;
11005     
11006                     name += tok->str();
11007     
11008                     if (Token::Match(tok, "struct|union|enum"))
11009                         name += " ";
11010     
11011                     // pointers and references are OK in template
11012                     else if (tok->str() == "<")
11013                         ++level;
11014                     else if (tok->str() == ">")
11015                         --level;
11016     
11017                     if (tok == var->typeEndToken())
11018                         break;
11019     
11020                     tok = tok->next();
11021                 }
11022             }
11023     
11024             unknowns.insert(std::pair<std::string, const Token *>(name, nameTok));
11025         }
11026     
11027         if (!unknowns.empty()) {
11028             std::string last;
11029             int count = 0;
11030     
11031             for (std::multimap<std::string, const Token *>::const_iterator it = unknowns.begin(); it != unknowns.end(); ++it) {
11032                 // skip types is std namespace because they are not interesting
11033                 if (it->first.find("std::") != 0) {
11034                     if (it->first != last) {
11035                         last = it->first;
11036                         count = 1;
11037                         reportError(it->second, Severity::debug, "debug", "Unknown type \'" + it->first + "\'.");
11038                     } else {
11039                         if (count < 3) // limit same type to 3
11040                             reportError(it->second, Severity::debug, "debug", "Unknown type \'" + it->first + "\'.");
11041                         count++;
11042                     }
11043                 }
11044             }
11045         }
11046     }
11047     
11048     void Tokenizer::simplifyMathExpressions()
11049     {
11050         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
11051     
11052             //simplify Pythagorean trigonometric identity: pow(sin(x),2)+pow(cos(x),2) = 1
11053             //                                             pow(cos(x),2)+pow(sin(x),2) = 1
11054             // @todo: sin(x) * sin(x) + cos(x) * cos(x) = 1
11055             //        cos(x) * cos(x) + sin(x) * sin(x) = 1
11056             //simplify Hyperbolic identity: pow(sinh(x),2)-pow(cosh(x),2) = -1
11057             //                              pow(cosh(x),2)-pow(sinh(x),2) = -1
11058             // @todo: sinh(x) * sinh(x) - cosh(x) * cosh(x) = -1
11059             //        cosh(x) * cosh(x) - sinh(x) * sinh(x) = -1
11060             if (Token::Match(tok, "pow|powf|powl (")) {
11061                 if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "sin|sinf|sinl (")) {
11062                     Token * const tok2 = tok->linkAt(3);
11063                     if (!Token::Match(tok2, ") , %num% ) + pow|powf|powl ( cos|cosf|cosl ("))
11064                         continue;
11065                     const std::string& leftExponent = tok2->strAt(2);
11066                     if (!isTwoNumber(leftExponent))
11067                         continue; // left exponent is not 2
11068                     const Token * const tok3 = tok2->tokAt(8);
11069                     Token * const tok4 = tok3->link();
11070                     if (!Token::Match(tok4, ") , %num% )"))
11071                         continue;
11072                     const std::string& rightExponent = tok4->strAt(2);
11073                     if (!isTwoNumber(rightExponent))
11074                         continue; // right exponent is not 2
11075                     if (tok->tokAt(3)->stringifyList(tok2->next()) == tok3->stringifyList(tok4->next())) {
11076                         Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok4->tokAt(4));
11077                         tok->str("1");
11078                     }
11079                 } else if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "cos|cosf|cosl (")) {
11080                     Token * const tok2 = tok->linkAt(3);
11081                     if (!Token::Match(tok2, ") , %num% ) + pow|powf|powl ( sin|sinf|sinl ("))
11082                         continue;
11083                     const std::string& leftExponent = tok2->strAt(2);
11084                     if (!isTwoNumber(leftExponent))
11085                         continue; // left exponent is not 2
11086                     const Token * const tok3 = tok2->tokAt(8);
11087                     Token * const tok4 = tok3->link();
11088                     if (!Token::Match(tok4, ") , %num% )"))
11089                         continue;
11090                     const std::string& rightExponent = tok4->strAt(2);
11091                     if (!isTwoNumber(rightExponent))
11092                         continue; // right exponent is not 2
11093                     if (tok->tokAt(3)->stringifyList(tok2->next()) == tok3->stringifyList(tok4->next())) {
11094                         Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok4->tokAt(4));
11095                         tok->str("1");
11096                     }
11097                 } else if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "sinh|sinhf|sinhl (")) {
11098                     Token * const tok2 = tok->linkAt(3);
11099                     if (!Token::Match(tok2, ") , %num% ) - pow|powf|powl ( cosh|coshf|coshl ("))
11100                         continue;
11101                     const std::string& leftExponent = tok2->strAt(2);
11102                     if (!isTwoNumber(leftExponent))
11103                         continue; // left exponent is not 2
11104                     const Token * const tok3 = tok2->tokAt(8);
11105                     Token * const tok4 = tok3->link();
11106                     if (!Token::Match(tok4, ") , %num% )"))
11107                         continue;
11108                     const std::string& rightExponent = tok4->strAt(2);
11109                     if (!isTwoNumber(rightExponent))
11110                         continue; // right exponent is not 2
11111                     if (tok->tokAt(3)->stringifyList(tok2->next()) == tok3->stringifyList(tok4->next())) {
11112                         Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok4->tokAt(4));
11113                         tok->str("-1");
11114                     }
11115                 } else if (Token::Match(tok->tokAt(2), "cosh|coshf|coshl (")) {
11116                     Token * const tok2 = tok->linkAt(3);
11117                     if (!Token::Match(tok2, ") , %num% ) - pow|powf|powl ( sinh|sinhf|sinhl ("))
11118                         continue;
11119                     const std::string& leftExponent = tok2->strAt(2);
11120                     if (!isTwoNumber(leftExponent))
11121                         continue; // left exponent is not 2
11122                     const Token * const tok3 = tok2->tokAt(8);
11123                     Token * const tok4 = tok3->link();
11124                     if (!Token::Match(tok4, ") , %num% )"))
11125                         continue;
11126                     const std::string& rightExponent = tok4->strAt(2);
11127                     if (!isTwoNumber(rightExponent))
11128                         continue; // right exponent is not 2
11129                     if (tok->tokAt(3)->stringifyList(tok2->next()) == tok3->stringifyList(tok4->next())) {
11130                         Token::eraseTokens(tok, tok4->tokAt(4));
11131                         tok->str("-1");
11132                     }
11133                 }
11134             }
11135         }
11136     }
11137     
11138     bool Tokenizer::simplifyStrlen()
11139     {
11140         // replace strlen(str)
11141         bool modified=false;
11142         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
11143             if (Token::Match(tok, "strlen ( %str% )")) {
11144                 tok->str(MathLib::toString(Token::getStrLength(tok->tokAt(2))));
11145                 tok->deleteNext(3);
11146                 modified=true;
11147             }
11148         }
11149         return modified;
11150     }
11151     
11152     void Tokenizer::prepareTernaryOpForAST()
11153     {
11154         // http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/operator_precedence says about ternary operator:
11155         //       "The expression in the middle of the conditional operator (between ? and :) is parsed as if parenthesized: its precedence relative to ?: is ignored."
11156         // The AST parser relies on this function to add such parentheses where necessary.
11157         for (Token* tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
11158             if (tok->str() == "?") {
11159                 bool parenthesesNeeded = false;
11160                 int depth = 0;
11161                 Token* tok2 = tok->next();
11162                 for (; tok2; tok2 = tok2->next()) {
11163                     if (tok2->link() && Token::Match(tok2, "[|(|<"))
11164                         tok2 = tok2->link();
11165                     else if (tok2->str() == ":") {
11166                         if (depth == 0)
11167                             break;
11168                         depth--;
11169                     } else if (tok2->str() == ";" || (tok2->link() && tok2->str() != "{" && tok2->str() != "}"))
11170                         break;
11171                     else if (tok2->str() == ",")
11172                         parenthesesNeeded = true;
11173                     else if (tok2->str() == "<")
11174                         parenthesesNeeded = true;
11175                     else if (tok2->str() == "?") {
11176                         depth++;
11177                         parenthesesNeeded = true;
11178                     }
11179                 }
11180                 if (parenthesesNeeded && tok2 && tok2->str() == ":") {
11181                     tok->insertToken("(");
11182                     tok2->insertToken(")", emptyString, true);
11183                     Token::createMutualLinks(tok->next(), tok2->previous());
11184                 }
11185             }
11186         }
11187     }
11188     
11189     void Tokenizer::reportError(const Token* tok, const Severity::SeverityType severity, const std::string& id, const std::string& msg, bool inconclusive) const
11190     {
11191         const std::list<const Token*> callstack(1, tok);
11192         reportError(callstack, severity, id, msg, inconclusive);
11193     }
11194     
11195     void Tokenizer::reportError(const std::list<const Token*>& callstack, Severity::SeverityType severity, const std::string& id, const std::string& msg, bool inconclusive) const
11196     {
11197         const ErrorLogger::ErrorMessage errmsg(callstack, &list, severity, id, msg, inconclusive);
11198         if (mErrorLogger)
11199             mErrorLogger->reportErr(errmsg);
11200         else
11201             Check::reportError(errmsg);
11202     }
11203     
11204     void Tokenizer::setPodTypes()
11205     {
11206         if (!mSettings)
11207             return;
11208         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
11209             if (!tok->isName())
11210                 continue;
11211     
11212             // pod type
11213             const struct Library::PodType *podType = mSettings->library.podtype(tok->str());
11214             if (podType) {
11215                 const Token *prev = tok->previous();
11216                 while (prev && prev->isName())
11217                     prev = prev->previous();
11218                 if (prev && !Token::Match(prev, ";|{|}|,|("))
11219                     continue;
11220                 tok->isStandardType(true);
11221             }
11222         }
11223     }
11224     
11225     void Tokenizer::SimplifyNamelessRValueReferences()
11226     {
11227         // Simplify nameless rValue references - named ones are simplified later
11228         for (Token* tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
11229             if (Token::Match(tok, "&& [,)]")) {
11230                 tok->str("&");
11231                 tok->insertToken("&");
11232             }
11233         }
11234     }
11235     
11236     const Token *Tokenizer::findSQLBlockEnd(const Token *tokSQLStart)
11237     {
11238         const Token *tokLastEnd = nullptr;
11239         for (const Token *tok = tokSQLStart->tokAt(2); tok != nullptr; tok = tok->next()) {
11240             if (tokLastEnd == nullptr && tok->str() == ";")
11241                 tokLastEnd = tok;
11242             else if (tok->str() == "__CPPCHECK_EMBEDDED_SQL_EXEC__") {
11243                 if (Token::simpleMatch(tok->tokAt(-2), "END - __CPPCHECK_EMBEDDED_SQL_EXEC__ ;"))
11244                     return tok->next();
11245                 return tokLastEnd;
11246             } else if (Token::Match(tok, "{|}|==|&&|!|^|<<|>>|++|+=|-=|/=|*=|>>=|<<=|~"))
11247                 break; // We are obviously outside the SQL block
11248         }
11249     
11250         return tokLastEnd;
11251     }
11252     
11253     void Tokenizer::simplifyNestedNamespace()
11254     {
11255         if (!isCPP())
11256             return;
11257     
11258         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
11259             if (Token::Match(tok, "namespace %name% ::") && tok->strAt(-1) != "using") {
11260                 Token * tok2 = tok->tokAt(2);
11261     
11262                 // validate syntax
11263                 while (Token::Match(tok2, ":: %name%"))
11264                     tok2 = tok2->tokAt(2);
11265     
11266                 if (!tok2 || tok2->str() != "{")
11267                     return; // syntax error
11268     
11269                 std::stack<Token *> links;
11270                 tok2 = tok->tokAt(2);
11271     
11272                 while (tok2->str() == "::") {
11273                     links.push(tok2);
11274                     tok2->str("{");
11275                     tok2->insertToken("namespace");
11276                     tok2 = tok2->tokAt(3);
11277                 }
11278     
11279                 tok = tok2;
11280     
11281                 if (!links.empty() && tok2->str() == "{") {
11282                     tok2 = tok2->link();
11283                     while (!links.empty()) {
11284                         tok2->insertToken("}");
11285                         tok2 = tok2->next();
11286                         Token::createMutualLinks(links.top(), tok2);
11287                         links.pop();
11288                     }
11289                 }
11290             }
11291         }
11292     }
11293     
11294     static bool sameTokens(const Token *first, const Token *last, const Token *other)
11295     {
11296         while (other && first->str() == other->str()) {
11297             if (first == last)
11298                 return true;
11299             first = first->next();
11300             other = other->next();
11301         }
11302     
11303         return false;
11304     }
11305     
11306     static Token * deleteAlias(Token * tok)
11307     {
11308         Token::eraseTokens(tok, Token::findsimplematch(tok, ";"));
11309     
11310         // delete first token
11311         tok->deleteThis();
11312     
11313         // delete ';' if not last token
11314         tok->deleteThis();
11315     
11316         return tok;
11317     }
11318     
11319     void Tokenizer::simplifyNamespaceAliases()
11320     {
11321         if (!isCPP())
11322             return;
11323     
11324         int scope = 0;
11325     
11326         for (Token *tok = list.front(); tok; tok = tok->next()) {
11327             if (tok->str() == "{")
11328                 scope++;
11329             else if (tok->str() == "}")
11330                 scope--;
11331             else if (Token::Match(tok, "namespace %name% =")) {
11332                 const std::string name(tok->next()->str());
11333                 Token * tokNameStart = tok->tokAt(3);
11334                 Token * tokNameEnd = tokNameStart;
11335     
11336                 while (tokNameEnd && tokNameEnd->next() && tokNameEnd->next()->str() != ";")
11337                     tokNameEnd = tokNameEnd->next();
11338     
11339                 if (!tokNameEnd)
11340                     return; // syntax error
11341     
11342                 int endScope = scope;
11343                 Token * tokLast = tokNameEnd->next();
11344                 Token * tokNext = tokLast->next();
11345                 Token * tok2 = tokNext;
11346     
11347                 while (tok2 && endScope >= scope) {
11348                     if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "{"))
11349                         endScope++;
11350                     else if (Token::simpleMatch(tok2, "}"))
11351                         endScope--;
11352                     else if (tok2->str() == name) {
11353                         if (Token::Match(tok2->previous(), "namespace %name% =")) {
11354                             // check for possible duplicate aliases
11355                             if (sameTokens(tokNameStart, tokNameEnd, tok2->tokAt(2))) {
11356                                 // delete duplicate
11357                                 tok2 = deleteAlias(tok2->previous());
11358                                 continue;
11359                             } else {
11360                                 // conflicting declaration (syntax error)
11361                                 if (endScope == scope) {
11362                                     // delete conflicting declaration
11363                                     tok2 = deleteAlias(tok2->previous());
11364                                 }
11365     
11366                                 // new declaration
11367                                 else {
11368                                     // TODO: use the new alias in this scope
11369                                     tok2 = deleteAlias(tok2->previous());
11370                                 }
11371                                 continue;
11372                             }
11373                         }
11374     
11375                         tok2->str(tokNameStart->str());
11376                         Token * tok3 = tokNameStart;
11377                         while (tok3 != tokNameEnd) {
11378                             tok2->insertToken(tok3->next()->str());
11379                             tok2 = tok2->next();
11380                             tok3 = tok3->next();
11381                         }
11382                     }
11383                     tok2 = tok2->next();
11384                 }
11385     
11386                 if (tok->previous() && tokNext) {
11387                     Token::eraseTokens(tok->previous(), tokNext);
11388                     tok = tokNext->previous();
11389                 } else if (tok->previous()) {
11390                     Token::eraseTokens(tok->previous(), tokLast);
11391                     tok = tokLast;
11392                 } else if (tokNext) {
11393                     Token::eraseTokens(tok, tokNext);
11394                     tok->deleteThis();
11395                 } else {
11396                     Token::eraseTokens(tok, tokLast);
11397                     tok->deleteThis();
11398                 }
11399             }
11400         }
11401     }
11402     
11403     
11404     Tokenizer::VariableMap::VariableMap() : mVarId(0) {}
11405     
11406     void Tokenizer::VariableMap::enterScope()
11407     {
11408         mScopeInfo.push(std::list<std::pair<std::string, int>>());
11409     }
11410     
11411     bool Tokenizer::VariableMap::leaveScope()
11412     {
11413         if (mScopeInfo.empty())
11414             return false;
11415     
11416         for (const std::pair<std::string, int> &outerVariable : mScopeInfo.top()) {
11417             if (outerVariable.second != 0)
11418                 mVariableId[outerVariable.first] = outerVariable.second;
11419             else
11420                 mVariableId.erase(outerVariable.first);
11421         }
11422         mScopeInfo.pop();
11423         return true;
11424     }
11425     
11426     void Tokenizer::VariableMap::addVariable(const std::string &varname)
11427     {
11428         if (mScopeInfo.empty()) {
11429             mVariableId[varname] = ++mVarId;
11430             return;
11431         }
11432         std::map<std::string, int>::iterator it = mVariableId.find(varname);
11433         if (it == mVariableId.end()) {
11434             mScopeInfo.top().push_back(std::pair<std::string, int>(varname, 0));
11435             mVariableId[varname] = ++mVarId;
11436             return;
11437         }
11438         mScopeInfo.top().push_back(std::pair<std::string, int>(varname, it->second));
11439         it->second = ++mVarId;
11440     }
11441     
11442     bool Tokenizer::VariableMap::hasVariable(const std::string &varname) const
11443     {
11444         return mVariableId.find(varname) != mVariableId.end();
11445     }
11446
